original: @261a * // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @261a * // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: bee ro tsa n'a bhi sam bo dhi tantra sya sad britti n'a ma /
analyzed: bee ro tsa n'a bhi sam bo dhi tantra sya sad britti n'a ma /
translated: Vairocanābhisambodhitantra-sādhananāma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs pa byang chub pa'i rgyud kyi tshig 'grel zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs pa byang chub pa'i rgyud kyi tshig 'grel zhes bya ba /
translated: The Word Commentary of the Tantra of Vairocana's Perfect Awakening

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis thog ma thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis thog ma thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes nas /
translated: After the Bhagavān attained omniscient wisdom for the first time,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes des 'dul ba'i 'gro ba rnam pa gnyis su gzigs te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes des 'dul ba'i 'gro ba rnam pa gnyis su gzigs te /
translated: with that omniscient wisdom he saw two types of beings to be tamed:

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa la mos pa gtso bor gyur pa dang / zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa gtso bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa la mos pa gtso bor gyur pa dang / zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa gtso bor gyur pa'o //
translated: those whose interest is primarily in the profound and vast, and those whose interest is primarily in the conceptual.

original: 'dul ba'i 'gro ba de rnams la yang spyod pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i 'gro ba de rnams la yang spyod pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those beings to be tamed also have two types of conduct:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo nas 'jug cing spyod pa dang / sngags kyi sgo nas 'jug cing spyod pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo nas 'jug cing spyod pa dang / sngags kyi sgo nas 'jug cing spyod pa'o //
translated: those who engage in conduct through the perfection vehicle and those who engage in conduct through the mantra vehicle.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo nas 'jug cing spyod pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo nas 'jug cing spyod pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who engage in conduct through the perfection vehicle are also of two types:

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa la mos pa gtso bor gyur pa dang / zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa gtso bor gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa la mos pa gtso bor gyur pa dang / zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa gtso bor gyur pa ste /
translated: Those who are interested in the profound and vast are of two kinds: those who are interested in the profound and vast but are not fit vessels for the profound and vast, and those who are interested in the profound and vast and are fit vessels for the profound and vast.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo nas 'jug cing spyod pa'i gdul ba'i 'gro ba dmigs pa dang bcas pa la mos pa gtso bor gyur pa rnams kyi don du 'dul ba dang / mdo sde dang / mngon pa'i chos rnams dang / de bzhin du gzhan yang theg pa chen po'i mdo sde khyim bdag dpa' bo la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo nas 'jug cing spyod pa'i gdul ba'i 'gro ba dmigs pa dang bcas pa la mos pa gtso bor gyur pa rnams kyi don du 'dul ba dang / mdo sde dang / mngon pa'i chos rnams dang / de bzhin du gzhan yang theg pa chen po'i mdo sde khyim bdag dpa' bo la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: For the sake of those who are interested in the profound and vast but are not fit vessels for the profound and vast, the Buddha taught the Perfection Vehicle in the form of the three scriptural collections of the Vinaya, the Sutras, and the Abhidharma, and also the Mahayana sutras such as the Sutra of the Heroic Child.

original: de bzhin du zab cing rgya che la mos pa'i 'dul ba'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don du zab cing rgya che ba'i mdo sde sdong po bkod pa dang / sa bcu dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po la sogs pa rnams bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du zab cing rgya che la mos pa'i 'dul ba'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don du zab cing rgya che ba'i mdo sde sdong po bkod pa dang / sa bcu dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po la sogs pa rnams bstan to //
translated: For the sake of those who are interested in the profound and vast and are fit vessels for the profound and vast, the Buddha taught the profound and vast sutras such as the Flower Ornament Sutra, the Sutra of the Ten Levels, and the King of Meditations.

original: de bzhin du sngags kyi sgo nas 'jug cing spyod pa'i gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnams la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags kyi sgo nas 'jug cing spyod pa'i gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnams la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who are interested in the profound and vast but are not fit vessels for the profound and vast are of two kinds: those who are interested in the profound and vast but are not fit vessels for the profound and vast and those who are interested in the profound and vast but are not fit vessels for the profound and vast and are of the Mahayana type.

original: dmigs pa ngang bcas pa la mos pa gtso bor gyur pa dang / zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa gtso bor gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa ngang bcas pa la mos pa gtso bor gyur pa dang / zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa gtso bor gyur pa ste /
translated: and the second is those who are mainly interested in the profound and the vast.

original: de la dmigs pa dang bcas pa la mos pa gtso bor gyur pa rnams kyi don du /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa dang bcas pa la mos pa gtso bor gyur pa rnams kyi don du /
translated: For the sake of those who are mainly interested in the object with its aspects,

original: 'phags pa legs par grub pa'i rgyud dang / rig 'dzin gyi sde snod la sogs pa bya ba'i rgyud rnams bstan to //
analyzed: 'phags pa legs par grub pa'i rgyud dang / rig 'dzin gyi sde snod la sogs pa bya ba'i rgyud rnams bstan to //
translated: the tantras of action such as the Tantra of the Well-Accomplished and the Basket of the Knowledge Holders were taught.

original: de bzhin du zab cing rgya che bas 'dul ba'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don du 'phags pa de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud la sogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zab cing rgya che bas 'dul ba'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don du 'phags pa de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud la sogs pa bstan te /
translated: Similarly, for the sake of those who are to be guided by the profound and the vast, the Tantra of the Compendium of Principles and so forth were taught.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa la gtso bor gyur pa zhes pa yang zab cing rgya che ba la ma mos shing mi spyod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa la gtso bor gyur pa zhes pa yang zab cing rgya che ba la ma mos shing mi spyod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Although those who are mainly interested in the object with its aspects are not not interested in and do not practice the profound and the vast,

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa la spyod par mos pa'i shas che ba la bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa la spyod par mos pa'i shas che ba la bya'o //
translated: they are mainly interested in practicing the object with its aspects.

original: zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa @261b gtso bor gyur pa rnams la yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa @261b gtso bor gyur pa rnams la yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Also, for those who are mainly interested in the profound and the vast, there is no practice with reference points.

original: zab cing rgya che ba la spyod pa'i shas che ba ste /
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba la spyod pa'i shas che ba ste /
translated: However, they are mainly engaged in the profound and the vast.

original: de lta bu yin par ni gsal por 'phags pa de nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa nang gi rnal 'byor gtso bor gyur pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta bu yin par ni gsal por 'phags pa de nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa nang gi rnal 'byor gtso bor gyur pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: That is clear in the Compendium of Principles and so forth, which are mainly for inner yoga,

original: phyi'i spyod pa rnams kyang med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i spyod pa rnams kyang med pa ma yin no //
translated: but the outer practices are not absent.

original: de bzhin du bya ba'i rgyud rnams kyang phyi'i spyod pa gtso bor gyur pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du bya ba'i rgyud rnams kyang phyi'i spyod pa gtso bor gyur pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Similarly, action tantras are mainly for outer practices,

original: nang gi spyod pa yang med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nang gi spyod pa yang med pa ma yin te /
translated: but inner practices are not absent.

original: rig 'dzin gyi sde snod la sogs par rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnam pa gsum la gzhol ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo nas 'jug cing spyod pa rnams la yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rig 'dzin gyi sde snod la sogs par rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnam pa gsum la gzhol ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo nas 'jug cing spyod pa rnams la yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
translated: In the basket of awareness holders and so forth, the three doors of liberation and so forth are taught, and similarly, those who enter and practice by way of the perfections should understand that they are to be applied as appropriate.

original: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa rnam par sprul pa byin gyis rlob pa'i rgyud 'di yang thabs dang shes rab gtse bor gyur pa rnal 'byor gyi rgyud yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa rnam par sprul pa byin gyis rlob pa'i rgyud 'di yang thabs dang shes rab gtse bor gyur pa rnal 'byor gyi rgyud yin mod kyi /
translated: Likewise, this tantra, the Manifest Enlightenment of Vairocana, the Tantra of the Blessing of Emanations, is a yoga tantra in which method and wisdom are the main principles.

original: bya ba la mos pa'i gdul bya'i 'gro ba rnams gzung ba'i phyir bya ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su mthun pa'i spyod pa dag kyang bstan pas bya ba'i rgyud dam /
analyzed: bya ba la mos pa'i gdul bya'i 'gro ba rnams gzung ba'i phyir bya ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su mthun pa'i spyod pa dag kyang bstan pas bya ba'i rgyud dam /
translated: However, in order to attract those beings who are to be trained and who are devoted to action, it also teaches conduct that is in accord with action tantra.

original: gnyis ka'i rgyud lta bur so sor brtags shing grags so //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i rgyud lta bur so sor brtags shing grags so //
translated: Thus, it is analyzed and renowned as being like a tantra of both.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyud 'di yang gdul ba'i 'gro ba rab dang 'bring dang tha ma ste rnam pa gsum gyi don du bstan te /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyud 'di yang gdul ba'i 'gro ba rab dang 'bring dang tha ma ste rnam pa gsum gyi don du bstan te /
translated: This tantra of the Bhagavān is also taught for the sake of three types of beings to be trained: the highest, the middling, and the lowest.

original: mgo smos pas go ba dang / don rnam par phye bas go ba dang / tshig lhur len pa'i gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: mgo smos pas go ba dang / don rnam par phye bas go ba dang / tshig lhur len pa'i gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: They are those who understand through a brief explanation, those who understand through an extensive explanation, and those who are to be trained and are devoted to words.

original: de la mgo smos pas go ba ni shes rab mchog tu rno zhing thos pa mang ba dang ldan pas rgyud 'di'i mtshan don dang rjes su mthun pa rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa rnam par sprul pa byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya
analyzed: de la mgo smos pas go ba ni shes rab mchog tu rno zhing thos pa mang ba dang ldan pas rgyud 'di'i mtshan don dang rjes su mthun pa rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa rnam par sprul pa byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya
translated: Those who understand this tantra through merely hearing its name are those who have supreme sharpness of wisdom and are endowed with much learning.

original: ba'i mtshan tsam thos pas rgyud 'di'i don thams cad go bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba'i mtshan tsam thos pas rgyud 'di'i don thams cad go bar 'gyur te /
translated: They will understand the entire meaning of this tantra by merely hearing the name of this tantra, which is in accord with the meaning of the name, the Tantra of the Blessing of the Emanation of the Complete Enlightenment of Vairocana.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rang bzhin du shes so //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rang bzhin du shes so //
translated: The word “Vairocana” indicates that the Bhagavat Vairocana is the saṃbhogakāya, the perfection of the accumulations of merit and wisdom, and the nature of omniscience.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa zhes pa la mngon par byang chub pa ni rang gi sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa zhes pa la mngon par byang chub pa ni rang gi sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ste /
translated: “Complete enlightenment” means the perfect knowledge of one’s mind just as it is.

original: de yang chos thams cad stong pa nyid nam mkha' lta bu'i mtshan nyid du thugs su chung @262a * //
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad stong pa nyid nam mkha' lta bu'i mtshan nyid du thugs su chung @262a * //
translated: Moreover, he has realized that all phenomena are by nature emptiness, like space.

original: pa'o // rnam par sprul pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis kyang de ltar mngon bar rdzogs par byang chub pa nyid kyi tshe na /
analyzed: pa'o // rnam par sprul pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis kyang de ltar mngon bar rdzogs par byang chub pa nyid kyi tshe na /
translated: The words “emanation” indicate that when he fully awakened in that way,

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis chos nyid kyis thob pa lhun gyis grub pa nyid du sku mi zad pa'i rgyan gyis sus kyang zil gyis mi non pa nyid du khams gsum thams cad du khyab pa longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku la sogs pas
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis chos nyid kyis thob pa lhun gyis grub pa nyid du sku mi zad pa'i rgyan gyis sus kyang zil gyis mi non pa nyid du khams gsum thams cad du khyab pa longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku la sogs pas
translated: through the power of his previous aspirations, he spontaneously and effortlessly attained the enjoyment body and the emanation body, which pervade the entire three realms with a form that is not outshone by anyone and is adorned with inexhaustible ornaments.

original: ji ltar snod du gyur pa'i sems can gang gis 'dul ba'i skus don mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar snod du gyur pa'i sems can gang gis 'dul ba'i skus don mdzad pa ste /
translated: He acts for the welfare of beings through the bodies of the enjoyment body and the emanation body, which are suitable to tame any being who is a suitable vessel.

original: sangs rgyas kyi skus 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi skur ston pa nas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la de rnams kyi tshul bstan cing don mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi skus 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi skur ston pa nas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la de rnams kyi tshul bstan cing don mdzad pa dang /
translated: They display the form of a buddha to those beings who are to be guided by the form of a buddha, and they display the forms of hearers, solitary realizers, Brahma, Indra, and so on to those beings who are to be guided by those forms, and they act for their benefit.

original: de bzhin du gsung mi zad pa'i rgyan gyis kyang khams gsum thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi gsung dam pas khyab par chos ston pa dang / de bzhin du thugs mi zad pa'i rgyan gyis kyang rnam pa dang bcas pa'i yid las byung ba'i dbang chen dang chu'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i rnam par bstan par go ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung mi zad pa'i rgyan gyis kyang khams gsum thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi gsung dam pas khyab par chos ston pa dang / de bzhin du thugs mi zad pa'i rgyan gyis kyang rnam pa dang bcas pa'i yid las byung ba'i dbang chen dang chu'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i rnam par bstan par go ba'o //
translated: Similarly, through the inexhaustible ornament of speech, they teach the Dharma with the excellent speech of the buddhas, pervading the entire three realms. And similarly, through the inexhaustible ornament of mind, they are understood to display the forms of the great mind-born kings, the maṇḍala of water, and so on.

original: de bzhin du byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis kyang de ltar rnam par sprul pa sku gsung thugs mi zad pa'i rgyan gyis khams gsum thams cad du khyab par bstan pa de ni kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su🔽dag pa rnams kyi spyod yul du gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis kyang de ltar rnam par sprul pa sku gsung thugs mi zad pa'i rgyan gyis khams gsum thams cad du khyab par bstan pa de ni kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su dag pa rnams kyi spyod yul du gyur gyi /
translated: That is the domain of the pure bodhisattvas such as Samantabhadra.

original: gdul ba'i 'gro ba 'og ma rnams kyi spyod yul du ma gyur pas /
analyzed: gdul ba'i 'gro ba 'og ma rnams kyi spyod yul du ma gyur pas /
translated: It is not the domain of the lower disciples.

original: sku la sogs pa mi zad pa'i rgyan de nyid gdul ba'i 'gro ba de rnams kyi don du rgyud 'dir dkyil 'khor dang sngags dang phyag rgya'i sgo nas lus ngag yid kyi mtshan mar gyur pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sku la sogs pa mi zad pa'i rgyan de nyid gdul ba'i 'gro ba de rnams kyi don du rgyud 'dir dkyil 'khor dang sngags dang phyag rgya'i sgo nas lus ngag yid kyi mtshan mar gyur pa bstan pa ste /
translated: For the sake of those disciples, the inexhaustible ornaments of body and so on are taught in this tantra through the door of the maṇḍala, mantra, and mudra as the characteristics of body, speech, and mind.

original: byin gyis rlob pa zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor dang sngags dang phyag rgya'i sgo nas lus ngag yid gsum gyi cha lugs dang rang bzhin du lhag par gzhag ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor dang sngags dang phyag rgya'i sgo nas lus ngag yid gsum gyi cha lugs dang rang bzhin du lhag par gzhag ces pa'i don to //
translated: “ Blessing” means to establish the aspects of body, speech, and mind in the costume and nature of the deity through the door of the maṇḍala, mantra, and mudra.

original: de ltar rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa rnam par sprul pa byin gyis rlob pa zhes pa don dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan tsam gyis mgo smos pas go ba'i gdul bya rnams kyis don 'di lta bur go ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa rnam par sprul pa byin gyis rlob pa zhes pa don dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan tsam gyis mgo smos pas go ba'i gdul bya rnams kyis don 'di lta bur go ste /
translated: Thus, those disciples who understand the meaning of this by merely hearing the title, which is a name that accords with the meaning, will understand the meaning in this way.

original: de dag gi don du rgyud 'di'i mtshan tsam smos par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi don du rgyud 'di'i mtshan tsam smos par shes par bya'o //
translated: For their sake, one should understand that the mere title of this tantra is mentioned.

original: de ltar shes pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar shes pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: Not only is it understood in this way,

original: @262b gzhan yang rgyud 'di'i 'brel pa dang / brjod bar bya ba bstan pa dang dgos pa yang bstan par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: @262b gzhan yang rgyud 'di'i 'brel pa dang / brjod bar bya ba bstan pa dang dgos pa yang bstan par shes par bya ste /
translated: but one should also understand the connection of this tantra, the teaching of what is to be expressed, and the purpose.

original: rgyud 'di ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor sku mi zad pa la sogs pa'i rgyud dang 'brel par blta ste /
analyzed: rgyud 'di ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor sku mi zad pa la sogs pa'i rgyud dang 'brel par blta ste /
translated: This tantra is to be seen as connected to the tantras of the inexhaustible body mandala and so on, which are the nature of Bhagavat Vairocana.

original: rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor 'di ni rgyud 'di'i rgyu yin la rgyud 'di ni de'i 'bras bur shes par bya ste de ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor 'di ni rgyud 'di'i rgyu yin la rgyud 'di ni de'i 'bras bur shes par bya ste de ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: This natural mandala is the cause of this tantra, and this tantra is to be understood as its result. That is the connection.

original: de bzhin du rgyud 'dir dkyil 'khor dang sngags dang phyag rgya'i sgo nas lus dang ngag dang yid ji ltab bzhin du bstan pas rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshul ji lta bu yin pa rgyud 'dis mtshon par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyud 'dir dkyil 'khor dang sngags dang phyag rgya'i sgo nas lus dang ngag dang yid ji ltab bzhin du bstan pas rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshul ji lta bu yin pa rgyud 'dis mtshon par shes par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, since this tantra teaches the body, speech, and mind by way of the maṇḍala, mantra, and mudrā, one should understand that this tantra illustrates the mode of the natural maṇḍala.

original: de bas na rgyud 'di ni rjod par byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na rgyud 'di ni rjod par byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, this tantra is the means of expression, and the natural maṇḍala of the Bhagavān is the object of expression.

original: de la dgos pa ni rgyud 'dir ji skad du bshad pa'i rim gyis sgrub pa'i spyod pas rang gi lhag pa'i lha mnyes par byas nas lha dang mi'i longs spyod dang / ral gri dang rig 'dzin la sogs pa mngon par mtho ba'i mtshan nyid thob pa ni dngos dang brgyud nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi mkhyen rab dam pas bla na med pa'i thams cad mkhyen par gyur pa ni dgos pa de'i yang dgos par shes
analyzed: de la dgos pa ni rgyud 'dir ji skad du bshad pa'i rim gyis sgrub pa'i spyod pas rang gi lhag pa'i lha mnyes par byas nas lha dang mi'i longs spyod dang / ral gri dang rig 'dzin la sogs pa mngon par mtho ba'i mtshan nyid thob pa ni dngos dang brgyud nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi mkhyen rab dam pas bla na med pa'i thams cad mkhyen par gyur pa ni dgos pa de'i yang dgos par shes
translated: The purpose is that, having pleased one's excellent deity by means of the practice explained in this tantra, one obtains the characteristics of the higher states of gods and humans, and the characteristics of the higher states of the sword, the knowledge-holder, and so forth. The purpose of the purpose is to be understood as the unsurpassed omniscience of the Bhagavat Vairocana, who has become omniscient through the excellent wisdom of the Bhagavat Vairocana, directly and indirectly.

original: par bya'o // don rnam par phye bas go ba'i gdul ba rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: par bya'o // don rnam par phye bas go ba'i gdul ba rnams kyis ni /
translated: Those disciples who understand through an analysis of the meaning

original: don de dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan tsam smos pas rgyud kyi don shes par mi nus te /
analyzed: don de dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan tsam smos pas rgyud kyi don shes par mi nus te /
translated: are unable to understand the meaning of the tantra by merely mentioning a name that is consistent with that meaning.

original: de bas na de dag gi don du rgyud kyi don rnams rnam par phye ste bshad pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyud dang / rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang de'i mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyu dang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu la sogs pa bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi don du rgyud kyi don rnams rnam par phye ste bshad pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyud dang / rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang de'i mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyu dang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu la sogs pa bshad pa ste /
translated: Therefore, for the sake of those, the meaning of the tantra is explained by dividing it into the tantra of Vairocana, the explanation of the nature, result, cause of its manifest enlightenment, nature, result, and so on.

original: de la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu bshad pa ni /
translated: Among those, the explanation of the cause of Vairocana is as follows:

original: 'jig rten pa'i sems kyi rim pa brgyad la sogs pa dang / mos pas spyod pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa'i rim pas kun du sangs rgyas pa'i sa'i bar du ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sems kyi rim pa brgyad la sogs pa dang / mos pas spyod pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa'i rim pas kun du sangs rgyas pa'i sa'i bar du ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu bshad pa'o //
translated: The stages of the worldly mind, such as the eight, and the stages of the supramundane bhūmis, such as the stage of engagement through belief, up to the stage of perfect buddhahood, are the explanation of the cause of Vairocana.

original: rang bzhin bshad pa yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku rnam pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin bshad pa yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku rnam pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The explanation of the nature is also the characteristic of the four bodies of Bhagavān Vairocana.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin bshad pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin bshad pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the nature of Bhagavān Vairocana is as follows:

original: gang gi phyir rgyud 'dir sprul pa'i sku rnam pa gnyis su brtags nas sku bzhir bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyud 'dir sprul pa'i sku rnam pa gnyis su brtags nas sku bzhir bshad pa yin no //
translated: Because in this Tantra, having analyzed the Emanation Body into two, it explains the four Bodies.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid mi zad pa'i rgyan rnam par sprul pas khams gsum thams cad khyab pa /🔽sems can dang sems @263a * //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid mi zad pa'i rgyan rnam par sprul pas khams gsum thams cad khyab pa / sems can dang sems @263a * //
translated: The emanation of the adornment of the inexhaustible Body, Speech, and Mind pervades the entire three realms.

original: can ma yin pa'i lus la sogs par snod du gyur pa ji ltar snang ba de ni de'i 'bras bu bshad pa'o //
analyzed: can ma yin pa'i lus la sogs par snod du gyur pa ji ltar snang ba de ni de'i 'bras bu bshad pa'o //
translated: The appearance of the sentient and non-sentient bodies, etc., as the vessel is the result of that.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyu yang rgyu ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyu yang rgyu ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The cause of manifest enlightenment is the cause, which is the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: rtsa ba ni snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba ni snying rje chen po'o //
translated: The root is great compassion.

original: mthar thug pa ni thabs so zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa ni thabs so zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The culmination is the means.

original: rang bzhin yang de la byang chub gang zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang de la byang chub gang zhe na /
translated: The nature is also that. What is enlightenment?

original: gang rang gi sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ste zhes pa la sogs pa ji skad du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang rang gi sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ste zhes pa la sogs pa ji skad du gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is the thorough knowledge of one's own mind just as it is.

original: de bzhin du de'i rnam par sprul pa dang / byin gyis rlob pa dag kyang bshad par bya ste zhib tu ni bsdus pa'i don nyid du bshad pas 'dir ma smos so //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rnam par sprul pa dang / byin gyis rlob pa dag kyang bshad par bya ste zhib tu ni bsdus pa'i don nyid du bshad pas 'dir ma smos so //
translated: Likewise, its emanations and blessings should be explained, but since they are explained in detail in the very meaning of the summary, they are not mentioned here.

original: tshig lhur len pa'i gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnams kyis de ltar rgyu dang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu la sogs pa rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: tshig lhur len pa'i gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnams kyis de ltar rgyu dang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu la sogs pa rnam par phye ste /
translated: Those who are disciples who are intent on the words, having explained the causes, natures, results, and so on, having distinguished them in that way,

original: bshad kyang tshig dang don rnams zhib tu mi go ste /
analyzed: bshad kyang tshig dang don rnams zhib tu mi go ste /
translated: do not understand the words and meanings in detail.

original: de bas na de dag gi don du tshig re re nas spros shing rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi don du tshig re re nas spros shing rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, for their sake, in order to elaborate and explain each word in detail,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa byin gyis rlob pa zhes pa la sogs pa rgyud 'di'i thog ma nas mjug gi bar du spros te bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa byin gyis rlob pa zhes pa la sogs pa rgyud 'di'i thog ma nas mjug gi bar du spros te bshad pa yin no //
translated: the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the One Who Blesses, and so on, elaborates and explains from the beginning to the end of this tantra.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa byin gyis rlob pa rdo rje chen po rgya che ba la sogs pa rgyud 'di thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bcu gcig bstan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa byin gyis rlob pa rdo rje chen po rgya che ba la sogs pa rgyud 'di thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bcu gcig bstan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: In this regard, all of these tantras, beginning with the Great Expanse of the Blessing of the Blessed One, the Tathagata, teach the eleven perfections of the Blessed One Vairocana.

original: spong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / ston pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mthu phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan gyi don gyi thabs phun sum tshogs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: spong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / ston pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mthu phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan gyi don gyi thabs phun sum tshogs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: They are the perfection of abandonment, the perfection of abode, the perfection of retinue, the perfection of teacher, the perfection of power, the perfection of the method for others' benefit, the perfection of the cause of the Blessed One Vairocana,

original: rang bzhin phun sum tshogs /
analyzed: rang bzhin phun sum tshogs /
translated: the perfection of nature,

original: pa dang / byang chub kyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub kyi rnam par sprul pa byin gyis rlob pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang / byang chub kyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub kyi rnam par sprul pa byin gyis rlob pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of the cause of enlightenment, the perfection of nature, and the perfection of the blessing of the emanations of enlightenment.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das zhes pa'i tshig gis spong ba phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das zhes pa'i tshig gis spong ba phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The word “bhagavat” indicates the perfection of abandonment,🔽which is defined as the abandonment of all afflictive and cognitive

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid do//
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid do//
translated: obscurations.

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa ni yon tan rnam pa brgyad dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa ni yon tan rnam pa brgyad dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The perfection of the place is endowed with eight qualities.

original: de la 'dir gnas phun sum tshogs pa brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir gnas phun sum tshogs pa brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, the eight perfections of the place are as follows:🔽The perfection of the place of the gathering of all tathāgatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad lhag par gnas pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sra zhing rgya che ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub chen po thugs su chud pa'i gnas phun sum tshogs @263b pa dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams mngon par 'du ba phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad lhag par gnas pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sra zhing rgya che ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub chen po thugs su chud pa'i gnas phun sum tshogs @263b pa dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams mngon par 'du ba phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: the perfection of the place that is solid and vast, the perfection of the place that is the realization of great awakening, the perfection of the place that is the gathering of the great bodhisattvas who are vajra holders,

original: snga khang gi rtse mo rgya che ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa dang / gdan phun sum tshogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: snga khang gi rtse mo rgya che ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa dang / gdan phun sum tshogs pa rnams so //
translated: The first chamber is excellent in terms of its vastness, excellent in terms of its color, excellent in terms of its shape, and excellent in terms of its seat.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa byin gyis rlob pa zhes pa'i tshig gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad lhag par gnas pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //🔽rdo rje chen po brgya che ba //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa byin gyis rlob pa zhes pa'i tshig gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad lhag par gnas pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to // rdo rje chen po brgya che ba //
translated: There, the phrase “blessed by the Tathagatas” indicates the excellence of the abode of all the Tathagatas.

original: zhes pa'i tshig gis sra zhing rgya che ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig gis sra zhing rgya che ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “great vajra, great size” indicates the excellence of its solidity and vastness.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi pho brang zhes pas ni byang chub chen po thugs su chud pa'i gnas phun sum tshogs pa'o //🔽rdo rje 'dzin thams cad 'du ba //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi pho brang zhes pas ni byang chub chen po thugs su chud pa'i gnas phun sum tshogs pa'o // rdo rje 'dzin thams cad 'du ba //
translated: The phrase “palace of the realm of phenomena” indicates the excellence of the abode of the realization of great enlightenment.

original: zhes pas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par 'du ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par 'du ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “gathering of all vajra holders” indicates the excellence of the gathering of the bodhisattvas who are vajra holders.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pas rnam par rol pa mtha' dang dbung med cing rtse mo mtho ba zhes pas ni snga khang gi rtse mo rgya che ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pas rnam par rol pa mtha' dang dbung med cing rtse mo mtho ba zhes pas ni snga khang gi rtse mo rgya che ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the Tathāgata’s palace, which was limitless and boundless, and whose peak was lofty” describes the excellence of the palace’s height.

original: rin po che'i rgyal pos shin tu legs par brgyan pa 'byung ba zhes pas ni kha dog phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che'i rgyal pos shin tu legs par brgyan pa 'byung ba zhes pas ni kha dog phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “which was adorned with the finest jewels” describes the excellence of its color.

original: khang bzangs chen po rin po che'i rgyal po'i zhes pas ni dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: khang bzangs chen po rin po che'i rgyal po'i zhes pas ni dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the great palace of the king of jewels” describes the excellence of its shape.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi seng ge'i khri la bzhugs zhes pas ni gdan phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi seng ge'i khri la bzhugs zhes pas ni gdan phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase “seated upon a lion throne in the center of a great lotus flower” describes the excellence of its location.🔽The phrase “upon which was seated the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha, the one endowed with knowledge and good conduct, the Sugata, the knower of the world, the unsurpassed guide of those who need training, the teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Blessed Lord” describes the excellence of its occupant.

original: de dag ni phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa brgyad dang ldan pa ste gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa brgyad dang ldan pa ste gnyis pa'o //
translated: These are the eight excellences.

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni rdo rje 'dzin nam mkha' dri ma med pa zhes pa nas kun du bzang po dang / byams pa dang / 'jam dpal dang sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba zhes pa la sogs pas rig par bya ste de dag gis bskor zhing mdun du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni rdo rje 'dzin nam mkha' dri ma med pa zhes pa nas kun du bzang po dang / byams pa dang / 'jam dpal dang sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba zhes pa la sogs pas rig par bya ste de dag gis bskor zhing mdun du byas pa'o //
translated: The excellent retinue is indicated by the words “Vajra Holder, the stainless sky,” and so forth, up to “Samantabhadra, Maitreya, Manjushri, Sarvanivaranavishkambhin,” and so forth, who surround him and are in his presence.

original: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa ni lung dang rtogs pa'i chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa ni lung dang rtogs pa'i chos ston pa ste /
translated: The excellent teacher is the one who teaches the Dharma of transmission and realization.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma dus gsum las 'das par byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma dus gsum las 'das par byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: Moreover, after the sun of the tathagatas has blessed the three times to be beyond time,

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi gzhi zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sgo'i chos ston to zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi gzhi zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sgo'i chos ston to zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: he teaches the Dharma of the Dharma gateway called “the basis of the equality of body, speech, and mind.”

original: mthu phun sum tshogs pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i gtso bo rnams kyis ma thob pa'i rnal 'byor gyi sbrul pa thob pa ste skabs der /
analyzed: mthu phun sum tshogs pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i gtso bo rnams kyis ma thob pa'i rnal 'byor gyi sbrul pa thob pa ste skabs der /
translated: The excellent power is the attainment of the yoga of emanation that is not attained by the principal ones of mundane and supramundane yoga.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po la sogs pa de dag dang / gsang ba pa'i bdag po la sogs @264a * //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po la sogs pa de dag dang / gsang ba pa'i bdag po la sogs @264a * //
translated: Then, the bodhisattvas such as Samantabhadra and the vajra holders such as Guhyapati

original: pa rdo rje 'dzin pa de dag bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis sku mnyam pa nyid bkod pa mi zad pa'i mdzod rnam par bsgyings pa la zhugs so //
analyzed: pa rdo rje 'dzin pa de dag bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis sku mnyam pa nyid bkod pa mi zad pa'i mdzod rnam par bsgyings pa la zhugs so //
translated: entered the array of the inexhaustible treasury of the equality of the body of the Bhagavat Vairocana.

original: de bzhin du gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid bkod pa mi zad pa'i mdzod rnam par bsgyings pa la zhugs te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid bkod pa mi zad pa'i mdzod rnam par bsgyings pa la zhugs te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Similarly, they entered the array of the inexhaustible treasury of the equality of speech and mind.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi thabs phun sum tshogs pa ni skabs de thams cad du yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i phrin las thams cad dang / gsung gi phrin las thams cad dang / thugs kyi phrin las thams cad sems can gyi khams thams cad la kun du gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi tshig dag gis chos ston par mthong ba zhes pa nas de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten rab tu sim par🔽bgyid pa lags na zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi thabs phun sum tshogs pa ni skabs de thams cad du yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i phrin las thams cad dang / gsung gi phrin las thams cad dang / thugs kyi phrin las thams cad sems can gyi khams thams cad la kun du gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi tshig dag gis chos ston par mthong ba zhes pa nas de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten rab tu sim par🔽bgyid pa lags na zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
translated: The passage continues, “In the same way, the wisdom of omniscience is seen to bring great comfort to the world with its gods…”

original: gzhan yang rgyud 'dir bshad pa thams cad kyis ji ltar rigs par bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa dang / de'i byang chub kyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyud 'dir bshad pa thams cad kyis ji ltar rigs par bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa dang / de'i byang chub kyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: Moreover, all the explanations in this tantra are to be understood as the eleven perfections of the Bhagavat Vairocana: the perfection of cause, the perfection of nature, the perfection of the cause of his enlightenment, the perfection of his nature, the perfection of the cause of his great compassion, the perfection of his nature, the perfection of the cause of his great love, the perfection of his nature, the perfection of the cause of his great joy, the perfection of his nature, the perfection of the cause of his great equanimity, and the perfection of his nature.

original: byang chub kyi rnam par sprul pa byin gyis rlob pa'i rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi rnam par sprul pa byin gyis rlob pa'i rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The perfection of the cause of his great compassion is the perfection of his nature of blessing the emanations of his enlightenment.

original: sngar bshad zin pas 'dir ma bshad do //
analyzed: sngar bshad zin pas 'dir ma bshad do //
translated: Since this has already been explained, it is not explained here.

original: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bcu gcig gis ni rgyu 'di thams cad bsdus par blta'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bcu gcig gis ni rgyu 'di thams cad bsdus par blta'o //
translated: Therefore, the eleven perfections of the Bhagavat Vairocana should be seen as including all these causes.

original: mdo sde dang rgyud gzhan dag tu 'di skad bdag gis thos pa 'byung la /
analyzed: mdo sde dang rgyud gzhan dag tu 'di skad bdag gis thos pa 'byung la /
translated: In other sutras and tantras, it is said, Thus have I heard.

original: rgyud 'dir ma smos pa ni ston pa dang dus dang gnas des pa dang nyan pa dang sdud par mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po dang / phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa rtogs pa gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir 'di skad bdag gis thos pa ma smos te /
analyzed: rgyud 'dir ma smos pa ni ston pa dang dus dang gnas des pa dang nyan pa dang sdud par mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po dang / phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa rtogs pa gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir 'di skad bdag gis thos pa ma smos te /
translated: The reason that the phrase “thus have I heard” is not mentioned in this tantra is that the teacher, time, place, compiler, and the bodhisattvas who compiled it, such as Samantabhadra and Vajrapāṇi, are primarily realized.

original: rgyud 'di bshad pa yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mngon par byang chub pa'i sku'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byang chub kyi snying por rtag tu bzhugs pas bshad de /
analyzed: rgyud 'di bshad pa yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mngon par byang chub pa'i sku'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byang chub kyi snying por rtag tu bzhugs pas bshad de /
translated: The explanation of this tantra is also explained by the blessed Vairocana, the saṃbhogakāya, through the blessing of the body of manifest enlightenment.

original: dus dang gnas de nyid na nges par bzhugs pas dus gcig gi tshe zhes pa ma smos so //
analyzed: dus dang gnas de nyid na nges par bzhugs pas dus gcig gi tshe zhes pa ma smos so //
translated: Since he always abides at the site of enlightenment, the phrase “at one time” is not mentioned.

original: nyan pa po yang kun du bzang po la sogs pa de rnams thos pa snying por gyur pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan pa po yang kun du bzang po la sogs pa de rnams thos pa snying por gyur pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The listeners, such as Samantabhadra, are not the essence of hearing.

original: rtogs pa gtso @264b bor gyur pas 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes ma smos so //
analyzed: rtogs pa gtso @264b bor gyur pas 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes ma smos so //
translated: Since realization is primary, “thus have I heard” is not mentioned.

original: mdo sde dang gzhung gzhan dag tu smos pa ni bcom ldan 'das longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dus dang gnas ma nges pa na yang bzhugs te /
analyzed: mdo sde dang gzhung gzhan dag tu smos pa ni bcom ldan 'das longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dus dang gnas ma nges pa na yang bzhugs te /
translated: The sutras and other scriptures mention that the Bhagavan, the body of perfect enjoyment, abides in time and place without restriction.

original: bar bar ni 'og min gyi gnas na bzhugs shing chos 'chad /
analyzed: bar bar ni 'og min gyi gnas na bzhugs shing chos 'chad /
translated: Sometimes he abides in the Akanistha realm and teaches the Dharma.🔽Sometimes he abides on the peak of Mount Meru and teaches the Dharma and likewise, sometimes his emanations abide in Rajagrha and sometimes in Sravasti and so on and teach the Dharma.

original: res 'ga' ni ri rab kyi rtse mo na bzhugs shing chos 'chad pa dang / de bzhin du sprul pa yang res 'ga' ni rgyal po'i khab na bzhugs res 'ga' ni mnyan du yod pa la sogs pa'i gnas na bzhugs shing chos 'chad pa de de ltar gnas dang dus ma nges pas dus gcig gi tshe na zhes smos la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni ri rab kyi rtse mo na bzhugs shing chos 'chad pa dang / de bzhin du sprul pa yang res 'ga' ni rgyal po'i khab na bzhugs res 'ga' ni mnyan du yod pa la sogs pa'i gnas na bzhugs shing chos 'chad pa de de ltar gnas dang dus ma nges pas dus gcig gi tshe na zhes smos la /
translated: Since he abides in such places and times without restriction, it is said that at one time.

original: nyan pa po yang 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa thos pa snying por gyur pa ste /
analyzed: nyan pa po yang 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa thos pa snying por gyur pa ste /
translated: The listeners are arya sravakas and so on for whom listening is the essence.

original: rtogs pa gtso bor gyur pa ma yin pas na 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes ma smos so //
analyzed: rtogs pa gtso bor gyur pa ma yin pas na 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes ma smos so //
translated: Since realization is not their priority, it is not said that they listened in this way.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bcu gcig kyang rnam pa bzhir bsdus te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bcu gcig kyang rnam pa bzhir bsdus te /
translated: The eleven perfections of the Bhagavat Vairocana are also included in four.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: skyes bu dang gnas dang 'khor dang dgos pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dang gnas dang 'khor dang dgos pa'o //
translated: They are the person, the place, the retinue, and the purpose.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags yan chad dpyis phyin par shes rab kyis bshig ste med par byas pa ni bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags yan chad dpyis phyin par shes rab kyis bshig ste med par byas pa ni bcom pa'o //
translated: With regard to that, the Bhagavat is the one who has destroyed, that is, eliminated, the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, including their traces, by means of wisdom.

original: gnyis su na bdud rnams bcom pa la yang bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis su na bdud rnams bcom pa la yang bya ste /
translated: Alternately, it is also to be taken as the one who has destroyed the demons.

original: mdor na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa yang mngon par byang chub pa'i sku la bya ste /
analyzed: mdor na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa yang mngon par byang chub pa'i sku la bya ste /
translated: In brief, the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience is to be taken as the body of manifest enlightenment.

original: des ni skyes bu'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: des ni skyes bu'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the greatness of the person.

original: skyes bu'i che ba bstan pa de yang chos nyan pa'i sems can chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnam pa gnyis las chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni 'chad pa'i skyes bu la mi rtog par chos bzang ngan rtog pas der zad la /
analyzed: skyes bu'i che ba bstan pa de yang chos nyan pa'i sems can chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnam pa gnyis las chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni 'chad pa'i skyes bu la mi rtog par chos bzang ngan rtog pas der zad la /
translated: Those who follow the Dharma are not concerned with the person who teaches the Dharma, but only with the Dharma, whether good or bad.

original: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ni 'chad pa'i skyes bu btsan pas de 'di la yid ches pa'i phyir dgos pa'i dgos par gyur pa'i skyes bu btsan pa de bstan to //
analyzed: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ni 'chad pa'i skyes bu btsan pas de 'di la yid ches pa'i phyir dgos pa'i dgos par gyur pa'i skyes bu btsan pa de bstan to //
translated: Those who follow faith are concerned with the person who teaches the Dharma, because they have confidence in him.

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa yang dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i 'gro ba gzung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa yang dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i 'gro ba gzung ba'i phyir te /
translated: The excellence of the place is taught in order to attract beings who follow faith.

original: gnas de lta bu na bzhugs pas bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba'am btsun pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: gnas de lta bu na bzhugs pas bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba'am btsun pa bstan pas so //
translated: Because he resides in such a place, the greatness or eminence of the Bhagavan is taught.

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa yang gcig pur mi bzhugs kyi 'khor de lta bus bskor cing bzhugs so zhes pas bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba'am btsun par bstan pa yin no //🔽de'i skyes bu btsan par @265a * //
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa yang gcig pur mi bzhugs kyi 'khor de lta bus bskor cing bzhugs so zhes pas bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba'am btsun par bstan pa yin no // de'i skyes bu btsan par @265a * //
translated: The greatness or nobility of the Lord is taught.

original: bstan pa na /
analyzed: bstan pa na /
translated: When his greatness is taught,

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i 'gro ba dogs pa med par skyes bu de lta bu la mnyam par spro bas dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sems can gzung pa'i phyir bstan to //
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i 'gro ba dogs pa med par skyes bu de lta bu la mnyam par spro bas dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sems can gzung pa'i phyir bstan to //
translated: those who are followers through faith, without hesitation, are inspired to be equal to such a person. Thus, it is taught in order to attract those sentient beings who are followers through faith.

original: gnas bshad pa yang rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te skyes bu btsan pa dang / gnas de lta bu'i yon tan sgrub pa pos rjes su dran par byas na 'grub pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpas bcags pa'i gnas de mchod rten du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas bshad pa yang rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te skyes bu btsan pa dang / gnas de lta bu'i yon tan sgrub pa pos rjes su dran par byas na 'grub pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpas bcags pa'i gnas de mchod rten du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching of the place is also for three reasons: for the sake of the greatness of the person, for the sake of the establishment of the qualities of such a place by the practitioner through recollection, and for the sake of the transformation of that place, which is trodden by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, into a stupa.

original: skyes bu btsan pa ni gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: skyes bu btsan pa ni gong du bshad zin to //
translated: The greatness of the person has already been explained above.

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The excellent retinue is also threefold:🔽the excellent person, the excellent assembly, and the excellent Dharma.🔽The excellent person is taught to be the bodhisattvas and the vajra holders such as Vimalagaganatva, who are the best of those who listen to and uphold the Dharma.

original: skyes bu btsan pa dang de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' dang rdo rje 'dzin pa nam mkha' dri ma med pa la sogs pa chos nyan pa dang 'dzin pa'i mchog tu bstan pa dang / nyan pa'i mchog de dag bzhugs pas sdud par mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du gyur par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu btsan pa dang de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' dang rdo rje 'dzin pa nam mkha' dri ma med pa la sogs pa chos nyan pa dang 'dzin pa'i mchog tu bstan pa dang / nyan pa'i mchog de dag bzhugs pas sdud par mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du gyur par bstan pa'o //
translated: The excellent assembly is taught to be the bodhisattvas who are the compilers, because they are the ones who listen to the Dharma.🔽The excellent Dharma is taught to be the Dharma that is to be compiled, because it is the Dharma that is to be listened to.

original: skyes bu ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: skyes bu ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The excellent person has already been explained.

original: dgos pa ni rgyud 'dir rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyud dang / rang bzhin dbang chen dang chu la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor sgrub pa dang / las bshad pa'i rim pa bzhin du bsgrubs nas mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i bde ba thob par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa ni rgyud 'dir rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyud dang / rang bzhin dbang chen dang chu la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor sgrub pa dang / las bshad pa'i rim pa bzhin du bsgrubs nas mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i bde ba thob par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The purpose is for the sake of attaining the bliss of high status and the auspicious state of liberation by accomplishing the tantra of Vairocana's manifest enlightenment in this tantra, the maṇḍalas of the natural great lords of water and so forth, and the stages of explained activities.

original: de ltar phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bcu gcig po bzhi po 'dir bsdus so //
analyzed: de ltar phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bcu gcig po bzhi po 'dir bsdus so //
translated: Thus, the eleven perfections are included in these four.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa byin gyis rlob pa zhes pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad byang chub kyi snying po na gnas pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa byin gyis rlob pa zhes pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad byang chub kyi snying po na gnas pa la bya ste /
translated: In this context, the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata, is the consecration, which refers to all the Tathāgatas of the past, future, and present who abide at the essence of enlightenment.

original: byin gyis rlob pa zhes pa'i tshig ni gnas pa'i don to //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa zhes pa'i tshig ni gnas pa'i don to //
translated: The word “consecration” has the meaning of abiding.

original: skabs 'dir byang chub kyi snying po na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi sangs rgyas thams cad gnas pas sangs rgyas mang po gnas par 'gyur ba'i dogs pa bsal ba la sogs pa ni bsdus pa'i don nyid du zhib tu bshad pas 'dir ma
analyzed: skabs 'dir byang chub kyi snying po na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi sangs rgyas thams cad gnas pas sangs rgyas mang po gnas par 'gyur ba'i dogs pa bsal ba la sogs pa ni bsdus pa'i don nyid du zhib tu bshad pas 'dir ma
translated: Here, since all the Buddhas of the past, future, and present abide at the essence of enlightenment, the doubts such as “there will be many Buddhas abiding there” are eliminated. Since this is explained in detail in the very meaning of the summary, it is not mentioned here.

original: smos so // rdo rje chen po ni rdo rje de nyid phal pa ma yin gyi mchog gam dam pa la chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smos so // rdo rje chen po ni rdo rje de nyid phal pa ma yin gyi mchog gam dam pa la chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The “great vajra” is not an ordinary vajra, but is called “great” because it is supreme or sublime.

original: rgya che ba ni rdo rje dang ldan pa'i khang pa de ni yangs shing rgya che ba'am rdo rje de dag nyid grangs mang ba la bya'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni rdo rje dang ldan pa'i khang pa de ni yangs shing rgya che ba'am rdo rje de dag nyid grangs mang ba la bya'o //
translated: Vast means that the palace endowed with vajras is vast and extensive, or that those vajras themselves are numerous.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi pho brang zhes bya ba ni de la chos ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi pho brang zhes bya ba ni de la chos ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched do //
translated: The palace of the dharmadhatu means that dharmas are the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: dbyings ni rang bzhin te phung po la sogs pa'i chos kun rdzob pa'i mtshan nyid rigs pas brtag mi bzod pa ste /
analyzed: dbyings ni rang bzhin te phung po la sogs pa'i chos kun rdzob pa'i mtshan nyid rigs pas brtag mi bzod pa ste /
translated: Dhatu is the nature, which is the emptiness of the aggregates and so on, unable to withstand rational analysis of their superficial characteristics.

original: @265b stong pa nyid ni de dag gi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: @265b stong pa nyid ni de dag gi rang bzhin te /
translated: Emptiness is their nature.

original: stong pa'i rang bzhin khong du chud pa ni pho brang ngam 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa'i rang bzhin khong du chud pa ni pho brang ngam 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Comprehending the nature of emptiness is called a palace or an emergence.

original: rdo rje 'dzin thams cad 'du ba zhes pa de la rdo rje ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta ba 'joms pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin thams cad 'du ba zhes pa de la rdo rje ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta ba 'joms pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: The gathering of all vajra holders means that vajra is the wisdom that conquers incorrect views.

original: shes rab de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses that wisdom is a vajra holder.

original: 'du ba'i tshig ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa'i skabs su bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'du ba'i tshig ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa'i skabs su bshad zin to //
translated: The word “assembled” was explained in the section on the excellence of the place.

original: rdo rje 'dzin ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang der mi 'du ba ni ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang der mi 'du ba ni ma yin mod kyi /
translated: It is not the case that the bodhisattvas who are not vajra holders do not assemble there.

original: 'dir sngags bshad pa'i skabs yin pas rdo rje 'dzin pa gtso bor smos so //
analyzed: 'dir sngags bshad pa'i skabs yin pas rdo rje 'dzin pa gtso bor smos so //
translated: But since this is a section on the explanation of the mantra, the vajra holder is mentioned as the principal figure.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa yang rnam pa gsum gyi phyir 'dzin te /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa yang rnam pa gsum gyi phyir 'dzin te /
translated: The vajra holder is also held to be of three kinds:

original: so so'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo ston pa dang / rig pa'i brtul zhugs dang mchod pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo ston pa dang / rig pa'i brtul zhugs dang mchod pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dzin pa'o //
translated: the one who is held to show the door of liberation of each of the bodhisattvas, and the one who is held to be the observance of awareness and the branch of worship.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyag rgya autpala dang padmo la sogs pa 'dzin pa yang so so'i rnam par thar pa'i ston par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyag rgya autpala dang padmo la sogs pa 'dzin pa yang so so'i rnam par thar pa'i ston par rig par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas who have arisen from the perfections and hold the seals of the utpala, lotus, and so on, should be known to show their individual liberations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pas rnam par rol pa zhes pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na de lta bu'i gnas la sogs par mos shing smon pa las ji ltar smon pa bzhin du thob nas spyod pa ni rol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pas rnam par rol pa zhes pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na de lta bu'i gnas la sogs par mos shing smon pa las ji ltar smon pa bzhin du thob nas spyod pa ni rol ba'o //
translated: The Tathagata's Play of Devotion, when he was practicing the Bodhisattva deeds, was devoted to such places and so forth, and having attained them just as he had wished, he played.

original: mtha' dang dbung med cing rtse mo mtho ba zhes pa ni mtha' gnyis dmigs su med pas na dbus kyang dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' dang dbung med cing rtse mo mtho ba zhes pa ni mtha' gnyis dmigs su med pas na dbus kyang dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: Without end or middle, with a high peak, the two ends are not perceived, so the middle is also not perceived.

original: rtse mo mtho ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu'i gtsug tor dang 'dra ste rtse mo ltar mi snang ba la bya'o //
analyzed: rtse mo mtho ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu'i gtsug tor dang 'dra ste rtse mo ltar mi snang ba la bya'o //
translated: The high peak is like the ushnisha on the Tathagata's head, meaning that the peak does not appear.

original: rin po che'i rgyal pos shin tu legs par brgyan pa 'byung ba zhes pa ni kha dog phun sum tshogs pa ste snga khang de nyid rin po ches spras pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rin po che'i rgyal pos shin tu legs par brgyan pa 'byung ba zhes pa ni kha dog phun sum tshogs pa ste snga khang de nyid rin po ches spras pa la bya'o //
translated: Arising, well-adorned with the king of jewels, refers to the perfection of color, meaning that the palace itself is adorned with jewels.

original: khang bzangs chen po rin po che'i rgyal po'i nang na zhes pa ni dbyibs bshad pa'o //
analyzed: khang bzangs chen po rin po che'i rgyal po'i nang na zhes pa ni dbyibs bshad pa'o //
translated: In the great palace, in the king of jewels, explains the shape.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi seng ge'i khri la bzhugs zhes pa ni sngon gyi smon lam gyis seng ge'i lus su gyur cing seng ge'i khri byed pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi seng ge'i khri la bzhugs zhes pa ni sngon gyi smon lam gyis seng ge'i lus su gyur cing seng ge'i khri byed pa'am /
translated: The phrase “seated on a lion throne in the body of a bodhisattva” means that through his previous aspirations, he has taken on the body of a lion and is making a lion throne,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lus nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi gdan du byed de seng ge'i bya ba byed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lus nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi gdan du byed de seng ge'i bya ba byed pa la bya'o //
translated: or the body of a bodhisattva itself is the seat of the Bhagavān, and he is performing the activity of a lion.

original: bcom ldan 'das gnas de lta bu na bzhugs pa yang 'khor byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje 'dzin nam mkha' 'dri ma med pa la sogs pa 'di rnams dang bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gnas de lta bu na bzhugs pa yang 'khor byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje 'dzin nam mkha' 'dri ma med pa la sogs pa 'di rnams dang bzhugs te /
translated: The Bhagavān is dwelling in such a place together with the bodhisattvas, such as the bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi, who is like the sky free of stains, and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang don dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan can sha stag gzhung las 'byung bas bskor zhing mdun gyis bltas pa la chos 'chad @266a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang don dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan can sha stag gzhung las 'byung bas bskor zhing mdun gyis bltas pa la chos 'chad @266a * //
translated: The bodhisattvas also have names that accord with their meaning, and they are surrounded by and face the Bhagavān as they listen to the Dharma.

original: do ; /'di lta ste /
analyzed: do ; /'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma dus gsum las 'das par byin gyis brlabs nas sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi gzhi zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sgo'i chos ston to zhes pa chos kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma dus gsum las 'das par byin gyis brlabs nas sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi gzhi zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sgo'i chos ston to zhes pa chos kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Dharma is also of two kinds:

original: rtogs pa'i chos dang lung gi chos so //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i chos dang lung gi chos so //
translated: the Dharma of realization and the Dharma of transmission.

original: de la rtogs pa'i chos kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rtogs pa'i chos kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Dharma of realization is also of two kinds:

original: don dam pa dang kun rdzob pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa dang kun rdzob pa'o //
translated: the ultimate and the relative.

original: don dam pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid stong pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: don dam pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid stong pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The ultimate is the nature of emptiness, the characteristic of suchness.

original: kun rdzob kyi chos ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs mi zad pa'i rgyan gyis khams gsum khyab par ston pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi chos ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs mi zad pa'i rgyan gyis khams gsum khyab par ston pa'o //
translated: The relative Dharma is the display of the adornments of the inexhaustible body, speech and mind of the Tathagata pervading the three realms.

original: lung gi chos ni mdo sde dang tshigs su bcad pa la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: lung gi chos ni mdo sde dang tshigs su bcad pa la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
translated: The Dharma of transmission is the twelve branches of excellent speech, such as the sutras and verses.

original: de rnams las gang bshad ce na /
analyzed: de rnams las gang bshad ce na /
translated: From among those, what is being explained here?

original: skabs 'dir lung gi chos rgyud 'di nyid bshad pa ste /
analyzed: skabs 'dir lung gi chos rgyud 'di nyid bshad pa ste /
translated: In this context, the Dharma of transmission is this very tantra.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi gzhi zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sgo'i chos ston to zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi gzhi zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sgo'i chos ston to zhes gsungs te /
translated: He teaches the Dharma door called the basis of the equality of body, speech, and mind.

original: de la sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid ces pa mnyam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi 'khor los sems can gyi lus dang ngag dang yid ji snyed pa de snyed du khyab pas mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid ces pa mnyam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste / bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi 'khor los sems can gyi lus dang ngag dang yid ji snyed pa de snyed du khyab pas mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Therein, the equality of body, speech, and mind is to be understood through three equalities.🔽The equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of the Bhagavat is the equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of sentient beings.🔽The equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of the Bhagavat is the equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of sentient beings.🔽The equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of the Bhagavat is the equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of sentient beings.

original: gnyis su na bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi 'khor los sems can gyi don du sbyor ba na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i 'khor los gsung dang thugs kyi bya ba yang byed /
analyzed: gnyis su na bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi 'khor los sems can gyi don du sbyor ba na / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i 'khor los gsung dang thugs kyi bya ba yang byed /
translated: The equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of the Bhagavat is the equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of sentient beings.

original: gsung gi 'khor los kyang sku dang thugs kyi bya ba yang byed /🔽thugs kyi 'khor los kyang sku dang gsung gi bya ba yang byed de /
analyzed: gsung gi 'khor los kyang sku dang thugs kyi bya ba yang byed /🔽thugs kyi 'khor los kyang sku dang gsung gi bya ba yang byed de /
translated: The equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of the Bhagavat is the equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of sentient beings.🔽The equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of the Bhagavat is the equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of sentient beings.🔽The equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of the Bhagavat is the equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of sentient beings.🔽The equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of the Bhagavat is the equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of sentient beings.🔽The equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of the Bhagavat is the equality of the wheel of body, speech, and mind of sentient beings.

original: de ltar mtshungs par byed pas na mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar mtshungs par byed pas na mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: It is sameness because it makes them equal in this way.

original: gsum du na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la sogs pa dang ; sems can gyi lus dang ngag dang yid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du dbyer med cing ro gcig pas na mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: gsum du na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la sogs pa dang ; sems can gyi lus dang ngag dang yid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du dbyer med cing ro gcig pas na mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Or else, it is sameness because the body, etc. of the Tathagata and the body, speech, and mind of sentient beings are undifferentiated and of one taste in emptiness.

original: chos kyi sgo zhes pa ni de lta bu'i sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi gzhi de bshad pas rtogs pa'i chos la 'jug par gyur pa'i sgo yin pas sgo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos kyi sgo zhes pa ni de lta bu'i sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi gzhi de bshad pas rtogs pa'i chos la 'jug par gyur pa'i sgo yin pas sgo zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Dharma door is so called because the explanation of that basis of the sameness of body, speech, and mind is the door through which one enters the Dharma of realization.

original: de bzhin du lung gi chos gzhan rnams kyang rtogs pa'i chos la 'jug pa'i sgo lta bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lung gi chos gzhan rnams kyang rtogs pa'i chos la 'jug pa'i sgo lta bur rig par bya'o //
translated: And in the same way, one should understand that the other scriptures are like doors through which one enters the Dharma of realization.

original: de la chos 'chad pa yang sku bzhi gang gis 'chad ce na /
analyzed: de la chos 'chad pa yang sku bzhi gang gis 'chad ce na /
translated: By what kind of four bodies does one expound the Dharma?

original: chos kyi sku dang byang chub kyi snying po na bzhugs pa'i sku ni mi g-yo ba nyid tshig tu brjod pa las 'das pas na tshig gis chos mi 'chad de /
analyzed: chos kyi sku dang byang chub kyi snying po na bzhugs pa'i sku ni mi g-yo ba nyid tshig tu brjod pa las 'das pas na tshig gis chos mi 'chad de /
translated: The Dharma body and the body of the essence of enlightenment do not expound the Dharma through speech, because they are unmoving and beyond verbal expression.

original: de'i byin rlabs kyis longs spyod rdzogs pa @266b dang sprul pa'i skus 'chad do //
analyzed: de'i byin rlabs kyis longs spyod rdzogs pa @266b dang sprul pa'i skus 'chad do //
translated: By its blessing, the enjoyment body and emanation body teach.

original: de la skabs 'dir yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi gzhi zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sgo 'chad de /
analyzed: de la skabs 'dir yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi gzhi zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sgo 'chad de /
translated: In this context, the Bhagavān Vairocana, the enjoyment body, teaches the Dharma gateway called the basis of the equality of body, speech, and mind.

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma dus gsum las 'das par byin gyis brlabs nas 'chad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma dus gsum las 'das par byin gyis brlabs nas 'chad de /
translated: The sun of the tathāgatas, having blessed the three times, teaches.

original: chos kyi sku de nyi ma lta bur snang ba'i rang bzhin yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma zhes bya la /
analyzed: chos kyi sku de nyi ma lta bur snang ba'i rang bzhin yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma zhes bya la /
translated: Since that dharmakāya is the nature of the appearance of the sun, it is called the sun of the tathāgatas.

original: chos kyi sku nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa'i dus las 'das te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa'i dus las 'das te /
translated: The sun of the dharmakāya is beyond the times of the sun, moon, and so on.

original: de bas na dus gsum las 'das pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dus gsum las 'das pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be beyond the three times.

original: dus gsum las 'das pa ni 'das pa'i dus dang / da ltar gyi dus dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum las 'das pa ni 'das pa'i dus dang / da ltar gyi dus dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus las 'das pa'o //
translated: Beyond the three times means beyond the past, present, and future.

original: de dag gis ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bshad pa yin no //🔽mthu phun sum tshogs pa bshad pa ni gzhung las de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po la sogs pa de dag dang / gsang ba pa'i bdag po la sogs pa rdo rje 'dzin de dag ces pa nas gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi tshig rnam par dag pa'i tshig dag gis chos ston pa dag kyang mthong ngo zhes pa'i bar du 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de dag gis ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bshad pa yin no // mthu phun sum tshogs pa bshad pa ni gzhung las de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po la sogs pa de dag dang / gsang ba pa'i bdag po la sogs pa rdo rje 'dzin de dag ces pa nas gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi tshig rnam par dag pa'i tshig dag gis chos ston pa dag kyang mthong ngo zhes pa'i bar du 'byung ba ste /
translated: Those explain the perfect teacher.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis sku mnyam pa nyid bkod pa mi zad pa'i mdzod rnam par bsgyings pa la zhugs so zhes pa de la kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa bcu la sogs

original: pa rab tu thob pa na rang gi ting nge 'dzin dang rnam par thar pa'i sgo nas mthu dang rdzu 'phrul 'byin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par brgyan pa la sogs pa byas pas mgu zhing de las gzhan pa'i bya ba med do snyam pa'i blo skye ba la /
analyzed: pa rab tu thob pa na rang gi ting nge 'dzin dang rnam par thar pa'i sgo nas mthu dang rdzu 'phrul 'byin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par brgyan pa la sogs pa byas pas mgu zhing de las gzhan pa'i bya ba med do snyam pa'i blo skye ba la /
translated: When they attain the supreme, they think, “I have displayed my power and miracles through my samadhis and doors of liberation and I have created the adornments of the buddha realms and so forth. I am satisfied. There is no other activity than this.”

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi dpal be'u'i 'od mchog bkye bas byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyi gtsug tu phog ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi dpal be'u'i 'od mchog bkye bas byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyi gtsug tu phog ste /
