translated: The light of the glorious knot of the bhagavat Vairochana falls on the crowns of the bodhisattvas.

original: de'i byin gyi rlabs kyis kun du bzang po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' de rnams bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku mnyam pa nyid bkod pa mi zad pa'i mdzod rnam par bsgyings pa la zhugs so //
analyzed: de'i byin gyi rlabs kyis kun du bzang po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' de rnams bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku mnyam pa nyid bkod pa mi zad pa'i mdzod rnam par bsgyings pa la zhugs so //
translated: Through the blessings of that, the bodhisattvas such as Samantabhadra enter into the bhagavat Vairochana’s body, the array of the inexhaustible treasury of the equality of the body.

original: de bzhin du gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid bkod pa mi zad pa'i mdzod rnam par bsgyings pa la yang zhugs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid bkod pa mi zad pa'i mdzod rnam par bsgyings pa la yang zhugs te /
translated: Similarly, they enter into the array of the inexhaustible treasury of the equality of speech and mind.

original: de la mnyam pa nyid ni gong du bshad pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la mnyam pa nyid ni gong du bshad pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The equality of the Buddha is the three kinds explained above.

original: bkod pa ni skabs 'dir rnam pa sna tshogs su blta'o //🔽mi zad pa ni chos kyi sku'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sku la sogs pa de dag nam 'khor ba yod @267a * //
analyzed: bkod pa ni skabs 'dir rnam pa sna tshogs su blta'o // mi zad pa ni chos kyi sku'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sku la sogs pa de dag nam 'khor ba yod @267a * //
translated: The array is to be seen as various in this context.

original: kyi bar du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: kyi bar du gnas pa'o //
translated: The inexhaustibility is that those bodies, etc. remain as long as cyclic existence lasts, by the blessing of the body of truth.

original: mdzod ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku de nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: mdzod ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku de nyid la bya ste /
translated: The treasury is the body of the Bhagavat Vairocana himself,

original: sku de las ji ltar 'dul ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i sku la sogs pa'i 'khor lo zad mi shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: sku de las ji ltar 'dul ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i sku la sogs pa'i 'khor lo zad mi shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir la /
translated: because from that body there arises an inexhaustible wheel of bodies, etc. in accordance with the disciples to be tamed.

original: sku la sogs pa'i 'khor lo de dag nyid sus kyang zil gyis mi non par rang gi bya ba la 'jug pas ni rnam par bsgyings pa'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i 'khor lo de dag nyid sus kyang zil gyis mi non par rang gi bya ba la 'jug pas ni rnam par bsgyings pa'o //
translated: The display is that those wheels of bodies, etc. engage in their own activities without being overwhelmed by anyone.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'am gsung ngam thugs la ni 'jug pa'am ldog pa yang mi dmigs so zhes pa la 'ga' zhig rtog pa skye ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'am gsung ngam thugs la ni 'jug pa'am ldog pa yang mi dmigs so zhes pa la 'ga' zhig rtog pa skye ste /
translated: However, some might think that the engagement or withdrawal of the body, speech, or mind of the Bhagavat Vairocana is not observed.

original: gdul bya'i 'gro ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gdul bya'i 'gro ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The beings to be trained are of four kinds:🔽Bodhisattvas who have eliminated the obscurations of the knowable and of the defilements, but who still have a residue of the obscurations of habitual tendencies,🔽those who have realized the level of practice with pure aspiration,

original: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dar la tsam gyis bsgribs pa'i lhag ma lus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / mos pa rnam par dag pa spyod pa'i sa mngon du byas pa rnams dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs la /
analyzed: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dar la tsam gyis bsgribs pa'i lhag ma lus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / mos pa rnam par dag pa spyod pa'i sa mngon du byas pa rnams dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs la /
translated: the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas who have eliminated the defilement-related obscurations,

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa phyogs gcig pa rnams dang ; nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa'i 'gro ba sna tshogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa phyogs gcig pa rnams dang ; nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa'i 'gro ba sna tshogs pa rnams so //
translated: and the various beings who have not eliminated either the defilement-related or the cognitive obscurations.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la 'jug pa dang ldog pa mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la 'jug pa dang ldog pa mi dmigs te /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One’s body is not perceived as entering or leaving.

original: rnam par mi rtog na yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog na yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it is nonconceptual, it is the domain of the bodhisattvas who have attained complete purity.

original: 'og ma rnams kyi spyod yul du 'gyur ram mi 'gyur snyam du dogs pa skyen /
analyzed: 'og ma rnams kyi spyod yul du 'gyur ram mi 'gyur snyam du dogs pa skyen /
translated: One may wonder, Will this be the domain of those who follow the lower approaches or not?

original: de'i lan ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par byang chub pa nyid kyi tshe na rnam par mi rtog par sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs dang / chos nyid kyi lhun gyis grub pa nyid du longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i skus ji ltar snod du gyur pa'i sems can gyi don thams cad du mdzad de /
analyzed: de'i lan ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par byang chub pa nyid kyi tshe na rnam par mi rtog par sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs dang / chos nyid kyi lhun gyis grub pa nyid du longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i skus ji ltar snod du gyur pa'i sems can gyi don thams cad du mdzad de /
translated: The answer is that at the very moment of the transcendent and accomplished conqueror's manifest enlightenment, through the force of his previous aspirations and the spontaneous presence of the nature of phenomena, he ensured that the benefit of all beings who were to be guided was accomplished by means of the sambhogakaya and nirmanakaya.

original: de bas na gzhung las thams cad du yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i phrin las thams cad dang / gsung gi phrin las thams cad dang / thugs kyi phrin las thams cad sems can gyi khams thams cad la kun du gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi tshig 'di dag gis chos ston par mthong zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na gzhung las thams cad du yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i phrin las thams cad dang / gsung gi phrin las thams cad dang / thugs kyi phrin las thams cad sems can gyi khams thams cad la kun du gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi tshig 'di dag gis chos ston par mthong zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the source texts state, In all ways, the transcendent and accomplished conqueror Vairochana is seen to teach the dharma to the realms of sentient beings through these words of the way of secret mantra, with all the activity of his body, all the activity of his speech and all the activity of his mind.

original: de la mthong ba ni byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la mthong ba ni byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa ste /
translated: Seeing is the domain of the bodhisattvas Samantabhadra and so forth.

original: de yang rnam pa thams cad du mthong ba ni ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa thams cad du mthong ba ni ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, it is not that they see in every way.

original: rang gi mthu dang spyod yul shas che chung gis bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la sogs pa'i 'khor lo mthong ba'am rtogs pa @267b la bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi mthu dang spyod yul shas che chung gis bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la sogs pa'i 'khor lo mthong ba'am rtogs pa @267b la bya ste /
translated: However, they see or realize the wheel of the Bhagavat’s body and so forth, according to the extent of their own power and domain.

original: rnam pa thams cad du rtogs shing mthong na de bzhin gshegs pa dang bye brag med par gyur pa'i phyir ro //🔽des na 'phags pa kun du bzang po la sogs pa de rnams nyid bshad pa'i chos su 'jug pa'i zhar la sngags rgyud dang rtog pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid rnams la zhugs nas bshad pa'i chos kyi rim par bsdu bar mdzad pas ji ltar rjes
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du rtogs shing mthong na de bzhin gshegs pa dang bye brag med par gyur pa'i phyir ro // des na 'phags pa kun du bzang po la sogs pa de rnams nyid bshad pa'i chos su 'jug pa'i zhar la sngags rgyud dang rtog pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid rnams la zhugs nas bshad pa'i chos kyi rim par bsdu bar mdzad pas ji ltar rjes
translated: If they realized and saw in every way, they would be no different than a tathagata.

original: su rtogs pa de bstan par yang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: su rtogs pa de bstan par yang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, those noble ones such as Samantabhadra, having engaged in the Dharma to be explained, also taught the Dharma that is the nature of the tantras and the kalpas of mantra and so forth, and they also taught the stages of the Dharma to be explained.

original: thams cad du yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i phrin las thams cad dang / gsung gi phrin las thams cad dang thugs kyi phrin las thams cad sems can gyi khams thams cad la kun du gsang sngags bshad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad du yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i phrin las thams cad dang / gsung gi phrin las thams cad dang thugs kyi phrin las thams cad sems can gyi khams thams cad la kun du gsang sngags bshad par bya ba ste /
translated: In all times, the Bhagavat Vairocana's all activities of body, all activities of speech, and all activities of mind are secret mantras to be explained to all realms of sentient beings.

original: thams cad du zhes pa la dus zhes khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes pa la dus zhes khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: In all times is to be supplied from within.

original: des na tshig gi don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: des na tshig gi don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the words is as follows.

original: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pa'i dus dbang byang chub thob pa'i dus su shes pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pa'i dus dbang byang chub thob pa'i dus su shes pa'o //
translated: One should understand that in all times means the time of completing the stages and perfections, the time of empowerment, and the time of attaining enlightenment.

original: de ci 'dra ba zhig gis she na /
analyzed: de ci 'dra ba zhig gis she na /
translated: What is it like?

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i phrin las thams cad dang / gsung gi phrin las thams cad dang / thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ces gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i phrin las thams cad dang / gsung gi phrin las thams cad dang / thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ces gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is said to be the Bhagavat Vairocana's all activities of body, all activities of speech, and all activities of mind.

original: de la 'dir sku'i phrin las la sogs pa'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par byed pa dang / de bzhin du byang chub thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bya ba ste nan tan no //
analyzed: de la 'dir sku'i phrin las la sogs pa'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par byed pa dang / de bzhin du byang chub thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bya ba ste nan tan no //
translated: Here, the words “activity of body” and so on refer to the practice of the Bhagavān’s perfection of the grounds and perfections, and likewise the activity of body, speech, and mind that serves as the cause for attaining enlightenment.

original: des bcom ldan 'das kyis ye shes la mthu'i khyad par bsags pa gang yin pa de la phrin las zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des bcom ldan 'das kyis ye shes la mthu'i khyad par bsags pa gang yin pa de la phrin las zhes brjod do //
translated: The Bhagavān’s accumulation of the special power of wisdom is called “activity.”

original: de lta bu'i mthu'i mtshan nyid las kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha'i gzugs su gyur pa'i spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mthu'i mtshan nyid las kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha'i gzugs su gyur pa'i spyod pa ste /
translated: The form of the deity of the activity maṇḍala, which has the characteristic of such power, is the conduct.

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad la kun du gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi tshig dag gis chos ston par mthong zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad la kun du gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi tshig dag gis chos ston par mthong zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that “all realms of sentient beings see the Bhagavān teaching the Dharma with the words of the way of mantra.”

original: de la sems can gyi khams thams cad la zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la sems can gyi khams thams cad la zhes pa ni /
translated: Here, “all realms of sentient beings” refers to

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams na 'gro ba rigs drug tu gtogs pa'i sems can las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis tshe thob pa rnams la zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams na 'gro ba rigs drug tu gtogs pa'i sems can las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis tshe thob pa rnams la zhes dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that all sentient beings who have obtained life through the power of karma and afflictions, who belong to the six kinds of migrating beings in the infinite world systems.

original: kun du zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byam thams cad du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: kun du zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byam thams cad du shes par bya'o //
translated: The word all should be understood to mean in all the infinite world systems.

original: gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi tshig dag gis chos ston pa zhes pa de la shes pa dang skyob par ldan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sngags su gsungs la /🔽de dag gi rnam par thar pa'i sgo la sogs pa'i tshig rnams dang / der byin @268a * //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi tshig dag gis chos ston pa zhes pa de la shes pa dang skyob par ldan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sngags su gsungs la / de dag gi rnam par thar pa'i sgo la sogs pa'i tshig rnams dang / der byin @268a * //
translated: The words teaching the Dharma with the words of the mantra method - the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are said to be mantras because they possess the knowledge and protection of that.

original: gyis brlab pa'i yi ge dang tshig rnams kyang sngags kyi tshig tu gsungs so //
analyzed: gyis brlab pa'i yi ge dang tshig rnams kyang sngags kyi tshig tu gsungs so //
translated: The words such as the door of liberation of those [Buddhas and Bodhisattvas], and the syllables and words of the consecration in that [door of liberation], are also said to be the words of the mantra.

original: sngags de rnams kyi rgyu dang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu thob pa'i thabs lam ni tshul te /
analyzed: sngags de rnams kyi rgyu dang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu thob pa'i thabs lam ni tshul te /
translated: The method of the path for attaining the cause, nature, and result of those mantras is the method.

original: de go zhing rtogs par byed pa'i chos kyi tshig go //
analyzed: de go zhing rtogs par byed pa'i chos kyi tshig go //
translated: The words of the Dharma that cause one to understand and realize that are the words.

original: de nyid la sngags kyi tshig ces kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid la sngags kyi tshig ces kyang gsungs so //
translated: That is also called the mantra words.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi phrin las sngags la sogs pa'i lhar snang bar gyur pa de rnams kyis gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi mtshan nyid bshad pa'i chos ston par kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyis mthong ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi phrin las sngags la sogs pa'i lhar snang bar gyur pa de rnams kyis gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi mtshan nyid bshad pa'i chos ston par kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyis mthong ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: Those deeds of the Blessed One, appearing as the deities of the mantra and so forth, those bodhisattvas such as Samantabhadra saw teaching the Dharma with the characteristics of the mantra method.

original: 'dis ni don rnam pa gsum gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni don rnam pa gsum gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This teaches three topics.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la sogs pa'i phrin las rnams kyi las kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha'i gzugs su gyur pa dang / de yang ji ltar snod du gyur pa'i gdul bya'i 'gro ba 'dul nus pas rjes su mthun pa dang / de ston pa'i chos sngags kyi tshig tu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la sogs pa'i phrin las rnams kyi las kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha'i gzugs su gyur pa dang / de yang ji ltar snod du gyur pa'i gdul bya'i 'gro ba 'dul nus pas rjes su mthun pa dang / de ston pa'i chos sngags kyi tshig tu'o //
translated: The deeds of the Tathāgata’s body and so forth become the forms of the deities of the karma maṇḍala, and that is suitable because it is able to tame the beings of the world who are suitable vessels, and that is taught with the words of the mantra Dharma.

original: don 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud 'dir gzhung 'di gsal bar bstan te /
analyzed: don 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud 'dir gzhung 'di gsal bar bstan te /
translated: This meaning is also clearly taught in this scripture of the Blessed One’s tantra.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi rang gi sku la sogs pa las kyi lha'i gzugs su gyur pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i thogs pa med pa'i stobs bcu'i mos pa las du ma'i kha dog dang dbyibs su bkod pa'i bdag gi ngo bo bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi rang gi sku la sogs pa las kyi lha'i gzugs su gyur pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i thogs pa med pa'i stobs bcu'i mos pa las du ma'i kha dog dang dbyibs su bkod pa'i bdag gi ngo bo bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya
translated: Because the Bhagavān’s own body and so on become the form of the deity of the action, the essence of the Tathāgata’s unimpeded ten powers is arranged in many colors and shapes.🔽

original: stong dpag tu med par sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang ; bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsod nams las grub pa'i lus 'byung ngo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stong dpag tu med par sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang ; bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsod nams las grub pa'i lus 'byung ngo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because the Bhagavat's own body and so forth become the form of the deity of the action, the nature of the body of the Tathagata's ten unobstructed powers, which is arranged in many colors and shapes from aspiration, arises from the merit of the perfections of giving, morality, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom for countless trillions of eons.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la sogs pa'i las rnams lha la sogs pa'i gzugs su gyur pa de ni ci yang rung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la sogs pa'i las rnams lha la sogs pa'i gzugs su gyur pa de ni ci yang rung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, those actions of the Bhagavat's body and so forth that become the form of the deity and so forth are not just anything.

original: sems can 'dul nus par snang ba'i rang bzhin kho na ste /
analyzed: sems can 'dul nus par snang ba'i rang bzhin kho na ste /
translated: They are only of the nature that appears to be able to tame sentient beings.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de nas de nyid kyi tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de nas de nyid kyi tshe /
translated: Immediately after the Bhagavat entered into equipoise, at that very time,

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i sgo spu'i bu ga thams cad nas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin las dang tshe dang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu za ba dang zar 'jug pa'i gzugs dang / kha dog dang /🔽dbyibs dang / nga ro dang / 'gro ba dang / spyod pa dang nges pa'i tshig brjod pa sems can thams cad so so so sor yang dag par mgu bar byed pa chos kyi dbyings kyis rnam par bskyed pa'i sku rnams byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i sgo spu'i bu ga thams cad nas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin las dang tshe dang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu za ba dang zar 'jug pa'i gzugs dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / nga ro dang / 'gro ba dang / spyod pa dang nges pa'i tshig brjod pa sems can thams cad so so so sor yang dag par mgu bar byed pa chos kyi dbyings kyis rnam par bskyed pa'i sku rnams byung bar gyur to //
translated: From all the pores of his body, which are the doors for the deliverance of the entire realm of sentient beings, there emerged forms that were the results of actions, life, and ripening, which were to be consumed and which were to be consumed by sentient beings in accordance with their aspirations.🔽They had various colors, shapes, voices, ways of going, conduct, and expressions, and they were bodies that were born from the realm of phenomena and that satisfied every single sentient being.

original: byung nas kyang nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i 'jig rten gyi @268b khams rab 'byam rnams su sgra dbyangs gcig gis chos kyi dbyings khyab par rnam par rig par byed pa /
analyzed: byung nas kyang nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i 'jig rten gyi @268b khams rab 'byam rnams su sgra dbyangs gcig gis chos kyi dbyings khyab par rnam par rig par byed pa /
translated: Having emerged, they pervaded the realm of phenomena with a single sound that was cognized in all the infinite world systems that are equal to space.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di sgrogs par gyur to zhes pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du de dag gis bshad pa'i tshig sngags la sogs par bya ba'i phyir dang ; der byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di sgrogs par gyur to zhes pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du de dag gis bshad pa'i tshig sngags la sogs par bya ba'i phyir dang ; der byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: And likewise, in order to perform the mantra words and so on that they explain, and in order to bless them, it is said:

original: ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gsang sngags kyi tshul yig 'bru dag tu byin gyis brlab ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gsang sngags kyi tshul yig 'bru dag tu byin gyis brlab ce na /
translated: How do the Tathagatas bless the mantra words as the method of mantra?

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mar yang dag par bsgrub pa'i bden pa'i tshig gang yin pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mar yang dag par bsgrub pa'i bden pa'i tshig gang yin pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang /
translated: Lord of Secrets, the Tathagatas bless the true words that are accomplished over many quintillions of eons, the four noble truths, the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rin po che bdun dang / tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres ba bco brgyad gang ngag yin pa dang /🔽gsang ba pa'i bdag po mdor na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid bsod nams dang ye shes kyi stobs dang / sngon gyi smon lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rin po che bdun dang / tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres ba bco brgyad gang ngag yin pa dang / gsang ba pa'i bdag po mdor na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid bsod nams dang ye shes kyi stobs dang / sngon gyi smon lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: The four bases of supernatural powers, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the six perfections, the seven precious branches of enlightenment, the four brahmavihāras, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.🔽Guhyapati, in brief, all the omniscient wisdom of the tathāgatas is taught to sentient beings in accordance with their fortune through the blessing of the dharmadhātu, the power of the tathāgatas' merit and wisdom, and the power of their previous aspirations.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi byin gyis brlabs nas sems can rnams la skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du gsang sngags kyi cho ga yang dag par rab tu ston to zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi byin gyis brlabs nas sems can rnams la skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du gsang sngags kyi cho ga yang dag par rab tu ston to zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The secret mantra rituals are perfectly taught.

original: de la chos kyi sku rtog pa thams cad rab tu med par gnas pa las ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa de lta bu'i sngags kyi lha tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur zhes 'ga' zhig smra na de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku rtog pa thams cad rab tu med par gnas pa las ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa de lta bu'i sngags kyi lha tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur zhes 'ga' zhig smra na de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di gsungs te /
translated: If someone were to ask, How can the assembly of such mantra deities of the Tathagata arise from the dharmakaya, which abides with all conceptual thoughts completely absent? the Bhagavat taught this:

original: lus kyi bye brag ji snyed pa //
analyzed: lus kyi bye brag ji snyed pa //
translated: As many as are the distinctions of bodies,

original: brjod pa las ni mang du 'gyur //
analyzed: brjod pa las ni mang du 'gyur //
translated: from speech they become more numerous.

original: de bzhin sngags kyi mgon po ye //
analyzed: de bzhin sngags kyi mgon po ye //
translated: Likewise, the mantra lords

original: bye brag dag kyang grangs med gsungs //
analyzed: bye brag dag kyang grangs med gsungs //
translated: are said to have countless distinctions.

original: ji ltar yid bzhin nor bu ni //
analyzed: ji ltar yid bzhin nor bu ni //
translated: Just as the wish-fulfilling jewel

original: dpal ldan 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa //
analyzed: dpal ldan 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa //
translated: accomplishes the desired aims of the glorious ones,

original: de bzhin 'jig rten sgron ma yi //
analyzed: de bzhin 'jig rten sgron ma yi //
translated: so too the lamp of the world

original: sku yang don rnams thams cad sgrub //
analyzed: sku yang don rnams thams cad sgrub //
translated: accomplishes all aims with its body.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po chos kyi dbyings rnam par mi rtog pa ji ltar dgos pa thams cad mngon par sgrub ce na /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po chos kyi dbyings rnam par mi rtog pa ji ltar dgos pa thams cad mngon par sgrub ce na /
translated: If one were to ask, Lord of Secrets, how does the nonconceptual dharmadhatu accomplish all needs?

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po 'di lta ste /
translated: Lord of Secrets, it is like this:

original: dper na nam mkha'i khams ni sems can yang ma yin /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i khams ni sems can yang ma yin /
translated: For example, the element of space is not a sentient being,

original: srog kyang ma yin /
analyzed: srog kyang ma yin /
translated: not a life force,

original: shed las skyes pa yang ma yin /🔽byed pa po @269a * //
analyzed: shed las skyes pa yang ma yin / byed pa po @269a * //
translated: It is not born from a source.

original: yang ma yin /🔽tshor ba po yang ma yin /
analyzed: yang ma yin / tshor ba po yang ma yin /
translated: It is not an agent.🔽It is not a feeler.

original: gzung ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzung ba yang ma yin /
translated: It is not an object.🔽It is not a subject.

original: 'dzin pa yang ma yin zhing rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dzin pa yang ma yin zhing rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral mod kyi /
translated: It is free from all thoughts and concepts.

original: 'on kyang sems can gyi khams ma lus pa rnam par 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa thams cad byed de /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can gyi khams ma lus pa rnam par 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa thams cad byed de /
translated: Nevertheless, it performs all the activities of coming and going for the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: 'di la ni dogs pa med do //
analyzed: 'di la ni dogs pa med do //
translated: There is no doubt about this.

original: de bzhin rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: Likewise, it is nonconceptual.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa gnas med 'di //🔽'gro ba rnams kyi phyi dang nang //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa gnas med 'di // 'gro ba rnams kyi phyi dang nang //
translated: The omniscience of the Buddha, which is not a location,🔽Establishes the outer and inner of all beings

original: thams cad nges pa nyid du sgrub //
analyzed: thams cad nges pa nyid du sgrub //
translated: As definitely being just that.

original: ces so // gsung 'di la yang bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa 'di lta bu yin par khong du chud de /
analyzed: ces so // gsung 'di la yang bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa 'di lta bu yin par khong du chud de /
translated: The Bhagavān’s intention in this statement is understood as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi sku la rnam par gnas pa la rnam par rtog pa med kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis lha'i lus la sogs pa thams cad du rab tu snang na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi sku la rnam par gnas pa la rnam par rtog pa med kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis lha'i lus la sogs pa thams cad du rab tu snang na /
translated: Although the Tathāgata, abiding in the dharmakāya, is without conceptualization, by the power of his former aspirations he appears in all places, in the bodies of gods and so on.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa'i go skabs ga la yod ces so //🔽sems can las kyi tshe rnam par bskyed pa rnams zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa'i go skabs ga la yod ces so // sems can las kyi tshe rnam par bskyed pa rnams zhes pa nas /
translated: How could there be any opportunity for conceptualization there?

original: rnam par dag pa'i tshig dag gis chos ston pa dag kyang mthong ngo zhes pa'i bar bshad par bya ste ;
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i tshig dag gis chos ston pa dag kyang mthong ngo zhes pa'i bar bshad par bya ste ;
translated: The text should be explained from “the beings generated by the life-force of karma” up to “the pure words of the Dharma.”

original: de la rdo rje 'dzin pa dang / kun du bzang po dang / phyag na padmo'i lus dang 'dra ba zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i byin gyi rlabs sems can las kyi tshe bskyed pa rnams dang /
analyzed: de la rdo rje 'dzin pa dang / kun du bzang po dang / phyag na padmo'i lus dang 'dra ba zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i byin gyi rlabs sems can las kyi tshe bskyed pa rnams dang /
translated: Here, “like the bodies of Vajradhara, Samantabhadra, and Padmapāṇi” means that the beings generated by the life-force of karma of the Bhagavān Vairocana’s consecration of complete enlightenment

original: las kyi tshe bkag ba rnams yang srid pa'i myu gu mngon par bskyed pa'i phyir chos 'chad do //
analyzed: las kyi tshe bkag ba rnams yang srid pa'i myu gu mngon par bskyed pa'i phyir chos 'chad do //
translated: The Dharma is taught in order to generate the sprout of rebirth again for those whose karma has been interrupted.

original: de la las kyis rnam par bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: de la las kyis rnam par bskyed pa ni /
translated: The generation of karma is as follows.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa gnas pa na sems gsum sbyong ba dang sa bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan ji lta bu yin pa de nges par shes shing de la mos pas nyon mongs pa kun nas mi ldang bar rnam par mnan te /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa gnas pa na sems gsum sbyong ba dang sa bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan ji lta bu yin pa de nges par shes shing de la mos pas nyon mongs pa kun nas mi ldang bar rnam par mnan te /
translated: One who is on the stage of action in faith purifies the three minds and, by knowing and believing in the qualities of the ten stages and so on, one suppresses the passions so that they do not arise.

original: sems sbyang ba la sogs pa'i dge ba'i las kyi dbang gis ji ltar smon pa bzhin du brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa gang 'dod par skye ba ni las kyi tshe rnam par skyed pa yin la /
analyzed: sems sbyang ba la sogs pa'i dge ba'i las kyi dbang gis ji ltar smon pa bzhin du brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa gang 'dod par skye ba ni las kyi tshe rnam par skyed pa yin la /
translated: By the power of good karma such as the purification of the mind, one is born wherever one wishes, such as as Sakra, Brahma, and so on, just as one has wished. This is the generation of karma and life.

original: de yang sems dang po bskyed pa nas sa bcu pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de yang sems dang po bskyed pa nas sa bcu pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Moreover, this is from the first production of the thought up to the tenth stage.

original: de la sems dang po bskyed pa ni sa dang po rab tu dga' ba la bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems dang po bskyed pa ni sa dang po rab tu dga' ba la bya'o //
translated: The first production of the thought is to be understood as the first stage, the Joyous.

original: las kyi tshe bkag pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa rnams phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe /
analyzed: las kyi tshe bkag pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa rnams phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe /
translated: The stopping of life through karma is when ārya śrāvakas who have abandoned the afflictive obstructions stop their life at the time of nirvāṇa without remainder.

original: padmo dam pa'i snying po la bskal pa brgyad cur gnas nas /
analyzed: padmo dam pa'i snying po la bskal pa brgyad cur gnas nas /
translated: They remain for eighty eons in the heart of a holy lotus.

original: tshe 'gog par byed pa de la byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyi tshe 'gog pa de las @269b bzlog ste /
analyzed: tshe 'gog par byed pa de la byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyi tshe 'gog pa de las @269b bzlog ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas stop that stopping of life.

original: yang srid pa'i myu gu bskyed nas sa bcu la 'jug pa dang rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos 'chad do //🔽'di nyid la yongs su rdzogs par bya ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yang srid pa'i myu gu bskyed nas sa bcu la 'jug pa dang rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos 'chad do // 'di nyid la yongs su rdzogs par bya ba zhes pa ni /
translated: In order to generate the sprout of rebirth and enter and complete the ten bhūmis, they teach the Dharma.

original: sngags kyi tshig rnam par dag pa 'di nyid kyis zhes bya bar dgongs te /
analyzed: sngags kyi tshig rnam par dag pa 'di nyid kyis zhes bya bar dgongs te /
translated: The phrase “in this very life” is to be applied to the phrase “through this very pure mantra.”

original: sngags kyi tshig rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni phyag na padmo dang phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa'i sras su gyur pa'i sems can rnams dang / las kyi tshe bkag pa'i sems can rnams ni sems can phal ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gro la /
analyzed: sngags kyi tshig rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni phyag na padmo dang phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa'i sras su gyur pa'i sems can rnams dang / las kyi tshe bkag pa'i sems can rnams ni sems can phal ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gro la /
translated: The phrase “pure mantra words” refers to sentient beings who have become the sons of Vajrapāṇi, Padmapāṇi, and so on, and sentient beings who have been blocked from karmic life. They do not come under the power of afflictions like ordinary sentient beings.

original: de rnams la chos bshad pa yang sa dang po nas brtsams nas sa bcu rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rnam par dkar ba'i chos sha stag yin pas sngags kyi tshig rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la chos bshad pa yang sa dang po nas brtsams nas sa bcu rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rnam par dkar ba'i chos sha stag yin pas sngags kyi tshig rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Also, the Dharma that is explained to them is only pure Dharma because it is for the sake of completing the ten grounds beginning with the first ground. Therefore, it is “pure mantra words.”

original: gzhung las / de nas yang bcom ldan 'das gsang ba pa'i bdag po phyag na rdo rje 'khor 'dus pa de nyid na 'dug pas /🔽bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa nas /
analyzed: gzhung las / de nas yang bcom ldan 'das gsang ba pa'i bdag po phyag na rdo rje 'khor 'dus pa de nyid na 'dug pas / bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa nas /
translated: The text says, “Then again, the bhagavān lord of secrets Vajrapāṇi, who was sitting in the midst of the assembly,🔽said this to the bhagavān . . .”

original: bcom ldan 'das ye shes 'di'i rgyu ni gang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ye shes 'di'i rgyu ni gang /
translated: and continues down to “The bhagavān, what is the cause of this gnosis?

original: rtsa ba ni gang /
analyzed: rtsa ba ni gang /
translated: What is its root?

original: mthar thug pa ni gang lags zhes pa'i bar du 'byung ba la /
analyzed: mthar thug pa ni gang lags zhes pa'i bar du 'byung ba la /
translated: What is its culmination?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las las byung ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de sems can rnams la rnam par phye ste tshul sna tshogs dang / thabs sna tshogs kyis bshad pa de dag ji ltar mthong ba bcom ldan 'das la slar bzlas nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de'i rgyu dang rtsa ba dang mthar thug pa dris pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las las byung ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de sems can rnams la rnam par phye ste tshul sna tshogs dang / thabs sna tshogs kyis bshad pa de dag ji ltar mthong ba bcom ldan 'das la slar bzlas nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de'i rgyu dang rtsa ba dang mthar thug pa dris pa yin gyi /
translated: The omniscient wisdom that arises from the Bhagavat's body, speech, and mind is explained to sentient beings through various methods and various means.

original: ji ltar zhes pa dang 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig rnams ni dri ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa dang 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig rnams ni dri ba ma yin te /
translated: The words how and the words that will come below are not questions.

original: de rnams bdag gis ji ltar rtogs pa rnams gsol nas /
analyzed: de rnams bdag gis ji ltar rtogs pa rnams gsol nas /
translated: After I have explained how I understand them,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu dang rtsa ba dang mthar thug pa dri ba'i spyir smos pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu dang rtsa ba dang mthar thug pa dri ba'i spyir smos pa'o //
translated: I ask about the cause, root, and culmination of omniscient wisdom in general.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das dang de bzhin gshegs pa ni gong du bshad la /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das dang de bzhin gshegs pa ni gong du bshad la /
translated: The Bhagavat and the Tathagata were explained above.

original: dgra bcom pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pa'am mchod par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pa'am mchod par 'os pa'o //
translated: The arhats are the conquerors of the enemy of the afflictions, or are worthy of worship.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes nas zhes pa ni snying po byang chub na yang dag par bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes nas zhes pa ni snying po byang chub na yang dag par bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Having attained the gnosis of omniscience, the perfect buddhas, means that they abide in the essence of enlightenment.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa rnam pa gnyis te /🔽kun rdzob ni stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres bco brgyad la sogs @270a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa rnam pa gnyis te / kun rdzob ni stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres bco brgyad la sogs @270a * //
translated: The gnosis of omniscience is twofold, conventional and ultimate.

original: pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The conventional is the omniscience of all aspects, such as the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: don dam pa ni stong pa nyid du mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ni stong pa nyid du mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is the knowledge of emptiness.

original: rnam par phye ste zhes pa ni so sor bshags pa'i don te thams cad mkhyen par ro gcig tu gyur cing rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: rnam par phye ste zhes pa ni so sor bshags pa'i don te thams cad mkhyen par ro gcig tu gyur cing rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: Having analyzed, means the meaning of confession, becoming of one taste with omniscience. The characteristic of perfection will be explained below.

original: mi dang lhar skye ba la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i dge ba bcu grub pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i cha'o //
analyzed: mi dang lhar skye ba la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i dge ba bcu grub pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i cha'o //
translated: The ten mundane virtues such as being born as a human or god are established, and all the śrāvakas and so on are also parts of the omniscient one.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsod nams kyang thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ba'i brgyud pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsod nams kyang thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ba'i brgyud pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Mundane merit is also the indirect cause of omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i cha shas yod pas na rgyur 'gyur la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i cha shas yod pas na rgyur 'gyur la /
translated: Since it is a part of omniscience, it becomes a cause.

original: gzhan yang dngos dang brgyud pa nas brgyud pa'i rang bzhin yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos dang brgyud pa nas brgyud pa'i rang bzhin yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood as being the direct and indirect nature.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na dge ba'i tshogs rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la bsags pa de lhun gyis grub pa nyid du sems can rnams la rnam par phye ba ni tshul la sogs pa sna tshogs su bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na dge ba'i tshogs rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la bsags pa de lhun gyis grub pa nyid du sems can rnams la rnam par phye ba ni tshul la sogs pa sna tshogs su bstan pa ste /
translated: When practicing the conduct of the bodhisattva, the accumulation of the collections of virtue in the wisdom of omniscience is naturally divided into the various aspects of sentient beings, such as the various ways.

original: de la tshul sna tshogs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la tshul sna tshogs zhes pa ni /
translated: Among them, the various ways are as follows.

original: kha cig la ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul zhes pa nas mngon par shes pa lnga'i tshul gyi bar te /
analyzed: kha cig la ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul zhes pa nas mngon par shes pa lnga'i tshul gyi bar te /
translated: Some are taught the way of the śrāvaka vehicle up to the way of the five kinds of superknowledge.

original: de rnams so so'i rnam par grol ba'i lam la bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams so so'i rnam par grol ba'i lam la bya'o //
translated: These are to be applied to the path of liberation of each of them.

original: bsam pa sna tshogs shes pa ni kha cig la ni ltar skye bar bya ba zhes pa nas mi'am ci'i bar du skye bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston zhes pa'i bar te /
analyzed: bsam pa sna tshogs shes pa ni kha cig la ni ltar skye bar bya ba zhes pa nas mi'am ci'i bar du skye bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston zhes pa'i bar te /
translated: Knowing the various thoughts means that for some he teaches the Dharma in order to be born as a god, for some in order to be born as a human, and so on up to for some in order to be born as a kinnara.

original: de rnams su skye bar 'dod pa'i bsam pa dang rjes su mthun par chos 'chad pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams su skye bar 'dod pa'i bsam pa dang rjes su mthun par chos 'chad pa la bya'o //
translated: This is to be applied to explaining the Dharma in accordance with the thoughts of those who wish to be born in those realms.

original: thabs sna tshogs kyi tshul gyis chos ston zhes pa ni /
analyzed: thabs sna tshogs kyi tshul gyis chos ston zhes pa ni /
translated: He teaches the Dharma by means of the way of various methods.

original: de la sems can la la sangs rgyas kyis gdul bar bya ba dag gis ni sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su mthong zhes pa nas spyod lam rnam pa sna tshogs su bzhugs par mthong la zhes pa'i bar te /
analyzed: de la sems can la la sangs rgyas kyis gdul bar bya ba dag gis ni sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su mthong zhes pa nas spyod lam rnam pa sna tshogs su bzhugs par mthong la zhes pa'i bar te /
translated: Some sentient beings who are to be guided by the Buddha see him in the form of a buddha, and so on up to seeing him abiding in various kinds of conduct.

original: tshul sna tshogs dang bsam pa sna tshogs 'chad pa yang thabs yin mod kyi /
analyzed: tshul sna tshogs dang bsam pa sna tshogs 'chad pa yang thabs yin mod kyi /
translated: Although explaining various ways and various thoughts is also a method,

original: de dag nyid sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i skus sems can de dag gi rang rang gi skad kyi tshul du smra zhing /
analyzed: de dag nyid sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i skus sems can de dag gi rang rang gi skad kyi tshul du smra zhing /
translated: Since they themselves speak in the individual languages of those sentient beings through the bodies of buddhas and so on,

original: so so'i spyod lam du rnam par gnas par ston pas na thabs kyi yang thabs su blta'o //
analyzed: so so'i spyod lam du rnam par gnas par ston pas na thabs kyi yang thabs su blta'o //
translated: and since they display abiding in the individual conduct of those sentient beings, they are to be regarded as the method of methods.

original: spyod lam rnam pa sna tshogs su zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang nyan thos la sogs pas 'dul ba'i sems can de dag gi spyod lam dang rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs su 'gyur zhing ston pa la bya'o //
analyzed: spyod lam rnam pa sna tshogs su zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang nyan thos la sogs pas 'dul ba'i sems can de dag gi spyod lam dang rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs su 'gyur zhing ston pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase “in various types of conduct” means that they take on and display forms that are in accordance with the conduct of those sentient beings who are to be trained by buddhas, śrāvakas, and so on.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang 'di ltar /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang 'di ltar /
translated: That gnosis of omniscience is also like this.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol @270b ba'i ror ro gcig pa legs so zhes pa ni de ltar tshul sna tshogs dang / bsam pa dang thabs sna tshogs kyi sgo nas rnam pa tha dad pa du mar spros pa yang thun mong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol @270b ba'i ror ro gcig pa legs so zhes pa ni de ltar tshul sna tshogs dang / bsam pa dang thabs sna tshogs kyi sgo nas rnam pa tha dad pa du mar spros pa yang thun mong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa /
translated: The phrase it is good that they have the same taste as the Tathagata's liberation means that, although they are elaborated in many different ways, through various methods and intentions, in general they all have the same taste as the Tathagata's liberation, which is the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: rtog pa'i bag chags kyi gnas las shin tu 'das pa'i mtshan nyid du ro gcig tu 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: rtog pa'i bag chags kyi gnas las shin tu 'das pa'i mtshan nyid du ro gcig tu 'gyur ba ni /
translated: They have the same taste in being characterized by the complete transcendence of the predispositions of conceptualization.

original: dper na bu ram shing rnam pa mang po'i khu ba las bu ram du byas na bu ram shing de rnams kyi so so'i ror dbyer med de ro gcig pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na bu ram shing rnam pa mang po'i khu ba las bu ram du byas na bu ram shing de rnams kyi so so'i ror dbyer med de ro gcig pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: This is like the many different kinds of sugarcane juice having the same taste when made into sugar, in that their individual tastes cannot be distinguished.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper bgyi na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper bgyi na /
translated: Bhagavan, it is as follows:

original: nam mkha'i khams ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba ste zhes pa nas lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten rab tu sim par bgyid pa lags zhes pa'i bar gyi ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de'i rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba ste zhes pa nas lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten rab tu sim par bgyid pa lags zhes pa'i bar gyi ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de'i rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa
translated: The passage from “the realm of space is free from all thoughts and concepts” up to “it brings complete satisfaction to the world and its gods” teaches by means of similes the attainment of the perfect nature of that omniscient gnosis,

original: dang mngon par mtho ba'i gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang spong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / nges par legs pa thob pa'i gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa thob par dpe dag gis bstan te /
analyzed: dang mngon par mtho ba'i gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang spong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / nges par legs pa thob pa'i gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa thob par dpe dag gis bstan te /
translated: the perfect benefit for others in the higher realms, the perfect elimination and the perfect benefit for others in the attainment of definite goodness.

original: dpe dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis lhun gyis grub pa nyid du rnam par mi rtog mi dpyod par tshul sna tshogs la sogs pa'i sgo nas sems can gyi don byed par yang bstan to //
analyzed: dpe dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis lhun gyis grub pa nyid du rnam par mi rtog mi dpyod par tshul sna tshogs la sogs pa'i sgo nas sems can gyi don byed par yang bstan to //
translated: The similes also teach how that omniscient gnosis, through the power of previous aspirations, spontaneously accomplishes the welfare of sentient beings in various ways without any deliberation or analysis.

original: de la nam mkha'i dpes ni rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la nam mkha'i dpes ni rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The example of space illustrates the perfection of its nature.

original: nam mkha' ji ltar rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i bag chags kyi gnas med pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de la rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa med de /
analyzed: nam mkha' ji ltar rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i bag chags kyi gnas med pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de la rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa med de /
translated: Just as space is not the abode of the habitual tendencies of conceptualization and investigation, so omniscient gnosis is free of conceptualization and investigation.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa med ces pa'i don to //🔽de la de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog cing sems pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa med ces pa'i don to // de la de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog cing sems pa med pa yin na /
translated: This is the meaning of “free of conceptualization and investigation.”🔽If omniscient gnosis is thus nonconceptual and mindless, how can it give rise to the continuity of the body and so forth and accomplish the welfare of sentient beings?

original: sems pa med par ji ltar lus la sogs pa'i rgyun 'byung zhing sems can gyi don byed snyam du dogs pa la sa'i dpes rnam par mi rtog bzhin du mngon par mtho ba'i gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa byed par bstan te /
analyzed: sems pa med par ji ltar lus la sogs pa'i rgyun 'byung zhing sems can gyi don byed snyam du dogs pa la sa'i dpes rnam par mi rtog bzhin du mngon par mtho ba'i gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa byed par bstan te /
translated: To dispel such doubts, the example of the earth illustrates how, without conceptualization, it can perfectly accomplish the welfare of others in the higher realms.

original: de la sa ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa med bzhin du rtsa ba dang 'bras bu dang / me tog la sogs pas sems can thams cad kyi gsos su 'gyur bar byed do //
analyzed: de la sa ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa med bzhin du rtsa ba dang 'bras bu dang / me tog la sogs pas sems can thams cad kyi gsos su 'gyur bar byed do //
translated: The earth, without thought or discrimination, serves as the sustenance of all sentient beings through its roots, fruits, flowers, and so forth.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa med bzhin du sngags kyi lha la sogs pa'i sgor ston te /🔽sems can rnams kyis kyang sngags kyi lha @271a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa med bzhin du sngags kyi lha la sogs pa'i sgor ston te / sems can rnams kyis kyang sngags kyi lha @271a * //
translated: In the same way, that omniscient wisdom, without thought or discrimination, manifests in the form of the mantra deities and so forth.

original: la sogs pa bsnyen cing ba zlas pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas mnyes par byas pas mngon par mtho ba'i mtshan nyid mi dang lha'i longs spyod la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa bsnyen cing ba zlas pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas mnyes par byas pas mngon par mtho ba'i mtshan nyid mi dang lha'i longs spyod la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Sentient beings, by propitiating the mantra deities and so forth through the means of recitation and so on, will attain the characteristics of higher rebirth, such as the enjoyments of humans and gods.

original: me'i dpes ni spong ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: me'i dpes ni spong ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The example of fire teaches the perfection of abandonment.

original: ji ltar mes rtsi shing la sogs pa thams cad bsregs kyang sreg par 'gyur ba'i mthu mi zad do //
analyzed: ji ltar mes rtsi shing la sogs pa thams cad bsregs kyang sreg par 'gyur ba'i mthu mi zad do //
translated: Just as fire burns all trees and so forth, yet the power of burning is inexhaustible,

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang mi shes pa'i bud shing thams cad sreg ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang mi shes pa'i bud shing thams cad sreg ste /
translated: Likewise, that gnosis of omniscience burns all the fuel of non-knowledge.

original: rgyu'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis mi shes pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams sel zhing med par byed pa ni bud shing sreg pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis mi shes pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams sel zhing med par byed pa ni bud shing sreg pa'o //
translated: At the time of the cause, the bodhisattva deeds, the stages of the grounds and perfections and so forth, it removes and eliminates the afflictions such as non-knowledge and so forth, which are the opposing factors, like burning fuel.

original: gnyis su na 'bras bu'i tshe thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mi shes pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas na mi shes pa'i bud shing sreg pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis su na 'bras bu'i tshe thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mi shes pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas na mi shes pa'i bud shing sreg pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: In another way, at the time of the result, omniscience itself has the characteristic of non-knowledge, so it has the nature of burning the fuel of non-knowledge.

original: des gong ma'i spong ba phun sum tshogs pa de nyid kyang des bag chags thams cad ma lus par spong ngo //
analyzed: des gong ma'i spong ba phun sum tshogs pa de nyid kyang des bag chags thams cad ma lus par spong ngo //
translated: The next verse shows that it also completely eliminates all the habitual tendencies of the above mentioned perfect abandonment.

original: zhes rlung gi dpe 'og mas bstan te /
analyzed: zhes rlung gi dpe 'og mas bstan te /
translated: The next example of wind shows this:

original: de bas na rlung gi khams ni rdul thams cad sel bar bgyid pa lags so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na rlung gi khams ni rdul thams cad sel bar bgyid pa lags so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the wind element is what removes all dust.

original: de la rdul ni phra ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de la rdul ni phra ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The particle is the characteristic of the subtle.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis mi shes pa'i bag chags phra mo'i mthar thug pa spangs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis mi shes pa'i bag chags phra mo'i mthar thug pa spangs pa la bya'o //
translated: Likewise, it is the abandonment of the subtle latent propensities of ignorance by the wisdom of omniscience.

original: chu'i dpes ni nges par legs pa'i gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: chu'i dpes ni nges par legs pa'i gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The example of water teaches the perfection of the benefit for others, which is definite goodness.

original: ji ltar chu des tsha ba la sogs pas gdungs pa'i sems can gyi lus sim par byed pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gdungs pa zhi bar byed pa nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa la sbyor zhing rdzogs par byed pas na /
analyzed: ji ltar chu des tsha ba la sogs pas gdungs pa'i sems can gyi lus sim par byed pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gdungs pa zhi bar byed pa nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa la sbyor zhing rdzogs par byed pas na /
translated: Just as that water cools the bodies of sentient beings tormented by heat and so forth, likewise that wisdom of omniscience also pacifies the suffering and the afflictions such as attachment of all sentient beings. It is the characteristic of definite goodness, which is nirvana. It is the perfection of nirvana.

original: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten rab tu sim par bgyid pa lags zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten rab tu sim par bgyid pa lags zhes pa'o //
translated: It is the cooling of the world with its gods.

original: de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshul sngon chad bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa las /
analyzed: de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshul sngon chad bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa las /
translated: These are the ways of omniscience that the Bhagavat has previously taught.

original: phyag na rdo rje bdag nyid kyis 'di ltar rtogs so zhes gsol ba ste bdag nyid kyis rtogs par bstan pa yang chos gsung ba po spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje bdag nyid kyis 'di ltar rtogs so zhes gsol ba ste bdag nyid kyis rtogs par bstan pa yang chos gsung ba po spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir yin no //
translated: The request I, Vajrapani, have realized it in this way is taught for the sake of generating enthusiasm for the one who speaks the Dharma.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin de ltar rtogs mod kyi de dag gi rgyu gtso bo'i rgyu dang / rgyu'i rgyu dang mthar phyin par byed pa'i rgyu gang lags zhes dris pa ni 'di'i rgyu ni gang /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin de ltar rtogs mod kyi de dag gi rgyu gtso bo'i rgyu dang / rgyu'i rgyu dang mthar phyin par byed pa'i rgyu gang lags zhes dris pa ni 'di'i rgyu ni gang /
translated: Although it is taught that I have realized their nature, the question What is the cause of these?

original: rtsa ba ni gang /
analyzed: rtsa ba ni gang /
translated: What is the root?

original: mthar @271b thug pa ni gang lags zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mthar @271b thug pa ni gang lags zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: What is the ultimate? is asked in terms of the primary cause, the cause of the cause, and the cause that brings to completion.

original: de la 'phags pa phyag na rdo rjes tshul sna tshogs la sogs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i ror ro gcig par rtogs pa de ci rtogs pa'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa phyag na rdo rjes tshul sna tshogs la sogs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i ror ro gcig par rtogs pa de ci rtogs pa'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: In that regard, the noble Vajrapani has realized the various ways and so forth as being of one taste in the flavor of the tathagata's liberation. Is that realized by the wisdom of realization?

original: thos pa'i shes rab kyis shes /
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab kyis shes /
translated: Is it known by the wisdom of hearing?

original: gal te rtogs pa'i shes rab kyis shes na ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang khyad par med la /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa'i shes rab kyis shes na ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang khyad par med la /
translated: If they know it through the wisdom of realization, they would be no different from tathagatas.

original: thos pa'i shes rab kyis shes na yang sems can tha mal pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab kyis shes na yang sems can tha mal pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na /
translated: If they know it through the wisdom of learning, they would be like ordinary beings.

original: lan ni shes rab de gnyi gas shes pa la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: lan ni shes rab de gnyi gas shes pa la nyes pa med de /
translated: The reply is that there is no fault in knowing it through either of those two wisdoms.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku mi zad pa'i rgyan la sogs pa la 'jug pa na rang gi mthu dang 'tsham pa'i spyod yul gyis shes kyi ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku mi zad pa'i rgyan la sogs pa la 'jug pa na rang gi mthu dang 'tsham pa'i spyod yul gyis shes kyi ;
translated: When they enter the inexhaustible adornments of the Bhagavat's body, they know it through the scope of their own power.

original: bcom ldan 'das ltar rnam pa thams cad du shes pa ni ma yin pas khyad par med par mi 'gyur la thos pa yang rtogs pa gtso bor gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ltar rnam pa thams cad du shes pa ni ma yin pas khyad par med par mi 'gyur la thos pa yang rtogs pa gtso bor gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: But they do not know it in all aspects like the Bhagavat, so they are not the same. And their learning is primarily realization.

original: sems can tha mal pa ltar thos pa tsam gtso bor gyur pa ma yin pas sems can tha mal pa dang khyad par med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can tha mal pa ltar thos pa tsam gtso bor gyur pa ma yin pas sems can tha mal pa dang khyad par med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not primarily mere learning like that of ordinary beings, so they are not the same as ordinary beings.

original: gnyis su na rtogs pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad du shes na yang nyes pa med de bcom ldan 'das kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis pha rol gyi sems shes pa bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul rnam pa thams cad du shes🔽par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis su na rtogs pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad du shes na yang nyes pa med de bcom ldan 'das kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis pha rol gyi sems shes pa bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul rnam pa thams cad du shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Second, even if one knows everything with the wisdom of realization, there is no fault, because through the blessing of the Bhagavān, one will know the entire domain of omniscient wisdom, just as one knows the minds of others.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de'i rgyu dang rtsa ba dang mthar thug pa dris pa la legs so zhes bya ba'i tshig lan gsum gsungs pa las snga ma ni don bzang po dris pas mnyes shing bstod pa'i🔽tshig yin la /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de'i rgyu dang rtsa ba dang mthar thug pa dris pa la legs so zhes bya ba'i tshig lan gsum gsungs pa las snga ma ni don bzang po dris pas mnyes shing bstod pa'i tshig yin la /
translated: To that, Vajrapāṇi asked the Bhagavān about the cause, root, and culmination of that omniscient wisdom. In response, the Bhagavān said Excellent! three times. The first statement is a word of praise, pleased by the question about the good meaning.

original: gnyis pa ni dri ba'i tshig de nyid legs pa la bya zhing /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dri ba'i tshig de nyid legs pa la bya zhing /
translated: The second is to be taken as referring to the question itself being excellent.

original: tha ma gcig ni phyag na rdo rje la bya ste /
analyzed: tha ma gcig ni phyag na rdo rje la bya ste /
translated: The last one is for Vajrapāṇi.

original: de lta bu'i don bzang po 'dri zhing sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir dris pa legs so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don bzang po 'dri zhing sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir dris pa legs so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is said Excellent! for asking such a good meaning and for benefiting sentient beings.

original: shin tu legs par nyon la yid la zung shig ces bya bas ni snod bzhi las bzlog par gsungs te /
analyzed: shin tu legs par nyon la yid la zung shig ces bya bas ni snod bzhi las bzlog par gsungs te /
translated: This is the opposite of the four kinds of vessels.

original: nyon cig ces pa ni snod kha sbub pa las bzlog pa'o //🔽legs par zhes pa ni snod glo rdol can las bzlog pa'o ;
analyzed: nyon cig ces pa ni snod kha sbub pa las bzlog pa'o // legs par zhes pa ni snod glo rdol can las bzlog pa'o ;
translated: Listen means the opposite of an upside-down vessel.🔽Very well means the opposite of a leaky vessel.

original: / shin tu zhes pa ni snod mi gtsang ba las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: / shin tu zhes pa ni snod mi gtsang ba las bzlog pa'o //
translated: And means the opposite of a dirty vessel.

original: yid la zung shig ces pas ni snod zhabs rdol las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: yid la zung shig ces pas ni snod zhabs rdol las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Keep it in mind means the opposite of a vessel with a hole in it.

original: rgyu ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: rgyu ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The cause is the thought of awakening.

original: rtsa ba ni snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba ni snying rje chen po'o //
translated: The root is great compassion.🔽The culmination is skillful means.

original: mthar thug pa ni thabs so zhes pa de la byang chub kyi sems la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mthar thug pa ni thabs so zhes pa de la byang chub kyi sems la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The thought of awakening is twofold:

original: byang chub kyi phyir sems @272a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir sems @272a * //
translated: the thought of awakening for the sake of awakening,

original: pa dang ; byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyi sems so //
analyzed: pa dang ; byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyi sems so //
translated: and the thought of awakening that is the nature of awakening.

original: byang chub kyi phyir sems pa ni smon pa dang 'jug pa'i sems dag kyang yin mod kyi skabs 'dir dang po'i byang chub kyi sems la bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir sems pa ni smon pa dang 'jug pa'i sems dag kyang yin mod kyi skabs 'dir dang po'i byang chub kyi sems la bya ste /
translated: The thought of awakening for the sake of awakening is the aspiration and the engaged thought of awakening. However, in this context, it is the first thought of awakening that is meant.

original: sa dang po'i sems de mngon par byang chub pa'i snying por sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa dang po'i sems de mngon par byang chub pa'i snying por sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that thought of the first stage is applied to the essence of manifest enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyi sems kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyi sems kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: The thought of the nature of enlightenment is also like this.

original: sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems de ni chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pas mngon par byang chub pa'i sems dang rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems de ni chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pas mngon par byang chub pa'i sems dang rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that thought of enlightenment of the first stage is of the nature of the realization of the equality of all phenomena, it is of the same nature as the thought of manifest enlightenment.

original: de lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu'i gtso bor rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu'i gtso bor rig par bya'o //
translated: Such a thought of enlightenment should be known as the principal cause of omniscient wisdom.

original: snying rje ni rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: snying rje ni rtsa ba ste /
translated: Compassion is the root.

original: sems can sdug bsngal bas gdungs pa las bral ba'i phyir snying rje'i sgo nas smon lam la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems skye ste /
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal bas gdungs pa las bral ba'i phyir snying rje'i sgo nas smon lam la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems skye ste /
translated: Because it is the door of compassion that the thought of enlightenment of aspiration and so forth arises from the distress of sentient beings suffering,

original: de bas na snying rje de byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsa bar gyur pas na rgyu'i yang rgyur blta'o //
analyzed: de bas na snying rje de byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsa bar gyur pas na rgyu'i yang rgyur blta'o //
translated: and therefore compassion is seen as the cause of the cause, since it becomes the root of the thought of enlightenment.

original: gnyis su na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bstan par gnas par byed pa'i phyir rtsa ba zhes bya ste /🔽thugs rje'i gzungs kyis lhag ma lus pa'i mya ngan las mi 'da' bar dus thams cad du mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par gnas shing kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i ye shes brten pa ste sdong po'i rtsa ba ltar brten par byed pas na thams cad
analyzed: gnyis su na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bstan par gnas par byed pa'i phyir rtsa ba zhes bya ste / thugs rje'i gzungs kyis lhag ma lus pa'i mya ngan las mi 'da' bar dus thams cad du mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par gnas shing kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i ye shes brten pa ste sdong po'i rtsa ba ltar brten par byed pas na thams cad
translated: Second, it is called a root because it causes the wisdom of omniscience to be taught and to endure.

original: mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rtsa ba'o //
translated: The wisdom of omniscience is the root because it causes the wisdom of the relative and the ultimate to endure, to be supported, like the root of a tree, by not passing into nirvāṇa, by remaining in a non-abiding nirvāṇa at all times through the dhāraṇī of compassion, through the remainder of the body.

original: mthar thug pa ni thabs so zhes pa la /
analyzed: mthar thug pa ni thabs so zhes pa la /
translated: The method is the culmination, it is said.

original: thabs ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thabs ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The method is the perfection of generosity and so on.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rdzogs par sbyor ba'i mthar thug par de dag gis ston pas na mthar thug par blta'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rdzogs par sbyor ba'i mthar thug par de dag gis ston pas na mthar thug par blta'o //
translated: They should be seen as the culmination because they teach the culmination of the application to the perfection of the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de la thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu byang chub kyi sems so zhes bya na /
analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu byang chub kyi sems so zhes bya na /
translated: If it is said that the cause of omniscience is the mind of awakening,

original: byang chub nyid gang yin mi shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub nyid gang yin mi shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of enlightenment,🔽the Bhagavān said, “Lord of Secrets, what is enlightenment?

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de la byang chub gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas 'di lta ste nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de la byang chub gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas 'di lta ste nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is the characteristic of space.”

original: gong du byang chub kyi sems thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyur bshad pa de'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin bshad pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gong du byang chub kyi sems thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyur bshad pa de'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin bshad pa la bya'o //
translated: The enlightenment of the mind explained above as the cause of the gnosis of omniscience is the nature of enlightenment.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de la byang chub gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de la byang chub gang zhe na /
translated: Lord of Secrets, what is enlightenment?🔽It is the thorough knowledge of one’s own mind just as it is.

original: gang gi rang gi sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ste zhes pa la gang zhe na zhes pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang theg pa chen po'i byang chub rnams las gang yin zhes pa la mi bya'i byang chub
analyzed: gang gi rang gi sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ste zhes pa la gang zhe na zhes pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang theg pa chen po'i byang chub rnams las gang yin zhes pa la mi bya'i byang chub
translated: What is it? It is not the enlightenment of the hearers, solitary realizers, or the Mahāyāna.

original: de ci 'dra ba yin zhes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de ci 'dra ba yin zhes pa la bya'o //
translated: What is it like?

original: rang gi sems yang dag pa ji @272b lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ni sbyor ba'i sems kyis bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam par mthong ba de sems kyi skad cig ma phyi mas bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa de yang dag pa ma yin
analyzed: rang gi sems yang dag pa ji @272b lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ni sbyor ba'i sems kyis bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam par mthong ba de sems kyi skad cig ma phyi mas bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa de yang dag pa ma yin
translated: The correct thorough understanding of one's mind is the subsequent moment of mind that, with the mind of application, sees the aspect of a pot, etc. and then refutes the incorrectness of that aspect of a pot, etc.

original: par sun phyung nas de ltar gzung ba'i cha sun phyung ste med na 'dzin pa'i cha yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: par sun phyung nas de ltar gzung ba'i cha sun phyung ste med na 'dzin pa'i cha yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If the apprehended aspect does not exist, the apprehending aspect also does not exist.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yongs su dag pa rnam pa med pa rang bzhin gyis dag par shes pa ni rang gi sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yongs su dag pa rnam pa med pa rang bzhin gyis dag par shes pa ni rang gi sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the correct thorough understanding of one's mind is the knowledge that the mind is pure, free from the nature of apprehended and apprehender, devoid of aspects and naturally pure.

original: de bzhin du gzhung gzhan las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhung gzhan las kyang /
translated: Similarly, other scriptures explain:

original: ye shes bzhi las mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni byang chub tu bshad /
analyzed: ye shes bzhi las mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni byang chub tu bshad /
translated: The wisdom of equality from among the four wisdoms is explained to be enlightenment.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes dang so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes dang so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: Mirror-like primordial wisdom, discerning primordial wisdom, and primordial wisdom of successful activities are to be understood as explained as the primordial wisdom of omniscience.

original: de la yang bla na med pa yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub po zhes pa la bla na med pa ni byang chub de'i gong na de las lhag pa'i byang chub gzhan med pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang bla na med pa yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub po zhes pa la bla na med pa ni byang chub de'i gong na de las lhag pa'i byang chub gzhan med pa'o //
translated: As for “unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment,” “unsurpassed” means that there is no other enlightenment higher or greater than that enlightenment.

original: yang dag par byang chub pa ni phyin ci ma log par byang chub pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag par byang chub pa ni phyin ci ma log par byang chub pa la bya ste /
translated: “Perfect enlightenment” means enlightenment that is not mistaken.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs kyang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pas phyogs gcig phyin ci log pa ni ma yin gyi /
