analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs kyang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pas phyogs gcig phyin ci log pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The Listeners and the Self-realized Buddhas have eliminated the afflictive obstructions but have not eliminated the obstructions to omniscience, so they are not completely non-mistaken.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis ka spangs pas yang dag par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis ka spangs pas yang dag par byang chub pa'o //
translated: But since the Buddha has eliminated both the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, he is perfectly enlightened.

original: rdzogs par byang chub pa ni kun tu byang chub pa zhes bya ste shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i bag chags kyi mthar thug pa ma lus par spangs pas na kun du byang chub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par byang chub pa ni kun tu byang chub pa zhes bya ste shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i bag chags kyi mthar thug pa ma lus par spangs pas na kun du byang chub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Complete enlightenment is called “universal enlightenment” because it is the complete abandonment of all the habitual tendencies of the obscurations of knowledge and the afflictions.

original: gnyis su na rang gi sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i chos rnams rnam pa thams cad du stong par shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis su na rang gi sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i chos rnams rnam pa thams cad du stong par shes pa la bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, the complete understanding of one’s own mind as it is in reality is the knowledge that all phenomena, both conventional and ultimate, are empty in every respect.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de la chos ni rdul tsam yang med cing mi dmigs so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de la chos ni rdul tsam yang med cing mi dmigs so zhes pa ni /
translated: Lord of the Secret Ones, in this respect, there is not even an atom’s worth of phenomena that can be found or observed.

original: byang chub de la phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin bag chags tsam yang med pas byang chub de nyid 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du med cing dmigs su med do zhes pa ni dmigs pa'i yul ma yin pas gzung ba'i rang bzhin yang med do //
analyzed: byang chub de la phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin bag chags tsam yang med pas byang chub de nyid 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du med cing dmigs su med do zhes pa ni dmigs pa'i yul ma yin pas gzung ba'i rang bzhin yang med do //
translated: Since it is not an observed object, it also does not have the nature of apprehended-object.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub de ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de //🔽zhes pa ni de la nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ni rtag pa dang mi 'gyur ba dang stong pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin mod kyi /
analyzed: byang chub de ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de // zhes pa ni de la nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ni rtag pa dang mi 'gyur ba dang stong pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin mod kyi /
translated: That enlightenment has the characteristic of space.🔽Here, the characteristic of space is indeed permanence, immutability, emptiness, and so forth.

original: skabs 'dir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rang bzhin med pa la bya ste /🔽de bas @273a * //🔽na de bstan pa'i phyir de la byang chub par byed pa yang med la /
analyzed: skabs 'dir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rang bzhin med pa la bya ste / de bas @273a * // na de bstan pa'i phyir de la byang chub par byed pa yang med la /
translated: However, in this context, it is the absence of the nature of apprehended-object and apprehending-subject.🔽Therefore, in order to demonstrate that, it is said,🔽There is nothing that is enlightened,

original: byang chub par bya ba 'ga' yang med do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub par bya ba 'ga' yang med do zhes gsungs te /
translated: and there is nothing that is an object of enlightenment.

original: byang chub par byed pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub par byed pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The enlightener is the apprehender.

original: byang chub bar bya ba ni gzung ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub bar bya ba ni gzung ba ste /
translated: The enlightened is the apprehended.

original: byang chub de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no apprehender or apprehended in that enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub la mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir te zhes pa ni byang chub de sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub la mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir te zhes pa ni byang chub de sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because enlightenment is without a sign. This means that enlightenment does not have the signs of aspects such as the colors blue, yellow, and so on.

original: chos thams cad kyang mtshan nyid med ces pa la sogs pa la sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa de byang chub po zhes bshad na /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang mtshan nyid med ces pa la sogs pa la sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa de byang chub po zhes bshad na /
translated: As for the statement that all phenomena are also without a sign, and so on, it has been explained that the mind’s perfect knowledge of things as they are is enlightenment.

original: sems las gzhan pa'i chos de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sems las gzhan pa'i chos de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But are not those phenomena that are other than the mind also perfectly known as they are?

original: ji ltar sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes shing mtshan nyid med pa la sogs par bshad pa bzhin du chos thams cad kyang mtshan nyid med de nam mkha' bzhin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes shing mtshan nyid med pa la sogs par bshad pa bzhin du chos thams cad kyang mtshan nyid med de nam mkha' bzhin zhes pa'o //
translated: Just as the mind is fully understood as it is, and is explained to be without characteristics, and so on, all phenomena are also without characteristics, like space.

original: yang na chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de nyid byang chub mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yang na chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de nyid byang chub mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Or, all phenomena are without characteristics, and that very characteristic of space is the characteristic of enlightenment, which is without characteristics.

original: de la chos ni sems las gzhan pa'i phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos ni sems las gzhan pa'i phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: In this regard, phenomena are the aggregates, and so on, other than the mind.

original: 'di lta ste nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do zhes pa ni nam mkha' la mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do zhes pa ni nam mkha' la mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase that is to say, the characteristic of space is because space is without characteristics.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni gang nas yongs su btsal bar bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni gang nas yongs su btsal bar bgyi /
translated: Blessed One, from where should omniscience be sought?

original: gang gis ni byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par bgyi lags zhes pa nas /
analyzed: gang gis ni byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par bgyi lags zhes pa nas /
translated: By what should enlightenment be fully awakened to?

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i chos snang ba'i sgo chos snang ba'i tshul dang po ste zhes pa'i bar du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / byang chub mngon par rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa'i thabs dris pa dang /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i chos snang ba'i sgo chos snang ba'i tshul dang po ste zhes pa'i bar du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / byang chub mngon par rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa'i thabs dris pa dang /
translated: The Buddha said, This is the method for entering omniscient wisdom and fully awakening to enlightenment.

original: de gnyis rang gi sems las btsal ba'i thabs bstan pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis rang gi sems las btsal ba'i thabs bstan pa la bya'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the method for searching for those two in one's own mind.

original: de la thams cad mkhyen pa gang nas btsal ba dang / gang gis byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhes pa ni de la ji ltar 'jug ces dris pa'o //
analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pa gang nas btsal ba dang / gang gis byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhes pa ni de la ji ltar 'jug ces dris pa'o //
translated: Regarding where is omniscience sought? and by what does one fully awaken to perfect enlightenment? this is the question how does one enter?

original: byang chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rang gi sems las yongs su btsal bar bya'o zhes pa ni nam rang gi sems @273b nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa 'phro ba'i bag chags spangs te rnam par dag pa na /
analyzed: byang chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rang gi sems las yongs su btsal bar bya'o zhes pa ni nam rang gi sems @273b nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa 'phro ba'i bag chags spangs te rnam par dag pa na /
translated: Awakening and omniscience should be sought in one's own mind. This means that when one's own mind has abandoned the habitual tendencies of the proliferation of the nature of subject and object, and is pure,

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba so so rang gis rig pa mi g-yo ba ye shes kyi snang ba'i mtshan nyid byang chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba so so rang gis rig pa mi g-yo ba ye shes kyi snang ba'i mtshan nyid byang chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: it becomes the nature of awakening and omniscience, characterized by the appearance of the immovable wisdom, which is naturally luminous and individually cognized.

original: sems la ji ltar brtags pas don de shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sems la ji ltar brtags pas don de shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, How is that meaning known by investigating the mind?

original: de la rtog pa'i gang zag kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rtog pa'i gang zag kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of persons who investigate:

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'og ma'i lta ba can 'gro ba tha dad pa rnams so //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'og ma'i lta ba can 'gro ba tha dad pa rnams so //
translated: those who possess the supramundane wisdom of the buddhas and bodhisattvas and those who possess the view of the lower vehicles and the different migrating beings.

original: de la 'gro ba tha dad pas brtags pa ni de'i nang na yang med phyi rol na yang med gnyis ka'i bar na yang mi dmigs so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba tha dad pas brtags pa ni de'i nang na yang med phyi rol na yang med gnyis ka'i bar na yang mi dmigs so zhes gsungs te /
translated: As for the investigation of the mind in terms of different beings, it is said that it does not exist internally, externally, or in between.

original: phyi ni gzung ba /
analyzed: phyi ni gzung ba /
translated: The external is the object.

original: nang ni 'dzin pa /
analyzed: nang ni 'dzin pa /
translated: The internal is the subject.

original: bar ni de gnyis ka'i bar de na yang sems mi dmigs so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bar ni de gnyis ka'i bar de na yang sems mi dmigs so zhes pa'o //
translated: The mind is not observed in between those two.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams kyis kyang sems kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / khams dang / rgyud dang ; gnas pa ste rnam pa lnga'i dngos por mi dmigs te de bas na sngon por ma yin zhes pa nas lus la ma yin yid la mi gnas so zhes pa'i bar du gsungs te /🔽ma gzigs zhes pa ni 'das pa dang / mi dmigs zhes pa ni da ltar gyi dus na yang ma gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams kyis kyang sems kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / khams dang / rgyud dang ; gnas pa ste rnam pa lnga'i dngos por mi dmigs te de bas na sngon por ma yin zhes pa nas lus la ma yin yid la mi gnas so zhes pa'i bar du gsungs te / ma gzigs zhes pa ni 'das pa dang / mi dmigs zhes pa ni da ltar gyi dus na yang ma gzigs pa'o //
translated: Even those who have supramundane wisdom do not observe the mind in terms of five aspects: color, shape, element, continuum, and location. Therefore, it is said that it is not blue, up to it does not exist in the body or in the mind.🔽Not seeing refers to the past. Not observing refers to not seeing in the present.

original: gzigs par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang gzigs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzigs par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang gzigs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Not seeing refers to not seeing in the future.

original: sngon por ma yin zhes pa nas shel gyi kha dog tu ma yin zhes pa'i bar du ni sems de kha dog gi rnam par mthong ba'i yul ma yin pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sngon por ma yin zhes pa nas shel gyi kha dog tu ma yin zhes pa'i bar du ni sems de kha dog gi rnam par mthong ba'i yul ma yin pa la bya'o //
translated: From “not blue” up to “not the color of crystal” means that it is not an object seen in the aspect of color.

original: thung ngur ma yin zhes pa nas /
analyzed: thung ngur ma yin zhes pa nas /
translated: From “not short” up to

original: skyes par ma yin ma ning du ma yin no zhes pa'i bar du dbyibs kyi rnam par mthong ba ma yin pa la bya'o //
analyzed: skyes par ma yin ma ning du ma yin no zhes pa'i bar du dbyibs kyi rnam par mthong ba ma yin pa la bya'o //
translated: “not long” means that it is not seen in the aspect of shape.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin ma yin /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin ma yin /
translated: “Not the nature of the desire realm,”

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi rang bzhin ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi rang bzhin ma yin /
translated: “not the nature of the form realm,”

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin ma yin zhes pa ni khams kyi rnam par mthong ba med pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin ma yin zhes pa ni khams kyi rnam par mthong ba med pa la bya'o //
translated: and “not the nature of the formless realm” means that it is not seen in the aspect of the realms.

original: lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang zhes pa nas /
analyzed: lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang zhes pa nas /
translated: “Not the nature of gods, nāgas, yakṣas,” and so on up to

original: sems can ris mthun pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no zhes pa'i bar du rgyud kyi mthong ba med pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sems can ris mthun pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no zhes pa'i bar du rgyud kyi mthong ba med pa la bya'o //
translated: “not the nature of sentient beings of the same type” means that it is not seen in the aspect of a continuum.

original: sems de ni mig la mi gnas zhes pa nas yid la mi gnas so zhes pa'i bar du dbang po drug la sems gnas par mthong ba med pa la bya'o //🔽kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa de rnams kyi rnam par snang ba na sems de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i @274a * //
analyzed: sems de ni mig la mi gnas zhes pa nas yid la mi gnas so zhes pa'i bar du dbang po drug la sems gnas par mthong ba med pa la bya'o // kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa de rnams kyi rnam par snang ba na sems de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i @274a * //
translated: The mind does not dwell in the eyes, up to the mind does not dwell in the mental faculty. This means that the mind is not seen to dwell in the six sense faculties.

original: rang bzhin dang ma bral bas dri ma dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ma bral bas dri ma dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: When those colors, shapes, and so forth appear in the aspect of the mind, the mind is not free from the nature of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de ltar dri ma dang bcas pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dri ma dang bcas pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since it is contaminated in that way, it is not the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de bas na dri ma de dag thams cad yongs su dag pa'i sems de ni thams cad mkhyen pa ste de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na dri ma de dag thams cad yongs su dag pa'i sems de ni thams cad mkhyen pa ste de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, that mind, which is completely pure of all those contaminations, is omniscience.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems de ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sems de ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de zhes gsungs te /
translated: That mind has the characteristic of space.

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa spangs pa ste nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de dang 'dra bas na /
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa spangs pa ste nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de dang 'dra bas na /
translated: The characteristic of space is the abandonment of conceptualization and discrimination. Since it is similar to that characteristic of space,

original: de'i phyir rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be free from all thoughts and discursive thoughts.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa spangs pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa spangs pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it abandons discursive thought and investigation.

original: de ltar na sems ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid dang 'dra ba'i phyir byang chub kyang de nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na sems ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid dang 'dra ba'i phyir byang chub kyang de nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, since the mind is similar to the characteristic of space, enlightenment is also that.

original: nam mkha'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni sems kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni sems kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of space is the nature of the mind.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi rang bzhin te zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽de ltar sems dang byang chub rnams gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gnyis su med de /
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi rang bzhin te zhes gsungs pa yin no // de ltar sems dang byang chub rnams gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gnyis su med de /
translated: The nature of the mind is the nature of enlightenment.🔽Thus, the mind and enlightenment are non-dual, without the nature of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de ltar na sems dang nam mkha'i dbyings dang byang chub 'di ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de ltar na sems dang nam mkha'i dbyings dang byang chub 'di ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Lord of Secrets, thus, the mind, the realm of space, and enlightenment are non-dual, without duality.

original: de yang snying rje'i rtsa ba can thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su gzung ba ste zhes pa ni de lta bu'i sems kyi rang bzhin gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyang med pa /
analyzed: de yang snying rje'i rtsa ba can thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su gzung ba ste zhes pa ni de lta bu'i sems kyi rang bzhin gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyang med pa /
translated: The nature of such a mind is also devoid of the habitual tendencies of subject and object.

original: byang chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid de'i rtsa ba ni snying rje ste brtan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid de'i rtsa ba ni snying rje ste brtan par byed pa'o //
translated: The root of that which is characterized by enlightenment and omniscience is compassion, which stabilizes it.

original: de la sbyor bar byed pa'i thabs ni pha rol tu phyin pa ste yongs su gzung ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de skyong ba'i rgyur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sbyor bar byed pa'i thabs ni pha rol tu phyin pa ste yongs su gzung ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de skyong ba'i rgyur shes par bya'o //
translated: The means that are applied to it are the perfections. It should be understood that the embrace is the cause of sustaining that gnosis of omniscience.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de bas na rnam grangs 'dis kyang zhes pa nas rig par bya'o zhes pa'i bar ni gong du byang chub gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de bas na rnam grangs 'dis kyang zhes pa nas rig par bya'o zhes pa'i bar ni gong du byang chub gang zhe na /
translated: Lord of Secrets, therefore, by this explanation as well, you should understand that the perfection of wisdom is the mother and skillful means is the father.

original: gang rang gi sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'o zhes pa dang / byang chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rang gi sems las yongs su btsal bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / sems de ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yin te zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa de rnam grangs gcig ste /
analyzed: gang rang gi sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'o zhes pa dang / byang chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rang gi sems las yongs su btsal bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / sems de ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yin te zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa de rnam grangs gcig ste /
translated: That mind is pure by nature.🔽These are synonyms.

original: gnyis ka yang byang chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu ston pa'i tshig gi rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang byang chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu ston pa'i tshig gi rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
translated: Both are synonyms for the words that teach the cause of enlightenment and omniscience.

original: / @274b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rtogs pa'i chos dang lung gi chos byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor la gang dang gang bshad pa rnams ni tshig la sogs pa'i sgo tha dad kyang byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa dang / rang gi sems yongs su shes par bya ba'i don rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te gzhan gyi phyir du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / @274b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rtogs pa'i chos dang lung gi chos byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor la gang dang gang bshad pa rnams ni tshig la sogs pa'i sgo tha dad kyang byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa dang / rang gi sems yongs su shes par bya ba'i don rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te gzhan gyi phyir du ni ma yin no //
translated: Whatever Dharma of realization and Dharma of scripture the Blessed Buddhas teach to the assembly of Bodhisattvas, although the doors of their words and so forth are different, they are for the sake of the two aspects of the purification of the Thought of Enlightenment and the thorough knowledge of one’s own mind, and not for any other reason.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi nang du chos gang dang gang ston pa de dag thams cad ni byang chub kyi sems yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sems yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi nang du chos gang dang gang ston pa de dag thams cad ni byang chub kyi sems yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sems yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, whatever Dharma is taught in the assembly of Bodhisattvas, all of it should be understood as being for the sake of the purification of the Thought of Enlightenment and the thorough knowledge of the mind.

original: de la byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po thob pa'i byang chub kyi sems de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir dag pa'o //🔽sems yongs su shes pa ni gang sems kyi ngo bo shes pa de'i rgyus sa dang po thob par byed pa mos pas spyod pa'i dus kyi sems bskyed pa de la bya ste de dag gi phyir chos bshad ces pa'i don te /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po thob pa'i byang chub kyi sems de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir dag pa'o // sems yongs su shes pa ni gang sems kyi ngo bo shes pa de'i rgyus sa dang po thob par byed pa mos pas spyod pa'i dus kyi sems bskyed pa de la bya ste de dag gi phyir chos bshad ces pa'i don te /
translated: The pure thought of enlightenment is the thought of enlightenment of one who has attained the first stage of the Bodhisattva, pure because it is free from subject and object.🔽The knowledge of the thought is the thought of enlightenment of the stage of action in faith, which is the cause of the knowledge of the nature of the thought, and which leads to the attainment of the first stage.

original: byang chub kyi sems nyid la sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems nyid la sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “for their sake I will explain the Dharma” is that the Bodhisattva is applying himself to the thought of enlightenment.

original: de ltar sems yongs su gzung bar bya ba yang kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar sems yongs su gzung bar bya ba yang kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the thought of enlightenment is not to be known as a consciousness of color, etc.

original: rnam pa'i rang bzhin thams cad las 'das pa'i rang bzhin du ste /
analyzed: rnam pa'i rang bzhin thams cad las 'das pa'i rang bzhin du ste /
translated: It is to be known as the nature which transcends all forms.

original: byang chub ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha dang bral ba rnam par dag pa tsam gyi rang bzhin du yang ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha dang bral ba rnam par dag pa tsam gyi rang bzhin du yang ma yin te /
translated: Enlightenment is not even the nature of mere purity, free from the subject-object dichotomy.

original: ji tsam du mtshan mar gyur pa de dag thams cad du rang gi sems de shes par mi bya zhing btsal du mi rnyed par 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji tsam du mtshan mar gyur pa de dag thams cad du rang gi sems de shes par mi bya zhing btsal du mi rnyed par 'di lta ste /
translated: In all those things that are characterized, one’s mind is not to be known or sought and is not to be found.

original: rnam par ram /
analyzed: rnam par ram /
translated: In terms of form,

original: kha dog tu 'am zhes pa nas rnam pa thams cad kyi bar du yongs su btsal kyang mi dmigs pa yin te zhes pa'i bar gyis gsungs te /
analyzed: kha dog tu 'am zhes pa nas rnam pa thams cad kyi bar du yongs su btsal kyang mi dmigs pa yin te zhes pa'i bar gyis gsungs te /
translated: color, and so forth, up to and including all aspects, it is not to be observed.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i rnam par de dag re re nas smos pa yang gang dang gang la chags pa'i gnas rnams la rig pa'i gzhung gis brtags na dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i rnam par de dag re re nas smos pa yang gang dang gang la chags pa'i gnas rnams la rig pa'i gzhung gis brtags na dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The individual enumeration of those aspects, such as color and shape, is that when the treatises of knowledge are examined, the things that are the objects of attachment do not exist.

original: kha dog dang gzugs la sogs pa de dag brtag pa yang kha dog dang gzugs la sogs pa de dag sems la tha mi dad de /
analyzed: kha dog dang gzugs la sogs pa de dag brtag pa yang kha dog dang gzugs la sogs pa de dag sems la tha mi dad de /
translated: The examination of those colors, forms, and so forth is that those colors, forms, and so forth are not different from the mind.

original: sems kyi snang ba yin na ni sems nyid kyang gzugs can du 'gyur la /
analyzed: sems kyi snang ba yin na ni sems nyid kyang gzugs can du 'gyur la /
translated: If they are appearances of the mind, the mind itself would become physical.

original: ji tsam du gzugs dang ldan pa de dag thams cad ni rdul phran gyi chas gzhig na yod par mi 'gyur ro //🔽kha dog la sogs pa de @275a * //
analyzed: ji tsam du gzugs dang ldan pa de dag thams cad ni rdul phran gyi chas gzhig na yod par mi 'gyur ro // kha dog la sogs pa de @275a * //
translated: Whatever has form is destroyed by the particles of dust and does not exist.

original: dag sems las tha dad na yang de dag rdul phran gyi chas gzhig na yod par ma grub pas gzugs med na gzugs kyi rnam par skye ba'i rnam par shes pa mi skye ste yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dag sems las tha dad na yang de dag rdul phran gyi chas gzhig na yod par ma grub pas gzugs med na gzugs kyi rnam par skye ba'i rnam par shes pa mi skye ste yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Even though those colors and so forth are different from the mind, since they are not established as existing by the particles of dust, when there is no form, the consciousness that arises in the aspect of form does not arise and does not exist.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa gzhan yang phyi rol gyi yul sun phyung ste dmigs su med pas na ;
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa gzhan yang phyi rol gyi yul sun phyung ste dmigs su med pas na ;
translated: Likewise, since the other, such as feeling, and so forth, are refuted as external objects and are not observed,

original: yul med par sems dang sems las byung ba mi srid pas mi dmigs so //
analyzed: yul med par sems dang sems las byung ba mi srid pas mi dmigs so //
translated: since the mind and mental factors are not possible without an object, they are not observed.

original: gsar ba pa'i bdag po 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i chos snang ba'i tshul dang po ste zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gsar ba pa'i bdag po 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i chos snang ba'i tshul dang po ste zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the first method of the appearance of phenomena called the bodhisattva’s pure gateway of the generation of bodhicitta.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa na sems de lta bu'i tshul du yongs su shes pa de ni sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa ste rnam pa gsum gyi rgyur bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa na sems de lta bu'i tshul du yongs su shes pa de ni sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa ste rnam pa gsum gyi rgyur bshad pa yin no //
translated: The thorough understanding of that kind of mind on the level of earnest aspiration is explained as the cause of the three aspects of enlightenment mind on the first bodhisattva level, full enlightenment, and omniscience.

original: de las dang po'i byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa'i sgo yin pas byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa'i sgo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de las dang po'i byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa'i sgo yin pas byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa'i sgo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since it is the door to entering the pure nature of the first bodhicitta, it is called the door of pure bodhicitta.

original: chos snang pa'i sgo zhes bya ba la chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: chos snang pa'i sgo zhes bya ba la chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: As for the door of illumination of the Dharma, the Dharma is nirvana, free of subject and object.

original: snang ba ni mkhyen zhes pa'i don te snying po byang chub nyid yin la /
analyzed: snang ba ni mkhyen zhes pa'i don te snying po byang chub nyid yin la /
translated: Illumination means knowledge, which is the very heart of enlightenment.

original: de 'thob pa'i rgyu 'am sgo yang sems yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de 'thob pa'i rgyu 'am sgo yang sems yin zhes pa'o //
translated: And the door or cause for attaining that is mind.

original: chos snang ba'i tshul zhes pa la chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste skad cig ma dang po la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi mtshan nyid mngon par byang chub nas skad cig ma gnyis pa la me long lta bu dang / so sor rtog pa dang /
analyzed: chos snang ba'i tshul zhes pa la chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste skad cig ma dang po la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi mtshan nyid mngon par byang chub nas skad cig ma gnyis pa la me long lta bu dang / so sor rtog pa dang /
translated: The phrase “the way things appear” refers to nirvana. Having attained manifest enlightenment, which is characterized by the timeless awareness of the equalness of all things, in the first instant, in the second instant one gains the mirrorlike aspect of timeless awareness, the discerning aspect,🔽

original: bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid thob ste kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul du thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid thob ste kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul du thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The way of the appearance of phenomena refers to nirvana. Having attained manifest enlightenment, which is characterized by the gnosis of equality in the first instant, in the second instant one attains the gnosis of omniscience, which is characterized by the mirrorlike gnosis, the individually discerning gnosis, and the gnosis of performing one’s activity.🔽One becomes omniscient in the conventional and ultimate ways.

original: dang po zhes pa ni skad cig ma dang po la byang chub thob pa la bya'o //
analyzed: dang po zhes pa ni skad cig ma dang po la byang chub thob pa la bya'o //
translated: The first refers to the attainment of enlightenment in the first instant.

original: gang la gnas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshegs chung dus sgom pa thams spong ting 'dzin 'thob cing zhes pa la sogs pa ni de lta bur rang gi sems yang dag ba ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa la gnas pa'i rjes su bsngags pa🔽gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la gnas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshegs chung dus sgom pa thams spong ting 'dzin 'thob cing zhes pa la sogs pa ni de lta bur rang gi sems yang dag ba ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa la gnas pa'i rjes su bsngags pa🔽gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The praise for the bodhisattvas who abide in the perfect knowledge of their own minds as they are is stated in the lines beginning “Abiding in this, the bodhisattvas, with little hardship, abandon all afflictions and attain concentration.”

original: gang la gnas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhes pa ni rang gi sems gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par mi mthong bas gnas pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gang la gnas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhes pa ni rang gi sems gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par mi mthong bas gnas pa la bya ste /
translated: The line when abiding in which bodhisattvas... refers to abiding in the non-perception of one's own mind as subject and object, and so on.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du ma mthong ba'i @275b sems ni rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du ma mthong ba'i @275b sems ni rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: Thus, the mind that does not perceive the nature of subject and object is pure.

original: de ltar sems rnam par dag na lhun gyis grub pa nyid du nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang las kyi sgrib pa dang / skye ba'i sgrib pa la sogs pa thams cad spong ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar sems rnam par dag na lhun gyis grub pa nyid du nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang las kyi sgrib pa dang / skye ba'i sgrib pa la sogs pa thams cad spong ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: When the mind is pure in this way, one spontaneously attains the samadhi that is the antidote for eliminating all the afflictive obstructions, the karmic obstructions, the obstructions to birth, and so on.

original: de bas na tshegs chung dus sgrib pa thams cad spong ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob cing zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na tshegs chung dus sgrib pa thams cad spong ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob cing zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that with little difficulty one attains the samadhi that eliminates all obstructions.

original: de lta bu'i sems rnam par dag pa la rab tu gnas par gyur na sgrib pa thams cad bsal bas sangs rgyas thams cad la mngon sum du chos nyan zhing bsnyen bkur byed pa dang mngon par shes pa lnga thob pa ste lha'i mig gis lam ring bo
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems rnam par dag pa la rab tu gnas par gyur na sgrib pa thams cad bsal bas sangs rgyas thams cad la mngon sum du chos nyan zhing bsnyen bkur byed pa dang mngon par shes pa lnga thob pa ste lha'i mig gis lam ring bo
translated: When one abides in such a completely pure mind, all obscurations are removed and one listens to the Dharma and serves all the buddhas in person. One attains the five kinds of preternatural knowledge:

original: na 'dug pa'i gzugs kyang ri dang rtsig pa la sogs pa la thogs pa med par mthong la /
analyzed: na 'dug pa'i gzugs kyang ri dang rtsig pa la sogs pa la thogs pa med par mthong la /
translated: With the divine eye, one sees forms that are far away, even on the other side of a mountain or wall, without being obstructed by them.

original: lha'i rnabs lam ring po na 'dug pa'i sgra yang ri dang rtsig pa la sogs pas mi sgrib par thos shing /
analyzed: lha'i rnabs lam ring po na 'dug pa'i sgra yang ri dang rtsig pa la sogs pas mi sgrib par thos shing /
translated: With the divine ear, one hears sounds that are far away, even sounds that are not obstructed by mountains, walls and so forth.

original: gzhan gyi sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa'am 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa shes pa dang / tshe rabs snga ma la yang ci byed pa dang gnas gang du gnas pa rjes su dran zhing rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la sogs pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa'am 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa shes pa dang / tshe rabs snga ma la yang ci byed pa dang gnas gang du gnas pa rjes su dran zhing rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la sogs pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: One knows the minds of others, whether they are attached or free from attachment and so forth, one recalls what one did in previous lives and where one stayed and one attains the bases of supernormal powers and so forth.

original: mtha' yas pa'i mi dang lha la sogs pa'i tshig shes pa'i gzugs kyis mtha' yas pa'i bya la sogs pa'i dbyangs kyi nga ro las don ston pa'i gzungs dang 'brug gi sgra dang / sems can ma yin pa'i sgra sa g-yo ba dang chu la sogs pa mtha' yas pa'i sgra las sgra de dag gis don ci ston pa rtogs pa'i gzungs thob ste /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i mi dang lha la sogs pa'i tshig shes pa'i gzugs kyis mtha' yas pa'i bya la sogs pa'i dbyangs kyi nga ro las don ston pa'i gzungs dang 'brug gi sgra dang / sems can ma yin pa'i sgra sa g-yo ba dang chu la sogs pa mtha' yas pa'i sgra las sgra de dag gis don ci ston pa rtogs pa'i gzungs thob ste /
translated: He obtains the dhāraṇī of understanding the meaning taught by those sounds, from the infinite sounds of non-sentient beings such as earthquakes and water and so on.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa rjes su shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa rjes su shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will understand the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pas khams gsum du 'khor ba na yang thob pa'i chos las nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / ma thob pa yang thob par 'gyur zhing 'khor ba ji srid bar sems can gyi don bya ba dag la yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pas khams gsum du 'khor ba na yang thob pa'i chos las nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / ma thob pa yang thob par 'gyur zhing 'khor ba ji srid bar sems can gyi don bya ba dag la yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because he is blessed by all the Tathāgatas, he will not decline from the Dharma that he has attained, even while transmigrating in the three realms, and he will attain what he has not attained. And he will not become weary of working for the welfare of sentient beings for as long as saṃsāra lasts.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad dang lhan cig 'grogs pa 'thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad dang lhan cig 'grogs pa 'thob par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, he will attain companionship with all the Buddhas.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga dag kyang 'thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga dag kyang 'thob par 'gyur /
translated: One also attains the five superknowledges.🔽One attains the dhāraṇī of infinite languages, sounds, and tones.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: skad dang sgra dang dbyangs mtha' yas pa'i gzungs kyang 'thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: skad dang sgra dang dbyangs mtha' yas pa'i gzungs kyang 'thob par 'gyur /
translated: One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa rjes su shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs bas 'khor ba na @276a * //🔽yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can du 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa rjes su shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs bas 'khor ba na @276a * // yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can du 'gyur /
translated: One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba dag la yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba dag la yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i tshul khrims la rab tu gnas pa zhes pa ni stong pa nyid rab tu rtogs pa la gnas pas stong pa nyid kyi ngang tshul du gyur pa yin gyi sems can don byed kyang tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i tshul khrims la rab tu gnas pa zhes pa ni stong pa nyid rab tu rtogs pa la gnas pas stong pa nyid kyi ngang tshul du gyur pa yin gyi sems can don byed kyang tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i tshul khrims dang /
translated: One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sdom pa la sogs pa kun rdzob kyi tshul khrims la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: sdom pa la sogs pa kun rdzob kyi tshul khrims la ni mi bya'o //
translated: One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽One is not discouraged in working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: log par lta ba rnam par spangs ba ni mu stegs la sogs pa'i lta ba rnams dang bral ba la bya la /
analyzed: log par lta ba rnam par spangs ba ni mu stegs la sogs pa'i lta ba rnams dang bral ba la bya la /
translated: Abandoning wrong views means being free from the views of the tīrthikas and so forth.

original: yang dag par lta ba rtogs pa khong du chud pa ni de ltar log pa'i lta ba spangs pas yang dag pa'i lta ba rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par lta ba rtogs pa khong du chud pa ni de ltar log pa'i lta ba spangs pas yang dag pa'i lta ba rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Realizing and comprehending the correct view is called “realizing the correct view” because of abandoning wrong views in that way.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang sgrib pa thams cad spong ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa ni de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin sngar thob nas thos pa tsam du ma zad kyi ting nge 'dzin nyid dang ldan par gnas🔽pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang sgrib pa thams cad spong ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa ni de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin sngar thob nas thos pa tsam du ma zad kyi ting nge 'dzin nyid dang ldan par gnas pa la bya'o //
translated: Moreover, O Lord of Secrets, the bodhisattva who abides in this samādhi that abandons all obscurations, having attained such a samādhi previously, does not merely hear it but abides endowed with the samādhi itself.

original: mos pa'i stobs bskyed pas tshegs chung dus sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed de zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mos pa'i stobs bskyed pas tshegs chung dus sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed de zhes pa ni /
translated: By generating the power of aspiration, he perfects all the qualities of the buddhas with little difficulty.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rab tu spang ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems byang chub kyi mtshan nyid da lta bu lhag par mos pa'i mthu bsags pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rtogs pa dang lung gi mtshan nyid dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rab tu spang ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems byang chub kyi mtshan nyid da lta bu lhag par mos pa'i mthu bsags pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rtogs pa dang lung gi mtshan nyid dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa
translated: By accumulating the power of deep interest in it, one will realize the qualities of buddhahood, the characteristics of the scriptures, the perfections, and so on,

original: dang / sku'i 'khor lo la sogs pa'i chos rnams ma bsgrubs kyang thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dang / sku'i 'khor lo la sogs pa'i chos rnams ma bsgrubs kyang thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and the teachings of the wheel of the buddha’s body and so forth, even without practicing them.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po mdor na rigs kyi bu 'am /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po mdor na rigs kyi bu 'am /
translated: Guhyapati, in brief, that son of family🔽or daughter of family will possess immeasurable good qualities.

original: rigs kyi bu mo de ni yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes ba ni de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi yon tan so so nas brjod na skal bar yang mi
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de ni yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes ba ni de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi yon tan so so nas brjod na skal bar yang mi
translated: The good qualities of those sons of family or daughters of family who possess such a samadhi cannot be fully described individually,

original: rdzogs te / brjod kyis mi lang bas tshad 'di tsam mo zhes gzung du med de /
analyzed: rdzogs te / brjod kyis mi lang bas tshad 'di tsam mo zhes gzung du med de /
translated: and since they are inexpressible, they cannot be grasped as being of this or that measure.

original: mdor na yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mdor na yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In brief, it is said that he is endowed with immeasurable good qualities.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces zhus pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces zhus pa zhes pa nas /
translated: Then again, Vajrapāṇi asked the Bhagavān, as stated in the text up to:

original: thub pa chen pos bstan du gsol /
analyzed: thub pa chen pos bstan du gsol /
translated: The Great Sage should teach.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni gong du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi @276b mtshan nyid zhib du bshad de /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni gong du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi @276b mtshan nyid zhib du bshad de /
translated: Up to this point, the cause of omniscient wisdom and the characteristics of bodhicitta have been explained in detail.

original: byang chub kyi sems de lta bu la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i yon tan gyi tshad kyang yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de lta bu la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i yon tan gyi tshad kyang yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs nas /
translated: Having said that the one who abides in such bodhicitta is endowed with immeasurable good qualities,

original: de lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ji ltar skye bar 'gyur ba dang / byang chub kyi sems de'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra bar shes par bya ba la sogs pa dris pa ste de yang ji lta bu snyam na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ji ltar skye bar 'gyur ba dang / byang chub kyi sems de'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra bar shes par bya ba la sogs pa dris pa ste de yang ji lta bu snyam na /
translated: the question is asked about how such bodhicitta arises and how the characteristics of that bodhicitta are to be understood.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub tu sems skyes pa zhes bgyi ba lags zhes pa la sogs pa ste spyir na skyes pa dang skye ba zhes bya ba gnyis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub tu sems skyes pa zhes bgyi ba lags zhes pa la sogs pa ste spyir na skyes pa dang skye ba zhes bya ba gnyis te /
translated: In general, there are two terms, is born and is born.

original: de la skye ba zhes bya ba ni ming tsam ste bu mngal du zhugs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la skye ba zhes bya ba ni ming tsam ste bu mngal du zhugs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therein, is born is a mere name, like the son who has entered the womb.

original: skyes zhes bya ba ni skyes par btags pa'i don te dper na bu btsas pa dngos lta bu'o //
analyzed: skyes zhes bya ba ni skyes par btags pa'i don te dper na bu btsas pa dngos lta bu'o //
translated: But is born is the meaning of the designation of birth, like the son who is born in actuality.

original: de bas na byang chub kyi sems skye ba tsam dris pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub kyi sems skye ba tsam dris pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not a question of the mere birth of the thought of enlightenment, but

original: sa dang po'i sems byang chub kyi mtshan nyid du yongs su rdzogs par skyes pa dris pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po'i sems byang chub kyi mtshan nyid du yongs su rdzogs par skyes pa dris pa la bya'o //
translated: it is to be understood as a question of the birth of the thought of the first stage, which is fully perfected as the characteristic of enlightenment.

original: byang chub tu zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi phyir skye ba la bya ste ;
analyzed: byang chub tu zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi phyir skye ba la bya ste ;
translated: Enlightenment is to be understood as the birth for the sake of unexcelled enlightenment,

original: de yang sa dang po'i sems kyi mtshan nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub dang rang bzhin gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sa dang po'i sems kyi mtshan nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub dang rang bzhin gcig pa'o //
translated: and that is the characteristic of the thought of the first stage, which is of the same nature as unexcelled enlightenment.

original: sa gong ma la sogs pas rim gyis rdzogs par byed pa yang rang bzhin de las tha dad pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sa gong ma la sogs pas rim gyis rdzogs par byed pa yang rang bzhin de las tha dad pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The perfections of the higher levels and so on are also not different from that nature.

original: rang bzhin de nyid las mi mthun pa dang gnyen po la sogs pa ldog pa'i sgo nas ming gzhan du btags pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: rang bzhin de nyid las mi mthun pa dang gnyen po la sogs pa ldog pa'i sgo nas ming gzhan du btags pa tsam du zad de /
translated: From that very nature, they are merely nominally imputed as different, as antidotes to incompatible traits and so on.

original: dper na gser nyid las rgyan la sogs par byas na rang bzhin gcig kyang ming gi rnam grangs mang por thogs pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na gser nyid las rgyan la sogs par byas na rang bzhin gcig kyang ming gi rnam grangs mang por thogs pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, when ornaments and so on are made from gold, they have the same nature, but they are given many different names.

original: de bas na byang chub kyi rang bzhin sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems de la bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub kyi rang bzhin sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems de la bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the nature of enlightenment is the bodhicitta of the first bhumi.

original: smon pa dang 'jug pa'i sems kyang byang chub kyi phyir sems pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: smon pa dang 'jug pa'i sems kyang byang chub kyi phyir sems pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Although the aspiration and engagement mindsets are also mindsets for enlightenment,

original: sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems ltar bla na med pa'i byang chub dang rang bzhin mi gcig pas de dag la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems ltar bla na med pa'i byang chub dang rang bzhin mi gcig pas de dag la ni mi bya'o //
translated: they are not called that, because they are not of the same nature as the unsurpassed enlightenment of the first bhumi’s bodhicitta.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na lan bka' stsal pa nas dang po'i mtshan nyid kyi byang chub gsungs pas na gzhan ma yin par mngon no //🔽byang chub 'byung ba'i sems skyes pa'i //
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na lan bka' stsal pa nas dang po'i mtshan nyid kyi byang chub gsungs pas na gzhan ma yin par mngon no // byang chub 'byung ba'i sems skyes pa'i //
translated: Again, in one way, it is evident that it is not other, since the answer is given and the enlightenment of the first stage is mentioned.🔽How should one understand the characteristic of the arising of the thought

original: mtshan nyid ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi //
translated: of enlightenment?

original: zhes pa ni sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems de las bla na med pa'i byang chub 'byung bas de ni byang chub 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems de las bla na med pa'i byang chub 'byung bas de ni byang chub 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The thought of enlightenment is the thought of the first stage, and since enlightenment arises from it, it is called the arising of enlightenment.

original: byang chub 'byung ba'i sems de skye ba'i mtshan nyid bsod nams chen po'i snying po nas nam mkha' @277a * //🔽bzhin du tshad med pa la sogs pa la dris pa la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub 'byung ba'i sems de skye ba'i mtshan nyid bsod nams chen po'i snying po nas nam mkha' @277a * // bzhin du tshad med pa la sogs pa la dris pa la bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of the arising of that thought of enlightenment is the great merit, which is like space, immeasurable, etc.🔽The knowledge of the thought is the best of all,

original: sems mkhyen pa ni rnams kyi mchog / dpa' chen ye shes las byung ba //
analyzed: sems mkhyen pa ni rnams kyi mchog / dpa' chen ye shes las byung ba //
translated: arising from the wisdom of the great hero.

original: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das la yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa ste bcom ldan 'das ni 'jig rten dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sems mkhyen pa'i mchog yin pa'i phyir dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de las byung bas na ye shes las byung ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das la yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa ste bcom ldan 'das ni 'jig rten dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sems mkhyen pa'i mchog yin pa'i phyir dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de las byung bas na ye shes las byung ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is praise of the Lord in terms of his qualities. The Lord is the supreme knower of the minds of mundane beings, of sravakas, and of pratyekabuddhas, and the enjoyment body arises from that knowledge of all things, hence it is said to arise from knowledge.

original: ji snyed cig las 'das nas ni //
analyzed: ji snyed cig las 'das nas ni //
translated: How many minds does he pass beyond

original: skye bar 'gyur ba bstan du gsol //
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur ba bstan du gsol //
translated: before he generates the Thought of Awakening?

original: zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i sems grangs du zhig 'das nas byang chub kyi sems de skye zhes dris pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i sems grangs du zhig 'das nas byang chub kyi sems de skye zhes dris pa ste /
translated: This asks, how many mundane minds does he pass beyond before he generates the Thought of Awakening?

original: sems brgya drug cu po las 'das nas skye ba la bya ste /
analyzed: sems brgya drug cu po las 'das nas skye ba la bya ste /
translated: It is to be understood that he passes beyond one hundred and sixty minds.

original: sems skyes zhes pa ma yin gyi skye ba tsam la bya'o //
analyzed: sems skyes zhes pa ma yin gyi skye ba tsam la bya'o //
translated: It is not that he generates a mind, but that he merely passes beyond it.

original: mgon pos sems kyi mtshan nyid dang // dus kyang rgya cher bshad du gsol //
analyzed: mgon pos sems kyi mtshan nyid dang // dus kyang rgya cher bshad du gsol //
translated: The Protector has explained the characteristics of the mind and the times in great detail.

original: zhes pa ni sems brgya drug cu po de dag gi mtshan nyid 'dod chags kyi sems dang / zhe sdang gi sems dang zhes pa la sogs pa dang / sems brgya drug cu po de dag las 'das nas kyang bskal pa la sogs pa ji srid cig na byang chub kyi sems de skye bar 'gyur zhes dus dris pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems brgya drug cu po de dag gi mtshan nyid 'dod chags kyi sems dang / zhe sdang gi sems dang zhes pa la sogs pa dang / sems brgya drug cu po de dag las 'das nas kyang bskal pa la sogs pa ji srid cig na byang chub kyi sems de skye bar 'gyur zhes dus dris pa'o //
translated: Having gone beyond those one hundred and sixty thoughts, after how long a time, such as an eon, will that thought of enlightenment arise?🔽What kind of merit will they have,🔽and what kind of conduct will they have?

original: de dag bsod nams ci 'dra dang // spyod pa ci 'drar 'gyur ba dang // zhes pa ni de lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems skyes pa de'i bsod nams ji lta bu dang / spyod pa ci 'dra ba zhig spyad pas na byang chub kyi sems de thob ces pa'o //🔽sems la sems kyi khyad par yang //
analyzed: de dag bsod nams ci 'dra dang // spyod pa ci 'drar 'gyur ba dang // zhes pa ni de lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems skyes pa de'i bsod nams ji lta bu dang / spyod pa ci 'dra ba zhig spyad pas na byang chub kyi sems de thob ces pa'o // sems la sems kyi khyad par yang //
translated: This is asking about the merit of one who has given rise to such a thought of enlightenment, and what kind of conduct, by practicing what, will one attain that thought of enlightenment.🔽Please teach, O Great Sage,

original: thub pa chen pos bstan du gsol //
analyzed: thub pa chen pos bstan du gsol //
translated: the difference of thoughts in the mind.

original: sems kyi rgyud de las byang @277b chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes chen po 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud de las byang @277b chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes chen po 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the great enlightenment and the knowledge of a Buddha come from that mind continuum.

original: legs so zhes pa ni de lta bu'i don bzang po dris pa nyid legs pa dang / phyag na rdo rje dga' ba skyed pa'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: legs so zhes pa ni de lta bu'i don bzang po dris pa nyid legs pa dang / phyag na rdo rje dga' ba skyed pa'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: Excellent is said in order to generate delight in Vajrapani, because he has asked about such an excellent meaning.

original: theg pa chen po'i go 'phang mchog / ces pa ni sems kyi rgyud de theg pa gsum gyi nang na mchog ste dam pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i go 'phang mchog / ces pa ni sems kyi rgyud de theg pa gsum gyi nang na mchog ste dam pa'o //
translated: The supreme stage of the Great Vehicle is that mind continuum, which is the best, the highest, among the three vehicles.

original: sems kyi rgyud kyi mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud kyi mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristic of the mind continuum🔽is to be connected with the supreme stage of the Great Vehicle.

original: zhes pa ni yon tan gyi khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pa'i sems kyi mtshan nyid bshad kyis nyon cig ces sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yon tan gyi khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pa'i sems kyi mtshan nyid bshad kyis nyon cig ces sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with the statement, Listen to the explanation of the characteristic of the mind that has such special qualities.

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi gsang ba'i mchog / ces pa ni de lta bu'i sems rnam par dag pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang mngon par byang chub pa'i rang bzhin de sems can phal cher gyi spyod yul ma yin pa dang / snod ma yin pa la mi bstan pa'i phyir gsang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi gsang ba'i mchog / ces pa ni de lta bu'i sems rnam par dag pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang mngon par byang chub pa'i rang bzhin de sems can phal cher gyi spyod yul ma yin pa dang / snod ma yin pa la mi bstan pa'i phyir gsang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: means that such a completely pure mind, which is the nature of omniscience and full enlightenment, is called “secret” because it is not the domain of most sentient beings and is not taught to those who are not suitable vessels.

original: rtog ge kun gyis mi shes pa //
analyzed: rtog ge kun gyis mi shes pa //
translated: It is not known by any reasoning.

original: zhes pa ni stong pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems de mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i rigs pa'i sgo nas ji lta ba bzhin du mi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni stong pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems de mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i rigs pa'i sgo nas ji lta ba bzhin du mi rtogs pa'o //
translated: This means that the mind, which has the characteristic of emptiness, is not realized as it is through the doors of the reasoning of direct perception and inference.

original: yid gcig bsdus la mnyen par gyis //
analyzed: yid gcig bsdus la mnyen par gyis //
translated: Gather your mind together and be gentle.

original: zhes pa ni ma yengs par nyon cig pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ma yengs par nyon cig pa'o //
translated: This means “listen without distraction.”

original: sems ni brgya rtsa drug cu las //
analyzed: sems ni brgya rtsa drug cu las //
translated: The mind arises from the one hundred and sixty.

original: 'das nas skye bar 'gyur zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: 'das nas skye bar 'gyur zhes sbyar te /
translated: This is connected with “after passing beyond.”

original: 'jig rten pa'i sems brgya drug cu las 'das nas chos la bdag med par rtogs te mos pas spyod pa'i sa la sems gsum rnam par bsgom pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rnam par spyod pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po rnam pa bzhi byas nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa las 'phar te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sems brgya drug cu las 'das nas chos la bdag med par rtogs te mos pas spyod pa'i sa la sems gsum rnam par bsgom pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rnam par spyod pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po rnam pa bzhi byas nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa las 'phar te /
translated: Having transcended the one hundred and sixty mundane thought states, one realizes the absence of self in phenomena and, on the level of earnest aspiration, one cultivates the three states of mind, engages in the transcendent perfections and, by means of the four ways of gathering disciples, one rises above the level of earnest aspiration.

original: sa rab tu dga' ba'i sems ye shes kyi sa la zhugs pa la bya ste /🔽ji snyed cig las 'das nas ni /
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba'i sems ye shes kyi sa la zhugs pa la bya ste / ji snyed cig las 'das nas ni /
translated: One enters the level of the utterly joyful one, the level of gnosis.

original: skye bar 'gyur zhes dris pa'i lan no //
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur zhes dris pa'i lan no //
translated: The answer to the question, “How many levels does one transcend?”

original: bsod nams ches zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams chen po'i rgyu las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ches zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams chen po'i rgyu las skyes pa'o //
translated: It is born from the cause of great merit, that is, the transcendent perfections and so forth.

original: snying po ni phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: snying po ni phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: Its essence is the unmistaken accomplishment,

original: dper na tsandan dang seng ldeng gi snying po ltar mchog dam pa la bya'o //
analyzed: dper na tsandan dang seng ldeng gi snying po ltar mchog dam pa la bya'o //
translated: like the heartwood of sandalwood or acacia, it is the most sublime.

original: byang chub nyid kyi phyir byang chub 'byung ba zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: byang chub nyid kyi phyir byang chub 'byung ba zhes sbyar te /
translated: It is enlightenment itself, so it is called the source of enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i phyir na byang chub kyi sems de las sems 'byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i phyir na byang chub kyi sems de las sems 'byung ba la bya'o //
translated: And because it is for the attainment of supreme enlightenment, it is the mind that is the source of the mind of enlightenment.

original: nam mkha' lta bur dpag med cing //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur dpag med cing //
translated: It is immeasurable like space.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de'i yon tan la sogs pa tshad bzung zhing dpag tu med pa'am rnam pa med pas 'di tsam mo zhes tshad gzung du med de nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de'i yon tan la sogs pa tshad bzung zhing dpag tu med pa'am rnam pa med pas 'di tsam mo zhes tshad gzung du med de nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la bya'o //
translated: This refers to the fact that the qualities of that mind of enlightenment and so forth are immeasurable and limitless, or are of a non-conceptual nature, and so cannot be measured by saying “it is this much.” It is like space.

original: gos pa med par ji bzhin gnas //
analyzed: gos pa med par ji bzhin gnas //
translated: It abides as it is, unstained.

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i sems nam mkha'i mtshan nyid la glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyis ma gos pa ste //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i sems nam mkha'i mtshan nyid la glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyis ma gos pa ste //
translated: That mind, which has the characteristics of space, is unstained by the habitual tendencies of adventitious afflictions.

original: @278a * // de ltar glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma'i dbang du ma gyur pas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: @278a * // de ltar glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma'i dbang du ma gyur pas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa la bya'o //
translated: As such, it is unstained by the characteristics of adventitious afflictions, and so it abides as the nature of utter purity.

original: chos kun gyis ni mi bsgul te //
analyzed: chos kun gyis ni mi bsgul te //
translated: It is unshaken by any phenomena.

original: dpag med ye shes kyis bsgrubs pa //
analyzed: dpag med ye shes kyis bsgrubs pa //
translated: It is accomplished by immeasurable wisdom.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de tshad med pa'i ye shes las byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de tshad med pa'i ye shes las byung ba la bya'o //
translated: This refers to the bodhisattva spirit that arises from immeasurable intuition.

original: yang dag rdzogs sangs rgyas ston pa //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs sangs rgyas ston pa //
translated: The teaching of the perfect Buddha

original: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la mchod pa byas pa dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa spyad pa las byung ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la mchod pa byas pa dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa spyad pa las byung ste /
translated: This refers to the bodhisattva spirit that arises from worship of the Buddha and bodhisattvas and from practice of the stages and transcendences.

original: de'i spyod pa ci 'drar 'gyur ba dang zhes dris pa'i lan no //
analyzed: de'i spyod pa ci 'drar 'gyur ba dang zhes dris pa'i lan no //
translated: This is the reply to the question, What will be the nature of his practice?

original: byang chub phyir ni dang por 'dod //
analyzed: byang chub phyir ni dang por 'dod //
translated: First, for the sake of enlightenment,

original: ces pa ni sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems la bya ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems la bya ste /
translated: This refers to the bodhisattva spirit of the first stage.

original: de rnams ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyu dang rang bzhin bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyu dang rang bzhin bshad pa'o //
translated: These explain the cause and nature of the bodhisattva spirit.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de la /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de la /
translated: Lord of Mysteries, as for the bodhisattva spirit of the second stage,

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas //
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas //
translated: Since beginningless cyclic existence,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams //
translated: foolish ordinary beings

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: 'jig pas stong nyid shes par bya //
analyzed: 'jig pas stong nyid shes par bya //
translated: should know emptiness through destruction.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu bshad pa yin te rgyu de yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu bshad pa yin te rgyu de yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The above passage explains the cause of Bhagavat Vairocana. That cause is twofold.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i sems brgya drug cu la sogs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i sems brgya drug cu la sogs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Among them, the one hundred and sixty mundane minds, etc. are the substantial cause of Vairocana.

original: gzhan sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gzhan sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The other, the stages and perfections, are the cooperative cause.

original: de lta bas na so so'i skye bo la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de lta bas na so so'i skye bo la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Thus, there are also two kinds of ordinary beings:

original: 'jig rten pa'i gzhung lugs shes pa dang mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i gzhung lugs shes pa dang mi shes pa'o //
translated: those who know and those who do not know the mundane treatises.

original: de la byis pa ni ngan par smra ba dang / ngan par byed pa dang ; ngan par sems pa ste /
analyzed: de la byis pa ni ngan par smra ba dang / ngan par byed pa dang ; ngan par sems pa ste /
translated: Among them, the childish are those who speak, act, and think badly.

original: de dag ni rang gi gzhung lugs kyang mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi gzhung lugs kyang mi shes pa'o //
translated: They do not even know their own treatises.

original: de las gzhan pa ni rang rang gi gzhung lugs shes pa 'phags pa'i lam thob pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni rang rang gi gzhung lugs shes pa 'phags pa'i lam thob pa la bya ste /
translated: Those other than that are those who know their own treatises, who have attained the noble path.

original: de dag 'khor ba na sdug bsngal gsum gyis gdungs nas gdungs pa de las thar pa'i phyir bdag dang bdag gir brtags pa de dag la brten nas sbyin pa la sogs pa byas te thar bar re ba'o //
analyzed: de dag 'khor ba na sdug bsngal gsum gyis gdungs nas gdungs pa de las thar pa'i phyir bdag dang bdag gir brtags pa de dag la brten nas sbyin pa la sogs pa byas te thar bar re ba'o //
translated: Since they are tormented by the three sufferings in samsara, in order to be liberated from that torment, they hope to attain liberation by means of generosity and so forth based on the self and entities connected to the self that are imputed.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba la mngon par chags nas bdag tu 'dzin pa grangs med pa la rtog pa de dag kyang bdag ces pa'i rang bzhin ci 'dra ba ma dpyad par chags pa skye ba ni rang rang gi gzhung lugs mi shes pa'i byis pa rnams so
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba la mngon par chags nas bdag tu 'dzin pa grangs med pa la rtog pa de dag kyang bdag ces pa'i rang bzhin ci 'dra ba ma dpyad par chags pa skye ba ni rang rang gi gzhung lugs mi shes pa'i byis pa rnams so
translated: Those who, through attachment to the self and entities connected to the self, conceive of innumerable selves are childish beings who do not understand their own textual systems.

original: // rang rang gi gzhung lugs shes pa de rnams kyang so so'i bdag tu brtags pa de la brten pa ni gzhan dag ni dus las byung ba dang zhes pa nas brjod par bya ba dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin par rtog ste zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: // rang rang gi gzhung lugs shes pa de rnams kyang so so'i bdag tu brtags pa de la brten pa ni gzhan dag ni dus las byung ba dang zhes pa nas brjod par bya ba dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin par rtog ste zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Those who understand their own textual systems are based on the imputation of individual selves. Others conceive of the self as arising from time, and so forth, up to the conception of the self as inexpressible.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi so so'i bdag tu brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi so so'i bdag tu brtags pa ste /
translated: These are the individual imputations of the self by worldly beings.

original: ji skad du smos pa'i bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo de dag gi sa bdag cag 'gro ba rnams bskyed de //
analyzed: ji skad du smos pa'i bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo de dag gi sa bdag cag 'gro ba rnams bskyed de //
translated: The self and the nature of the self as mentioned above generate us, the transmigrators.

original: @278b de dag nyid kyis 'jig par yang byed par rtog go //
analyzed: @278b de dag nyid kyis 'jig par yang byed par rtog go //
translated: They also imagine that they are destroyed by those very [selves].

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po bdag gi khyad par de lta bu la sogs pa zhes pa ni gong du smos pa'i bdag gi dngos po rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po bdag gi khyad par de lta bu la sogs pa zhes pa ni gong du smos pa'i bdag gi dngos po rnams la bya'o //
translated: The Lord of Secrets said, The distinctions of the self such as these refers to the entities of the self mentioned above.

original: thar pa 'dod pas zhes pa de lta bur bdag tu brtags pa nyid la brten nas thar ba re ba'o //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pas zhes pa de lta bur bdag tu brtags pa nyid la brten nas thar ba re ba'o //
translated: Those who desire liberation means that based on just such an imputation of a self, they hope for liberation.

original: rnal 'byor 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor bdag gis zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i tshul du lus ngag yid gsum yul la 'jug pa las 'gog pa dang / dngos po gang la dmigs pa de la sems rtse gcig tu dmigs pa 'dzag pa ni rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor bdag gis zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i tshul du lus ngag yid gsum yul la 'jug pa las 'gog pa dang / dngos po gang la dmigs pa de la sems rtse gcig tu dmigs pa 'dzag pa ni rnal 'byor te /
translated: The line the self who desires yoga means that the yogi, in the manner of the world, stops the engagement of body, speech, and mind in objects and focuses the mind one-pointedly on whatever entity is observed. This is yoga.

original: lus ngag yid gsum yul la mi 'jug par 'gog pa'i rnal 'byor 'dod pa rnams kyis de lta bu'i bdag rnams rab tu rtog pa la bya'o //
analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum yul la mi 'jug par 'gog pa'i rnal 'byor 'dod pa rnams kyis de lta bu'i bdag rnams rab tu rtog pa la bya'o //
translated: Those who desire the yoga of cessation, in which body, speech, and mind do not engage objects, should imagine such a self.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo phyugs dang mtshungs pa rnams zhes pa ni rang gi gzhung lugs mi shes pa la bya ste /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo phyugs dang mtshungs pa rnams zhes pa ni rang gi gzhung lugs mi shes pa la bya ste /
translated: “Foolish ordinary people, who are like cattle” refers to those who do not know their own system.

original: byugs dang mtshungs pa zhes pa ni ngan par smra ba dang / ngan par sems pa dang / ngan par byed pa'i dpe ste phyugs ni za pa dang / g-yem pa dang 'jigs pa las bsam pa gzhan med de /
analyzed: byugs dang mtshungs pa zhes pa ni ngan par smra ba dang / ngan par sems pa dang / ngan par byed pa'i dpe ste phyugs ni za pa dang / g-yem pa dang 'jigs pa las bsam pa gzhan med de /
