translated: “Like cattle” is an example of bad speech, bad thought, and bad action. Cattle have no thoughts other than eating, copulating, and fearing.

original: byis pa rnams kyang de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas phyugs dang mtshungs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyang de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas phyugs dang mtshungs zhes pa'o //
translated: Since foolish people have characteristics like that, they are like cattle.

original: brgya lam na res 'ga' zhig la zhes pa de lta bu'i byis pa phyugs dang mtshungs pa 'khor ba na 'khyams pa na chos kyi 'du shes 'byung ba ni dkon pa'i mchog ste /
analyzed: brgya lam na res 'ga' zhig la zhes pa de lta bu'i byis pa phyugs dang mtshungs pa 'khor ba na 'khyams pa na chos kyi 'du shes 'byung ba ni dkon pa'i mchog ste /
translated: “Sometimes, after a hundred eons” means that for such foolish people, who are like cattle, wandering in cyclic existence, the perception of the Dharma is a rare jewel.

original: chos kyi 'du shes skye ba yang smyung bar gnas nas bsod nams su 'gyur ba la bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi 'du shes skye ba yang smyung bar gnas nas bsod nams su 'gyur ba la bya ste /
translated: The arising of the idea of Dharma is also to be taken as the merit of fasting.

original: smyung bar gnas pa de tsam gyis sems mgu ste smyung bar gnas pa nyid la yang du dus dus su sgom par byed de /
analyzed: smyung bar gnas pa de tsam gyis sems mgu ste smyung bar gnas pa nyid la yang du dus dus su sgom par byed de /
translated: The mind is pleased with just that fasting, and from time to time one meditates on fasting itself.

original: de bas na smyung bar gnas pa la gnas par bya'o zhes de tsam zhig sems la byas nas mgu ba bskyed cing phyi phyir de nyid la goms par byed de zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na smyung bar gnas pa la gnas par bya'o zhes de tsam zhig sems la byas nas mgu ba bskyed cing phyi phyir de nyid la goms par byed de zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, one should abide in fasting. Having done just that much, one should generate satisfaction and repeatedly cultivate that.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de ni dge ba'i las skye ba'i sa bon lta bu ste /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de ni dge ba'i las skye ba'i sa bon lta bu ste /
translated: Lord of Secrets, that is like the seed of the arising of virtuous karma.

original: sems dang po'i zhes pa ni sems bdun pa'i tshe tshul khrims bsrungs pa'i dge ba 'byung ba'i sa bon du gyur pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang po'i zhes pa ni sems bdun pa'i tshe tshul khrims bsrungs pa'i dge ba 'byung ba'i sa bon du gyur pa la bya'o //
translated: The first mind is to be taken as the seed of the arising of the virtue of guarding morality at the time of the seventh mind.

original: de la 'ga' zhig smyung bar gnas pa ni brtul zhugs kyi mtshan nyid de nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gcig yin na ji ltar dge ba'i sa bon du 'gyur snyam du dogs pa skye ba la /
analyzed: de la 'ga' zhig smyung bar gnas pa ni brtul zhugs kyi mtshan nyid de nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gcig yin na ji ltar dge ba'i sa bon du 'gyur snyam du dogs pa skye ba la /
translated: Some think that fasting is the definition of austerity, and if it is one part of affliction, how could it be a seed of virtue?

original: dogs pa bsal ba ni smyung bar byas pa'i 'og tu mchod pa dang sbyin pa'i sems 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: dogs pa bsal ba ni smyung bar byas pa'i 'og tu mchod pa dang sbyin pa'i sems 'byung ba ste /
translated: The removal of that doubt is the arising of the thought of offering and giving after fasting.

original: smyung ba de ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed pas nyes pa med do //🔽sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag kyang zag pa dang bcas @279a * //
analyzed: smyung ba de ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed pas nyes pa med do // sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag kyang zag pa dang bcas @279a * //
translated: Since fasting is the immediate condition of virtue such as giving, there is no fault.

original: pa'i dge ba la bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i dge ba la bya'o //
translated: Those such as giving are to be taken as contaminated virtue.

original: de'i rgyu nyid kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed de zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu nyid kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed de zhes sbyar te /
translated: One gives gifts due to that cause.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i nyi ma zhes pa smyung bar byad pa de nyid la goms par byed pa'i rgyus zla ba dang skar ma dang nyi ma la sogs pa bzang po'i nyin par pha ma la sogs pa'i gnyen rnams la sbyin par byed pa ni tshul khrims
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i nyi ma zhes pa smyung bar byad pa de nyid la goms par byed pa'i rgyus zla ba dang skar ma dang nyi ma la sogs pa bzang po'i nyin par pha ma la sogs pa'i gnyen rnams la sbyin par byed pa ni tshul khrims
translated: The “sun with signs” is the day of fasting. The “moon, stars, and sun” are the good days. The “relatives” are the parents and so on. The “giving” is the giving to them. This is the morality.

original: bsrungs ba'i dge ba las 'byung ba'i myu gur blta'o //
analyzed: bsrungs ba'i dge ba las 'byung ba'i myu gur blta'o //
translated: The “sprout” is the virtue that arises from the observance of morality.

original: de nas gzhan yang sbyin pa de nyid mi shes pa dag la yang sbyin par byed ces pa ni sbyin pa ste ma la goms pa'i mthus gnyen ma yin pa gzhan la yang sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang sbyin pa de nyid mi shes pa dag la yang sbyin par byed ces pa ni sbyin pa ste ma la goms pa'i mthus gnyen ma yin pa gzhan la yang sbyin pa ste /
translated: “Then, moreover, giving to those who do not know” is giving to those who are not one’s relatives. The “strength of familiarity” is the strength of familiarity with giving to one’s relatives. The “giving to others” is giving to those who are not one’s relatives.

original: de yang dge ba bcu'i las 'byung ba'i sdong bu lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: de yang dge ba bcu'i las 'byung ba'i sdong bu lta bur blta'o //
translated: The “trunk” is the virtue that arises from the ten virtues.

original: de nas gzhan yang sbyin pa de nyid snod du dung ba yongs su tshol zhing par byed de zhes pa ni pa dang ma dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon dang bram ze rig byed bzhi pa rdzogs par shes pa la sbyin na de dag ni sbyin gnas te /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang sbyin pa de nyid snod du dung ba yongs su tshol zhing par byed de zhes pa ni pa dang ma dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon dang bram ze rig byed bzhi pa rdzogs par shes pa la sbyin na de dag ni sbyin gnas te /
translated: Furthermore, he gives to those who are worthy recipients, those who are his father, mother, preceptor, teacher, or brahmin who has completed the four Vedas.

original: bsod nams mtha' med par 'gyur bas sbyin pa'i snos do snyam nas sbyin par byed pa de yang dge ba'i las 'byung ba'i rgyu ste lo ma lta bur blta'o //🔽de nas gzhan yang sbyin pa de nyid bla ma'am rol mo mkhan dag la dga' bzhin du sbyin par byed de zhes pa ni sbyin pa de ni snga ma las rgya che ste /
analyzed: bsod nams mtha' med par 'gyur bas sbyin pa'i snos do snyam nas sbyin par byed pa de yang dge ba'i las 'byung ba'i rgyu ste lo ma lta bur blta'o // de nas gzhan yang sbyin pa de nyid bla ma'am rol mo mkhan dag la dga' bzhin du sbyin par byed de zhes pa ni sbyin pa de ni snga ma las rgya che ste /
translated: He gives to them, thinking that they are worthy recipients of his giving, since his merit will be limitless. This is the cause of the arising of virtuous karma, which should be regarded as being like leaves.🔽Furthermore, he gives that very giving to gurus or musicians with a happy mind.

original: snod la yang mi rtog par bla ma dang rol mo mkhan la sogs pa la sems dga' bar sbyin pas dngos po la ma chags par sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: snod la yang mi rtog par bla ma dang rol mo mkhan la sogs pa la sems dga' bar sbyin pas dngos po la ma chags par sbyin pa ste /
translated: This giving is greater than the previous one, since he gives to gurus, musicians, and so on with a happy mind, without investigating whether they are worthy recipients. This is giving without attachment to things.

original: de yang dge ba'i las 'byung ba'i rgyu ste me tog lta bur blta'o //🔽de nas gzhan yang sbyin pa de nyid yid dga' ba dag la sbyin par byed de zhes pa ni zas 'dod pa la zas /
analyzed: de yang dge ba'i las 'byung ba'i rgyu ste me tog lta bur blta'o // de nas gzhan yang sbyin pa de nyid yid dga' ba dag la sbyin par byed de zhes pa ni zas 'dod pa la zas /
translated: Furthermore, it should be seen as the cause of the arising of virtuous karma, like a flower.🔽Then, furthermore, one should give that very generosity to those who are delighted in mind.

original: gos 'dod pa la gos la sogs pa ci 'dod pa rnams sbyin pa la bya ste ;
analyzed: gos 'dod pa la gos la sogs pa ci 'dod pa rnams sbyin pa la bya ste ;
translated: This refers to giving food to those who desire food, clothing to those who desire clothing, and so forth, whatever they desire.

original: / de yang dge ba'i las 'byung ba'i 'bras bur blta'o //
analyzed: / de yang dge ba'i las 'byung ba'i 'bras bur blta'o //
translated: Furthermore, it should be seen as the result of the arising of virtuous karma.

original: de nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po //
analyzed: de nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po //
translated: Then, the Lord of Secrets,

original: gzhan yang mtho ris su skye bar bya ba'i phyir tshul khrims bsrung ste zhes pa ni de lta bu'i sbyin pa rnams byas nas lus kyi las gsum dang / ngag gi las bzhi dang / yid kyi las gsum gyi sgo nas mi dge ba 'byung ba spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul khrims bsrungs nas de'i 'bras bu mngon par mtho ba'i mtshan nyid lha la sogs pa'i longs spyod mtho ris su skye ba'i phyir te longs spyod de nyid ga sos su 'gyur
analyzed: gzhan yang mtho ris su skye bar bya ba'i phyir tshul khrims bsrung ste zhes pa ni de lta bu'i sbyin pa rnams byas nas lus kyi las gsum dang / ngag gi las bzhi dang / yid kyi las gsum gyi sgo nas mi dge ba 'byung ba spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul khrims bsrungs nas de'i 'bras bu mngon par mtho ba'i mtshan nyid lha la sogs pa'i longs spyod mtho ris su skye ba'i phyir te longs spyod de nyid ga sos su 'gyur
translated: Furthermore, it is said that one should observe discipline in order to be reborn in the higher realms. Having practiced generosity in this way, one observes discipline, which is defined as the avoidance of negative actions, in terms of the three physical actions, the four verbal actions and the three mental actions. The result of this is rebirth in the higher realms, in the celestial and other abodes, which is defined as a state of high rebirth.🔽🔽

original: ba la bya'o //
analyzed: ba la bya'o //
translated: Furthermore, “in order to be born in the higher realms, one should guard morality” means that after making such gifts, one should guard morality, which is characterized by abandoning the occurrence of non-virtue through the three physical actions, the four verbal actions, and the three mental actions, and then be born in the higher realms, which is characterized by the result of that, namely, the enjoyment of gods and so on, which is the exalted state.

original: de nas yang gsang ba pa'i bdag po //
analyzed: de nas yang gsang ba pa'i bdag po //
translated: Then again, Guhyapati

original: gzhan yang sems de lta bu nyid @279b kyis 'khor bar rgyu ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la la zhig las tshig 'di skad thos te zhes pa de lta bur sbyin pa byed cing tshul khrims bsrung ba la mkhan po 'jig rten pa'i gzhung lugs shes pa 'ga'
analyzed: gzhan yang sems de lta bu nyid @279b kyis 'khor bar rgyu ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la la zhig las tshig 'di skad thos te zhes pa de lta bur sbyin pa byed cing tshul khrims bsrung ba la mkhan po 'jig rten pa'i gzhung lugs shes pa 'ga'
translated: “Furthermore, one who wanders in cyclic existence with such a mind hears these words from a certain spiritual friend” means that after making gifts in that way and guarding morality, one should listen to the words of a certain spiritual friend who knows the worldly scriptural systems.

original: zhig gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen byas te /
analyzed: zhig gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen byas te /
translated: One of them acted as a spiritual friend

original: rang gi ston pa'i lha la brten du bcug pa ste //
analyzed: rang gi ston pa'i lha la brten du bcug pa ste //
translated: and made him rely on his own teacher, the god.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen des kyang lha rnams kyi rang bzhin bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen des kyang lha rnams kyi rang bzhin bstan pa ni /
translated: That spiritual friend taught the nature of the gods:

original: lha 'di dag ni lha chen te //
analyzed: lha 'di dag ni lha chen te //
translated: These gods are great gods,

original: thams cad la ni bde ba ster //
analyzed: thams cad la ni bde ba ster //
translated: who bestow happiness on all.🔽If you worship them with devotion,

original: de la khyod kyis gus mchod dang // thams cad grub pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: de la khyod kyis gus mchod dang // thams cad grub pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: all your wishes will be fulfilled.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: And so on up to:🔽Similarly, the gods and supreme sages

original: de bzhin lha dang drang srong mchog / rig byed rig byed skyes bu yin //🔽zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin lha dang drang srong mchog / rig byed rig byed skyes bu yin // zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: are the ones who know the Vedas.

original: mkhas pa'i mchod pa gyis shig ces //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i mchod pa gyis shig ces //
translated: Make offerings to the wise!

original: zhes pa ni de ltar gong du ming gis smos pa'i lha de rnams gang la dad pa la ston pa dang mchod pa'i gnas su byas na lha de rnams kyis bde ba ster ba dang bsam pa thams cad 'grub bar byed do zhes bsten pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar gong du ming gis smos pa'i lha de rnams gang la dad pa la ston pa dang mchod pa'i gnas su byas na lha de rnams kyis bde ba ster ba dang bsam pa thams cad 'grub bar byed do zhes bsten pa'o //
translated: This passage teaches that if you make those gods mentioned above the object of your faith and worship, those gods will bestow happiness on you and fulfill all your wishes.

original: de las de 'dra'i tshig thos nas //
analyzed: de las de 'dra'i tshig thos nas //
translated: Having heard such words as these,

original: yid ni yang dag mgu gyur te //
analyzed: yid ni yang dag mgu gyur te //
translated: your mind will be truly delighted.

original: de'i che rab tu gus ldan pas //
analyzed: de'i che rab tu gus ldan pas //
translated: With great devotion

original: de dag la ni nan tan byed //
analyzed: de dag la ni nan tan byed //
translated: they practice them.

original: ces pa ni de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis lha rnams bstan pa thos nas byis pa de la yid mgu ba skyes te /
analyzed: ces pa ni de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis lha rnams bstan pa thos nas byis pa de la yid mgu ba skyes te /
translated: Having heard the teachings of the spiritual friends about the gods, the child gives rise to a delighted mind.

original: de nas lha de dag la brten pa dang mchod pa nan tan byed cing lha de rnams la rab tu dad pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de nas lha de dag la brten pa dang mchod pa nan tan byed cing lha de rnams la rab tu dad pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Then, relying on and making offerings to those gods, he practices them and becomes endowed with faith in those gods.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po 'di ni byis pa so so'i skye bo 'khor ba ni kun du 'khyams pa rnams kyi dbugs phyin pa'i mchog yin te /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po 'di ni byis pa so so'i skye bo 'khor ba ni kun du 'khyams pa rnams kyi dbugs phyin pa'i mchog yin te /
translated: Lord of Secrets, this is the supreme relief for childish ordinary beings who wander in saṃsāra.🔽This is the strength, explained by the victors as the eighth mind.

original: 'di ni stobs su gyur pa ste sems brgyad par rgyal ba rnams kyis bshad do zhes pa ni de lta bu'i byis pa so so'i skye bo tha dad pa rnams 'khor ba nas skyabs dang mgon med par 'khyams pa las dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis skyabs dang
analyzed: 'di ni stobs su gyur pa ste sems brgyad par rgyal ba rnams kyis bshad do zhes pa ni de lta bu'i byis pa so so'i skye bo tha dad pa rnams 'khor ba nas skyabs dang mgon med par 'khyams pa las dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis skyabs dang
translated: Thus, childish ordinary beings, who are different, wander in saṃsāra without refuge or protector.

original: mgon de dag bstan pas byis pa de rnams kyis skyabs dang mgon rnyed de dbugs phyin pa ni brtan por gyur pas dge ba'i stobs su gyur pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mgon de dag bstan pas byis pa de rnams kyis skyabs dang mgon rnyed de dbugs phyin pa ni brtan por gyur pas dge ba'i stobs su gyur pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The children who have found refuge and protection through the teachings of those protectors, and who have found relief, are those who have become stable and have become powerful in virtue.

original: de nas gsang ba'i bdag po gzhan yang khyad par rtogs pa ji skad du yongs su grags pa'i khyad par de dang de dag la khyad par du gnas pa rnams la 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi don du blo skye shing de yang yod do zhes stong pa nyid
analyzed: de nas gsang ba'i bdag po gzhan yang khyad par rtogs pa ji skad du yongs su grags pa'i khyad par de dang de dag la khyad par du gnas pa rnams la 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi don du blo skye shing de yang yod do zhes stong pa nyid
translated: Then, the Lord of Secrets, having understood the distinctions as they are well known, and having understood the distinctions in those distinctions, and having understood the meaning of the sole reality, and having understood that it exists,🔽thinks of emptiness

original: kho na la dngos por sems te /🔽sngar bdag @280a * //
analyzed: kho na la dngos por sems te / sngar bdag @280a * //
translated: as an entity.🔽Previously, having understood the nature of the self

original: gi ngo bo smos pa rnams dang ston pa'i lha rnams kyi rang bzhin ji skad smos pa bzhin du shes nas bdag tu brtags pa dang lta de rnams la brten te /
analyzed: gi ngo bo smos pa rnams dang ston pa'i lha rnams kyi rang bzhin ji skad smos pa bzhin du shes nas bdag tu brtags pa dang lta de rnams la brten te /
translated: and the nature of the teacher deities as described, the self is imagined based on those views.

original: lha de rnams kyis bstan pa'i gzhung gis las dang nyon mongs pa spangs nas dag pa'i bdag tu rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: lha de rnams kyis bstan pa'i gzhung gis las dang nyon mongs pa spangs nas dag pa'i bdag tu rtog pa yin te /
translated: Having abandoned karma and afflictions through the scriptures taught by those deities, the pure self is imagined.

original: dag pa de yang stong pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin no snyam pa'i blo skye ba ste /
analyzed: dag pa de yang stong pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin no snyam pa'i blo skye ba ste /
translated: Purity is also nirvana, which is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid la bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong bar byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi bdag ces pa'i dngos po nyungs 'bru tsam mam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong bar byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi bdag ces pa'i dngos po nyungs 'bru tsam mam /
translated: They imagine that emptiness has a nature that experiences pleasure and pain, and that it is a thing the size of a mustard seed or a strand of hair.

original: spu'i nyag ma la sogs pa tsam du yod par rtog ste de dag ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis bdag dang lha rnams la brten nas rang gi rnam par grol ba tshol ba ste /
analyzed: spu'i nyag ma la sogs pa tsam du yod par rtog ste de dag ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis bdag dang lha rnams la brten nas rang gi rnam par grol ba tshol ba ste /
translated: They seek their own liberation in dependence on the self and the gods.

original: rnam par grol bar tshol ba'i bde ba de yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi brgyud pa'i rgyur blta'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol bar tshol ba'i bde ba de yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi brgyud pa'i rgyur blta'o //
translated: The bliss that they seek as liberation should be regarded as the cause of the lineage of the Bhagavat Vairocana.

original: dbang phyug chen po dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha de rnams kyang spyir sems can rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha de rnams kyang spyir sems can rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those gods such as Maheśvara and Brahmā are generally of two types:

original: las las skyes pa dang / ye shes kyi sems can no //
analyzed: las las skyes pa dang / ye shes kyi sems can no //
translated: sentient beings born from karma and sentient beings born from wisdom.

original: de la skabs 'dir ni lha de rnams kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo 'khyams pa rnams la so so'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ston pa ste /
analyzed: de la skabs 'dir ni lha de rnams kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo 'khyams pa rnams la so so'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ston pa ste /
translated: In this context, those gods also teach the path of their own nirvāṇa to the wandering ordinary beings.

original: lam de ston pa yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis mkhyen nas thob pa'i rgyur sbyor ba yin pas dbang po dang brgya byin la sogs pa'i lha de rnams bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku las sprul pa'i ye shes kyi sems can du
analyzed: lam de ston pa yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis mkhyen nas thob pa'i rgyur sbyor ba yin pas dbang po dang brgya byin la sogs pa'i lha de rnams bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku las sprul pa'i ye shes kyi sems can du
translated: And since they teach that path, those gods such as Indra and Śakra are to be seen as sentient beings who are emanations of the gnosis of the Bhagavat Vairocana, who is the cause of their attainment.

original: blta'o // gsang ba ba'i bdag po //🔽de dag gis ni stong pa nyid rab tu mi shes so zhes pa ni stong pa nyid la 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba'i bdag gi ngo bor brtags pas stong par mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: blta'o // gsang ba ba'i bdag po // de dag gis ni stong pa nyid rab tu mi shes so zhes pa ni stong pa nyid la 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba'i bdag gi ngo bor brtags pas stong par mi 'gyur te ;
translated: O Lord of Secrets,🔽they do not understand emptiness.🔽This means that the mere emptiness called “self-existence” is not emptiness,

original: / ji tsam du dngos por brtags pa de tsam du yod pa'i mtha' 'dzin pas stong pa nyid shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: / ji tsam du dngos por brtags pa de tsam du yod pa'i mtha' 'dzin pas stong pa nyid shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: because to the extent that one conceives of things, one grasps at the extreme of existence, and thus does not understand emptiness.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid ni dngos po can yang ma yin /
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid ni dngos po can yang ma yin /
translated: Therefore, emptiness is not a thing,

original: dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
translated: nor is it a non-thing.

original: yod pa yang ma yin pa yang ma yin gnyis ka yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin pa yang ma yin gnyis ka yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not existent, nor is it nonexistent, nor is it both,

original: de la rtog pa'am mi rtog pa yang med na de la ji ltar stong pa zhes btags par bya zhes stong pa'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rtog pa'am mi rtog pa yang med na de la ji ltar stong pa zhes btags par bya zhes stong pa'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and if it is neither imagined nor not imagined, how can it be called “emptiness”?

original: de la dngos po yang ma yin zhes pa ni byis pa rnams kyis ji ltar bdag tu brtags pa'i dngos po ma yin pa'o //🔽dngos po med pa yang ma yin zhes pa ni de lta bu yod @280b pa'i dngos po spangs pa'i gzhan zhig kyang ma yin pa'o //🔽yod pa yang ma yin zhes pa ni stong pa nyid la de lta bu'i dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: de la dngos po yang ma yin zhes pa ni byis pa rnams kyis ji ltar bdag tu brtags pa'i dngos po ma yin pa'o // dngos po med pa yang ma yin zhes pa ni de lta bu yod @280b pa'i dngos po spangs pa'i gzhan zhig kyang ma yin pa'o // yod pa yang ma yin zhes pa ni stong pa nyid la de lta bu'i dngos po med pa'o //
translated: In this passage, the meaning of “it is not a thing” is that it is not a thing as imagined by the childish.🔽The meaning of “it is not a non-thing” is that it is not something else that is the negation of such an existent thing.🔽The meaning of “it is not existent” is that emptiness is not such a thing.

original: med pa yang ma yin zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du med pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du med pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of “it is not nonexistent” is that it is not the case that emptiness does not exist.

original: gnyis ka yang ma yin zhes pa ni yod med gnyis las gzhan na yang med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang ma yin zhes pa ni yod med gnyis las gzhan na yang med pa'o //
translated: “Neither both nor not both” means that it does not exist apart from both existence and nonexistence.

original: de la rtog pa'am mi rtog pa yang med na /
analyzed: de la rtog pa'am mi rtog pa yang med na /
translated: If it is neither imagined nor not imagined,🔽how can it be designated as “emptiness”?

original: de la ji ltar stong pa zhes btags par bya zhes pa ni de ltar yod pa dang med pa ma yin pas stong pa nyid la dngos por gdag  tu med ces pa'o //
analyzed: de la ji ltar stong pa zhes btags par bya zhes pa ni de ltar yod pa dang med pa ma yin pas stong pa nyid la dngos por gdag  tu med ces pa'o //
translated: Since it is neither existent nor nonexistent, emptiness cannot be designated as a thing.

original: don 'di nyid tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: don 'di nyid tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa /
translated: This point is stated in verse:

original: gang dag stong nyid mi shes pa //
analyzed: gang dag stong nyid mi shes pa //
translated: Those who do not understand emptiness

original: de dag mya ngan 'das mi shes ;
analyzed: de dag mya ngan 'das mi shes ;
translated: do not understand nirvana.

original: / de phyir dngos dang dngos med pa //
analyzed: / de phyir dngos dang dngos med pa //
translated: Therefore, through the destruction of things and nonthings,

original: 'jig pas stong nyid shes par bya //🔽zhes pa ste /🔽gang dag stong nyid mi shes pa //
analyzed: 'jig pas stong nyid shes par bya // zhes pa ste / gang dag stong nyid mi shes pa //
translated: emptiness should be understood.🔽Those who do not understand emptiness

original: zhes pa ni stong pa nyid la dngos por brtags pa na stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin phyin ci ma log par mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni stong pa nyid la dngos por brtags pa na stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin phyin ci ma log par mi shes pa ste /
translated: Those who imagine emptiness as a thing do not understand the nature of emptiness without error.

original: de dag gis ni chos kyi dbyings zhi ba mya ngan las 'das pa rnams kyang shes par mi nus pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis ni chos kyi dbyings zhi ba mya ngan las 'das pa rnams kyang shes par mi nus pa la bya'o //
translated: This means that they are unable to know even the peaceful realm of reality, nirvana.

original: stong pa nyid ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is emptiness to be known?

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pas bsdus pa'i dngos po dang bral bas shes par nus te /🔽de bas na dngos dang dngos med pa /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pas bsdus pa'i dngos po dang bral bas shes par nus te / de bas na dngos dang dngos med pa /
translated: It is to be known by being free from entities that are included in entities and non-entities.🔽Therefore, it is said,

original: 'jig pas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “By the destruction of entities and non-entities.”

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rje sa gsol ba btab pa /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rje sa gsol ba btab pa /
translated: Then again, Vajrapani requested the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das sems kyi khyad par de dag bshad du gsol zhes pa ni sngar sems kyi khyad par brgya drug cu las 'das nas byang chub kyi sems skye'o zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems kyi khyad par de dag bshad du gsol zhes pa ni sngar sems kyi khyad par brgya drug cu las 'das nas byang chub kyi sems skye'o zhes gsungs na /
translated: “Blessed One, please explain those distinctions of mind.” This means that after surpassing the one hundred and sixty distinctions of mind, the mind of awakening arises.

original: sems kyi khyad par de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin pa bshad du gsol zhes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi khyad par de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin pa bshad du gsol zhes pa la bya'o //
translated: Please explain the characteristics of those distinctions of mind.

original: de skad ces gsol pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa zhes pa nas /
translated: Having made this request,

original: nyon cig ces pa'i bar du gsol ba'i len bshad par gnang ba'o //
analyzed: nyon cig ces pa'i bar du gsol ba'i len bshad par gnang ba'o //
translated: The reply to the request is the explanation.

original: de dag bshad pa yang gsang pa'i bshad po //
analyzed: de dag bshad pa yang gsang pa'i bshad po //
translated: The explanation of those is the secret explanation.

original: de la sems ni 'dod chags kyi sems dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems dang zhes pa nas bu ga lta bu'i sems dang skye bar gyur pa'i sems so zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: de la sems ni 'dod chags kyi sems dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems dang zhes pa nas bu ga lta bu'i sems dang skye bar gyur pa'i sems so zhes pa'i bar ro //
translated: Among those, mind is from the mind of desire to the mind of freedom from desire, and so on, up to the mind like a hole and the mind that has arisen.

original: sems de rnams bshad pa yang ming dang / mtshan nyid dang spong ba dang lam gyi sgo nas bshad par shes par bya la /
analyzed: sems de rnams bshad pa yang ming dang / mtshan nyid dang spong ba dang lam gyi sgo nas bshad par shes par bya la /
translated: Those minds should be understood to be explained by means of name, definition, abandonment, and the path.

original: sems de rnams kyi rang bzhin yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sems de rnams kyi rang bzhin yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The nature of those minds is also fourfold.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang // @281a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang // @281a * //
translated: Afflicted, virtuous, nonvirtuous,

original: lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: and neutral.🔽Among those minds, the transcendence of those minds is, in general, conduct through mantra.

original: de la sems de rnams las 'da' bar bya ba yang spyir na sngags kyi sgo nas spyod pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sems de rnams las 'da' bar bya ba yang spyir na sngags kyi sgo nas spyod pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of conduct:

original: grub pa dang / dam tshig can no //
analyzed: grub pa dang / dam tshig can no //
translated: accomplished and pledged.

original: de la grub pa ni mos bas spyod pa'i sa nas yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyis gang du 'dod par 'phar bas rim pa dang bskal pa'i tshigs kyang med do //
analyzed: de la grub pa ni mos bas spyod pa'i sa nas yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyis gang du 'dod par 'phar bas rim pa dang bskal pa'i tshigs kyang med do //
translated: As for the accomplishment, from the stage of devoted conduct, by means of a mental body, one flies wherever one wishes, and so there is no sequence or time period.

original: dam tshig can la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dam tshig can la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Also, for those who have the commitments, there are two types:

original: dbang po rtul po dang rnon po'o //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po dang rnon po'o //
translated: those of duller faculties and those of sharper faculties.🔽Among them, those of duller faculties, having first given rise to the mind of the path of the world, which is only emptiness, fly from there and realize the selflessness of persons.

original: de la dbang po rtul po ni thog mar 'jig rten pa'i lam stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig par blo skyes pa las 'phar nas gang zag la bdag med par rtogs te sems 'di rnams kyang sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de la dbang po rtul po ni thog mar 'jig rten pa'i lam stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig par blo skyes pa las 'phar nas gang zag la bdag med par rtogs te sems 'di rnams kyang sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang /
translated: They realize that these minds are suffering, impermanent,

original: stong pa nyid dang / bdag med par rtogs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / bdag med par rtogs te /
translated: empty, and selfless.

original: spong ba goms par byed na 'jig rten pa'i lam nas brtsams te bskal ba gsum gyi bar du gang zag la bdag med par bsgoms te /
analyzed: spong ba goms par byed na 'jig rten pa'i lam nas brtsams te bskal ba gsum gyi bar du gang zag la bdag med par bsgoms te /
translated: If they cultivate the abandonment, beginning from the path of the world, for three eons, they meditate on the selflessness of persons.

original: de nas phung po la yod do snyam pa'i blo skye ba de yang sun phyung nas phung pa la sogs pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bur chos la bdag med par rtogs te /
analyzed: de nas phung po la yod do snyam pa'i blo skye ba de yang sun phyung nas phung pa la sogs pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bur chos la bdag med par rtogs te /
translated: Then, having refuted the idea that the self exists in the aggregates, one realizes the selflessness of phenomena, that the aggregates and so on are like illusions and mirages.

original: sems gsum sgom pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam par spyod pa'i mtshan nyid mos pas spyod pa'i sa la 'jug go //
analyzed: sems gsum sgom pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam par spyod pa'i mtshan nyid mos pas spyod pa'i sa la 'jug go //
translated: One enters the level of earnest aspiration, which is characterized by the cultivation of those three kinds of mental states and by the practice of the transcendent perfections and so forth.

original: dbang po rnon po ni thog ma nyid nas gang zag dang chos gnyi ga la bdag med par rtogs pas sems de rnams kyang sgyu ma dang smig rgyu'i tshul gyis spong zhing sems gsum po sgom pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rnam par spyod pa'i rim gyis mos pas spyod pa'i sa de bskal pa gcig gis rdzogs nas bskal pa de'i bzhi cha gcig gis ye shes kyi sa la 'jug go ;
analyzed: dbang po rnon po ni thog ma nyid nas gang zag dang chos gnyi ga la bdag med par rtogs pas sems de rnams kyang sgyu ma dang smig rgyu'i tshul gyis spong zhing sems gsum po sgom pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rnam par spyod pa'i rim gyis mos pas spyod pa'i sa de bskal pa gcig gis rdzogs nas bskal pa de'i bzhi cha gcig gis ye shes kyi sa la 'jug go ;
translated: Those of sharp acumen, on the other hand, realize from the very beginning that neither the individual nor phenomena have a self and so they eliminate those three kinds of mental states by means of the illusionlike and miragelike modes and, by the process of practicing the transcendent perfections and so forth, they complete the level of earnest aspiration in a single eon and in a quarter of that eon they enter the level of wisdom.

original: / mos pas spyod pa'i sa la zhugs nas ni dbang po rno rtul gnyis ka yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa de bskal pa gcig gis rdzogs par byed pa dang / ye shes kyi sa la bskal pa bzhi cha gcig gis 'jug par 'dra'o //
analyzed: / mos pas spyod pa'i sa la zhugs nas ni dbang po rno rtul gnyis ka yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa de bskal pa gcig gis rdzogs par byed pa dang / ye shes kyi sa la bskal pa bzhi cha gcig gis 'jug par 'dra'o //
translated: Having entered the stage of action in faith, both those of sharp and dull faculties complete that stage of action in faith in one eon, and enter the stage of wisdom in one quarter of an eon.

original: sems kyi dngos po drug cu rnams las brgya drug cur 'phel ba yang sgrib pa'i cha phra chags gsum du phye ste gsum po de rnams re re zhing yang gsum gsum du phye bas rnam pa dgur blta'o //
analyzed: sems kyi dngos po drug cu rnams las brgya drug cur 'phel ba yang sgrib pa'i cha phra chags gsum du phye ste gsum po de rnams re re zhing yang gsum gsum du phye bas rnam pa dgur blta'o //
translated: From among the sixty mental states, the one hundred and sixty increase. The three parts of obscuration are divided into three, and each of those three is divided into three, so that they are seen as nine aspects.

original: de la sgrib pa chen po'i chen po la sems gcig spong la chen po'i 'bring po la ni gnyis spong /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa chen po'i chen po la sems gcig spong la chen po'i 'bring po la ni gnyis spong /
translated: Therein, one mental state is abandoned in the great of the great obscurations. Two are abandoned in the great of the medium.

original: chen po'i chung ngu la ni gsum spong /
analyzed: chen po'i chung ngu la ni gsum spong /
translated: Three are abandoned in the great of the small.

original: 'bring gi chen po la ni bzhi spong /
analyzed: 'bring gi chen po la ni bzhi spong /
translated: Four are abandoned in the medium of the great.

original: @281b 'bring gi 'bring la ni lnga spong /
analyzed: @281b 'bring gi 'bring la ni lnga spong /
translated: Five are abandoned in the medium of the medium.

original: 'bring gi chung du la ni drug spong /
analyzed: 'bring gi chung du la ni drug spong /
translated: Six are abandoned in the medium of the small.

original: chung ngu'i chen po la bdun spong /
analyzed: chung ngu'i chen po la bdun spong /
translated: Seven are abandoned in the small of the great.

original: chung ngu'i 'bring la brgyad spong /
analyzed: chung ngu'i 'bring la brgyad spong /
translated: The medium of the small abandons eight.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul gyis de ltar sems brgya drug cu mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas bskyod cing mos pas spyod pa'i sa de rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul gyis de ltar sems brgya drug cu mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas bskyod cing mos pas spyod pa'i sa de rdzogs par byed do //
translated: In accordance with the method that will be explained below, one should understand that the bodhisattva moves from the level of practice through belief and perfects that level by means of the one hundred and sixty mental states.

original: de la dgu po rnams kyi tha ma chung ngu'i yang chung du ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas 'phar nas spong ste ye shes kyi sa la 'jug par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dgu po rnams kyi tha ma chung ngu'i yang chung du ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas 'phar nas spong ste ye shes kyi sa la 'jug par shes par bya'o //
translated: The last of the nine, the small of the small, is the one that moves from the level of practice through belief and abandons it, and one should understand that it enters the level of wisdom.

original: de la 'dod chags kyi sems gang zhe na chags pa can chos kun du bsten pa'o zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems la bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags kyi sems gang zhe na chags pa can chos kun du bsten pa'o zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems la bya ste /
translated: What is a mind of attachment? It is a mind that is attached to all phenomena. This refers to a mind that is associated with attachment.

original: de yang dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bsten pa'i chos rnam pa bzhi las ji ltar rigs par chags nas bsnyen pa la shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bsten pa'i chos rnam pa bzhi las ji ltar rigs par chags nas bsnyen pa la shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it is to be understood as an attachment to any of the four kinds of phenomena, virtuous, nonvirtuous, afflicted, or neutral.

original: lha la sogs pa la dad cing mchod par bya ba la zhen nas mchod pa la sogs pa'i las de dag byed pa ni chags pa can chos kun du bsten pa zhes bya ste dge ba'o //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa la dad cing mchod par bya ba la zhen nas mchod pa la sogs pa'i las de dag byed pa ni chags pa can chos kun du bsten pa zhes bya ste dge ba'o //
translated: Those who are attached to and worship gods, etc., and who perform the actions of worship, etc., are called “those who are attached to the Dharma” and are virtuous.

original: de bzhin du bud med la sogs pa la zhen nas de'i bya ba byed pa ni chags ba can chos bsten pa ste nyon mongs pa can gyi sems so //🔽ma byin par len pa dang brdzun du smra ba la chos su zhen nas de dag gi bya ba byed pa ni chags pa can chos bsten pa ste mi dge ba'i sems so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bud med la sogs pa la zhen nas de'i bya ba byed pa ni chags ba can chos bsten pa ste nyon mongs pa can gyi sems so // ma byin par len pa dang brdzun du smra ba la chos su zhen nas de dag gi bya ba byed pa ni chags pa can chos bsten pa ste mi dge ba'i sems so //
translated: Similarly, those who are attached to women, etc., and who perform the actions of sexual intercourse, etc., are called “those who are attached to the Dharma” and are afflicted.🔽Those who are attached to stealing and lying and who perform the actions of stealing and lying are called “those who are attached to the Dharma” and are nonvirtuous.

original: bzo la sogs pa'i chos la zhen nas de dag gi bya ba byed pa ni chags pa can chos bsten pa ste lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bzo la sogs pa'i chos la zhen nas de dag gi bya ba byed pa ni chags pa can chos bsten pa ste lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Those who are attached to the Dharma of arts and crafts and who perform the actions of arts and crafts are called “those who are attached to the Dharma” and are neutral.

original: de ltar tshul 'dis sems gzhan rnams la yang ji ltar rigs par dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang lung ma bstan par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshul 'dis sems gzhan rnams la yang ji ltar rigs par dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang lung ma bstan par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, other minds should be connected with virtue, nonvirtue, affliction, and neutrality, as appropriate.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems gang zhe na /🔽'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos kun du bsten pa'o zhes pa ni gong du smos pa'i chos rnam pa bzhi la ma chags pa'am ma mos kyang chos nyid kyi spyod pa'am /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems gang zhe na / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos kun du bsten pa'o zhes pa ni gong du smos pa'i chos rnam pa bzhi la ma chags pa'am ma mos kyang chos nyid kyi spyod pa'am /
translated: What is a mind free from passion?🔽It is the practice of the Dharma free from passion.

original: gzhan gyi dbang du mi spyod bzhin du de dag gi bya ba byed pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos kun du bsten pa'o//
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du mi spyod bzhin du de dag gi bya ba byed pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos kun du bsten pa'o//
translated: The practice of the Dharma free from passion is the practice of the four Dharmas mentioned above, without attachment or desire, but with the practice of the Dharma or the practice of the Dharma of others.

original: zhe sdang gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a mind of hatred?🔽It is the practice of the Dharma of hatred.

original: sdang bas chos kun du bsten pa'o zhes pa ni zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i sems te gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdang bas chos kun du bsten pa'o zhes pa ni zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i sems te gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: A mind of hatred is a mind endowed with hatred, and it should be understood as virtuous, nonvirtuous, etc., in the manner explained above.

original: byams pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: byams pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a mind of loving kindness?

original: byams pa dang ldan pa'i chos kun du bsten pa'o zhes pa ni byams pa dang @282a * //
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa'i chos kun du bsten pa'o zhes pa ni byams pa dang @282a * //
translated: It is the practice of the Dharma of loving kindness.

original: ldan pa'i sems te dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ldan pa'i sems te dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: A mind of loving kindness is a mind endowed with loving kindness, and it should be understood as virtuous, nonvirtuous, etc., in the manner explained above.

original: gti mug gi sems gang zhe na gang mi dpyod par chos bsten pa'o zhes pa ni gti mug dang ldan pa'i sems so //
analyzed: gti mug gi sems gang zhe na gang mi dpyod par chos bsten pa'o zhes pa ni gti mug dang ldan pa'i sems so //
translated: What is a confused mind? It is a mind which does not investigate the Dharma.

original: shes rab kyi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a discriminating mind?

original: khyad par las khyad par gzhan rtogs par bya ste chos bsten pa'o zhes pa ni shes rab dang ldan pa'i sems te khyad par las zhes pa ni shes rab ma thob pa las shes rab thob pa la bya'o //🔽khyad par gzhan zhes pa ni shes rab de thob pa las shes rab mchog khyad par du rtogs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par las khyad par gzhan rtogs par bya ste chos bsten pa'o zhes pa ni shes rab dang ldan pa'i sems te khyad par las zhes pa ni shes rab ma thob pa las shes rab thob pa la bya'o // khyad par gzhan zhes pa ni shes rab de thob pa las shes rab mchog khyad par du rtogs pa la bya'o //
translated: It is a mind which investigates the Dharma in order to attain a higher stage of discrimination.

original: gtan la phab pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: gtan la phab pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a mind of certainty?

original: bka' dang bla ma'i tshig bzhin byed pa nyid do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bka' dang bla ma'i tshig bzhin byed pa nyid do zhes pa ni /
translated: It is a mind which acts in accordance with the words of the Buddha and the teacher.

original: rgyal po la sogs pa'i bka' dang / slob dpon la sogs pa'i lung mi byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa'i bka' dang / slob dpon la sogs pa'i lung mi byar mi rung ste /
translated: One should not disobey the words of the king, etc., nor the instructions of the teacher, etc.

original: nges par bya ba'i chos de byed pa'o //
analyzed: nges par bya ba'i chos de byed pa'o //
translated: One should act in accordance with the Dharma which is to be ascertained.

original: the tshom gyi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom gyi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a doubting mind?

original: ji ltar yongs su gzung ba des pa ngag la som nyi bsten pa dag go zhes pa ni the tshom dang ldan pa'i sems te sngar phyin ci ma log par zin pa la phyis bdag nyid kyis the tshom bslang ste dogs pa skye par byed pa ni de'i🔽chos la brten pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su gzung ba des pa ngag la som nyi bsten pa dag go zhes pa ni the tshom dang ldan pa'i sems te sngar phyin ci ma log par zin pa la phyis bdag nyid kyis the tshom bslang ste dogs pa skye par byed pa ni de'i chos la brten pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped is the mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped.🔽The mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped is the mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped.🔽The mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped is the mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped.🔽The mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped is the mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped.🔽The mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped is the mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped.

original: mun par 'gyur ba'i sems gang zhe na som nyi med pa la som nyir shes pa'o zhes pa ni mun pa lta bu'i sems te ji ltar mun pa'i nang na bum pa la sogs pa yod kyang gsal bar mi snang bas yod dam med the tshom za ba
analyzed: mun par 'gyur ba'i sems gang zhe na som nyi med pa la som nyir shes pa'o zhes pa ni mun pa lta bu'i sems te ji ltar mun pa'i nang na bum pa la sogs pa yod kyang gsal bar mi snang bas yod dam med the tshom za ba
translated: The mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped is the mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped.🔽The mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped is the mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped.🔽The mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped is the mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped.🔽The mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped is the mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped.

original: ste / de bzhin du dngos po phyin ci ma log pa la ma rig pa'i mun pas bsgribs pas the tshom skye ba'i sems ni mun pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ste / de bzhin du dngos po phyin ci ma log pa la ma rig pa'i mun pas bsgribs pas the tshom skye ba'i sems ni mun pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped is the mind that is doubtful about what is well grasped.

original: snang bar gyur pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: snang bar gyur pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: The mind that is doubtful about

original: som nyi med pa la som nyi med par bsten pa'o zhes pa ni snang ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sems te ji ltar nam mkha' snang ba la rdzas kyi dngos po gsal bar snang ba bzhin du snang ba'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs de yang des shes par
analyzed: som nyi med pa la som nyi med par bsten pa'o zhes pa ni snang ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sems te ji ltar nam mkha' snang ba la rdzas kyi dngos po gsal bar snang ba bzhin du snang ba'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs de yang des shes par
translated: Just as space is the clear appearance of material things in the appearance of light, that form which has the nature of appearance is to be known by that.

original: bya ba'i dngos po the tshom med bzhin du spyod pa ni som nyi med par chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i dngos po the tshom med bzhin du spyod pa ni som nyi med par chos bsten pa'o //
translated: The practice of the Dharma free from doubt is the practice of the mind that is free from doubt.

original: sdud pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdud pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind of gathering?🔽It is the unification of the many into one.

original: du ma gcig tu byed pa'o zhes pa ni sdud pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid so so ba las stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid gcig tu sdud pa'o //
analyzed: du ma gcig tu byed pa'o zhes pa ni sdud pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid so so ba las stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid gcig tu sdud pa'o //
translated: The mind that has the nature of gathering is the mind that gathers the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on, which have individual specific characteristics, into the single general characteristic of emptiness, selflessness, and so on.

original: 'thab @282b pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'thab @282b pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind of fighting?🔽It is mutual dispute.

original: phan tshun rtsod pa nyid do zhes pa ni 'thab mo can gyi sems te /
analyzed: phan tshun rtsod pa nyid do zhes pa ni 'thab mo can gyi sems te /
translated: The mind that has the nature of fighting is the mind that fights.

original: mi mthun pa'i mu re re gzung zhing rtsod pa'i chos re re bsten pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i mu re re gzung zhing rtsod pa'i chos re re bsten pa'o //
translated: Each of the unfavorable extremes is to be taken as a single instance of the Dharma of dispute.🔽What is the Dharma of dispute? It is the dispute between self and self.

original: rtsod pa'i gang zhen gang bdag nyid dang bdag nyid du rtsod pa'o zhes pa ni rtsod pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te gzhan dang phan tshun du mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzung zhing mi rtsod par bdag rang gi sems la sun 'byin pa'am dpyod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gang zhen gang bdag nyid dang bdag nyid du rtsod pa'o zhes pa ni rtsod pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te gzhan dang phan tshun du mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzung zhing mi rtsod par bdag rang gi sems la sun 'byin pa'am dpyod pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is the nature of the mind of dispute. It is as if one were to take the unfavorable extremes as a pair and, without disputing with another, were to dispute with one's own mind.

original: mi rtsod pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtsod pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the mind of non-dispute?🔽It is the view of equality.

original: mnyam pas mtshungs par blta ba'o zhes pa ni rtsod pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te dngos po gang yang rung ba la gzhan dang lta ba mthun pas mtshungs par spyod de rtsod pa med pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pas mtshungs par blta ba'o zhes pa ni rtsod pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te dngos po gang yang rung ba la gzhan dang lta ba mthun pas mtshungs par spyod de rtsod pa med pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
translated: This is the nature of the mind of non-dispute. It is the practice of equality with another, the practice of the Dharma of non-dispute, with regard to any object whatsoever, by means of the view of equality with another.

original: lha'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: lha'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the mind of the gods?

original: yid kyis bdag nyid la rlom sems su byed pa'o zhes pa ni lha lta bu'i sems sam /
analyzed: yid kyis bdag nyid la rlom sems su byed pa'o zhes pa ni lha lta bu'i sems sam /
translated: It is the self-conceit of the mind.

original: lha'i phyir sems pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i phyir sems pa ste /
translated: This is the nature of the mind of the gods.

original: lha lta bur sems pa ni ji ltar lha rnams bdag ni lha yin no snyam du sems pa bzhin du sems de yang bdag nyid gang yin pa de yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: lha lta bur sems pa ni ji ltar lha rnams bdag ni lha yin no snyam du sems pa bzhin du sems de yang bdag nyid gang yin pa de yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: The mind like a god is like the thought of the gods, “I am a god.” That mind is the thought, “That is what I am.”

original: lha'i phyir sems pa ni bdag gis lhar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i phyir sems pa ni bdag gis lhar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: The mind for the sake of a god is the thought, “I will become a god.”

original: lha ma yin gyi sems gang zhe na gang 'khor ba nyid la smod pa'o zhes pa ni lha ma yin lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi sems gang zhe na gang 'khor ba nyid la smod pa'o zhes pa ni lha ma yin lta bu'i sems te /
translated: What is the mind of an asura? It is the mind that criticizes cyclic existence.

original: de ltar lha ma yin de la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad la smod par byed pa de bzhin du sems de yang 'khor ba la smod par byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar lha ma yin de la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad la smod par byed pa de bzhin du sems de yang 'khor ba la smod par byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
translated: Just as the asura criticizes all things, so that mind is the practice of the Dharma that criticizes cyclic existence.

original: klu'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: klu'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind of a nāga?

original: gang longs spyod chen po nyid du bya ba'i phyir sems pa'o zhes pa ni klu lta bu'i sems te ji ltar klu phyug po la mgo mang po yod de /
analyzed: gang longs spyod chen po nyid du bya ba'i phyir sems pa'o zhes pa ni klu lta bu'i sems te ji ltar klu phyug po la mgo mang po yod de /
translated: It is the mind that thinks, “I will have great wealth.”

original: mgo mang po longs spyod che bar shes pa de bzhin du sems de yang longs spyod chen po la spyod pa'i chos bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mgo mang po longs spyod che bar shes pa de bzhin du sems de yang longs spyod chen po la spyod pa'i chos bstan pa'o //
translated: Just as the many heads of the nāga are known to be of great enjoyment, so too is the mind taught to be the enjoyment of the Dharma of great enjoyment.

original: de la klu'i mgo mang po longs spyod kyi dper ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la klu'i mgo mang po longs spyod kyi dper ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is the example of the many heads of the nāga to be understood as enjoyment?

original: rgya gar skad du longs spyod la bho ga //
analyzed: rgya gar skad du longs spyod la bho ga //
translated: In Sanskrit, enjoyment is bhoga.

original: klu'i mgo la yang bho ga zhes bya ste /
analyzed: klu'i mgo la yang bho ga zhes bya ste /
translated: The head of the nāga is also called bhoga.

original: skad kyang mthun la don du yang klu mgo mang po de phyug pas longs spyod chen po la longs spyod do //
analyzed: skad kyang mthun la don du yang klu mgo mang po de phyug pas longs spyod chen po la longs spyod do //
translated: Since the many heads of the nāga are wealthy, they enjoy great enjoyment.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang longs spyod chen po'i chos la bsten par byed pas klu lta bu'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang longs spyod chen po'i chos la bsten par byed pas klu lta bu'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, since the mind also relies on the Dharma of great enjoyment, it is called the mind like a nāga.

original: mi'i sems gang yin zhe na /🔽de nyid kyi don du sems pa'o zhes pa ni mi'i longs spyod 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi chos @283a * //
analyzed: mi'i sems gang yin zhe na / de nyid kyi don du sems pa'o zhes pa ni mi'i longs spyod 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi chos @283a * //
translated: What is the human mind?

original: la bsten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: la bsten par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the mind that thinks for that very purpose. It is the mind that relies on the Dharma of the qualities of enjoyment desired by humans.

original: bud med kyi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: bud med kyi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the female mind?

original: 'dod pa kho na'i phyir chos bsten pa'o zhes pa ni bud med lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: 'dod pa kho na'i phyir chos bsten pa'o zhes pa ni bud med lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The mind that is like a woman is the mind that resorts to the Dharma only for the sake of desire.

original: bud med ni 'dod chags kyi yul du gyur pa'i chos rnams 'thob par bya ba'i phyir chos de dag gi bya ba byed de /
analyzed: bud med ni 'dod chags kyi yul du gyur pa'i chos rnams 'thob par bya ba'i phyir chos de dag gi bya ba byed de /
translated: A woman performs the actions of those dharmas in order to obtain the dharmas that are the objects of desire.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang 'dod pa'i yul rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir chos de dag la bsten par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang 'dod pa'i yul rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir chos de dag la bsten par byed do //
translated: In the same way, that mind resorts to those dharmas in order to obtain the objects of desire.

original: dbang phyug gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang phyug gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind that is like a lord?

original: gang bdag gis thams cad bsam mo snyam du rlom sems su byed pa'o zhes pa ni dbang phyug lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang bdag gis thams cad bsam mo snyam du rlom sems su byed pa'o zhes pa ni dbang phyug lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is the mind that conceives of itself as thinking, “I think of everything.”

original: dbang phyug ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa ni bdag gis byas so bar sems so //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa ni bdag gis byas so bar sems so //
translated: The mind that is like a lord is the mind of a lord who thinks, “I create the creation and destruction of the entire world.”

original: de bzhin sems de yang bdag gis ma byas pa rnams kyang bdag gis byas so ba'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin sems de yang bdag gis ma byas pa rnams kyang bdag gis byas so ba'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
translated: In the same way, that mind resorts to the Dharma, thinking, “I create what is not created.”

original: dbang phyug ni lha chen po la bya'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni lha chen po la bya'o //
translated: The lord is the great god.

original: tshong pa'i sems gang zhe na gang bsdu ba byas te rnam par spel nas phyis bstan ba'o zhes pa ni tshong blta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: tshong pa'i sems gang zhe na gang bsdu ba byas te rnam par spel nas phyis bstan ba'o zhes pa ni tshong blta bu'i sems te /
translated: What is the merchant-mind? It is the mind which, having accumulated and increased, later gives.

original: tshong ba ni 'tshong zhing nyo ba'i chos rnams rin chung ba'i dus na kun bsdus nas nam rin che ba na de dag thams cad slar spel zhing 'tshong bar byed do //
analyzed: tshong ba ni 'tshong zhing nyo ba'i chos rnams rin chung ba'i dus na kun bsdus nas nam rin che ba na de dag thams cad slar spel zhing 'tshong bar byed do //
translated: The merchant accumulates goods when they are cheap and then later sells them when they are expensive.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang sngar phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi chos rnams mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i chos kyis de rnams nyid ji ltar rigs par slod pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang sngar phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi chos rnams mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i chos kyis de rnams nyid ji ltar rigs par slod pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
translated: In the same way, this mind, having previously accumulated the aggregates, elements and spheres by means of the impermanence, suffering, etc. of the dharmas, later gives them away by means of the dharmas which are to be practiced as appropriate.

original: zhing pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhing pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the farmer-mind?

original: gang thos pa rnam pa du ma tshol zhing phyis bsten pa'o zhes pa ni zhing pa lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang thos pa rnam pa du ma tshol zhing phyis bsten pa'o zhes pa ni zhing pa lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is the mind which, having sought out many teachings, later gives them.

original: sngar zhing thog rnams bsdus nas phyis zhing thog de rnams nyid la bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: sngar zhing thog rnams bsdus nas phyis zhing thog de rnams nyid la bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed do //
translated: Having previously gathered the fields, later one engages in the activities of eating, drinking, etc. in those very fields.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang sngar chos rnams mang du thos par byas te bsags nas phyis ji ltar thos pa'i chos de rnams sems pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang sngar chos rnams mang du thos par byas te bsags nas phyis ji ltar thos pa'i chos de rnams sems pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
translated: In the same way, having previously gathered the Dharma by listening to it a lot, later one engages in the Dharma by contemplating, meditating, etc. on those Dharmas that one has heard.

original: chu bo'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: chu bo'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the river-like thought?

original: gang mtha' gnyis la mi ltos shing bsten pa'o zhes pa ni chu bo lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang mtha' gnyis la mi ltos shing bsten pa'o zhes pa ni chu bo lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is the thought that does not depend on the two extremes and is applied.

original: chu bo ni mtha' gnyis mi mtho bar dbus kyi gzhung bzhin las 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: chu bo ni mtha' gnyis mi mtho bar dbus kyi gzhung bzhin las 'bab pa'o //
translated: A river flows in the middle, not looking at the two banks.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis spong par byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis spong par byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
translated: In the same way, this thought is applied to the Dharma that abandons the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: yang na chu bo mtha' gnyis la ltos shing 'bab pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: yang na chu bo mtha' gnyis la ltos shing 'bab pa de bzhin du /
translated: Or else, a river flows while looking at the two banks.

original: @283b sems de yang rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' bzung zhing de'i chos bsten par byed pa la yang bya'o //
analyzed: @283b sems de yang rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' bzung zhing de'i chos bsten par byed pa la yang bya'o //
translated: This also applies to the mind that is attached to the extremes of eternalism and nihilism and to the practice of its teachings.

original: lteng ka'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: lteng ka'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind like a pool?

original: gang srid pas bsten pa'o zhes pa ni lteng ka lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang srid pas bsten pa'o zhes pa ni lteng ka lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The mind like a pool is that which is attached to existence.

original: lteng ka de ni gzhan las 'bab pa'i chu rnams pa sogs la bdag las gar yang mi 'dzag ste /
analyzed: lteng ka de ni gzhan las 'bab pa'i chu rnams pa sogs la bdag las gar yang mi 'dzag ste /
translated: A pool does not let water flow out to others, nor does it flow out anywhere by itself.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang gzhan gyi thams cad ni sdud la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang gzhan gyi thams cad ni sdud la /
translated: In the same way, this mind does not let anything flow out to others,

original: bdag las gang ci yang mi gtong ba'i chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: bdag las gang ci yang mi gtong ba'i chos bsten pa'o //
translated: but it does let everything flow in to itself. It is the practice of the teaching of non-giving.

original: khron pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: khron pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind like a well?

original: gang ma zab pa la zab par sems pa'o zhes pa ni khron pa lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang ma zab pa la zab par sems pa'o zhes pa ni khron pa lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The mind like a well is that which thinks the shallow is deep.

original: khron pa chus gang ba ni mi zab kyang gting dpag tu mi mngon pas zab pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: khron pa chus gang ba ni mi zab kyang gting dpag tu mi mngon pas zab pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: A well filled with water is shallow, but it is as if it were deep because its depth is not apparent.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang zab mo'i blo ma yin pa la zab snyam du sems pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang zab mo'i blo ma yin pa la zab snyam du sems pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
translated: In the same way, this mind thinks the shallow is deep. It is the practice of the teaching of the non-profound.

original: kun du bsrung ba'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun du bsrung ba'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind of protection?🔽It is the mind which thinks: “This is the truth, the other is confused.”🔽It is the mind of protection, which thinks: “This is the truth, the other is confused.”

original: 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug snyam du sems ba'o zhes pa ni bsrung bar gyur pa'i sems te /🔽bdag gis ji ltar thos shing zin bde nyid ma nor ba'o snya nas brtan par bzung ste gzhan gyis zin cing rtogs pa de ma yin pa snyam du chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug snyam du sems ba'o zhes pa ni bsrung bar gyur pa'i sems te / bdag gis ji ltar thos shing zin bde nyid ma nor ba'o snya nas brtan par bzung ste gzhan gyis zin cing rtogs pa de ma yin pa snyam du chos bsten pa'o //
translated: It is the mind which thinks: “This is the truth, the other is confused.”

original: ser sna'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: ser sna'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind of miserliness?🔽It is the mind which thinks: “I will not give to others what I have obtained.”

original: bdag nyid bsten cing gzhan la mi ster ba'o zhes pa ni ser sna can gyi sems la bya ste ji ltar grags pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid bsten cing gzhan la mi ster ba'o zhes pa ni ser sna can gyi sems la bya ste ji ltar grags pa'o //
translated: It is the mind of miserliness, as it is generally known.

original: byi ba'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: byi ba'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind of flattery?🔽It is the mind which thinks: “I will serve in order to receive gifts.”🔽It is the mind of flattery, as it is generally known.🔽What is the mind of hoarding?🔽It is the mind which thinks: “I will serve in order to receive gifts.”

original: gang mchod pa la ltos te bsten pa'o zhes pa ni byi ba lta bu'i sems te byi ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa na mchod zhing 'dzin te /
analyzed: gang mchod pa la ltos te bsten pa'o zhes pa ni byi ba lta bu'i sems te byi ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa na mchod zhing 'dzin te /
translated: It is the mind of hoarding, as it is generally known.🔽What is the mind of advancement?🔽It is the mind which thinks: “I will serve in order to receive gifts.”

original: de bzhin du sems de yang 'phags pa'i lam la sogs pa thob par byed pa ni 'jug pa'i dus las 'phar ba ste//
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang 'phags pa'i lam la sogs pa thob par byed pa ni 'jug pa'i dus las 'phar ba ste//
translated: It is the mind of advancement, as it is generally known.🔽What is the mind of exaltation?🔽It is the mind which thinks: “I will serve in order to receive gifts.”

original: rim pa des 'phar ba'o //
analyzed: rim pa des 'phar ba'o //
translated: It is the mind of exaltation, as it is generally known.🔽What is the mind of the acquisition of good qualities?🔽It is the mind which thinks: “I will serve in order to receive gifts.”🔽It is the mind of the acquisition of good qualities, as it is generally known.🔽What is the mind of the acquisition of honors?🔽It is the mind which thinks: “I will serve in order to receive gifts.”🔽It is the mind of the acquisition of honors, as it is generally known.🔽What is the mind of the acquisition of the Path?🔽It is the mind which thinks: “I will serve in order to receive gifts.”🔽It is the mind of the acquisition of the Path, as it is generally known.🔽What is the mind of the acquisition of the fruit of the Path?

original: khyi'i sems gang zhe na gang chung dus kyang mgu bar 'gyur ba'o zhes pa ni khyi lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: khyi'i sems gang zhe na gang chung dus kyang mgu bar 'gyur ba'o zhes pa ni khyi lta bu'i sems te /
translated: What is the dog-like thought? It is the thought which is satisfied with little.

original: khyi ni chung dus kyang mgu ba'o //
analyzed: khyi ni chung dus kyang mgu ba'o //
translated: The dog is satisfied with little.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang gang yang rung ba'i dngos po chung dus mgu bar byed pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang gang yang rung ba'i dngos po chung dus mgu bar byed pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
translated: In the same way, this thought is satisfied with a small thing.

original: nam mkha' lding gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the garuḍa-like thought?

original: gang phyogs 'dzin pas chos la brten pa'o zhes pa ni nam mkha' lding lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang phyogs 'dzin pas chos la brten pa'o zhes pa ni nam mkha' lding lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is the thought which, by taking sides, adheres to the teaching.

original: nam mkha' ldeng ni klu la sogs pa 'dzin pa na 'dab mas rdob cing 'dzin te /🔽de bzhin du sems de yang gang bdag gi yin pa de'i phyogs 'dzin pa'i chos bsten @284a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' ldeng ni klu la sogs pa 'dzin pa na 'dab mas rdob cing 'dzin te / de bzhin du sems de yang gang bdag gi yin pa de'i phyogs 'dzin pa'i chos bsten @284a * //
translated: The garuḍa, seizing the nāga, etc. , seizes it by the wings.

original: par byed do //
analyzed: par byed do //
translated: In the same way, this thought, taking sides with what is its own, adheres to the teaching.

original: nam mkha' lding gi 'dab mas rdob cing sbrul 'dzin pa de ji ltar phyogs 'dzin pa'i dper 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi 'dab mas rdob cing sbrul 'dzin pa de ji ltar phyogs 'dzin pa'i dper 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can the garuḍa, seizing the nāga by the wings, be an example of taking sides?

original: rgya gar skad du 'dab ma la paksha zhes bya /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du 'dab ma la paksha zhes bya /
translated: In Sanskrit, pakṣa means wing, and pakṣa means side.

original: phyogs la yang paksha zhes bya ste /🔽de ltar skad gcig la don du yang nam mkha' lding gis klu de bdag gir byed pa'i phyir 'dzin la /
analyzed: phyogs la yang paksha zhes bya ste / de ltar skad gcig la don du yang nam mkha' lding gis klu de bdag gir byed pa'i phyir 'dzin la /
translated: pakṣa means “side.”

original: phyogs su gyur pa yang bdag gir bya ba'i dngos po'i don la phyogs 'dzin pas mthun no //
analyzed: phyogs su gyur pa yang bdag gir bya ba'i dngos po'i don la phyogs 'dzin pas mthun no //
translated: Thus, in one moment, the garuḍa seizes the nāga in the sense of taking possession of it, and it is similar in that it takes possession of the side in the sense of taking possession of the object.

original: byi ba'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: byi ba'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mouse-like mind?🔽It is the mind that thinks, “I will cut through all the bonds.”

original: bcings pa thams cad bcad pa'i phyir sems pa'o zhes pa ni byi ba lta bu'i sems te byi ba ni bcings pa thams cad gcod cing grol bar byed pa'o ;
analyzed: bcings pa thams cad bcad pa'i phyir sems pa'o zhes pa ni byi ba lta bu'i sems te byi ba ni bcings pa thams cad gcod cing grol bar byed pa'o ;
translated: The mouse-like mind is like a mouse, which cuts through all the bonds and frees itself.

original: / de bzhin du sems de yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi chings ma dgrol ba'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du sems de yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi chings ma dgrol ba'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
translated: In the same way, this mind also frees itself from the bonds of desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: glu'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: glu'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the singing-like mind?🔽It is the mind that thinks, “I will attract beings with the songs of my various melodies.”

original: bdag gi dbyangs sgra sna tshogs kyi glus sems can rnams gzud par bya'o snyam pa'o zhes pa ni glu lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: bdag gi dbyangs sgra sna tshogs kyi glus sems can rnams gzud par bya'o snyam pa'o zhes pa ni glu lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The singing-like mind is like singing.

original: ji ltar glu des sems can rnams dga' zhing 'du ba de bzhin du sems de yang bdag gis gang dang rjes su mthun pa'i sgra skad kyi dbyangs mang pos sems can rnams gang la dang pa la gzud do snyam pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar glu des sems can rnams dga' zhing 'du ba de bzhin du sems de yang bdag gis gang dang rjes su mthun pa'i sgra skad kyi dbyangs mang pos sems can rnams gang la dang pa la gzud do snyam pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
translated: Just as that song delights and attracts sentient beings, in the same way, with many kinds of sounds, melodies, and tones, I will introduce sentient beings to whatever they delight in.

original: gar gyi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: gar gyi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind of dance?

original: bdag gis rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs kyis gzhan dag yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug go snyam du sems pa'o zhes pa ni gar bya ba'i sems te /
analyzed: bdag gis rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs kyis gzhan dag yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug go snyam du sems pa'o zhes pa ni gar bya ba'i sems te /
translated: The mind that thinks, “I will cause others to take up the practice by means of various miracles.”

original: gar zhes bya'i tshig ni lus g-yo ba'i don yin la /
analyzed: gar zhes bya'i tshig ni lus g-yo ba'i don yin la /
translated: The word “dance” means to move the body.

original: gar gcig pur ma zad nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa'i lus kyi rdzu 'phrul thams cad kyang lus g-yo ba yin te /
analyzed: gar gcig pur ma zad nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa'i lus kyi rdzu 'phrul thams cad kyang lus g-yo ba yin te /
translated: Not only dance, but all miracles of the body, such as flying through the air, are movements of the body.

original: de lta bas na lus kyi rdzu 'phrul de dag gis sems can rnams rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs sbyor bar byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na lus kyi rdzu 'phrul de dag gis sems can rnams rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs sbyor bar byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
translated: Therefore, by means of those miracles of the body, one practices the teaching that causes sentient beings to take up the practice of various miracles.

original: sil snyan gyi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: sil snyan gyi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind of music?

original: bdag gis chos kyi rnga brdung ngo snyam pa'o zhes pa ni sil snyan gyi phyir sems pa ste /

analyzed: chos rnga bsgrags shing 'chad par bya ba'i chos bsten par byed pa'i sems so // khyim gyi sems gang zhe na /

original: seng ge ni bdag gi sgyu rtsal gyis byol song thams cad zil gyis gnon pa de bzhin du sems de yang bdag gis yang shes shing grags pa'i phyogs kyis gzhan rnams zil gyis gnon pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: seng ge ni bdag gi sgyu rtsal gyis byol song thams cad zil gyis gnon pa de bzhin du sems de yang bdag gis yang shes shing grags pa'i phyogs kyis gzhan rnams zil gyis gnon pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
translated: Just as the lion, by its own skill, overpowers all other animals, so too does the mind that is devoted to the Dharma which overpowers others by its own knowledge and fame.

original: 'ug pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'ug pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the owl-like state of mind?

original: gang mtshan mo sems pa'o zhes pa ni 'ug pa lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang mtshan mo sems pa'o zhes pa ni 'ug pa lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is the state of mind that thinks at night.

original: 'ug pa ni bdag gi zas tshol ba la sogs pa bya ba thams cad mtshan mo byed do //
analyzed: 'ug pa ni bdag gi zas tshol ba la sogs pa bya ba thams cad mtshan mo byed do //
translated: The owl does all its work, such as seeking food, at night.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag gi bya ba rnams mtshan mo byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag gi bya ba rnams mtshan mo byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the mind that is devoted to the Dharma which does all its work at night.

original: bya rog gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: bya rog gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the crow-like state of mind?🔽It is the state of mind that thinks in fear of everything.

original: gang thams cad du skrag pas sems pa'o zhes pa ni bya rog lta bu'i sems te bya rog ni kun gyis 'jigs shing brtabs bzhin du rang gi bya ba byed do //
analyzed: gang thams cad du skrag pas sems pa'o zhes pa ni bya rog lta bu'i sems te bya rog ni kun gyis 'jigs shing brtabs bzhin du rang gi bya ba byed do //
translated: The crow does all its work, such as seeking food, while frightened and terrified of everything.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang gang gis dngos po spyad pa thams cad la bag tsha zhing brtabs pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang gang gis dngos po spyad pa thams cad la bag tsha zhing brtabs pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
