translated: Likewise, this mind also is that which resorts to the Dharma of fear and anxiety in all activities.

original: srin po'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: srin po'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a rakshasa-like mind?

original: gang dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams sgrub pa'o zhes pa ni srin po lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams sgrub pa'o zhes pa ni srin po lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is that which accomplishes both virtue and nonvirtue.🔽This is a rakshasa-like mind.

original: srin po ni sngon dge ba la sogs pa spyad pa'i rgyus bdag mthu dang ldan par gyur la /
analyzed: srin po ni sngon dge ba la sogs pa spyad pa'i rgyus bdag mthu dang ldan par gyur la /
translated: A rakshasa is one who, by the power of having previously practiced virtue and so on, has become powerful.

original: mthu des gsod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams spyad de sems de yang de lta bu'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mthu des gsod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams spyad de sems de yang de lta bu'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
translated: By that power, he practices nonvirtuous dharmas such as killing. This mind also resorts to such dharmas.

original: tsher ma'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: tsher ma'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a thorn-like mind?🔽It is that which always thinks with regret.

original: gang thams cad du 'gyod pa sems pa'o zhes pa ni tsher ma lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang thams cad du 'gyod pa sems pa'o zhes pa ni tsher ma lta bu'i sems te /
translated: This is a thorn-like mind.

original: tsher ma ni 'dzugs shing gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tsher ma ni 'dzugs shing gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: A thorn is that which pierces and harms.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang byas pa'i dngos po la 'gyod pa skye ste 'gyod pa de nyid yang dang yang du yid la byed cing zug rdur gyur pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang byas pa'i dngos po la 'gyod pa skye ste 'gyod pa de nyid yang dang yang du yid la byed cing zug rdur gyur pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
translated: Likewise, that mind also generates regret for a created thing, and that very regret is repeatedly attended to by the mind and is a phenomenon that becomes painful.

original: sa 'og gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa 'og gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a mind like the lower regions?

original: sa 'og gi don du sems pa'o zhes pa ni sa 'og gi phyir sems pa ste sa 'og tu song nas de'i bya ba byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: sa 'og gi don du sems pa'o zhes pa ni sa 'og gi phyir sems pa ste sa 'og tu song nas de'i bya ba byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
translated: It is a mind that thinks of the lower regions. It is a phenomenon that is attended to for the sake of the lower regions, and having gone to the lower regions, it is a phenomenon that performs the activities there.

original: rlung gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: rlung gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a mind like the wind?

original: gang thams cad du thams cad sgrub pa'o zhes pa ni rlung lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang thams cad du thams cad sgrub pa'o zhes pa ni rlung lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is a mind that accomplishes everything in every way. It is a mind like the wind.

original: rlung ni res 'ga' me'i nang du zhugs /
analyzed: rlung ni res 'ga' me'i nang du zhugs /
translated: Sometimes the wind enters fire,

original: res 'ga' chu la sogs pa'i nang du zhugs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: res 'ga' chu la sogs pa'i nang du zhugs pa de bzhin du /
translated: sometimes it enters water, and so on.

original: sems de yang res 'ga' dge ba'i nang du zhugs nas dkrugs te mi dge bar byed /
analyzed: sems de yang res 'ga' dge ba'i nang du zhugs nas dkrugs te mi dge bar byed /
translated: Likewise, that mind sometimes enters virtue and agitates it, making it nonvirtuous.

original: res 'ga' ni mi dge ba'i nang du zhugs te dge par byed de /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mi dge ba'i nang du zhugs te dge par byed de /
translated: Sometimes it enters nonvirtue and makes it virtuous.

original: @285a * // mdor na kun gyi nang du 'jug la kun la yang mi gnas par byed pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: @285a * // mdor na kun gyi nang du 'jug la kun la yang mi gnas par byed pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
translated: In brief, one should practice the Dharma that enters into all [vehicles] and does not abide in any [vehicle].

original: chu'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: chu'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the water-like thought?

original: gad mi dge ba'i sems thams cad bkru ba'i phyir bsten pa'o //
analyzed: gad mi dge ba'i sems thams cad bkru ba'i phyir bsten pa'o //
translated: It is the practice of the Dharma that washes away all unwholesome thoughts.

original: me'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: me'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fire-like thought?

original: gang dka' thub nyid kyis gdung bar byed ba'o zhes pa ni me lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang dka' thub nyid kyis gdung bar byed ba'o zhes pa ni me lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is the practice of the Dharma that burns with austerity.

original: me ni rang gi tsha bas gdung bar byed de de bzhin du sems de yang rang gi dka' thub kyis lus dang sems gdungs shing sma 'bab par byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: me ni rang gi tsha bas gdung bar byed de de bzhin du sems de yang rang gi dka' thub kyis lus dang sems gdungs shing sma 'bab par byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
translated: Fire burns with its own heat. Likewise, this thought burns the body and mind with its own austerity, causing them to wither.

original: me dka' thub kyi dper ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: me dka' thub kyi dper ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can fire be an example of austerity?

original: rgya gar skad du tsha ba la ta pa zhes bya /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du tsha ba la ta pa zhes bya /
translated: In Sanskrit, heat is called tapa,

original: dka' thub la yang ta pa zhes bya ste skad mthun pas dper bya'o //
analyzed: dka' thub la yang ta pa zhes bya ste skad mthun pas dper bya'o //
translated: and austerity is also called tapa. The example is based on the similarity of the words.

original: 'dam gyi sems gang zhe na gang bdag gi nyes pas gzhan la skud ba'o zhes pa ni 'dam lta bu'i sems te 'dam ni bdag gi ngo bo ngan pa de gzhan la bsgos nas chags par byed do //
analyzed: 'dam gyi sems gang zhe na gang bdag gi nyes pas gzhan la skud ba'o zhes pa ni 'dam lta bu'i sems te 'dam ni bdag gi ngo bo ngan pa de gzhan la bsgos nas chags par byed do //
translated: What is the mud-like thought? It is the thought which, by its own faults, defiles others.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang rang gi nyes pa gzhan la gos par byed pa'i chos bstan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang rang gi nyes pa gzhan la gos par byed pa'i chos bstan par byed pa'o //
translated: This is the mud-like thought. Just as mud, by its own bad nature, defiles others, so this thought, by its own faults, defiles others.

original: rnyog pa'i sems gang zhe na /🔽gang pha rol gyi nyes pa 'dzin pas sems la rnyog pa skyes pa'o zhes pa ni rnyog pa lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: rnyog pa'i sems gang zhe na / gang pha rol gyi nyes pa 'dzin pas sems la rnyog pa skyes pa'o zhes pa ni rnyog pa lta bu'i sems te /
translated: What is the turbid thought?

original: gzhan gyi nyes pas bdag gi sems 'khrugs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nyes pas bdag gi sems 'khrugs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the thought which is turbid by the holding of others' faults.🔽This is the turbid thought. Just as water is turbid by the stirring up of its own sediment, so this thought is turbid by the stirring up of its own faults.

original: tshon rtsi'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshon rtsi'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the dye-like thought?

original: gang de la chags pa nyid du bsten pa'o zhes pa ni tshon rtsi lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang de la chags pa nyid du bsten pa'o zhes pa ni tshon rtsi lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is the thought which is attached to that.

original: tshon dkar po'am dmar po la sogs pa'i kha dog ni gang la bskus pa de tshon de nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshon dkar po'am dmar po la sogs pa'i kha dog ni gang la bskus pa de tshon de nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: This is the dye-like thought. Just as a piece of cloth takes on the nature of the dye with which it is soaked, so this thought takes on the nature of the object to which it is attached.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang dngos po gang bsams pa de la zhen nas ji ltar bsams pa de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang dngos po gang bsams pa de la zhen nas ji ltar bsams pa de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i chos bsten pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the mind is also the cultivation of the Dharma that adheres to whatever object is contemplated and becomes the nature of whatever is contemplated.

original: shing leb kyi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: shing leb kyi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind like a plank?

original: gang dge ba gzhan spong bas bsten pa'o zhes pa ni shing leb lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang dge ba gzhan spong bas bsten pa'o zhes pa ni shing leb lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is the cultivation of the Dharma that abandons other virtues.

original: shing leb ni mtshon la sogs pa gzhan rnams kyis mi phigs par skyob pa'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: shing leb ni mtshon la sogs pa gzhan rnams kyis mi phigs par skyob pa'i bya ba byed do //
translated: The mind like a plank is the Dharma that protects one from other things, such as weapons, and does not allow them to penetrate.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang dge ba gcig spyad pas dge ba gzhan sgrib par byed pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang dge ba gcig spyad pas dge ba gzhan sgrib par byed pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the mind is the cultivation of the Dharma that obscures other virtues by practicing one virtue.

original: nor ba'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: nor ba'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind like a mistake?🔽It is the mind that grasps one thing and thinks of something else.

original: gzhan gzung zhing gzhan kho nar sems pa'o zhes pa ni nor ba'i rang bzhin gyi sems te gang gi dngos po zin te nor nas gzhan yin snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gzung zhing gzhan kho nar sems pa'o zhes pa ni nor ba'i rang bzhin gyi sems te gang gi dngos po zin te nor nas gzhan yin snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: The mind like a mistake is the Dharma that grasps one thing and thinks of something else.

original: dug gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: dug gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind like poison?

original: gang shin tu dngos po med ba nyid @285b sems pa'o zhes pa ni dug lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang shin tu dngos po med ba nyid @285b sems pa'o zhes pa ni dug lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The thought that is like poison is that which thinks about complete non-existence.

original: dug ni gang gis zin na shi ste med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dug ni gang gis zin na shi ste med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Poison is that by which one is seized and dies, becomes non-existent.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang gang lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs rnams spangs nas slar mi skye bas med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang gang lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs rnams spangs nas slar mi skye bas med par byed pa'o //
translated: Similarly, that thought is also that by which, having abandoned the afflictions such as view, one becomes non-existent, since they are not produced again.

original: zhags pa'i sems gang zhen gang thams cad du bdag nyid bcings shing 'dug pa'o zhes pa ni zhags pa lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: zhags pa'i sems gang zhen gang thams cad du bdag nyid bcings shing 'dug pa'o zhes pa ni zhags pa lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The thought that is like a noose is that by which one is bound and remains bound everywhere.

original: zhags pa ni 'ching ba'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: zhags pa ni 'ching ba'i bya ba byed do //
translated: A noose is that which performs the action of binding.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag nyid 'ching bar byed pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag nyid 'ching bar byed pa'i chos bsten par byed pa'o //
translated: Similarly, that thought is also that by which one is bound, since it is that which resorts to the dharmas of bondage.

original: lcags sgrog gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: lcags sgrog gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the thought that is like an iron fetter?

original: gang rkang pa gnyis la 'dug ste sems pa'o zhes pa ni lcags sgrog lta bu'i sems te lcags sgrog ni rkang pa gnyis 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: gang rkang pa gnyis la 'dug ste sems pa'o zhes pa ni lcags sgrog lta bu'i sems te lcags sgrog ni rkang pa gnyis 'dzin par byed de /
translated: It is that by which one sits with one's two feet bound.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang yod pa dang med pa'i tshig gi mtha' gnyis 'dzin pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang yod pa dang med pa'i tshig gi mtha' gnyis 'dzin pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
translated: In the same way, this thought is the cultivation of the Dharma which is the apprehension of the two extremes of existence and non-existence.

original: de lcags sgrog gis rkang pa gnyis 'dzin pa sems kyis mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa'i dper ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lcags sgrog gis rkang pa gnyis 'dzin pa sems kyis mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa'i dper ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is the example of the two extremes of apprehension by the mind like the apprehension of the two feet by the fetter?

original: rgya gar skad du rkang pa la p'a da zhes bya /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du rkang pa la p'a da zhes bya /
translated: In the Indian language, the foot is called pada.

original: tshig la yang p'a da zhes bya ste mthun no //
analyzed: tshig la yang p'a da zhes bya ste mthun no //
translated: And the word is also called pada.

original: sprin gyi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: sprin gyi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cloud-like thought?

original: gang chu dag la sems pa'o zhes pa ni sprin lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang chu dag la sems pa'o zhes pa ni sprin lta bu'i sems te /
translated: That which thinks of water. This is the cloud-like thought.

original: sprin ni chu 'du zhing chu'i bya ba byed de de bzhin du sems de yang chu'i bya ba byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: sprin ni chu 'du zhing chu'i bya ba byed de de bzhin du sems de yang chu'i bya ba byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
translated: A cloud collects water and performs the function of water. In the same way, this thought is the cultivation of the Dharma which performs the function of water.

original: zhing gi sems gang zhe na rang gi lus nyid yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'o zhes pa ni zhing lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: zhing gi sems gang zhe na rang gi lus nyid yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'o zhes pa ni zhing lta bu'i sems te /
translated: What is the field-like thought? That which purifies one's own body. This is the field-like thought.

original: zhing ni 'bru la sogs pa skye bar bya ba'i phyir rmos pa la sogs pa'i byi dor gyi las byed do //
analyzed: zhing ni 'bru la sogs pa skye bar bya ba'i phyir rmos pa la sogs pa'i byi dor gyi las byed do //
translated: A field is tilled by plowing, etc. in order to produce grain, etc.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag gi lus bzang por bya ba'i phyir khrus dang byug pa dang / rgyan la sogs pas bdag gi lus brgyan par byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag gi lus bzang por bya ba'i phyir khrus dang byug pa dang / rgyan la sogs pas bdag gi lus brgyan par byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the mind is like a barber, because it attends to the Dharma in order to beautify the body with bathing, anointing, and ornaments.

original: lan tshva'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: lan tshva'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind like salt?

original: gang zhig gang gis sems par byed pa de la yang sems par byed pa'o zhes pa ni lan tshva lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis sems par byed pa de la yang sems par byed pa'o zhes pa ni lan tshva lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The mind is like salt, because it is the salt of whatever is thought.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i snod kyi nang du lan tshva gzhan na snod de yang lan tshvas zos nas byang ste rdol pa dang lan tshva'i ror 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i snod kyi nang du lan tshva gzhan na snod de yang lan tshvas zos nas byang ste rdol pa dang lan tshva'i ror 'gyur ro //
translated: When salt is put in a vessel, the vessel becomes salty, and when the vessel is broken, the salt is scattered and becomes the taste of the vessel.

original: de bzhin du sems des kyang gang gi dngos po la dmigs shing rtog la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems des kyang gang gi dngos po la dmigs shing rtog la /
translated: Likewise, the mind is the salt of whatever entity it observes and conceives.

original: rtog pa'i sems de nyid yis skad cig ma phyi ma'i cha la rtog pa des sun phung nas med par byed pa'i chos @286a * //🔽bsten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa'i sems de nyid yis skad cig ma phyi ma'i cha la rtog pa des sun phung nas med par byed pa'i chos @286a * // bsten par byed pa'o //
translated: The mind is like a razor, because it attends to the Dharma in order to shave off the hair of afflictions.

original: spu gri'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: spu gri'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind like a razor?

original: gang rab tu byung ba tsam la bsten pa'o zhes pa ni spu gri lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang rab tu byung ba tsam la bsten pa'o zhes pa ni spu gri lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The mind like a razor is that which relies on mere ordination.

original: spu gri ni rab tu byung ba'i skra 'dreg pa tsam gyi bya ba byed de /
analyzed: spu gri ni rab tu byung ba'i skra 'dreg pa tsam gyi bya ba byed de /
translated: A razor performs the function of shaving the hair of the ordained.

original: rab tu byung ba las gzhan nan tan ni mi byed do //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba las gzhan nan tan ni mi byed do //
translated: It does not perform any other function than that of the ordained.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang rab tu byung te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang rab tu byung te /
translated: Similarly, that mind also is ordained.

original: skra bregs nas rab tu byung ba tsam la gnas kyi rab tu byung ba'i bslab pa'i nan tan tshul khrims bsrung pa la sogs pa mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: skra bregs nas rab tu byung ba tsam la gnas kyi rab tu byung ba'i bslab pa'i nan tan tshul khrims bsrung pa la sogs pa mi byed pa'o //
translated: It abides in the mere ordination of shaving the hair and so on, but does not perform the function of the ordained, such as maintaining ethical discipline.

original: ri rab lta bu'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: ri rab lta bu'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind like Mount Meru?

original: gang mtho bar gyur nas sems pa'o zhes pa ni ri rab lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang mtho bar gyur nas sems pa'o zhes pa ni ri rab lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is the mind that thinks of itself as lofty.

original: ri rab ni dpag tshad stong phrag brgyad bcur gyen du mtho zhing 'phags te /
analyzed: ri rab ni dpag tshad stong phrag brgyad bcur gyen du mtho zhing 'phags te /
translated: Mount Meru is lofty and exalted, rising eighty thousand yojanas into the air.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag gi yon tan gyis kun nas 'phags so snyam nas 'gying zhing che bar byed pa'i chos bsten par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag gi yon tan gyis kun nas 'phags so snyam nas 'gying zhing che bar byed pa'i chos bsten par byed do //
translated: Similarly, that mind thinks, “I am exalted by my own good qualities,” and it cultivates the qualities of pride and self-importance.

original: rgya mtsho lta bu'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgya mtsho lta bu'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ocean-like thought?

original: gang rang gi lus nyid la mchog tu 'dzin cing 'dug pa'o zhes pa ni rgya mtsho lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang rang gi lus nyid la mchog tu 'dzin cing 'dug pa'o zhes pa ni rgya mtsho lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is the thought which, while remaining in the body, is the best.

original: rgya mtsho ni rang gi rlabs kyis bdag nyid la rlob cing reg par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho ni rang gi rlabs kyis bdag nyid la rlob cing reg par byed pa'o //
translated: The ocean is that which, by its own waves, is agitated and touched by itself.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag nyid kyi lus la mi rtag pa dang stong pa la sogs par rtog go //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag nyid kyi lus la mi rtag pa dang stong pa la sogs par rtog go //
translated: In the same way, this thought, by itself, considers the body as impermanent, empty, etc.

original: phug lta bu'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: phug lta bu'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cave-like thought?

original: gang sngar nges par gyur pa la gyis de nyid kyis 'gyur bar bsten pa'o zhes pa ni phug lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang sngar nges par gyur pa la gyis de nyid kyis 'gyur bar bsten pa'o zhes pa ni phug lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is the thought which, having previously become certain, is intent on that certainty.

original: phug ni sgo na chung ngur nges pa las phug gi nang ni sgo las rnam pa du mar che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phug ni sgo na chung ngur nges pa las phug gi nang ni sgo las rnam pa du mar che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The cave is that which, having a small opening, has an interior which is very large in many ways.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang sngar bdag nyid tshul khrims dang / yon tan dang ldan pa nges par gnas pa las tshul khrims dang yon tan de nyid kyis dregs nas de'i gzhis nga rgyal byed cing 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang sngar bdag nyid tshul khrims dang / yon tan dang ldan pa nges par gnas pa las tshul khrims dang yon tan de nyid kyis dregs nas de'i gzhis nga rgyal byed cing 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Likewise, the mind also is the same as before, when it is definitely abiding with morality and good qualities, but through that very morality and good qualities it becomes conceited and through that basis it becomes proud.

original: de la skye ba gyur pa'i sems gang zhe na /🔽gang gi sems gang kho na dang skyes pa de kho na dang lhan cig 'gro ba'o zhes pa ni skye bar gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te /
analyzed: de la skye ba gyur pa'i sems gang zhe na / gang gi sems gang kho na dang skyes pa de kho na dang lhan cig 'gro ba'o zhes pa ni skye bar gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te /
translated: What is the mind that has arisen?🔽The mind that has arisen is the mind that is born together with whatever mind it is born with.

original: sngon dge ba dang mi dge ba gang yang rung ba la spyad pa'i bag chags yod pas gang du skyes na yang bag chags de nyid dang lhan cig tu skye'o //
analyzed: sngon dge ba dang mi dge ba gang yang rung ba la spyad pa'i bag chags yod pas gang du skyes na yang bag chags de nyid dang lhan cig tu skye'o //
translated: The mind that has arisen is the mind that has a nature of arising, because it has the latent tendencies of whatever virtue or nonvirtue it has practiced. Wherever it is born, it is born together with those very latent tendencies.

original: yang na sngon gyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las gang yang rung ba'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu mi 'dra ba'i skye ba rnyed nas de lta bu dang lhan cig tu skye ba ste /
analyzed: yang na sngon gyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las gang yang rung ba'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu mi 'dra ba'i skye ba rnyed nas de lta bu dang lhan cig tu skye ba ste /
translated: Or, it is born together with whatever nonvirtuous karma it has previously accumulated, because it has obtained a birth that is the dissimilar result of that karma.

original: dper na tshe rabs snga ma la srog @286b gcod pa goms shing mang du byas pas tshe phyi ma la nad mang zhing tshe thung bar 'gyur ba ste de bzhin du dge ba la yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na tshe rabs snga ma la srog @286b gcod pa goms shing mang du byas pas tshe phyi ma la nad mang zhing tshe thung bar 'gyur ba ste de bzhin du dge ba la yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: For example, in a previous life, if one has become accustomed to and has done much killing, in the next life one will have many illnesses and a short life. In the same way, one should apply this as appropriate to virtue.

original: 'jig rten pa'i sems brgya drug cu bskal pa gsum gyis 'das nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems skye ste zhes pa la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sems brgya drug cu bskal pa gsum gyis 'das nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems skye ste zhes pa la /
translated: It is said that after one has passed through three eons with the one hundred and sixty worldly minds, the supramundane mind arises.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The supramundane mind is also of two types:

original: gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'i sems zag pa med pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i sems zag pa med pa rnam pa med pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'i sems zag pa med pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i sems zag pa med pa rnam pa med pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: the mind that is uncontaminated and has aspects, which is the realization of the selflessness of persons, and the mind that is uncontaminated and has no aspects, which is the naturally luminous realization of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de la skabs 'dir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa ni gang zag rnams kyis shes par nus sam zhe na /
analyzed: de la skabs 'dir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa ni gang zag rnams kyis shes par nus sam zhe na /
translated: In this context, can the supramundane consciousness be known by persons?

original: de ni rtog ge pa de dag gis ni mi nus te de bas na /
analyzed: de ni rtog ge pa de dag gis ni mi nus te de bas na /
translated: It cannot be known by those logicians. Therefore,

original: rtog ge kun gyis shes par dka' //
analyzed: rtog ge kun gyis shes par dka' //
translated: It is difficult to understand through all reasoning.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis sngon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis sngon bstan pa'o //
translated: It was taught by the Buddhas in the past.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar rtog ge pa rnams kyis kyang shes par mi nus na sus shes par nus she na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar rtog ge pa rnams kyis kyang shes par mi nus na sus shes par nus she na /
translated: If it cannot be understood even by logicians, who can understand it?

original: rtog ge pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin gyi //
analyzed: rtog ge pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin gyi //
translated: It is not the domain of logicians.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mkhyen te gsungs pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mkhyen te gsungs pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: It was known and taught by the Blessed Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis sngon zhes pa ni da ltar 'ba' zhig gis bshad pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis sngon zhes pa ni da ltar 'ba' zhig gis bshad pa ma yin gyi /
translated: As for taught by the Buddhas in the past, it is not only taught in the present.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang tshul 'di ltar mkhyen nas bshad pa'o zhes pa ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mkhyen ba gcig par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang tshul 'di ltar mkhyen nas bshad pa'o zhes pa ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mkhyen ba gcig par bstan pa'o //
translated: It was known and taught by the Buddhas of the past in this way. This shows that the Blessed Buddhas have the same knowledge.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / chos kyi sku dang 'gro ba'i don mdzad par gcig pas mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / chos kyi sku dang 'gro ba'i don mdzad par gcig pas mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the same in terms of the accumulation of merit and wisdom, the Dharma body, and the performance of benefit for beings.

original: nyes pa thams cad rnam spangs pa //
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad rnam spangs pa //
translated: He is free from all faults.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar zab cing zhi ba'i gang zag la bdag med par rtogs de nyon mongs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar zab cing zhi ba'i gang zag la bdag med par rtogs de nyon mongs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that the person who is thus profound and peaceful, who has realized the selflessness of the person, is free from the afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po //🔽de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems la gnas pa rnams la yang phung po la yod do snyam pa'i blo nye bar skye'o zhes pa ni de ltar gang zag la bdag med pa rnam pa dang bcas pa zab cing zhi ba 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po // de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems la gnas pa rnams la yang phung po la yod do snyam pa'i blo nye bar skye'o zhes pa ni de ltar gang zag la bdag med pa rnam pa dang bcas pa zab cing zhi ba 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems
translated: Lord of the Secret Ones!🔽 Even those who abide in the supramundane mind may have the thought The aggregates exist.

original: la gnas pa na gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis phung po tsam zhig yod par rtog gi //🔽gang zag la ni bdag med par rtogs te de ni bskal pa @287a * //
analyzed: la gnas pa na gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis phung po tsam zhig yod par rtog gi // gang zag la ni bdag med par rtogs te de ni bskal pa @287a * //
translated: This means that even those who abide in the supramundane mind, which is profound and peaceful and endowed with the aspects of the selflessness of the person, may think that the mere aggregates exist, as explained above.

original: gsum gyis rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum gyis rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: But they realize that the person is selfless. They will complete this in three eons.

original: phung po dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba bskyed pa zhes pa nas rnal 'byor pa dag bshal pa gcig gis 'da' bar byed do zhes pa'i bar ni de ltar phung po la spyir brtags te /
analyzed: phung po dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba bskyed pa zhes pa nas rnal 'byor pa dag bshal pa gcig gis 'da' bar byed do zhes pa'i bar ni de ltar phung po la spyir brtags te /
translated: The passage from “One who is free from attachment to the aggregates” up to “yogis transcend them with a single blow” means that having generally investigated the aggregates in that way,

original: brtags pa na de la dngos po yod do snyam du blo skyes pa de phung po so sor phye ste sun phyung ba na gzugs kyi phung po ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra ste ji ltar dbu ba la so sor gzhigs na dbu ba la snying po med
analyzed: brtags pa na de la dngos po yod do snyam du blo skyes pa de phung po so sor phye ste sun phyung ba na gzugs kyi phung po ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra ste ji ltar dbu ba la so sor gzhigs na dbu ba la snying po med
translated: when they are investigated, the thought arises that they are real things. When they are refuted by differentiating the aggregates, the form aggregate is like a lump of foam. Just as when foam is broken down into its parts, there is no essence to the foam,

original: pa bzhin du phung po de yang bshig ste so sor brtags na kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa chos so so ba rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid tsam du zad kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i dngos po gang yang med par shes so //
analyzed: pa bzhin du phung po de yang bshig ste so sor brtags na kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa chos so so ba rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid tsam du zad kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i dngos po gang yang med par shes so //
translated: in the same way, when that aggregate is destroyed and investigated, it is understood that it is just the mere characteristics of individual phenomena, such as color and shape, and there is no thing at all called an aggregate.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba ni chu'i chu bur dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba ni chu'i chu bur dang 'dra ste /
translated: Similarly, feeling is like a water bubble.

original: byung ma thag tu zhig cing med par 'gyur ba mi rtag pas 'dug pa'i gnas med pa la phung por brtags pa'i dngos po gang yang med par shes so //
analyzed: byung ma thag tu zhig cing med par 'gyur ba mi rtag pas 'dug pa'i gnas med pa la phung por brtags pa'i dngos po gang yang med par shes so //
translated: Since it is impermanent, disintegrating and ceasing as soon as it arises, it has no place to stay.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i phung po yang so sor gshig  na rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i phung po yang so sor gshig  na rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma dang 'dra ste /
translated: In the same way, when the aggregate of consciousness is broken down, consciousness is like an illusion.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma'i bal glang la sogs te /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma'i bal glang la sogs te /
translated: Just as an illusory elephant, etc.

original: de dag la bal glang yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag la bal glang yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: is not an elephant,

original: de dag gi rang bzhin ni sman dang shing bu la sogs par zad do //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin ni sman dang shing bu la sogs par zad do //
translated: but is just a medicine, a stick, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is also like that.

original: phung por ba rtags pa'o ;
analyzed: phung por ba rtags pa'o ;
translated: It is imputed as an aggregate.

original: / dngos po yod pa ma yin gyi de ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
analyzed: / dngos po yod pa ma yin gyi de ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
translated: It is not a real entity, but is just the nature of consciousness.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po yang so sor gzhigs na smig rgyu dang 'dra ste ji ltar skom pas gdungs pa'i skyes bus smig rgyu la chur mthong mod kyi /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po yang so sor gzhigs na smig rgyu dang 'dra ste ji ltar skom pas gdungs pa'i skyes bus smig rgyu la chur mthong mod kyi /
translated: When the aggregate of perception is broken down, it is like a mirage. Just as a person tormented by thirst sees a mirage as water,

original: de la chu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la chu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no real entity of water there,

original: smig rgyu'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
analyzed: smig rgyu'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
translated: but it is just the nature of a mirage.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The aggregate of perception is also like that.

original: 'du shes kyi phung por brtags pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung por brtags pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the entity imputed as the aggregate of perception does not exist,

original: de ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
translated: but it is just the nature of apprehending signs.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed kyi phung po yang chu shing gi snying po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed kyi phung po yang chu shing gi snying po dang 'dra ste /
translated: In the same way, the aggregate of compositional factors is like the core of a plantain tree,

original: kun du grags pas 'dir ma smos so //
analyzed: kun du grags pas 'dir ma smos so //
translated: but it is well known, so it is not mentioned here.

original: de ltar phung po de yang dbu bal sogs pa'i dpes sun phyung nas phung por brtags pa'i dngos po yod par mi 'gyur te so so'i mtshan nyid du zad do //
analyzed: de ltar phung po de yang dbu bal sogs pa'i dpes sun phyung nas phung por brtags pa'i dngos po yod par mi 'gyur te so so'i mtshan nyid du zad do //
translated: Thus, after refuting the aggregates with the examples of foam and so on, the entity imputed as the aggregates does not exist, but they are exhausted as individual characteristics.

original: de ltar phung por yod par ma grub na khams dang skye mched rnams kyang dngos po las gzhan ma yin pas khams dang @287b skye mched du brtags pa'i dngos po yod po ma yin gyi de rnams chos so so pa'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de ltar phung por yod par ma grub na khams dang skye mched rnams kyang dngos po las gzhan ma yin pas khams dang @287b skye mched du brtags pa'i dngos po yod po ma yin gyi de rnams chos so so pa'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
translated: Thus, if the aggregates are not established as existing, the elements and sense bases are also not things other than entities. Therefore, the entities imputed as elements and sense bases do not exist. They are merely the individual natures of phenomena.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yang ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yang ste /
translated: Also, the apprehended and the apprehender🔽are imputed as entities.

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni gzung pa'i dngos por brtags /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni gzung pa'i dngos por brtags /
translated: The form aggregate is imputed as the entity of the apprehended.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi ni 'dzin par brtags pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi ni 'dzin par brtags pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The four aggregates of feeling and so on are imputed as the entity of the apprehender. They do not exist.

original: chos so so ba'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
analyzed: chos so so ba'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
translated: They are merely the individual natures of phenomena.

original: de ltar phung po la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems bskyed nas dbu ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du bshig cing bsgoms pas phung po la yod do snyam pa'i phung por 'dzin pa'i blo skyes pa de las kyang grol bar 'gyur te de bas na nam phung
analyzed: de ltar phung po la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems bskyed nas dbu ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du bshig cing bsgoms pas phung po la yod do snyam pa'i phung por 'dzin pa'i blo skyes pa de las kyang grol bar 'gyur te de bas na nam phung
translated: Thus, having generated a mind free from attachment to the aggregates, by destroying them as having the nature of foam and so on and meditating on them, one is also liberated from the thought that arises, “The aggregates exist,” which is the mind that apprehends the aggregates. Therefore, at some point, the mind that apprehends the aggregates will be liberated.

original: po dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba bskyed pa de'i tshe dbu ba dang chu'i chu bur dang / sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang mtshungs par bsgoms pas rnam par grol bar 'gyur te zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: po dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba bskyed pa de'i tshe dbu ba dang chu'i chu bur dang / sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang mtshungs par bsgoms pas rnam par grol bar 'gyur te zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: When one generates freedom from attachment to the desire realm, one is liberated by meditating on them as being like a bubble on water, a mirage, an illusion, or a magical creation.

original: de ltar phung po las rnam par grol nas phung po la sogs par brtags pa'i mtshan nyid chos rnams kyi ngo bo'i rang bzhin tsam 'ba' zhig yod par rtog pa gzhung las gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar phung po las rnam par grol nas phung po la sogs par brtags pa'i mtshan nyid chos rnams kyi ngo bo'i rang bzhin tsam 'ba' zhig yod par rtog pa gzhung las gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, having been liberated from the aggregates, one realizes that there is only the mere nature of the entities of phenomena, which are imputed as aggregates and so on. The treatise says:

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa chos nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo zhi ba'i dbyings rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa chos nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo zhi ba'i dbyings rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
translated: “The nature of reality, the pacified dhātu, is realized by abandoning the aggregates, constituents, and sense bases, as well as apprehended and apprehender.”

original: de la phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang ; / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa zhes pa ni gong du phung po la sogs par brtags pa'i dngos po sun phyung ba'i tshul gyis chos nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa la brtags pa'i dngos por yod pa ma🔽yin pas rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de la phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang ; / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa zhes pa ni gong du phung po la sogs par brtags pa'i dngos po sun phyung ba'i tshul gyis chos nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa la brtags pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin pas rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: This is because the way to refute the entities that are imputed to the aggregates and so on was explained above.

original: de bas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa zhes pa yang gzugs kyi phung po la gzung bar brtags pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi la 'dzin pa'i dngos por rnam par brtags pa de rnam par spangs pa la bya'i /
analyzed: de bas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa zhes pa yang gzugs kyi phung po la gzung bar brtags pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi la 'dzin pa'i dngos por rnam par brtags pa de rnam par spangs pa la bya'i /
translated: Therefore, the phrase “free from apprehended objects and apprehending subjects” should be understood to mean that the imputation of form as an apprehended object and the imputation of the four aggregates that are feeling and so on as an apprehending subject are abandoned.

original: chos la bdag med par rtog ba'i mtshan nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par spangs ba la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par rtog ba'i mtshan nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par spangs ba la ni mi bya'o //
translated: However, it does not mean that the nature of phenomena is free from apprehended objects and apprehending subjects in the sense that it is characterized by the realization of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: chos nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo zhes pa de la chos ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo zhes pa de la chos ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The intrinsic nature of reality refers to the nature of the aggregates, etc.

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo chos nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo chos nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: That is the intrinsic nature of reality.

original: de yang sngon po dang dmar po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: de yang sngon po dang dmar po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: Moreover, it is the nature of blue, yellow, etc.

original: de ltar sngon po dang dmar po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tsam @288a * //
analyzed: de ltar sngon po dang dmar po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tsam @288a * //
translated: Thus, there is only the mere nature of blue, yellow, etc.

original: 'ba' zhig yod kyi phung po la sogs pa'i dngos por brtags pa'i dngos po med par rtog pa ni zhi ba'i dbyings rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig yod kyi phung po la sogs pa'i dngos por brtags pa'i dngos po med par rtog pa ni zhi ba'i dbyings rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The understanding that the entity imagined as the aggregates, etc. does not exist is called the realization of the sphere of peace.

original: zhi ba zhes pa ni sems kyi rgyud de la phung po la sogs par brtags pa'i 'khrul pa med pas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes pa ni sems kyi rgyud de la phung po la sogs par brtags pa'i 'khrul pa med pas zhi ba'o //
translated: Peace refers to the absence of error in the mind-stream that imagines the aggregates, etc.

original: dbyings ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dbyings ni rang bzhin no //
translated: Sphere refers to nature.

original: rtogs pa ni de lta bu'i tshul du khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni de lta bu'i tshul du khong du chud pa'o //
translated: Realization refers to the understanding of such a mode.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po //
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po //
translated: Lord of the Secret Ones!

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems phyin ci log dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i sems kyis khyad par brgyad dang 'brel pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems phyin ci log dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i sems kyis khyad par brgyad dang 'brel pa /
translated: The supramundane mind is related to eight distinctions, and it is free from the net of karma and afflictions.🔽This is the mind of yogins that transcends in one eon.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dra ba dang bral ba 'di ni rnal 'byor pa dag bskal pa gcig gis 'da' bar byed do zhes pa ni phung por brtags pa'i dngos po yod par 'dzin pa las grol nas chos rnams kyi so so'i rang bzhin tsam 'ba' zhig yod
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dra ba dang bral ba 'di ni rnal 'byor pa dag bskal pa gcig gis 'da' bar byed do zhes pa ni phung por brtags pa'i dngos po yod par 'dzin pa las grol nas chos rnams kyi so so'i rang bzhin tsam 'ba' zhig yod
translated: This is the mind that, having been freed from the apprehension of the existence of things imputed as the aggregates, realizes that there is only the mere individual nature of phenomena.

original: par rtog pa'i sems zhi ba de /
analyzed: par rtog pa'i sems zhi ba de /
translated: This mind of peace🔽engages in the realization that there is no entity in the aggregates and so on, and that there is only the individual nature of phenomena, such as blue and so on.

original: phung po la dngos po med pa nas brtsams te chos rnams kyi so so'i rang bzhin sngon po la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad par rtog pa la zhugs nas bskal pa gcig gis sems de nyid las 'das te chos la bdag med par rtogs pa mos pas
analyzed: phung po la dngos po med pa nas brtsams te chos rnams kyi so so'i rang bzhin sngon po la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad par rtog pa la zhugs nas bskal pa gcig gis sems de nyid las 'das te chos la bdag med par rtogs pa mos pas
translated: In one eon, it transcends that mind and realizes the selflessness of phenomena through aspiration.

original: spyod pa'i sa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyod pa'i sa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: It enters the level of engagement through aspiration.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa'i khyad par brgyad dang zhes ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa la zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i bar gyi sems brgyad la bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa'i khyad par brgyad dang zhes ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa la zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i bar gyi sems brgyad la bya ste /
translated: The eight distinctions of the supramundane mind as being mistaken and unmistaken refer to the eight minds from the one entering the stream up to the arhat.

original: sems de dag phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa yang phung po la sogs par brtags pa'i dngos po yod bar 'dzin pas phyin ci log pa'o //
analyzed: sems de dag phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa yang phung po la sogs par brtags pa'i dngos po yod bar 'dzin pas phyin ci log pa'o //
translated: These minds are mistaken because they apprehend the existence of things imputed as aggregates and so on.

original: nyon mongs spangs pas phyin ci ma log pa'o//
analyzed: nyon mongs spangs pas phyin ci ma log pa'o//
translated: They are unmistaken because they abandon the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang bcas pas na log pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang bcas pas na log pa'o //
translated: They are mistaken because they possess the latent afflictions.

original: 'brel pa zhes pa ni phung po la bdag med par rtogs pa'i sems zhi ba de phung po la yod par 'dzin pa'i sems kyi rim pa brgyad po des bskyed pa la bya ste de lta bas na /
analyzed: 'brel pa zhes pa ni phung po la bdag med par rtogs pa'i sems zhi ba de phung po la yod par 'dzin pa'i sems kyi rim pa brgyad po des bskyed pa la bya ste de lta bas na /
translated: The connection is that the mind of peace that realizes the selflessness of the aggregates is produced by those eight stages of mind that apprehend the existence of the aggregates.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems de phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa'i sems kyi khyad par brgyad dang 'brel pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems de phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa'i sems kyi khyad par brgyad dang 'brel pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: That supramundane mind is related to the eight distinctions of mind that are erroneous and non-erroneous.

original: de dag ni sngags kyi spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul po rnams gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'i rim gyis sems brgya drug cu la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam spong @288b ba'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sngags kyi spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul po rnams gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'i rim gyis sems brgya drug cu la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam spong @288b ba'i rim pa'o //
translated: These are the stages of the bodhisattvas who practice the mantra conduct, who are of dull faculties, and who, by the stages of realizing the selflessness of the person, abandon the afflictions of the one hundred and sixty moments of mind and so on.

original: da ni sngags kyi sgor spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen pos bgrod pa gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa shes rab rnon po rnams chos dang gang zag gnyis ka la bdag med par sgom zhing mos pas spyod pa'i sa la 'jug pa'i rim🔽pa bshad de /
analyzed: da ni sngags kyi sgor spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen pos bgrod pa gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa shes rab rnon po rnams chos dang gang zag gnyis ka la bdag med par sgom zhing mos pas spyod pa'i sa la 'jug pa'i rim🔽pa bshad de /
translated: Now, the stages of entering the bhūmi of devoted engagement of the bodhisattvas who practice the mantra gateway, who are of sharp faculties, who are not guided by others in the Mahāyāna, and who meditate on the selflessness of both persons and phenomena will be explained.

original: de yang gsad ba pa'i bdag po theg pa chen pos bgrod pa gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa rnams la chos la bdag med pa'i sems skye'o zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po la zhugs pa thos pa rab tu mang shing shes rab mchog
analyzed: de yang gsad ba pa'i bdag po theg pa chen pos bgrod pa gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa rnams la chos la bdag med pa'i sems skye'o zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po la zhugs pa thos pa rab tu mang shing shes rab mchog
translated: Moreover, the thought of the selflessness of phenomena arises in the lords of the killers who are not guided by others and who proceed by the Mahayana.

original: tu rno ba gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par rang gi blos chos rnams sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du shes nas chos la bdag med par rtogs par 'gyur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: tu rno ba gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par rang gi blos chos rnams sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du shes nas chos la bdag med par rtogs par 'gyur ba la bya'o //
translated: This refers to bodhisattvas who have entered the Mahayana, who have heard much, who have supreme wisdom, who are not guided by others, who understand phenomena to be like illusions, mirages, and so on, and who understand the selflessness of phenomena through their own intellect.

original: de la gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'i rim pa bskal pa gsum gyis 'da' bar bya ba dang / gang zag la bdag med kyang phung po tsam yod par 'du shes pa yang bskal pa gcig gis spang par bya dgos na /
analyzed: de la gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'i rim pa bskal pa gsum gyis 'da' bar bya ba dang / gang zag la bdag med kyang phung po tsam yod par 'du shes pa yang bskal pa gcig gis spang par bya dgos na /
translated: In the process of understanding the selflessness of the person, one must pass through three eons, and even the conception that the mere aggregates exist, although they are selfless, must be abandoned in one eon.

original: de dag gi bya ba ma byas par ji ltar chos la bdag med pa rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi bya ba ma byas par ji ltar chos la bdag med pa rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can one understand the selflessness of phenomena without having performed the activities of those eons?

original: lan ni / de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar de dag sngon spyad pa spyod cing phung po'i gnas rnam par 'jig pa na ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu'i 'du shes skyes so zhes pa ni sngon spyad pa spyod cing phung po'i gnas rnam par bshig nas sgyu ma dang smig rgyu zhes pa ni dang por dad pas rtsol zhing 'jug pa'i spyod pa spyad pa na phung po'i rang bzhin sgyu
analyzed: lan ni / de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de dag sngon spyad pa spyod cing phung po'i gnas rnam par 'jig pa na ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu'i 'du shes skyes so zhes pa ni sngon spyad pa spyod cing phung po'i gnas rnam par bshig nas sgyu ma dang smig rgyu zhes pa ni dang por dad pas rtsol zhing 'jug pa'i spyod pa spyad pa na phung po'i rang bzhin sgyu
translated: Why is that?🔽Because when they previously practiced the bodhisattva deeds and destroyed the bases of the aggregates, they generated the perception that they are like illusions, mirages, reflections, echoes, fire wheels, and cities of gandharvas.🔽When they previously practiced the bodhisattva deeds and destroyed the bases of the aggregates, they generated the perception that they are like illusions, mirages, reflections, echoes, fire wheels, and cities of gandharvas.🔽This means that when they first engaged in the conduct of faith and exertion, they understood and realized that the nature of the aggregates is like illusions and so forth.

original: ma la sogs pa lta bur shes shing go mas par byas pas gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'i rim pa ma spyad kyang chos la bdag med par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ma la sogs pa lta bur shes shing go mas par byas pas gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'i rim pa ma spyad kyang chos la bdag med par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, even though they did not practice the stages of realizing the selflessness of persons, they came to realize the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de la sgyu ma zhes pa ni chos rnams la sgyu ma lta bur 'du shes skyes te sgyu ma'i bal glang dang rta la sogs ba rdo dang shing la sogs pa las byas kyang rdo shing rnams su mi mngon par bal glang dang rta la sogs pa'i gzugs
analyzed: de la sgyu ma zhes pa ni chos rnams la sgyu ma lta bur 'du shes skyes te sgyu ma'i bal glang dang rta la sogs ba rdo dang shing la sogs pa las byas kyang rdo shing rnams su mi mngon par bal glang dang rta la sogs pa'i gzugs
translated: The illusion in this context is the perception of phenomena as being like illusions. Although illusory elephants, horses, and so on are created from things like stones and wood, the stones and wood are not perceived as such.

original: su snang mod kyi yang dag par na bal glang dang rta la sogs pa'i dngos po yod pa ma min te rdo shing la sogs pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: su snang mod kyi yang dag par na bal glang dang rta la sogs pa'i dngos po yod pa ma min te rdo shing la sogs pa tsam du zad do //
translated: The forms of elephants, horses, and so on appear. However, in reality, there are no things such as elephants and horses. They are simply stones and wood.

original: de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams snang yang rnam @289a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams snang yang rnam @289a * //
translated: In the same way, although phenomena such as the aggregates appear,

original: par shes par 'khrul pa'i dbang gis snang ste /
analyzed: par shes par 'khrul pa'i dbang gis snang ste /
translated: they appear due to the power of the delusion of consciousness.

original: yang dag par na chos kyi ngo bo sgyu ma'i bal glang dang 'dra ste snang du zin kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par na chos kyi ngo bo sgyu ma'i bal glang dang 'dra ste snang du zin kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In reality, the essence of phenomena is like an illusory elephant. Although it appears, it does not exist.

original: rnam par shes pa de ni rdo dang shing la sogs pa dang 'dra ste mi mngon yang gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i chos rnams ni yod ba ma yin gyi rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa'i rnam pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de ni rdo dang shing la sogs pa dang 'dra ste mi mngon yang gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i chos rnams ni yod ba ma yin gyi rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa'i rnam pa tsam du zad do //
translated: Consciousness is like a stone or a piece of wood, and so on, in that it is not manifest. The phenomena that appear as form and so on do not exist. They are simply the aspects of deluded consciousness.

original: de bzhin du smig rgyu yang 'brog dgon pa na skyes bu skom gyis gdungs pas smig rgyu la chur mthong ste chu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin na smig rgyu tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du smig rgyu yang 'brog dgon pa na skyes bu skom gyis gdungs pas smig rgyu la chur mthong ste chu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin na smig rgyu tsam du zad do //
translated: In the same way, a mirage is seen as water by a person tormented by thirst in a desert. There is no real water there, it is simply a mirage.

original: de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams sang yang yod pa ni ma yin gyi rnam pad shes pa 'khrul pa'i rnam pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams sang yang yod pa ni ma yin gyi rnam pad shes pa 'khrul pa'i rnam pa tsam du zad do //
translated: In the same way, the aggregates and so on do not exist, they are simply the aspects of deluded consciousness.

original: de bzhin du gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang / mgal me bskor ba dang / dri za'i grong khyer rnams kyang gong du sgyu ma la sogs pa bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang / mgal me bskor ba dang / dri za'i grong khyer rnams kyang gong du sgyu ma la sogs pa bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, reflections, echoes, a whirling firebrand, and a fairy city should be understood in the same way as illusions and so on were explained above.

original: mdor na phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams snang ba ni rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa'i snang ba tsam du zad do //
analyzed: mdor na phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams snang ba ni rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa'i snang ba tsam du zad do //
translated: In brief, the appearance of phenomena such as the aggregates is nothing but the appearance of the delusion of consciousness.

original: rmi lam na gzugs la sogs pa'i yul med na yang gzugs la sogs par mthong ba de dag gi bya ba byed mod kyi /
analyzed: rmi lam na gzugs la sogs pa'i yul med na yang gzugs la sogs par mthong ba de dag gi bya ba byed mod kyi /
translated: Even though there are no objects such as form in a dream, one sees such things as form and they perform a function.

original: rmi lam gyi tshe na gzugs la sogs pa med par gsal bar mngon te //🔽de dag thams cad rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis gyur pa tsam du zad do snyam nas de ltar mos pas spyod pa'i sa la zhugs nas phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams la bdag med par rtogs pa ni sgyu ma la sogs pa nas dri za'i grong
analyzed: rmi lam gyi tshe na gzugs la sogs pa med par gsal bar mngon te // de dag thams cad rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis gyur pa tsam du zad do snyam nas de ltar mos pas spyod pa'i sa la zhugs nas phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams la bdag med par rtogs pa ni sgyu ma la sogs pa nas dri za'i grong
translated: At the time of the dream, it is clear that form and so on do not exist.🔽Thinking that all of them are merely transformations by the power of consciousness, one enters the level of practice through devoted interest and realizes that phenomena such as the aggregates are selfless.

original: khyer la sogs pa lta bu'i 'du shes skyes te /
analyzed: khyer la sogs pa lta bu'i 'du shes skyes te /
translated: One generates the perception that they are like illusions and so on, up to like the cities of gandharvas.

original: chos rnams ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin mod kyi rnam par shes pa tsam yod par 'dzin te /
analyzed: chos rnams ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin mod kyi rnam par shes pa tsam yod par 'dzin te /
translated: One thinks that phenomena do not really exist but one holds that consciousness alone exists.

original: de lta bur chos la bdag med par rtogs pa mos pas spyod pa'i sa de la yang de lta bur chos rnams sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa'i tshul du 'jig cing 'jug pa'i sems dang / chos rnams de lta bur bshig nas de'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa la gnas pa'i sems dang ;
analyzed: de lta bur chos la bdag med par rtogs pa mos pas spyod pa'i sa de la yang de lta bur chos rnams sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa'i tshul du 'jig cing 'jug pa'i sems dang / chos rnams de lta bur bshig nas de'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa la gnas pa'i sems dang ;
translated: In the same way, on the level of earnest aspiration, which is the realization that phenomena have no identity, there is the mind that is engaged in and penetrates the understanding that phenomena are illusory, like mirages and so forth, and the mind that, having dismantled phenomena in this way, abides in the nonconceptual concentration.

original: de nas snying rje'i dbang gis pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam par spyod cing sa bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis shes nas de dag la rab tu mos par byed cing 'jug pa dang gnas
analyzed: de nas snying rje'i dbang gis pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam par spyod cing sa bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis shes nas de dag la rab tu mos par byed cing 'jug pa dang gnas
translated: Then, through the power of compassion, one engages in the practice of the transcendent perfections and so on, and with the wisdom that comes from listening, reflecting and meditating, one understands the qualities of the ten levels and so on, and one has interest in and engages in them.

original: pa dang ldang ba'i sems de gsum rnam par @289b bsgoms pas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan la sogs pa rnams yongs su me shes pa ni yongs su mi shes shing mngon du ma byas pa mnyan pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i shes rab
analyzed: pa dang ldang ba'i sems de gsum rnam par @289b bsgoms pas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan la sogs pa rnams yongs su me shes pa ni yongs su mi shes shing mngon du ma byas pa mnyan pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i shes rab
translated: Through cultivating these three—the mind of entering, abiding, and rising—one does not fully understand or actualize the qualities of the levels and transcendent perfections and so on.🔽The wisdom that comes from listening, reflecting and meditating on them, one realizes the absence of self in phenomena and apprehends that mere consciousness exists.

original: kyis chos la bdag med par rtogs shing rnam par shes pa tsam yod par 'dzin pa de ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i mtshan nyid de mos pas spyod pa'i sa de bskal pa gcig gis rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyis chos la bdag med par rtogs shing rnam par shes pa tsam yod par 'dzin pa de ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i mtshan nyid de mos pas spyod pa'i sa de bskal pa gcig gis rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the defining characteristic of the level of earnest aspiration and this level of earnest aspiration is completed in one eon.

original: de nas bskal pa'i bzhi cha gcig gis mos pas spyod pa'i sa de nas 'phar te /
analyzed: de nas bskal pa'i bzhi cha gcig gis mos pas spyod pa'i sa de nas 'phar te /
translated: Then, in one quarter of an eon, one rises above the level of earnest aspiration

original: ye shes kyi sa de la 'jug pa'i rim pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: ye shes kyi sa de la 'jug pa'i rim pa gsungs pa /
translated: and enters the levels of wisdom.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de'i phyir de dag gi sems kyi dbang du byas pas chos la bdag med pa nyid kyang spang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po de'i phyir de dag gi sems kyi dbang du byas pas chos la bdag med pa nyid kyang spang bar bya ba ste /
translated: Lord of the Secret Ones! Therefore, in terms of their minds, the absence of self in phenomena is also to be abandoned.

original: rang gi sems ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'o //
translated: One’s own mind is primordially unborn.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Lord of the Secret Ones, the mind is not perceived to have a prior limit or a later limit because of the thorough knowledge of its intrinsic reality.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir sems la sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs te rnal 'byor pa dag 'di yang bskal pa gnyis kyis 'da' bar byed do zhes pa'o //🔽de la de dag gi sems kyi dbang du byas pas chos la bdag med pa nyid kyang spang bar bya ba ste rang gi sems ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'o zhes pa ni sngar chos la bdag med par rtogs te rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig gzung
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir sems la sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs te rnal 'byor pa dag 'di yang bskal pa gnyis kyis 'da' bar byed do zhes pa'o // de la de dag gi sems kyi dbang du byas pas chos la bdag med pa nyid kyang spang bar bya ba ste rang gi sems ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'o zhes pa ni sngar chos la bdag med par rtogs te rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig gzung
translated: The yogins and yoginīs transcend this with two aeons.🔽In that regard, by means of their minds, they also abandon the selflessness of phenomena. One’s own mind is primordially unborn.🔽Previously, they realized the selflessness of phenomena, but they still thought that consciousness alone exists in the aspect of apprehender and apprehended.🔽Since that is also under their control, they realize that consciousness is primordially unborn.

original: ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yod par sems pa de yang rang gi dbang du gyur pas rnam par shes pa de gzod ma nas ma skyes par rtogs pas rnam par shes pa tsam du yod par 'du shes pa de yang spangs pas chos la bdag med pa
analyzed: ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yod par sems pa de yang rang gi dbang du gyur pas rnam par shes pa de gzod ma nas ma skyes par rtogs pas rnam par shes pa tsam du yod par 'du shes pa de yang spangs pas chos la bdag med pa
translated: Since they also abandon the conception that consciousness alone exists, they abandon the conception that the selflessness of phenomena exists.

original: nyid kyang spangs so //
analyzed: nyid kyang spangs so //
translated: He also abandons the notion of consciousness only.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa tsam du 'du shes pa de spangs pas chos la bdag med pa spangs zhes bya zhe na phung po la sogs pa rnams bdag med par rtogs pa'i rgyus rnam par shes pa tsam du yod par 'du shes skyes te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa tsam du 'du shes pa de spangs pas chos la bdag med pa spangs zhes bya zhe na phung po la sogs pa rnams bdag med par rtogs pa'i rgyus rnam par shes pa tsam du yod par 'du shes skyes te /
translated: Why is it that by abandoning the notion of consciousness only, one abandons the view that dharmas are not self? Because of the cause of understanding that the aggregates, etc., are not self, the notion arises that consciousness only exists.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa tsam yod par 'du shes pa de spangs na chos la bdag med pa nyid spangs ba yin te 'bras bu la rgyus btags pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa tsam yod par 'du shes pa de spangs na chos la bdag med pa nyid spangs ba yin te 'bras bu la rgyus btags pa'o //
translated: Therefore, when one abandons the notion that consciousness only exists, one abandons the view that dharmas are not self, because the effect is designated by the cause.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam yod par 'du shes pa de yang ji ltar spong zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam yod par 'du shes pa de yang ji ltar spong zhe na /
translated: How does one abandon the notion that consciousness only exists?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na gsang ba pa'i bdag po //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na gsang ba pa'i bdag po //
translated: Why is that? O Lord of Mysteries,

original: ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir sems la sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs te zhes gsungs pa yin @290a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir sems la sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs te zhes gsungs pa yin @290a * //
translated: because the essence is thoroughly understood, the mind is not perceived in terms of a prior limit or a posterior limit.

original: te ; / de ltar rang gi sems de thog ma gang nas skyes pa'i mtha' bcal na mtha' de mi rnyed la /
analyzed: te ; / de ltar rang gi sems de thog ma gang nas skyes pa'i mtha' bcal na mtha' de mi rnyed la /
translated: In this way, if one searches for the beginning of one’s mind, the beginning will not be found.

original: de ltar thog ma'i mtha' med pas tha ma 'gag pa'i mtha' yang rnyed par mi 'gyur te thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' mi rnyed do //
analyzed: de ltar thog ma'i mtha' med pas tha ma 'gag pa'i mtha' yang rnyed par mi 'gyur te thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' mi rnyed do //
translated: Since there is no beginning, the end of cessation will not be found either. The beginning and end will not be found.🔽Since there is no beginning, the mind is seen to be unborn. If it is unborn from the beginning, what is the consciousness that appears as the aspect of the apprehended and the aspect of the apprehender?

original: de ltar thog ma'i mtha' med pas sems de ma skyes par mngon te de ltar thog ma nas ma skyes na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i shes pa de gang na ci zhig yod snyam nas rnam par shes pa tsam yod par 'du shes pa
analyzed: de ltar thog ma'i mtha' med pas sems de ma skyes par mngon te de ltar thog ma nas ma skyes na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i shes pa de gang na ci zhig yod snyam nas rnam par shes pa tsam yod par 'du shes pa
translated: Thinking in this way, the notion that mere consciousness exists is abandoned.

original: de spangs pas chos la bdag med pa yang spangs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de spangs pas chos la bdag med pa yang spangs zhes bya'o //
translated: By abandoning that, the selflessness of phenomena is also abandoned.

original: de lta bu'i tshul du sgom zhing chos la bdag med pa spong pa yang bskal pa gnyis kyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul du sgom zhing chos la bdag med pa spong pa yang bskal pa gnyis kyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the meditation and the abandonment of the selflessness of phenomena will be completed in two eons.

original: da ni rab tu dga' ba'i sa byang chub kyi sems skye ba'i rim pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rab tu dga' ba'i sa byang chub kyi sems skye ba'i rim pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, I will explain the stages of the arising of the bodhicitta of the ground of Supreme Joy.

original: de yang gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' gsang sngags kyi sgo nas byang chub sems dpa' spyad pa spyod pa bskal pa bye ba khrig khrig brgya stong dpag tu med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu mad pa bsags pa
analyzed: de yang gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' gsang sngags kyi sgo nas byang chub sems dpa' spyad pa spyod pa bskal pa bye ba khrig khrig brgya stong dpag tu med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu mad pa bsags pa
translated: Moreover, O Lord of Secrets, bodhisattvas who practice the bodhisattva deeds through the gateway of mantra, who have accumulated the limitless accumulations of merit and wisdom for countless quintillions of eons,

original: zhes pa nas shin tu ngo bo nyid med pa'i sems skye ste /
analyzed: zhes pa nas shin tu ngo bo nyid med pa'i sems skye ste /
translated: ...the mind that is utterly devoid of intrinsic nature arises.🔽O Lord of Secrets, this is the first bodhicitta, as taught by the victors.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po 'di ni byang chub kyi sems dang po'o zhes rgyal ba rnams kyis gsungs so zhes pa'i bar gyis sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems de'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa dang / mtshan nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po 'di ni byang chub kyi sems dang po'o zhes rgyal ba rnams kyis gsungs so zhes pa'i bar gyis sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems de'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa dang / mtshan nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: This passage explains the perfect cause of the bodhicitta of the first ground, the perfect nature of the bodhicitta of the first ground, the perfect characteristics of the bodhicitta of the first ground, and the perfect result of the bodhicitta of the first ground.

original: mtshan nyid de'i sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa rnams bshad par rig par bya ste de la rgyu phun sum tshogs pa ni bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dpag tu med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa bsags pa zhes bya'o
analyzed: mtshan nyid de'i sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa rnams bshad par rig par bya ste de la rgyu phun sum tshogs pa ni bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dpag tu med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa bsags pa zhes bya'o
translated: The perfect cause is called the perfect accumulation of immeasurable merit and wisdom for immeasurable hundreds of thousands of millions of eons.

original: // rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa ni shes rab dang thabs dpag tu med pas yongs su gzung ba zhes pa nas dbang po dang nye ba'i dbang po la sogs pas phyag byas pa zhes pa'i bar te /
analyzed: // rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa ni shes rab dang thabs dpag tu med pas yongs su gzung ba zhes pa nas dbang po dang nye ba'i dbang po la sogs pas phyag byas pa zhes pa'i bar te /
translated: The perfect nature is from being held by immeasurable wisdom and means up to being praised by the faculties, the proximate faculties, and so forth.🔽By that perfect nature, the perfect abandonment and the perfect power are also included. The perfect abandonment is from being held by immeasurable wisdom and means up to perfectly transcending the karma of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa des spong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang mthu phun sum tshogs pa yang bsdus te spong ba phun sum tshogs pa ni shes rab dang thabs dpag tu med pas yongs su gzung ba zhes dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis las yang dag par 'das pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa des spong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang mthu phun sum tshogs pa yang bsdus te spong ba phun sum tshogs pa ni shes rab dang thabs dpag tu med pas yongs su gzung ba zhes dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis las yang dag par 'das pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The perfect power is from being held by immeasurable wisdom and means up to being praised by the faculties, the proximate faculties, and so forth.

original: mthu phun @290b sum tshogs pa ni lha dang dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag byas pa zhes dang / brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang dbang po dang nye ba'i dbang po la sogs pas phyag byas pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mthu phun @290b sum tshogs pa ni lha dang dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag byas pa zhes dang / brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang dbang po dang nye ba'i dbang po la sogs pas phyag byas pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The perfection of power is indicated by the phrase, “he is worshipped by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras,” and by the phrase, “he is worshipped by Indra, Brahma, the world guardians, and the great kings.”

original: mtshan nyid phun sum tshogs pa ni shin tu ngo bo nyid med pa'i sems skye zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid phun sum tshogs pa ni shin tu ngo bo nyid med pa'i sems skye zhes pa'o //
translated: The perfection of characteristics is indicated by the phrase, “the mind that is utterly devoid of intrinsic nature arises.”

original: mtshan nyid de'i sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de'i sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The perfection of the practice of those characteristics is indicated by the phrase, “it is as follows.”

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo rdzas med pa zhes pa nas mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid dang bral ba zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo rdzas med pa zhes pa nas mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid dang bral ba zhes pa'i bar ro //
translated: The perfection of the object is indicated by the phrase, “the nature of emptiness, the absence of entities,” up to the phrase, “free from eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.”

original: de la bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dpag tu med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa bsags pa zhes pa la /
analyzed: de la bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dpag tu med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa bsags pa zhes pa la /
translated: The perfection of the accumulation is indicated by the phrase, “having accumulated immeasurable collections of merit and wisdom for immeasurable hundreds of thousands of millions of eons.”

original: bskal pa bye ba ni 'bum phrag brgya la bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba ni 'bum phrag brgya la bya'o //
translated: An eon of a billion is one hundred thousand million.

original: brgya stong ni bskal pa bye ba khrig phrag 'bum la bya ste dpag tu med ces pa ni bskal pa bye ba phrag 'bum de yang tshad kyi sa gzhal du med grangs kyis bgrang du med par sems dang po bskyed pa'am /🔽gang zag la bdag med par bsgom pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: brgya stong ni bskal pa bye ba khrig phrag 'bum la bya ste dpag tu med ces pa ni bskal pa bye ba phrag 'bum de yang tshad kyi sa gzhal du med grangs kyis bgrang du med par sems dang po bskyed pa'am / gang zag la bdag med par bsgom pa nas brtsams te /
