translated: The phrase “having cultivated the bodhisattva trainings” refers to the time that a bodhisattva is engaged in the practice of the bodhisattva trainings.🔽The phrase “having completed the accumulations for enlightenment” refers to the time that a bodhisattva has completed the accumulations for enlightenment.🔽The phrase “having abandoned all the mental afflictions and having abandoned all the traces of the view that is in conflict with the Dharma” refers to the time that a bodhisattva has abandoned all the mental afflictions and has abandoned all the traces of the view that is in conflict with the Dharma.🔽The phrase “having fully completed the perfection of wisdom” refers to the time that a bodhisattva has fully completed the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i rgyus /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i rgyus /
translated: The phrase “having fully completed the perfection of skillful means” refers to the time that a bodhisattva has fully completed the perfection of skillful means.🔽The phrase “having fully completed the perfection of power” refers to the time that a bodhisattva has fully completed the perfection of power.

original: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba'i sems shin tu dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //🔽shes rab dang thabs dpag tu med pas yongs su gzung ba zhes pa /
analyzed: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba'i sems shin tu dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro // shes rab dang thabs dpag tu med pas yongs su gzung ba zhes pa /
translated: The phrase “having fully completed the perfection of aspiration” refers to the time that a bodhisattva has fully completed the perfection of aspiration.🔽The phrase “having fully completed the perfection of knowledge” refers to the time that a bodhisattva has fully completed the perfection of knowledge.🔽The phrase “having fully completed the perfection of strength” refers to the time that a bodhisattva has fully completed the perfection of strength.🔽The phrase “having fully completed the perfection of patience” refers to the time that a bodhisattva has fully completed the perfection of patience.

original: shes rab ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin kun chub par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: shes rab ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin kun chub par byed pa yin la /
translated: The phrase “having fully completed the perfection of morality” refers to the time that a bodhisattva has fully completed the perfection of morality.

original: thabs ni snying rje chen po'i dbang gis sems can rnams yongs su smin pa dang grol bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: thabs ni snying rje chen po'i dbang gis sems can rnams yongs su smin pa dang grol bar byed pa ste /
translated: The phrase “having fully completed the perfection of giving” refers to the time that a bodhisattva has fully completed the perfection of giving.🔽The phrase “having fully completed the perfection of wisdom” refers to the

original: dpag tu med pa ni shes rab dang thabs de dag nyid 'di tsam zhes dpag tu med do //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa ni shes rab dang thabs de dag nyid 'di tsam zhes dpag tu med do //
translated: Inconceivable refers to the fact that those wisdoms and methods are inconceivable, in that they cannot be measured.

original: de ltar shes rab kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin med par rtogs pas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spangs pa dang thabs kyis sems can smin cing grol bar byas pas ngan song la sogs pa spangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas de'i spong ba phun sum tshogs
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin med par rtogs pas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spangs pa dang thabs kyis sems can smin cing grol bar byas pas ngan song la sogs pa spangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas de'i spong ba phun sum tshogs
translated: Thus, by realizing that all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic nature through wisdom, one abandons afflictions and so forth. By means of method, one ripens and liberates sentient beings, abandoning the lower realms and so forth. Thus, one possesses the qualities of abandonment.🔽That is the perfection of abandonment.

original: pa'o // yongs su gzung ba zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de de lta bu'i shes rab thabs dpag tu med pa spong pa phun sum tshogs pa des yongs su gzung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: pa'o // yongs su gzung ba zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de de lta bu'i shes rab thabs dpag tu med pa spong pa phun sum tshogs pa des yongs su gzung ba la bya'o //
translated: The term “embraced” refers to the fact that the awakening mind is embraced by such wisdom, inconceivable methods, and the perfection of abandonment.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis las shin tu 'das pa dang zhes pa yang de lta bu'i shes rab dang dpag tu med pa dang ldan @291a * //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis las shin tu 'das pa dang zhes pa yang de lta bu'i shes rab dang dpag tu med pa dang ldan @291a * //
translated: It is also said to be “far beyond all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.”

original: pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lta ba las 'das te 'phags pa'am de dag gi spyod yul ma yin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lta ba las 'das te 'phags pa'am de dag gi spyod yul ma yin pa la bya ste /
translated: It is sublime, or not the domain of activity of sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, because it transcends the views of sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de yang spong ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang spong ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: And that is the perfection of abandonment.

original: lha dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag byas pa /
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag byas pa /
translated: It is worshipped by the world with its gods and asuras.

original: brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang dbang po dang nye ba'i dbang po la sogs pas phyag byas pa zhes pa ni de lta bu'i 'jig rten gyi dbang po la sogs pa sems can mthu chen rnams kyi mchod cing phyag byas pa'i mthu dang ldan pas mthu phun sum
analyzed: brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang dbang po dang nye ba'i dbang po la sogs pas phyag byas pa zhes pa ni de lta bu'i 'jig rten gyi dbang po la sogs pa sems can mthu chen rnams kyi mchod cing phyag byas pa'i mthu dang ldan pas mthu phun sum
translated: It is worshipped by Indra, Brahma, Isvara, Mahesvara, and so on, because it possesses the power of being worshipped and prostrated to by such powerful beings as the lords of the worlds, Indra and so on, who have great power and miracles.

original: tshogs pa'o // byang chub kyi sems de la gzugs med na ji ltar de dag gis phyag bya zhe na gzugs med kyang de'i yon tan dang rdzu 'phrul chen po dag thos nas 'dud cing phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa'o // byang chub kyi sems de la gzugs med na ji ltar de dag gis phyag bya zhe na gzugs med kyang de'i yon tan dang rdzu 'phrul chen po dag thos nas 'dud cing phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that thought of enlightenment is formless, how can it be worshipped? Even though it is formless, they bow down and pay homage to it after hearing of its great qualities and miracles.

original: yang na de lta bu'i sems dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal ba la yang bya'o //
analyzed: yang na de lta bu'i sems dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal ba la yang bya'o //
translated: Or else, it is to be understood as a salutation to the Bodhisattva who has such a mind.

original: 'di lta ste stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ces pa ni byang chub kyi sems de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: 'di lta ste stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ces pa ni byang chub kyi sems de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin med de /
translated: It is thus: The essence of emptiness means that this Thought of Enlightenment is devoid of the nature of subject and object.

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra bas stong pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra bas stong pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of emptiness, like space.

original: rdzas med pa zhes pa ni de ltar stong pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rdul phra mo la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas med pa zhes pa ni de ltar stong pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rdul phra mo la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is without substance because it is the nature of emptiness, it is not the nature of a substance such as an atom.

original: mtshan nyid med pa zhes ba ni mu stegs can la sogs pas brtags pa'i bdag la sogs ba khams gsum thams cad skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa zhes ba ni mu stegs can la sogs pas brtags pa'i bdag la sogs ba khams gsum thams cad skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is without characteristics because it is not the characteristic of a cause of the production and destruction of the entire three realms, such as the self imagined by the heterodox.

original: mtshan ma med pa zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de la sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de la sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: It is without signs because this Thought of Enlightenment is devoid of the signs of aspects such as blue, yellow, and so on.

original: spros pa thams cad las 'das pa zhes pa ni spros pa ni rnam par rtog pa la bya ste rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad las 'das pa zhes pa ni spros pa ni rnam par rtog pa la bya ste rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: The phrase beyond all conceptual elaboration means that conceptual elaboration is equivalent to discursive thought, and so it is free from discursive thought.

original: nam mkha' ltar dpag tu med pa zhes pa ni de ltar rnam par rtog pa med pas na nam mkha' dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar dpag tu med pa zhes pa ni de ltar rnam par rtog pa med pas na nam mkha' dang 'dra ste /
translated: The phrase incalculable like space means that, since it is free from discursive thought, it is like space.

original: nam mkha' ni tshad 'di tsam zhes dpag tu med do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni tshad 'di tsam zhes dpag tu med do //
translated: Space is incalculable, in the sense that one cannot say, It is just this much.

original: de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems de'i yon /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems de'i yon /
translated: In the same way, the virtues of that thought of awakening are also incalculable.

original: tan yang tshad gzung du med do //
analyzed: tan yang tshad gzung du med do //
translated: They cannot be measured.

original: chos thams cad kyi go skabs su gyur pa zhes pa las chos thams cad ni 'dus byas kyi chos la bya ste /🔽'dus byas kyi chos de rnams rdul phran gyi phyogs cha la sogs par bshig gam /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi go skabs su gyur pa zhes pa las chos thams cad ni 'dus byas kyi chos la bya ste / 'dus byas kyi chos de rnams rdul phran gyi phyogs cha la sogs par bshig gam /
translated: The phrase the opportunity for all phenomena means that all phenomena are equivalent to conditioned phenomena.

original: sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa'i tshul du bshig na @291b stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa'i tshul du bshig na @291b stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: If one analyzes those conditioned phenomena into their smallest parts, or if one analyzes them in terms of their being like illusions or mirages, they become empty by nature.

original: de dang byang chub kyi sems ro gcig pas chos de dag thams cad kyi go skabs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dang byang chub kyi sems ro gcig pas chos de dag thams cad kyi go skabs su gyur pa'o //
translated: Since it is of one taste with the Thought of Enlightenment, it is the occasion for all those dharmas.🔽All dharmas means the dharmas of the qualities of the Bhagavat Buddha, such as the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and the eighteen special qualities, and since they abide in that Thought of Enlightenment, it is the occasion for all dharmas.

original: gnyis su chos thams cad ces bya ba ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi chos rnams byang chub kyi sems de la gnas pas na chos thams cad kyi go skabs su gyur ba'o 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams dang🔽bral ba zhes pa la /
analyzed: gnyis su chos thams cad ces bya ba ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi chos rnams byang chub kyi sems de la gnas pas na chos thams cad kyi go skabs su gyur ba'o 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams dang bral ba zhes pa la /
translated: Free from the compounded and uncompounded realms🔽.

original: 'dus byas dang bral ba ni sa dang po'i sems thob pa'i mi mthun pa'i gnyen por gyur pas de rnams dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang bral ba ni sa dang po'i sems thob pa'i mi mthun pa'i gnyen por gyur pas de rnams dang bral ba'o //
translated: Free from the compounded means that since it is the antidote to the discordances of the attainment of the first stage, it is free from them.

original: 'dus ma byas dang bral ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags ma spangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas dang bral ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags ma spangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Free from the uncompounded means that since it has not abandoned the instinct for the objective obscurations and the afflictive obscurations, it does not abide in the realm of nirvana.

original: mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid dang bral ba zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ltar mig la sogs pas rgyu byas nas skyed pa ma yin pas de rnams dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid dang bral ba zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ltar mig la sogs pas rgyu byas nas skyed pa ma yin pas de rnams dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Free from eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind” means that it is free from those because it is not produced by the eyes and so on acting as causes, as is the case with the eye consciousness and so on.

original: shin tu ngo bo nyid med pa'i sems zhes pa ni de ltar gong du smos pa'i chos rnams gang dang yang mi ldan pas de rnams kyi rnam pa'am rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu ngo bo nyid med pa'i sems zhes pa ni de ltar gong du smos pa'i chos rnams gang dang yang mi ldan pas de rnams kyi rnam pa'am rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: “The mind that is utterly without intrinsic nature” means that since it is not associated with any of the phenomena mentioned above, it has no aspects or intrinsic nature of those.

original: de bas na shin tu ngo bo nyid med pa'i sems so ;🔽/ skye ste zhes pa ni de ltar ngo bo nyid med pa'i sems kyi mtshan nyid de gong du smos pa'i bskal ba snyed du bsong nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i rgyus sa dang po'i yon tan rnams rdzogs nas bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi
analyzed: de bas na shin tu ngo bo nyid med pa'i sems so ; / skye ste zhes pa ni de ltar ngo bo nyid med pa'i sems kyi mtshan nyid de gong du smos pa'i bskal ba snyed du bsong nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i rgyus sa dang po'i yon tan rnams rdzogs nas bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi
translated: Therefore, it is the mind that is utterly without intrinsic nature.

original: phyir sems de skye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyir sems de skye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: “Arises” means that the characteristic of the mind that is thus without intrinsic nature should be known to arise from the cause of accumulating the accumulations of merit and wisdom for eons as mentioned above, once the qualities of the first ground have been perfected, for the sake of unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: de dag nyon mongs las las grol //
analyzed: de dag nyon mongs las las grol //
translated: They are free from the passions and from action.

original: las dang nyon mongs ldan pa'ang yin //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs ldan pa'ang yin //
translated: They are endowed with action and passion.

original: de dag 'jig rten sbyin gnas te //🔽de dag rtag mchod ri mor bya //
analyzed: de dag 'jig rten sbyin gnas te // de dag rtag mchod ri mor bya //
translated: They are the world's field of merit.

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: They are always to be worshipped and honored.

original: nyon mongs las las grol zhes pa ni ngan song la sogs pa'i las dang sa dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bral ba'o //🔽las dang nyon mongs ldan pa'ang yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs las las grol zhes pa ni ngan song la sogs pa'i las dang sa dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bral ba'o // las dang nyon mongs ldan pa'ang yin //
translated: They are free from the passions and from action means that they are free from the actions of the miserable destinies and from the resistances on the first stage.

original: zhes pa la gong ma rnams thob par byed pa'i las dang de dag las sgrib pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'o //🔽de dag 'jig rten sbyin gnas te //
analyzed: zhes pa la gong ma rnams thob par byed pa'i las dang de dag las sgrib pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'o // de dag 'jig rten sbyin gnas te //
translated: They are endowed with action and passion means that they are endowed with the actions which cause the attainment of the former and with the passions which are the obscurations to those.

original: zhes pa ni /🔽de lta bu'i sems dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nor @292a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni / de lta bu'i sems dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nor @292a * //
translated: They are the world's field of merit means that.

original: dang 'bru dang rin po che la sogs pa yon dbul ba'i snod du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dang 'bru dang rin po che la sogs pa yon dbul ba'i snod du gyur pa'o //
translated: The Bodhisattvas who have such a mind are the vessels for the offerings of wealth, grain, jewels, etc.

original: mchod ces pa ni dri dang me tog la sogs pas mchod pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: mchod ces pa ni dri dang me tog la sogs pas mchod pa'i gnas so //
translated: Worship means that they are the objects of worship with incense, flowers, etc.

original: ri mor bya zhes pa ni phyag bya zhing thal mo sbyar ba dang / bsu zhing bskyal ba la sogs pa'i bkur sti'i gnas so //
analyzed: ri mor bya zhes pa ni phyag bya zhing thal mo sbyar ba dang / bsu zhing bskyal ba la sogs pa'i bkur sti'i gnas so //
translated: One should make images of them means one should make prostrations, join one's palms, and so on, and one should be an object of respect such as being welcomed and seen off.

original: de la rtag mchod ni de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' la 'jig rten pa rnams kyis mchod pa dang bkur sti la sogs ba bya'o //
analyzed: de la rtag mchod ni de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' la 'jig rten pa rnams kyis mchod pa dang bkur sti la sogs ba bya'o //
translated: One should always make offerings to them means that worldly beings should make offerings and respect and so on to such bodhisattvas.🔽Now the characteristics and qualities of the level of practice through belief are also explained:

original: da ni nyon mongs pas spyod pa'i sa'i mtshan nyid dang yon tan yang bshad de gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang /
analyzed: da ni nyon mongs pas spyod pa'i sa'i mtshan nyid dang yon tan yang bshad de gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover, Guhyapati,

original: mos pa yis ni spyod pa'i sa //🔽zhes pa nas /🔽blo ldan bskal ba gcig gis ni //
analyzed: mos pa yis ni spyod pa'i sa // zhes pa nas / blo ldan bskal ba gcig gis ni //
translated: the level of practice through belief🔽is the first of the ten levels.

original: sa las yang dag 'da' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sa las yang dag 'da' bar 'gyur //
translated: The wise one will transcend the levels

original: zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar ro //
translated: in one eon.

original: de la mos pa yis ni zhes pa mnyan pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams shes na de nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no snyam du de la shin tu mos pa skye ba'o //🔽de la / sems gsum rnam par sgom pa ste //
analyzed: de la mos pa yis ni zhes pa mnyan pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams shes na de nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no snyam du de la shin tu mos pa skye ba'o // de la / sems gsum rnam par sgom pa ste //
translated: With devotion means that if one understands the qualities of the Buddha, such as the stages and perfections, through the wisdom of listening, reflection, and meditation, one should develop devotion to them, thinking They are just that, nothing else.

original: zhes pa ni 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang ba'i sems te de dag rnam par sgom pa'i thabs ni sngar chos la bdag med pa'i skabs su bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang ba'i sems te de dag rnam par sgom pa'i thabs ni sngar chos la bdag med pa'i skabs su bshad zin to //
translated: As for cultivating the three minds, these are the minds of entering, abiding, and rising, and the method of cultivating them has already been explained in the section on the selflessness of phenomena.

original: mos pas spyod pa zhes pa ni chos de la mos pa tsam ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa zhes pa ni chos de la mos pa tsam ma yin gyi /
translated: The stage of devotion is not merely devotion to those teachings.

original: de rnams kyi yon tan goms par bya ba la nan tan byed pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi yon tan goms par bya ba la nan tan byed pa ste /
translated: It is the earnest practice of cultivating their qualities.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽By practicing the perfections

original: pha rol phyin rnams spyod pa dang // bsdu ba dag ni bzhi po yis //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol phyin rnams spyod pa dang // bsdu ba dag ni bzhi po yis //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And the four means of gathering disciples,

original: de la / pha rol phyin rnams spyod pa dang // zhes pa ni sa dang po nas brtsams te bcu pa'i bar du sa re re la phyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa re re spyod de /
analyzed: de la / pha rol phyin rnams spyod pa dang // zhes pa ni sa dang po nas brtsams te bcu pa'i bar du sa re re la phyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa re re spyod de /
translated: means that, beginning from the first level up to the tenth, on each level one practices one of the perfections, such as generosity, and so on.

original: bdag ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bdag ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as one practices the perfections oneself,

original: sems can gzhan rnams kyang bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas bsdus te spyod du 'jug go //
analyzed: sems can gzhan rnams kyang bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas bsdus te spyod du 'jug go //
translated: one also encourages other sentient beings to practice them by gathering them through the four means of gathering disciples.

original: de la rab tu dga' ba'i yon tan sems dga' bzhin du chos dang zang zing gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa ste /🔽mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa na bdag kyang spyod la /
analyzed: de la rab tu dga' ba'i yon tan sems dga' bzhin du chos dang zang zing gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa ste / mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa na bdag kyang spyod la /
translated: On the first level, Perfect Joy, one practices the perfection of generosity by giving the Dharma and material gifts with a joyful mind, with the qualities of that level.

original: sems can gzhan rnams kyang bsdu ba rnams pa bzhi'i sgo nas bsdus te spyod du 'jug go //
analyzed: sems can gzhan rnams kyang bsdu ba rnams pa bzhi'i sgo nas bsdus te spyod du 'jug go //
translated: While one is on the level of earnest aspiration, one practices the perfections oneself and encourages other sentient beings to practice them by gathering them through the four means of gathering disciples.

original: sa gnyis pa dri ma @292b med pa la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dri ma med pa la spyod pa yang /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa dri ma @292b med pa la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dri ma med pa la spyod pa yang /
translated: On the second level, The Stainless, one practices the stainless perfection of discipline.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i tshe bdag kyang spyod la gzhan rnams kyang spyod du 'jug go //🔽sa gsum pa 'od byed pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod de /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i tshe bdag kyang spyod la gzhan rnams kyang spyod du 'jug go // sa gsum pa 'od byed pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod de /
translated: At the time of the practice of devoted interest, one practices oneself and also makes others practice.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa yang mos pas spyod pa'i tshe bdag kyang spyod la gzhan yad spyod du 'jug go //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa yang mos pas spyod pa'i tshe bdag kyang spyod la gzhan yad spyod du 'jug go //
translated: On the third ground, the Luminous, one practices the perfection of patience, and also makes others practice it.🔽On the fourth ground, the Radiant, one practices the perfection of effort, radiating the light of wisdom, and also makes others practice it.

original: sa bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba can la ye shes kyi 'od 'phro bas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa dang / sa lnga pa sbyang dka' ba la bdud la sogs pas shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa dang //
analyzed: sa bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba can la ye shes kyi 'od 'phro bas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa dang / sa lnga pa sbyang dka' ba la bdud la sogs pas shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa dang //
translated: On the fifth ground, the Hard to Conquer, one practices the perfection of concentration, which is very difficult for demons and so on to conquer, and also makes others practice it.🔽On the sixth ground, the Manifest, one practices the perfection of wisdom, and also makes others practice it.

original: sa drug pa mngon du gyur pa shes rab mngon du gyur pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa dang / sa bdun pa ring du song ba la sems can rnams smin pa dang grol bar byed pa'i thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sa drug pa mngon du gyur pa shes rab mngon du gyur pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa dang / sa bdun pa ring du song ba la sems can rnams smin pa dang grol bar byed pa'i thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: On the seventh level, that of The One Gone Far, they practice the transcendent perfection of the means of bringing sentient beings to full maturity and liberation.🔽On the eighth level, that of The Immutable One, they practice the transcendent perfection of aspiration prayers, having gained mastery of aspiration prayers in order to attain the higher levels.

original: sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba la smon lam gyi dbang thob nas sa gong ma rnams thob pa'i phyir smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa dang / sa dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros la stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa dang /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba la smon lam gyi dbang thob nas sa gong ma rnams thob pa'i phyir smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa dang / sa dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros la stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa dang /
translated: On the ninth level, that of The One of Brilliant Intelligence, they practice the transcendent perfection of strength.

original: sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin la phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mngon sum du ye shes kyi chos 'dri zhing /
analyzed: sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin la phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mngon sum du ye shes kyi chos 'dri zhing /
translated: And on the tenth level, that of The Cloud of Dharma, they practice the transcendent perfection of exalted wisdom, asking the tathagatas of the ten directions questions directly on the wisdom Dharma.

original: spyod yul du gyur pa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa rnams mos pas spyod pa'i tshe nyid na bdag kyang spyod pa la goms par byed la sems can gzhan rnams kyang bsdu ba rnams bzhi'i sgo nas bsdus te spyod du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: spyod yul du gyur pa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa rnams mos pas spyod pa'i tshe nyid na bdag kyang spyod pa la goms par byed la sems can gzhan rnams kyang bsdu ba rnams bzhi'i sgo nas bsdus te spyod du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom that is the object of activity is practiced. When one is practicing with interest, one is also habituating oneself to the practice, and one is also engaging in the practice of gathering other sentient beings by means of the four ways of gathering.

original: bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi zhes pa ni sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang ; / don mthun pa'i sgo nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi zhes pa ni sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang ; / don mthun pa'i sgo nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The four ways of gathering are by means of generosity, pleasant speech, meaningful conduct, and practicing what one preaches.

original: sa de rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang yon tan rgya cher ni sa bcu pa'i mdo sde la sogs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa de rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang yon tan rgya cher ni sa bcu pa'i mdo sde la sogs par shes par bya'o //
translated: The characteristics and qualities of these levels should be understood in detail from the Ten Levels Sutra and so forth.

original: mos pa'i sa ni mtshungs pa med //
analyzed: mos pa'i sa ni mtshungs pa med //
translated: The level of interest is incomparable.

original: ces pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa de 'jig rten phal pa rnams dad mi mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa de 'jig rten phal pa rnams dad mi mnyam pa'o //
translated: This level of interest and practice is not the same as the faith of ordinary worldly people.

original: dpag tu med cing zhes pa de'i yon tan gyi spyi grangs kyis gzhal ba las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dpag tu med cing zhes pa de'i yon tan gyi spyi grangs kyis gzhal ba las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable, meaning that it is beyond being measured by a general enumeration of its qualities.

original: bsam mi khyab ces pa ni sems kyis bsams shing dpag pa las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab ces pa ni sems kyis bsams shing dpag pa las 'das pa'o //
translated: Inconceivable means beyond the imagination and speculation of the mind.

original: dpag med ye shes 'byung ba zhes pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa de la bya ste /
analyzed: dpag med ye shes 'byung ba zhes pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa de la bya ste /
translated: The source of immeasurable intuition is the stage of action out of faith.

original: dpag med ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: dpag med ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Immeasurable is the intuition of omniscience.

original: @293a * // sems bcu dag gis thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: @293a * // sems bcu dag gis thob par 'gyur //
translated: One attains it by ten thoughts.

original: zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po spyod pa'i sems kyi rim pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po spyod pa'i sems kyi rim pas so //
translated: By the sequence of thoughts that practice the ten perfections.

original: ngas gang cung zad brjod pa ni //
analyzed: ngas gang cung zad brjod pa ni //
translated: Whatever is said by me

original: thams cad 'di yis thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad 'di yis thob par 'gyur //
translated: is all attained by this.

original: zhes pa ni stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pa'i chos gang cung zad bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa de thams cad ni mos pas spyod pa des 'thob par 'gyur ro //🔽de phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa //
analyzed: zhes pa ni stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pa'i chos gang cung zad bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa de thams cad ni mos pas spyod pa des 'thob par 'gyur ro // de phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa //
translated: Whatever dharmas are said by the Lord, such as the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and the eighteen special qualities, all are attained by this action out of faith.🔽Therefore, the aspiration

original: mos pa zhes ni bya bar bshad //
analyzed: mos pa zhes ni bya bar bshad //
translated: for omniscience is explained.

original: ces pa ni de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos thams cad mos pas 'thob pas na mos pas spyod pa'i sa de thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa de'i rgyu ste nge bas na rgyu la 'bras bur btags te /
analyzed: ces pa ni de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos thams cad mos pas 'thob pas na mos pas spyod pa'i sa de thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa de'i rgyu ste nge bas na rgyu la 'bras bur btags te /
translated: Thus, since all the dharmas of the Tathagata are attained through aspiration, that stage of the practice of aspiration is the cause of that stage of omniscience.

original: mos pa zhes ni bya bar bshad //
analyzed: mos pa zhes ni bya bar bshad //
translated: It is explained as aspiration.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //🔽blo ldan bskal pa gcig gis ni //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no // blo ldan bskal pa gcig gis ni //
translated: This is what is said.🔽The wise one passes beyond the stages

original: sa las yang dag 'da' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sa las yang dag 'da' bar 'gyur //
translated: in a single eon.

original: zhes pa ni shes rab can gyis mos pas spyod pa'i sa de bskal pa gcig gis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes rab can gyis mos pas spyod pa'i sa de bskal pa gcig gis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that the wise one, through the practice of aspiration, perfects that stage in a single eon.

original: 'di yi yang ni bzhi cha yis //
analyzed: 'di yi yang ni bzhi cha yis //
translated: By a quarter of that,

original: mos pa'i sa las 'da' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mos pa'i sa las 'da' bar 'gyur //
translated: one passes beyond the stage of aspiration.🔽This means that in a single quarter of that eon, one passes beyond that stage of the practice of aspiration, which is the understanding of the selflessness of phenomena, and enters the stage of wisdom.

original: zhes pa ni bskal ba de'i bzhi cha gcig gis mos pas spyod pa'i chos bdag med par chud pa'i sa de las 'phar te ye shes kyi sa la 'jug pa'i stegs su gyur pa'i chos la bdag med pa yang spangs nas rang gi sems gzod ma nas ma
analyzed: zhes pa ni bskal ba de'i bzhi cha gcig gis mos pas spyod pa'i chos bdag med par chud pa'i sa de las 'phar te ye shes kyi sa la 'jug pa'i stegs su gyur pa'i chos la bdag med pa yang spangs nas rang gi sems gzod ma nas ma
translated: One abandons the selflessness of phenomena, which is the basis for entering the stage of wisdom, and one's own mind, which is primordially free from the extremes of conceptual elaboration, becomes the basis for entering the stage of wisdom.

original: skyes shing ma byung bar bsgom par zhugs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: skyes shing ma byung bar bsgom par zhugs pa la bya'o //
translated: It is to be applied to one who has generated the thought but has not yet entered into meditation.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i rim pa dang / yon tan de dag sngar mos pas spyod pa'i sa bdag med pa la 'jug pa'i skabs su mi bshad par rab tu dga' ba'i sa bshad pa'i 'og tu ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i rim pa dang / yon tan de dag sngar mos pas spyod pa'i sa bdag med pa la 'jug pa'i skabs su mi bshad par rab tu dga' ba'i sa bshad pa'i 'og tu ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
translated: Why are those stages and qualities of the level of devoted engagement not explained in the context of the level of devoted engagement that engages with selflessness, but rather are explained after the explanation of the Joyous level?

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The Joyous level is the result of the level of devoted engagement.

original: de ltar 'bras bu de ci 'dra bshes nas de'i rgyu gang yin pa de gdod brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu de ci 'dra bshes nas de'i rgyu gang yin pa de gdod brtag par bya ste /
translated: Having understood the result in that way, one should then investigate what its cause is.

original: de bas na mos pas spyod pa'i sa de'i rjes su bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na mos pas spyod pa'i sa de'i rjes su bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained after the level of devoted engagement.

original: de dag gis ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu sbyin pa la sogs pa sems brgyad po bshad pa dang / so so'i bdag tu brtag pa la brten nas 'ba' zhig pa'i blo skye bshad pa dang / de nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems skyes te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu sbyin pa la sogs pa sems brgyad po bshad pa dang / so so'i bdag tu brtag pa la brten nas 'ba' zhig pa'i blo skye bshad pa dang / de nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems skyes te /
translated: Those explain the eight thoughts such as generosity that are the causes of Vairocana, the explanation of how the thought of mere cognition arises in dependence on the investigation of individual selflessness and then the supramundane thought arises.

original: bdag tu brtags pa rnams med par rtogs nas phung po tsam du @293b 'dzin pa gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa bshad pa dang / phung po tsam po de la yang dbu ba dang chu'i chu bur la sogs pa'i tshul du bshig nas chos rnams so so'i rang bzhin sngon po la sogs pa tsam du zad par rtogs pa bshad pa dang /
analyzed: bdag tu brtags pa rnams med par rtogs nas phung po tsam du @293b 'dzin pa gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa bshad pa dang / phung po tsam po de la yang dbu ba dang chu'i chu bur la sogs pa'i tshul du bshig nas chos rnams so so'i rang bzhin sngon po la sogs pa tsam du zad par rtogs pa bshad pa dang /
translated: Having realized that the imputed self does not exist, one realizes the selflessness of persons, which is the apprehension of the mere aggregates. Having destroyed even the mere aggregates, like a bubble of water, one realizes the individual nature of phenomena, such as the mere blue color.

original: chos la bdag med par rtogs nas rang gi sems gzod ma nas ma skyes pa stong pa nyid du rtogs par bshad pa dang / sa dang po'i sems kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin de yang ngo bo nyid med par mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa rnams rgya cher bshad do //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par rtogs nas rang gi sems gzod ma nas ma skyes pa stong pa nyid du rtogs par bshad pa dang / sa dang po'i sems kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin de yang ngo bo nyid med par mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa rnams rgya cher bshad do //
translated: Having realized the selflessness of phenomena, one realizes that one’s mind is primordially unborn emptiness. And one realizes that the nature of the mind of the first ground is the same in being essentially natureless.

original: da ni 'dir de rnams nyid dbugs pa'i sgo nas mdor bsdus te phyag na rdo rjes gsol pa dang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis kyang mdor bsdus te gsungs pa de bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'dir de rnams nyid dbugs pa'i sgo nas mdor bsdus te phyag na rdo rjes gsol pa dang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis kyang mdor bsdus te gsungs pa de bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, here, those very [topics] are summarized in terms of the breath. Vajrapāṇi requested, and Bhagavān Vairocana also taught in summary. That will be explained.

original: de rnams lan gnyis su 'das te bshad cing dgos she na /
analyzed: de rnams lan gnyis su 'das te bshad cing dgos she na /
translated: Why are those explained twice?

original: sngar bshad pas gsal bar ma go na phyis bzlas te bshad pas gsal zhing brtan par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngar bshad pas gsal bar ma go na phyis bzlas te bshad pas gsal zhing brtan par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: If one does not understand clearly through the previous explanation, then by repeating the explanation later, it becomes clear and stable.

original: de bas na phal cher yang sngar rgya cher bshad pa de ma go na phyis mdor bsdus te bshad pas go ba yang yod la /
analyzed: de bas na phal cher yang sngar rgya cher bshad pa de ma go na phyis mdor bsdus te bshad pas go ba yang yod la /
translated: Therefore, if one does not understand the previous extensive explanation, one may understand it through the later summary explanation.

original: sngar tshig rkyang bas bshad pa de ma go ba la phyis tshigs su bshad de go ba yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar tshig rkyang bas bshad pa de ma go ba la phyis tshigs su bshad de go ba yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also possible that one may not understand the previous explanation with individual words, but later understand it through the verse explanation.

original: mdo sde la sogs pa gzhan dag nas kyang sngar spros te bshad pa'i don de nyid tshigs su bcad pas bsdus te bshad pa de dag srid de /
analyzed: mdo sde la sogs pa gzhan dag nas kyang sngar spros te bshad pa'i don de nyid tshigs su bcad pas bsdus te bshad pa de dag srid de /
translated: It is possible that in other sūtras and so forth, the meaning of the previously elaborated explanation is summarized in verse and explained.

original: de bas na 'dir yang sngar rgyas par bshad pa'i don de nyid phyis bsdus te bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir yang sngar rgyas par bshad pa'i don de nyid phyis bsdus te bshad do //
translated: Therefore, here also, the meaning that was previously explained extensively is summarized and explained later.

original: de yang de nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de yang de nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa nas /
translated: Moreover, from Then Vajrapāṇi said this to the Blessed One... up to

original: mchog skyes de dag dbugs phyin 'gyur //
analyzed: mchog skyes de dag dbugs phyin 'gyur //
translated: Those supreme ones will be relieved.

original: zhes pa'i bar du phyag na rdo rjes gsol ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du phyag na rdo rjes gsol ba'i tshig ste /
translated: This is the request by Vajrapāṇi.

original: mgon po khyab bdag khyod kyis ni //
analyzed: mgon po khyab bdag khyod kyis ni //
translated: O Lord, O Pervasive Lord,

original: sems kyi mtshan nyid bstan lags na //
analyzed: sems kyi mtshan nyid bstan lags na //
translated: you have taught the characteristics of the mind.

original: zhes pa ni sngar sems rnams kyi mtshan nyid bshad pa de dbugs dbyung ba rnam pa dus thob par 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngar sems rnams kyi mtshan nyid bshad pa de dbugs dbyung ba rnam pa dus thob par 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: This is asking how many types of relief will be obtained by those who have previously explained the characteristics of the minds.

original: dbugs 'byin rnam pa du thob nas //
analyzed: dbugs 'byin rnam pa du thob nas //
translated: Having obtained relief in how many ways...

original: zhes pa la phyi nas dbugs dbyung ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa la phyi nas dbugs dbyung ba zhes pa ni /
translated: Here, relief means

original: ji ltar 'jig rten na grags pa lam 'phrang 'jigs pa'i sa nas rkun po la sogs pa'i 'tshe ba las thar na dbugs dbyung ba zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten na grags pa lam 'phrang 'jigs pa'i sa nas rkun po la sogs pa'i 'tshe ba las thar na dbugs dbyung ba zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: just as it is known in the world, when one is freed from the harm of thieves and so forth on a dangerous path, it is called relief.

original: 'dir yang 'khor ba'i dgon pa na rnam par 'khyams pa'i sems can @294a * //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'khor ba'i dgon pa na rnam par 'khyams pa'i sems can @294a * //
translated: Here, sentient beings who wander in the wilderness of cyclic existence🔽are terrified by the danger of being harmed by the thieves of karma and affliction.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rkun pos 'tshe ba'i 'jigs pa las thar ba na dbugs dbyung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rkun pos 'tshe ba'i 'jigs pa las thar ba na dbugs dbyung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When they are liberated from that, it is called “relief.”

original: de las thar na gzhan dbugs dbyung bar bya ba'i sa med de dbugs dbyung ba gcig tu zad na /
analyzed: de las thar na gzhan dbugs dbyung bar bya ba'i sa med de dbugs dbyung ba gcig tu zad na /
translated: If they are liberated from that, there is no other place to be relieved, so relief is exhausted.

original: ci'i phyir dbugs dbyung ba dus thob ces mang po'i tshig tu smos she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbugs dbyung ba dus thob ces mang po'i tshig tu smos she na /
translated: Why is it said in many words, “relief is timely”?

original: ji ltar 'jig rten pa rnams 'jigs pa gcig la thar nas 'jigs pa de las dbyugs phyung mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten pa rnams 'jigs pa gcig la thar nas 'jigs pa de las dbyugs phyung mod kyi /
translated: Just as worldly people, when liberated from one fear, are relieved from that fear,

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'jigs pa rnams las mthar na dbugs ma phyung ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'jigs pa rnams las mthar na dbugs ma phyung ba'o //
translated: but are not finally relieved from other fears,

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang mi dge ba gang mi mthun pa gegs su gyur pa de las thar te dbugs phyung yang de las gzhan pa'i gegs su gyur pa rnams ma thar na de la dbugs ma phyung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang mi dge ba gang mi mthun pa gegs su gyur pa de las thar te dbugs phyung yang de las gzhan pa'i gegs su gyur pa rnams ma thar na de la dbugs ma phyung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: in the same way, here, when one is liberated from nonvirtue that is incompatible and obstructive, and is relieved from that, but is not liberated from other obstructions, that is called “not relieved.”

original: de bas na dbugs dbyung rnam pa dus zhes smos so //
analyzed: de bas na dbugs dbyung rnam pa dus zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “the aspects of relief, the times. ”

original: mchog skyes ni sras rnams te /
analyzed: mchog skyes ni sras rnams te /
translated: Supremely born means the sons.

original: mchog ni chos kyi dbyings te de bzhin nyid yin la de las skyes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: mchog ni chos kyi dbyings te de bzhin nyid yin la de las skyes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: Supreme is the dharmadhātu, suchness, and those born from that are the bodhisattvas.

original: de dag dbugs phyin par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dbugs phyin par gyur pa'o //
translated: They are the ones who are relieved.

original: de skad gsol nas bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: de skad gsol nas bcom ldan 'das //
translated: Having been thus requested, the bhagavān

original: rnam par snang mdzad chen po yis //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad chen po yis //
translated: Vairocana

original: de tshe phyag na rdo rje la //
analyzed: de tshe phyag na rdo rje la //
translated: said to Vajrapāṇi,

original: yid bsdus de ni nyon zhes gsungs //
analyzed: yid bsdus de ni nyon zhes gsungs //
translated: “Listen, O collected mind!

original: zhes pa nas stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med do zhes stong pa'i ye shes skyes pa de'i tshe chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid mnyam pa nyid kyis dbugs phyin pa yin no zhes pa'i bar du phyag na rdo rjes gsol pa rnams kyi lan bcom
analyzed: zhes pa nas stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med do zhes stong pa'i ye shes skyes pa de'i tshe chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid mnyam pa nyid kyis dbugs phyin pa yin no zhes pa'i bar du phyag na rdo rjes gsol pa rnams kyi lan bcom
translated: ” From “The nature of emptiness is nonexistence” up to “When the wisdom of emptiness arises, it is relief through the sameness of the nature of all phenomena,” Vajrapāṇi made requests, and

original: ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis bka' stsal ba yin no //
analyzed: ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis bka' stsal ba yin no //
translated: the bhagavān Vairocana replied.

original: yid bsdus de ni nyon zhes pa ni snod rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por gsungs pa ste sngar bshad do //🔽nam byis pa so so'i skye bo de dag mi dge ba'i las spangs te dge ba'i las byed pa de'i tshe dge bas dbugs phyin pa yin no zhes pa ni byis pa phyugs dang 'dra ba rnams 'khor ba na 'khyams pa las 'khor ba las skyo ste bsod
analyzed: yid bsdus de ni nyon zhes pa ni snod rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por gsungs pa ste sngar bshad do // nam byis pa so so'i skye bo de dag mi dge ba'i las spangs te dge ba'i las byed pa de'i tshe dge bas dbugs phyin pa yin no zhes pa ni byis pa phyugs dang 'dra ba rnams 'khor ba na 'khyams pa las 'khor ba las skyo ste bsod
translated: The phrase “and the mind is concentrated” is the antidote for the four types of vessels that were mentioned earlier.🔽When those childish ordinary beings abandon unwholesome actions and do wholesome actions, then they are “relieved by the wholesome.”

original: nams kyi 'du shes skyes na smyung bar 'dug cing sbyin pa la sogs pa byed pa ni dge bas dbugs phyin ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nams kyi 'du shes skyes na smyung bar 'dug cing sbyin pa la sogs pa byed pa ni dge bas dbugs phyin ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When those childish beings who are like cattle become weary of saṃsāra, and when they give rise to the notion of merit, they fast and give gifts and so forth. This is called “relieved by the wholesome.”

original: de la dge ba zhes pa ni dbugs dbyung ba gzhan yang dge ba yin na /
analyzed: de la dge ba zhes pa ni dbugs dbyung ba gzhan yang dge ba yin na /
translated: Here, the wholesome is also a relief.

original: ci'i phyir 'ba' zhig la dge ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'ba' zhig la dge ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called “wholesome” alone?

original: gzhan yang dge ba yin mod kyi 'on kyang gzhan rnams la so so'i ming yod pas 'di la dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge ba yin mod kyi 'on kyang gzhan rnams la so so'i ming yod pas 'di la dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Although it is also wholesome, since the others have their own names, this one is called “wholesome.”

original: nam bdag gi kho na nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa de'i tshe bdag la @294b brten nas dbugs phyin pa yin no zhes pa ni /
analyzed: nam bdag gi kho na nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa de'i tshe bdag la @294b brten nas dbugs phyin pa yin no zhes pa ni /
translated: When one knows one’s own true nature just as it is, then, based on the self, one is said to have found relief.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems brgyad spyod pa na dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad de 'jig rten pa rnams kyis bdag tu brtags pa'i dngos po ji lta bu nyid du shes nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems brgyad spyod pa na dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad de 'jig rten pa rnams kyis bdag tu brtags pa'i dngos po ji lta bu nyid du shes nas /
translated: When one practices the eight thoughts such as generosity, one meets with a spiritual friend and, knowing just what things are that are imputed as a self by worldly people,

original: bdag la brten zhing 'jig rten pa'i las rnams goms par byed pa ni bdag la brten nas dbugs phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la brten zhing 'jig rten pa'i las rnams goms par byed pa ni bdag la brten nas dbugs phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: one becomes habituated to worldly activities based on the self. This is called “finding relief based on the self.”

original: bdag gi de kho na nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bdag gi de kho na nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes pa ni /
translated: “One knows one’s own true nature just as it is”

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin shes pa la ni mi bya'i 'jig rten pa'i gzhung bzhin du bdag gis ngo bor brtags pa de phyin ci ma log par shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin shes pa la ni mi bya'i 'jig rten pa'i gzhung bzhin du bdag gis ngo bor brtags pa de phyin ci ma log par shes pa la bya'o //
translated: does not refer to knowing one’s nature as it is through wisdom, which is emptiness. It refers to knowing unmistakenly the nature of the self that is imputed in terms of worldly conventions.

original: nam phung po yongs su gzung ba byas te /
analyzed: nam phung po yongs su gzung ba byas te /
translated: When one has thoroughly relinquished the aggregates,

original: rang gi ngo bo la rnam par dpyad nas bdag la brten pa yongs su gtong ba de'i tshe bdag med pas dbugs phyin pa yin no zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la rnam par dpyad nas bdag la brten pa yongs su gtong ba de'i tshe bdag med pas dbugs phyin pa yin no zhes pa ni /
translated: and having analyzed their nature, one relinquishes the self that is based on them, at that time one is relieved by selflessness.

original: gang zag gi bdag med par rtogs la phung por brtags pa yod par 'dzin pa de ni bdag med pas dbugs phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag gi bdag med par rtogs la phung por brtags pa yod par 'dzin pa de ni bdag med pas dbugs phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This means that when one realizes the selflessness of persons, one still apprehends the aggregates as real.

original: nam phung po rnams spangs nas chos kyi dmigs pa la gnas pa de'i tshe chos kyis dbugs phyin pa yin no zhes pa ni /
analyzed: nam phung po rnams spangs nas chos kyi dmigs pa la gnas pa de'i tshe chos kyis dbugs phyin pa yin no zhes pa ni /
translated: When one has relinquished the aggregates and abides in the objective selflessness of phenomena, at that time one is relieved by phenomena.

original: phung por brtags pa yod par 'dzin pa de ni dbu ba dang chu bur la sogs pa'i tshul du bshig na /
analyzed: phung por brtags pa yod par 'dzin pa de ni dbu ba dang chu bur la sogs pa'i tshul du bshig na /
translated: This means that when one analyzes the aggregates and apprehends them as real, they are destroyed as being like foam, bubbles, and so on.

original: phung por brtags pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin gyi chos rnams so so'i mtshan nyid tsam 'ba' zhig yod par rtogs pa ni chos kyi dbugs phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung por brtags pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin gyi chos rnams so so'i mtshan nyid tsam 'ba' zhig yod par rtogs pa ni chos kyi dbugs phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one realizes that the entities imputed as aggregates do not exist and that only the mere characteristics of phenomena exist, this is called “relief by phenomena.”

original: nam chos rnams spangs mi skye ba la gnas pa de'i tshe chos la bdag med pas dbugs phyin pa yin no zhes pa ni /
analyzed: nam chos rnams spangs mi skye ba la gnas pa de'i tshe chos la bdag med pas dbugs phyin pa yin no zhes pa ni /
translated: When one abides in the abandonment and non-arising of phenomena, at that time one is relieved by the selflessness of phenomena.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams sgyu ma dang smig rgyu'i tshul du bshig na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams sgyu ma dang smig rgyu'i tshul du bshig na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: When the aggregates and so on are destroyed in the manner of an illusion and a mirage, they do not exist.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam du zad par rtogs la rnam par shes pa de nyid kyang thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' rnyed de rang bzhin med pa gzod ma nas ma skyes par rtogs pa de ni chos la bdag med pas dbugs phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam du zad par rtogs la rnam par shes pa de nyid kyang thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' rnyed de rang bzhin med pa gzod ma nas ma skyes par rtogs pa de ni chos la bdag med pas dbugs phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One realizes that they are merely consciousness, and that consciousness itself is without beginning or end, realized to be essentially unborn from the start. That is called “relieved by the selflessness of phenomena.”

original: nam phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched thams cad dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / bdag dang / srog la sogs pa dang / chos dang / mi skye ba dag kyang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi @295a * //
analyzed: nam phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched thams cad dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / bdag dang / srog la sogs pa dang / chos dang / mi skye ba dag kyang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi @295a * //
translated: When all the aggregates, elements, sense bases, apprehended, apprehender, self, life force, and so on, as well as phenomena and non-arising, are empty by nature,

original: yang ngo bo nyid med do zhes stong pa'i ye shes skyes pa de'i tshe chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid mnyam pa nyid kyis dbugs phyin pa yin no zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yang ngo bo nyid med do zhes stong pa'i ye shes skyes pa de'i tshe chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid mnyam pa nyid kyis dbugs phyin pa yin no zhes pa ni /
translated: Furthermore, when the wisdom of emptiness arises, thinking “There is no reality,” one is relieved by the sameness of the reality of all phenomena.🔽This means that one realizes that phenomena such as the aggregates are selfless, and one understands that they are exhausted in mere consciousness. One realizes that even that consciousness is primordially unborn, and one understands that it is by nature emptiness. The realization that even that nature of emptiness is realityless is the emptiness of emptiness,

original: phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams bdag med par rtogs te rnam par shes pa tsam du zad par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa de yang gzod ma nas ma skyes par rtogs te stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du shes pa'i stong pa'i rang bzhin de yang ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pa ni stong pa sa dang po'i sems kyi mtshan nyid stong pa'i yang stong pa
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams bdag med par rtogs te rnam par shes pa tsam du zad par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa de yang gzod ma nas ma skyes par rtogs te stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du shes pa'i stong pa'i rang bzhin de yang ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pa ni stong pa sa dang po'i sems kyi mtshan nyid stong pa'i yang stong pa
translated: the characteristic of the first level of the emptiness of mind.

original: ste mnyam pa nyid kyis dbugs phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ste mnyam pa nyid kyis dbugs phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “relief by sameness.”

original: de rnams ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bshad pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bshad pa la bya ste /
translated: These should be understood as the perfect cause of the Bhagavat Vairocana.

original: rgyu phun sum thogs pa bshad pa yang de 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gzhan yang rgyu'i gnas skabs nas 'byung ba /
analyzed: rgyu phun sum thogs pa bshad pa yang de 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gzhan yang rgyu'i gnas skabs nas 'byung ba /
translated: Moreover, from the stage of cause,

original: byang chub nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: byang chub nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: enlightenment has the characteristic of space,

original: rtog pa thams cad spangs pa yin //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad spangs pa yin //
translated: it is free from all conceptual thoughts.

original: gang zhig de rtogs 'dod pa des //
analyzed: gang zhig de rtogs 'dod pa des //
translated: One who desires to realize that

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //🔽zhes pa ste bla na med pa'i byang chub de rtogs par 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o // zhes pa ste bla na med pa'i byang chub de rtogs par 'dod pa de ni /
translated: is called a bodhisattva.

original: sa dang po man chad rnams 'ba' zhig la mi bya'i /
analyzed: sa dang po man chad rnams 'ba' zhig la mi bya'i /
translated: One who desires to realize that unsurpassed enlightenment is not only on the first stage and below.

original: sa bcu dang kun du bzang po'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang bla na med pa'i byang chub rtogs par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: sa bcu dang kun du bzang po'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang bla na med pa'i byang chub rtogs par 'dod pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas abiding on the ten stages and the stage of universal good also desire to realize unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyi spyod pa yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyi spyod pa yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyur rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the conduct of those bodhisattvas should be known as the cause of the Bhagavān Vairocana.

original: da ni 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Now this should be analyzed:

original: sngags rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub kyi sems so zhes gzhung las gsungs na /
analyzed: sngags rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub kyi sems so zhes gzhung las gsungs na /
translated: The treatise states that the general characteristic of mantras is awakening.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni /
translated: Awakening is

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / las dang / bya ba'i rnam pa dang bral ba stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du yang ngo bo nyid med pa yin la /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / las dang / bya ba'i rnam pa dang bral ba stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du yang ngo bo nyid med pa yin la /
translated: free from the aspects of the aggregates, elements, sense spheres, apprehended objects, apprehending subjects, actions, and agents, and it is devoid of an essence in the nature of emptiness.

original: sngags ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de ston par byed pa'i sgra dang yig 'bru rnams te /
analyzed: sngags ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de ston par byed pa'i sgra dang yig 'bru rnams te /
translated: Mantras are the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and the sounds and syllables that teach them.

original: de rnams kyang mchog dang / 'bring dang / tha ma'i tha grub pa dang / zhi ba @295b dang ; rgyas pa dang / mngon spyod la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi bya ba byed de /
analyzed: de rnams kyang mchog dang / 'bring dang / tha ma'i tha grub pa dang / zhi ba @295b dang ; rgyas pa dang / mngon spyod la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi bya ba byed de /
translated: They perform the functions of the supreme, middling, and inferior activities of pacifying, increasing, and overpowering, respectively.

original: de ltar mi mthun na de rnams ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun na de rnams ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: If they are not in accord, how should they be understood?

original: de'i phyir de ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni /
translated: For that reason,

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po //
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po //
translated: the Lord of Secrets

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' gsang sngags kyi sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa bzhi bcus rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams bsgoms te gsang sngags kyi tshul rtogs par khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' gsang sngags kyi sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa bzhi bcus rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams bsgoms te gsang sngags kyi tshul rtogs par khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva who practices the bodhisattva deeds by way of mantra meditates on the dependent origination with forty and realizes the way of mantra.

original: yong kyang kun rdzob kyi chos rnams ni rigs pas brtag mi bzod de /
analyzed: yong kyang kun rdzob kyi chos rnams ni rigs pas brtag mi bzod de /
translated: Moreover, conventional phenomena cannot withstand rational analysis.

original: don dam par na stong pa'i rang bzhin yin mod kyi 'on kyang kun rdzob tu so so'i rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa'i bya ba rnams kyang byed par 'gyur te med ces byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: don dam par na stong pa'i rang bzhin yin mod kyi 'on kyang kun rdzob tu so so'i rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa'i bya ba rnams kyang byed par 'gyur te med ces byar mi rung ngo //
translated: In the ultimate, they are empty by nature, but still, conventionally, the activities of the individual causes and effects are performed, and it is not suitable to say that they do not exist.

original: de ltar stong pa'i rang bzhin las kun rdzob tu yod par snang ba ni sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa'i rang bzhin las kun rdzob tu yod par snang ba ni sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: Thus, the appearance of conventional existence from the nature of emptiness is like an illusion and so on.

original: de bzhin du sngags kyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems de yang don dam par stong pa yin mod kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / sgrub pa po'i sbyor ba'i mthus grub pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa sna tshogs kun rdzob tu snang zhing myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags kyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems de yang don dam par stong pa yin mod kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / sgrub pa po'i sbyor ba'i mthus grub pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa sna tshogs kun rdzob tu snang zhing myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, the nature of mantra, that is, awakening mind, is indeed empty in the ultimate sense. However, through the blessings of the ultimate expanse and the power of the practitioner's training, the various aspects of the resultant accomplishments appear and are experienced on the relative level.

original: de rnams kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpes bshad pa ni /
translated: These are explained by means of the analogies of illusion and so forth.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The text says:🔽Illusions, mirages, dreams,

original: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang zhes pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang zhes pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: and so forth.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang //
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang //
translated: Lord of Secrets, moreover,

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig bdag nyid kyi //
translated: just as when someone

original: lag na mgal me thogs nas ni //
analyzed: lag na mgal me thogs nas ni //
translated: whirls a firebrand,

original: bskor na 'khor lo ltar snang ba //
analyzed: bskor na 'khor lo ltar snang ba //
translated: a wheel appears,

original: de bzhin stong pa dag las 'byung //🔽zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin stong pa dag las 'byung // zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: so do things arise from emptiness.

original: de la sgyu ma gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sgyu ma gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: What is an illusion?

original: sman dang sngags kyis sbyor ba byed pa dag gi sbyor ba las dngos po rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs mig dang yid 'phrog pa sngon ma mthong ba dag kyang ston te /
analyzed: sman dang sngags kyis sbyor ba byed pa dag gi sbyor ba las dngos po rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs mig dang yid 'phrog pa sngon ma mthong ba dag kyang ston te /
translated: They display various different things that are captivating to the eye and mind, which have never been seen before, through the application of medicine and mantra.

original: de dag ni phan tshun phyogs bcur 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med do //
analyzed: de dag ni phan tshun phyogs bcur 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med do //
translated: They do not go or come in the ten directions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgyu ma ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgyu ma ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because illusions are empty by nature.

original: de bzhin du gsang sngags sbyor ba byed pa dag gi sbyor ba las thams cad 'byung ngo zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsang sngags sbyor ba byed pa dag gi sbyor ba las thams cad 'byung ngo zhes pa ni /
translated: Likewise, everything arises from the application of mantra and medicine.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan gyis gsang sngags dang sman gyi sbyor ba las ba lang dang rta la sogs pa'i dngos po rnam pa mang pos yid dang mi chags par byed par snang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan gyis gsang sngags dang sman gyi sbyor ba las ba lang dang rta la sogs pa'i dngos po rnam pa mang pos yid dang mi chags par byed par snang ste /
translated: Just as a magician makes many different things appear through the application of mantra and medicine, such as elephants, horses, and so on, which captivate the mind and are not to be desired,

original: @296a * // de rnams kyang ba glang rta la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa ma yin pas na phyogs bcur 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med de /
analyzed: @296a * // de rnams kyang ba glang rta la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa ma yin pas na phyogs bcur 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med de /
translated: those things do not exist as elephants, horses, and so on. Therefore, they do not go or come in the ten directions.

original: 'on kyang de dag ba glang la sogs pa'i bya ba yang byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag ba glang la sogs pa'i bya ba yang byed do //
translated: However, they also perform the actions of oxen and so forth.

original: de bzhin du sngags kyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems de stong pa nyid yin kyang sbyor ba las sngags kyi dngos grub kyi sbyor ba sbyar na rab dang 'bring la sogs pa'i grub pa'i 'bras bu rig 'dzin dang / nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang mi snang bar 'gro ba la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs su snang zhing myong par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags kyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems de stong pa nyid yin kyang sbyor ba las sngags kyi dngos grub kyi sbyor ba sbyar na rab dang 'bring la sogs pa'i grub pa'i 'bras bu rig 'dzin dang / nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang mi snang bar 'gro ba la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs su snang zhing myong par byed do //
translated: Similarly, although the nature of the mantra is emptiness, if one applies the mantra’s power to the practice, then the results of the practice, such as the attainments of the highest, middling, and so forth, will appear and be experienced in various ways, such as the attainment of the vidyādhara, the ability to travel through space, invisibility, and so forth.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang /
translated: Guhyapati, furthermore,

original: smig rgyu ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste de yang 'du shes kyis tha snyad tsam du 'dogs shing tha snyad sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: smig rgyu ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste de yang 'du shes kyis tha snyad tsam du 'dogs shing tha snyad sgrub par byed do //
translated: a mirage is empty by nature, and yet it is imputed as a mere convention by perception and establishes the convention.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes 'di yang gsang sngags so zhes tha snyad du 'dogs shing tha snyad kyang sgrub par byed do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes 'di yang gsang sngags so zhes tha snyad du 'dogs shing tha snyad kyang sgrub par byed do zhes pa ni /
translated: Similarly, this perception is also imputed as a convention, saying, ‘This is a mantra,’ and it also establishes the convention.”

original: de ltar sngags kyi 'bras bu sgyu ma dang 'dra na sngags kyi dngos po ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ltar sngags kyi 'bras bu sgyu ma dang 'dra na sngags kyi dngos po ci zhig ce na /
translated: Thus, if the result of mantra is like an illusion, what is the entity of mantra?

original: smig rgyu lta bu ste /🔽ji ltar 'brog dgon par smig rgyu la mi'am /
analyzed: smig rgyu lta bu ste / ji ltar 'brog dgon par smig rgyu la mi'am /
translated: It is like a mirage.

original: ri dags rnams kyis chur 'du shes te /
analyzed: ri dags rnams kyis chur 'du shes te /
translated: Just as in a desert a mirage is perceived as water by people or deer,🔽and although there is no water there, the mirage generates a consciousness in the aspect of water and satisfies thirst with water,

original: de na chu yod pa ma yin yang smig rgyu de'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa bskyed cing skom pa yang chus ngoms pa'i bya ba byed de de bzhin du sngags de yang dngos po yod pa ma yin pas 'du shes tsam du zad mod kyi /
analyzed: de na chu yod pa ma yin yang smig rgyu de'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa bskyed cing skom pa yang chus ngoms pa'i bya ba byed de de bzhin du sngags de yang dngos po yod pa ma yin pas 'du shes tsam du zad mod kyi /
translated: in the same way, since mantra is not an existent entity, it is merely a perception,

original: 'on kyang sngags kyi dngos grub kyi 'bras bu bskrun pa'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngags kyi dngos grub kyi 'bras bu bskrun pa'i bya ba byed do //
translated: but it does generate the result of the power of mantra.

original: de bzhin du yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang /
translated: Similarly,

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang /
translated: the Lord of Secrets said,

original: rmi lam na bdag nyid nyin gcig dang / thang cig dang / skad cig dang / yud tsam dang / lo la sogs par 'dug cing bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po myong bar mthong la /
analyzed: rmi lam na bdag nyid nyin gcig dang / thang cig dang / skad cig dang / yud tsam dang / lo la sogs par 'dug cing bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po myong bar mthong la /
translated: “Moreover, in a dream one sees oneself staying for a day, an hour, a moment, a second, a minute, a year, and so on, and one experiences many kinds of happiness and suffering.

original: sad na ci yang mi mthong ba de bzhin du gsang sngags kyi tshul 'di yang rmi lam lta bur khong du chud par bya'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sad na ci yang mi mthong ba de bzhin du gsang sngags kyi tshul 'di yang rmi lam lta bur khong du chud par bya'o zhes pa ni /
translated: Just as when one awakens from a dream, one does not see anything at all, so one should understand this way of mantra to be like a dream.

original: sngar sngags bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu'i dpe sgyu ma las blangs pa de sgyu ma ni yun ring du 'dug pa ma yin gyi skad cig yud tsam dag tu zad la sngags kyi 'bras bu ni bskal ba la sogs par yun ring du 'dug na ji ltar dper rung
analyzed: sngar sngags bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu'i dpe sgyu ma las blangs pa de sgyu ma ni yun ring du 'dug pa ma yin gyi skad cig yud tsam dag tu zad la sngags kyi 'bras bu ni bskal ba la sogs par yun ring du 'dug na ji ltar dper rung
translated: The example of illusion was previously taken for the result of mantra practice. But since an illusion does not last long, it is exhausted in a moment, whereas the result of mantra lasts for a long time, such as an eon.

original: zhe na / rmi lam gyi dpes yun ring du gnas par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhe na / rmi lam gyi dpes yun ring du gnas par bstan pa ste /
translated: How can it be an example? The example of a dream teaches that it lasts for a long time.

original: ji ltar rmi lam na yul gyi dngos po med par skad cig dang / nyi ma dang / zhag dang / lo la @296b sogs par yul rnams spyod cing bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po myong zhing rigs par mthong ste de las sad na dngos po gang yang med do //
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam na yul gyi dngos po med par skad cig dang / nyi ma dang / zhag dang / lo la @296b sogs par yul rnams spyod cing bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po myong zhing rigs par mthong ste de las sad na dngos po gang yang med do //
translated: Just as in a dream, without any objective entity, one experiences objects for a moment, a day, a fortnight, a year, and so on, and one sees many kinds of happiness and suffering, but when one awakens, there is not any entity at all.

original: de ltar yang cis mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yang cis mngon zhe na /
translated: How is that known?

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal pa'i mdo las kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal pa'i mdo las kyang gsungs pa /
translated: The King of Concentrations Sūtra also says:

original: ji ltar bu mo gzhan nu'i rmi lam na //
analyzed: ji ltar bu mo gzhan nu'i rmi lam na //
translated: Just as a girl in a dream

original: bu pho byung zhing shi ba de mthong nas //
analyzed: bu pho byung zhing shi ba de mthong nas //
translated: sees a son born and then dying,

original: byung na dga' zhing shi na mi dga' ltar //
analyzed: byung na dga' zhing shi na mi dga' ltar //
translated: and is happy when he is born and sad when he dies,

original: zhes pa ste de ltar rmi lam na yun ring por srid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ste de ltar rmi lam na yun ring por srid do //
translated: so it is with long life in a dream.

original: de bzhin du sngags bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu yang rang bzhin med pa las rnal 'byor pas bsgrubs na grub pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa sna tshogs tshe rabs dang bskal pa la sogs par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu yang rang bzhin med pa las rnal 'byor pas bsgrubs na grub pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa sna tshogs tshe rabs dang bskal pa la sogs par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, the results of mantra practice are also like illusions. If the yogin practices, the results of the accomplishments will be various, and will last for many lifetimes, eons, and so forth.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang //
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang //
translated: Lord of Secrets, moreover,

original: gsang sngags kyi dngos grub 'byung ba ni gzugs brnyan lta bur 'gyur par rig par bya ste zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi dngos grub 'byung ba ni gzugs brnyan lta bur 'gyur par rig par bya ste zhes pa ni /
translated: the arising of the accomplishments of mantra should be understood to be like a reflection.

original: de ltar sngags grub pa de rnams dngos po med par yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa las byung na sgrub pa po thams cad kyis grub pa ci'i phyir mi 'thob ce na /
analyzed: de ltar sngags grub pa de rnams dngos po med par yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa las byung na sgrub pa po thams cad kyis grub pa ci'i phyir mi 'thob ce na /
translated: If those who have accomplished mantra arise from dependent origination even though they are not real, why would all practitioners not attain accomplishment?

original: ji ltar gzugs brnyan de rdo dang shing gzhan las mi 'byung gi / me long gi dkyil 'khor dag pa las 'byung par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs brnyan de rdo dang shing gzhan las mi 'byung gi / me long gi dkyil 'khor dag pa las 'byung par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as that reflection does not arise from other stones and wood, but arises from the pure surface of a mirror.

original: de bzhin du sngags kyi grub pa de yang sgrub pa po thams cad la mi 'byung gi / gang byang chub kyi sems bsgoms shing rgyud dag par gyur pa de la 'byung par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags kyi grub pa de yang sgrub pa po thams cad la mi 'byung gi / gang byang chub kyi sems bsgoms shing rgyud dag par gyur pa de la 'byung par bstan pa'o //
translated: In the same way, that accomplishment of mantra does not arise for all practitioners, but arises for one who has cultivated the thought of awakening and purified their continuum.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang /🔽grub pa'i grub gnas ni dri za'i grong khyer lta bur blta'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang / grub pa'i grub gnas ni dri za'i grong khyer lta bur blta'o zhes pa ni /
