translated: Lord of Secrets, furthermore,🔽the abode of the site of accomplishment should be seen as like a city of gandharvas.

original: ji ltar dri za rnams kyi grong khyer dri za de rnams kyis gang du bsams pa der grong thal byung du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar dri za rnams kyi grong khyer dri za de rnams kyis gang du bsams pa der grong thal byung du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Just as a city of gandharvas arises by chance wherever gandharvas think of it,

original: de bzhin du gsang sngags grub pa de yang bdag nyid kyi lus rig 'dzin la sogs par grub pa'i phyir bsgrubs kyi gzhan gyi phyir ma bsgrubs kyang nam rig 'dzin la sogs pa grub na lha'i gzhal med khang dpag bsam gyi shing dang / grib ma dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsang sngags grub pa de yang bdag nyid kyi lus rig 'dzin la sogs par grub pa'i phyir bsgrubs kyi gzhan gyi phyir ma bsgrubs kyang nam rig 'dzin la sogs pa grub na lha'i gzhal med khang dpag bsam gyi shing dang / grib ma dang /
translated: Likewise, the accomplishment of secret mantra is accomplished for one’s own body, for the sake of accomplishing the vidyādhara, and so on. Even though it is not accomplished for the sake of others, when the vidyādhara, and so on, is accomplished, the celestial palace of the deity, the wish-fulfilling tree, the shadow,

original: shel gyi brag las bdud rtsi'i chu 'bab pa dang / rin po che'i gsing mal sogs pa'i gnas rnams bsams pa tsam gyis 'grub par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shel gyi brag las bdud rtsi'i chu 'bab pa dang / rin po che'i gsing mal sogs pa'i gnas rnams bsams pa tsam gyis 'grub par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
translated: the water of amṛta flowing from the crystal rock, the jeweled meadow, and so on, are all accomplished merely by thinking of them.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang gsang sngags kyi sgra ni brag ca lta bur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang gsang sngags kyi sgra ni brag ca lta bur rig par bya ste /
translated: Guhyapati, moreover, the sound of secret mantra should be known to be like an echo.

original: dper na sgra la brten nas brag ca 'byung pa ltar gsang sngags @297a * //
analyzed: dper na sgra la brten nas brag ca 'byung pa ltar gsang sngags @297a * //
translated: For example, just as an echo arises in dependence on sound,

original: kyi tshul 'di yang de dang 'dra par rig par bya'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: kyi tshul 'di yang de dang 'dra par rig par bya'o zhes pa ni /
translated: this method of secret mantra should be known to be like that.

original: ji ltar sgra'i rkyen gyis brag ca 'byung bas dngos po yod pa ma yin yang sgrar 'byung ba de bzhin du gsang sngags kyi sgra yang sngags kyi rang bzhin gyis stong mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sgra'i rkyen gyis brag ca 'byung bas dngos po yod pa ma yin yang sgrar 'byung ba de bzhin du gsang sngags kyi sgra yang sngags kyi rang bzhin gyis stong mod kyi /
translated: Just as an echo arises due to the condition of sound, and although it is not a real thing, it arises as sound, in the same way, although the sound of mantra is empty of the nature of mantra,

original: sgrub pa'i rkyen gyis sgra de 'byung ba ni dper na brag ca dang 'dra bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rkyen gyis sgra de 'byung ba ni dper na brag ca dang 'dra bar bstan pa'o //
translated: the arising of that sound due to the condition of practice is taught to be like an echo.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang /
translated: Lord of Secrets, moreover,

original: zla ba shar na chu'i nang du gzugs brnyan mthong nas chu zla zhes brjod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: zla ba shar na chu'i nang du gzugs brnyan mthong nas chu zla zhes brjod pa de bzhin du /
translated: when the moon rises, the reflection is seen in the water and is called the “moon in the water.”

original: sngags pa de nyid kyang chu zla bzhin du rig sngags 'chang zhes brjod do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sngags pa de nyid kyang chu zla bzhin du rig sngags 'chang zhes brjod do zhes pa ni /
translated: In the same way, the mantra practitioner is also called a “vidyādhara” like the moon in the water.

original: zla ba shar ba'i gzugs brnyan chu'i nang du 'byung pa de ni zla ba'i rang bzhin de las mi gzhan no //
analyzed: zla ba shar ba'i gzugs brnyan chu'i nang du 'byung pa de ni zla ba'i rang bzhin de las mi gzhan no //
translated: The arising of the reflection of the rising moon in the water is not different from the nature of the moon.

original: de bzhin du sngags grub pa'i rig 'dzin de yang rig 'dzin gyi lus bzang po la sogs pa ni sgrub pa'i gzugs de las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags grub pa'i rig 'dzin de yang rig 'dzin gyi lus bzang po la sogs pa ni sgrub pa'i gzugs de las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the vidyādhara who has accomplished mantra is not different from the form of the accomplishment, such as the excellent body of the vidyādhara.

original: gzugs de nyid las 'gyur mod kyi //
analyzed: gzugs de nyid las 'gyur mod kyi //
translated: It is from that very form that they arise.

original: 'on kyang rig 'dzin zhes brjod do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rig 'dzin zhes brjod do zhes pa'o //
translated: Nevertheless, they are called knowledge-holders.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang //
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang //
translated: Lord of Secrets, moreover,

original: ji ltar char pa bab pa na //
analyzed: ji ltar char pa bab pa na //
translated: just as when rain falls,

original: chu yi chu bur rnams 'byung ba //🔽de bzhin gsang sngags grub pa yi //
analyzed: chu yi chu bur rnams 'byung ba // de bzhin gsang sngags grub pa yi //
translated: water bubbles arise,🔽so too are the various emanations

original: sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'dod //
analyzed: sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'dod //
translated: desired from the accomplishment of mantra.

original: ces pa ni sngags gcig pu las grub pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa mang por ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ces pa ni sngags gcig pu las grub pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa mang por ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how can there be many results from a single mantra,

original: chu'i chu bur gyi dpes sngags de gcig pu yin yang grub pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa mang po 'byung par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chu'i chu bur gyi dpes sngags de gcig pu yin yang grub pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa mang po 'byung par bstan pa ste /
translated: the example of water bubbles demonstrates that although the mantra is single, many results of accomplishment arise.

original: ji ltar char pa bab pa na chu gcig pu de las chu'i chu bur che phra la sogs pa rnams pa mang po 'byung ba de bzhin du sngags gcig pu las kyang grub pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa du ma 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar char pa bab pa na chu gcig pu de las chu'i chu bur che phra la sogs pa rnams pa mang po 'byung ba de bzhin du sngags gcig pu las kyang grub pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa du ma 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as many large and small water bubbles arise from that single water when rain falls, so too many results of accomplishment arise from a single mantra.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang /
translated: Lord of Secrets, moreover,

original: sems can med cing srog dang ni //
analyzed: sems can med cing srog dang ni //
translated: There are no sentient beings, no life-force,

original: byed pa po yang med pa ste //
analyzed: byed pa po yang med pa ste //
translated: and also no agent.

original: dngos po thams cad stong nyid la //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad stong nyid la //
translated: All things are emptiness,

original: 'khrul pa kho na snang bar zad //🔽ces pa ni /
analyzed: 'khrul pa kho na snang bar zad // ces pa ni /
translated: and only delusion appears.

original: de ltar sngags kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid de sems can nam srog gam byed pa'i mkhan po med de /
analyzed: de ltar sngags kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid de sems can nam srog gam byed pa'i mkhan po med de /
translated: Thus, the nature of mantra is emptiness, without sentient beings, life-force, or an agent.

original: stong pa nyid yin kyang grub pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa kun du snang ba ni 'khrul pa snang bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid yin kyang grub pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa kun du snang ba ni 'khrul pa snang bar bstan pa'o //
translated: Although it is emptiness, the appearance of all results of accomplishment and so on is taught to be the appearance of delusion.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang /
translated: Guhyapati, furthermore,

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig bdag nyid kyi //
translated: just as someone

original: lag na mgal me thogs nas ni //
analyzed: lag na mgal me thogs nas ni //
translated: holding a firebrand in their hand

original: bskor na 'khor lo ltar snang ba //
analyzed: bskor na 'khor lo ltar snang ba //
translated: appears as a wheel when spun,

original: de bzhin stong pa dag las 'byung //
analyzed: de bzhin stong pa dag las 'byung //
translated: so it arises from emptiness.

original: zhes pa ni 'khrul pa la snang @297b ba'i dpe'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'khrul pa la snang @297b ba'i dpe'o //
translated: This is an example of the appearance of delusion.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Guhyapati,

original: 'di ni theg pa chen po'i gzhi //
analyzed: 'di ni theg pa chen po'i gzhi //
translated: this is the basis of the Mahāyāna.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to:

original: ye shes sna tshogs cher 'byung ba //
analyzed: ye shes sna tshogs cher 'byung ba //
translated: the great arising of various pristine consciousnesses.

original: nor gyi dbyig 'di shes na ni //
analyzed: nor gyi dbyig 'di shes na ni //
translated: If this jewel of wealth is known,

original: kun gyi sems kyi bye brag kyang //
analyzed: kun gyi sems kyi bye brag kyang //
translated: And the various states of mind of all beings

original: ji bzhin yang dag rab tu shes //
analyzed: ji bzhin yang dag rab tu shes //
translated: Are known just as they are, perfectly.

original: zhes pa'i bar du sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems mnyam pa nyid rtogs /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems mnyam pa nyid rtogs /
translated: Up to here, the bodhicitta of the first bhumi, equanimity, is realized.

original: pa de'i rjes su sngags pa bshad pa ste /
analyzed: pa de'i rjes su sngags pa bshad pa ste /
translated: After that, the mantra is explained:

original: theg pa chen po'i gzhi zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i gzhi zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ste /
translated: “The basis of the Mahayana” is the knowledge of bodhicitta just as it is.

original: theg pa chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The Mahayana is the path of the bodhisattva together with its result.

original: byang chub kyi sems de shes na 'jigs rten pa'i sems brgyad nas sa rab tu dga' ba'i bar gyi rim pa de rnams rab tu shes pas na de'i gnas so zhes pa'o //🔽mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i gzhi //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de shes na 'jigs rten pa'i sems brgyad nas sa rab tu dga' ba'i bar gyi rim pa de rnams rab tu shes pas na de'i gnas so zhes pa'o // mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i gzhi //
translated: If one knows that bodhicitta, one will know the stages from the eight worldly states up to the Joyful One.🔽“The basis of the equal and unequal” is as follows: The unequal is space, and since space is limitless, it is unequal to anything.

original: zhes pa la mi mnyam pa ni nam mkha' ste nam mkha' la mtha' med pas gang dang yang mi mnyam la de dang mnyam pa ni chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: zhes pa la mi mnyam pa ni nam mkha' ste nam mkha' la mtha' med pas gang dang yang mi mnyam la de dang mnyam pa ni chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid de /
translated: That which is equal to it is the dharmadhatu, emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin de shes pa ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin de shes pa ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i gnas so //
translated: The knowledge of the nature of emptiness is the state of equality with the unequaled.

original: nges pa'i gzhi zhes pa ni chos rnams stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du phyin ci ma log par nges par shes pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i gzhi zhes pa ni chos rnams stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du phyin ci ma log par nges par shes pa'o //
translated: The basis of ascertainment refers to the unmistaken knowledge that phenomena are by nature emptiness.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzhi zhes pa ni sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa de bla na med pa'i byang chub dang tha mi dad de ro gcig pas na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas🔽so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzhi zhes pa ni sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa de bla na med pa'i byang chub dang tha mi dad de ro gcig pas na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes pa'o //
translated: The basis of perfect complete buddhahood refers to the bodhicitta of the first ground, the realization of the equality of all phenomena, which is of one taste, inseparable from unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: mthar gyis theg pa chen po la 'dzeg pa'i gzhi ste zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mthar gyis theg pa chen po la 'dzeg pa'i gzhi ste zhes pa ni /
translated: The basis for gradually ascending to the Great Vehicle refers to the bodhicitta of the second ground up to the tenth ground.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu 'jig rten pa dang 'jigs rten las 'das pa'i sems 'og ma rnams kyang sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems 'di'i nang du 'dus la sa dang po nas kun du bzang po'i sa man chad kyi sems kyang 'di las
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu 'jig rten pa dang 'jigs rten las 'das pa'i sems 'og ma rnams kyang sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems 'di'i nang du 'dus la sa dang po nas kun du bzang po'i sa man chad kyi sems kyang 'di las
translated: The Bhagavat Vairocana is the cause, the lower mundane and supramundane minds are included within this bodhichitta of the first bhumi.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir de rnams kyi gnas su gyur pas na mthar gyis theg pa chen po la 'dzeg pa'i gzhi zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir de rnams kyi gnas su gyur pas na mthar gyis theg pa chen po la 'dzeg pa'i gzhi zhes pa'o //
translated: Since the minds from the first bhumi up to the bhumi of Samantabhadra are not different from this, they are the basis for ascending to the Mahayana.

original: ye shes sna tshogs cher 'byung ba //
analyzed: ye shes sna tshogs cher 'byung ba //
translated: The source of the great variety of wisdoms

original: nor gyi dbyig 'di shes na ni //
analyzed: nor gyi dbyig 'di shes na ni //
translated: If one knows this jewel of wealth,🔽One will know exactly

original: kun gyi sems kyi bye brag kyang //🔽ji bzhin yang dag rab tu shes //
analyzed: kun gyi sems kyi bye brag kyang // ji bzhin yang dag rab tu shes //
translated: The specific mind of all.

original: zhes pa ni sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems de thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i gtso bo yin pas ye shes nas tshogs che 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems de thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i gtso bo yin pas ye shes nas tshogs che 'byung ba yin la /
translated: Since the bodhichitta of the first bhumi is the principal source of omniscient wisdom, it is the source of the great accumulation of wisdom.

original: de legs par shes na rnam pa rnams mdzad kyi rgyu dang 'jigs rten dang 'jigs rten las 'das pa'i sems kyi khyad par thams @298a * //
analyzed: de legs par shes na rnam pa rnams mdzad kyi rgyu dang 'jigs rten dang 'jigs rten las 'das pa'i sems kyi khyad par thams @298a * //
translated: If one understands that well, one will understand all the differences of mundane and supramundane minds, which are the causes of the aspects.

original: cad rab tu shes par gyur pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: cad rab tu shes par gyur pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the understanding of all the differences of mundane and supramundane minds, which are the causes of the aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa rnam par sprul pa byin gyis rlob pa las sems kyi khyad par rim par phye ba dang po'o /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa rnam par sprul pa byin gyis rlob pa las sems kyi khyad par rim par phye ba dang po'o /
translated: This is the first chapter on the distinctions of mind from the blessing of the emanation of the great transcendent state of complete enlightenment of the Bhagavān Vairocana.

original: // / da ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes des mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams tshul nas tshogs dang bsam pa sna tshogs dang thabs sna tshogs kyis bla na med par
analyzed: // / da ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes des mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams tshul nas tshogs dang bsam pa sna tshogs dang thabs sna tshogs kyis bla na med par
translated: Now, after the Bhagavān Vairocana attained omniscient wisdom, with that omniscient wisdom he saw the infinite realms of sentient beings with various dispositions, aspirations, and methods, and with various vehicles he established them in their respective vehicles.

original: bsgral ba'i phyir sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis lhun gyis grub pa nyid du sku mnyam pa nyid mi zad pa'i rgyan gyi 'khor los khams gsum thams cad du khyab par mdzad pa /
analyzed: bsgral ba'i phyir sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis lhun gyis grub pa nyid du sku mnyam pa nyid mi zad pa'i rgyan gyi 'khor los khams gsum thams cad du khyab par mdzad pa /
translated: In order to liberate them, the wheel of adornments of the inexhaustible equality of the body pervades the entire three realms by the power of the force of former aspirations.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor de byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa kun du bzang po dang / phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa'i yongs su dag pa rnams kyis mngon sum du mthong zhing spyod yul du 'gyur na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor de byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa kun du bzang po dang / phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa'i yongs su dag pa rnams kyis mngon sum du mthong zhing spyod yul du 'gyur na /
translated: If the natural maṇḍala of the Bhagavān is seen and becomes the domain of the pure bodhisattva mahāsattvas, such as the noble Samantabhadra and Vajrapāṇi,

original: 'gro ba 'og ma rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la sogs pa'i 'khor lo de spyod yul du ma gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'og ma rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la sogs pa'i 'khor lo de spyod yul du ma gyur te /
translated: the wheel of the body of the Bhagavān and so on is not the domain of those of lower realms.

original: sems can de rnams kyi don du sku la sogs pa'i 'khor rnams dkyil 'khor dang sngags dang phyag rgya la sogs par byin brlab par bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes gsol pa 'chad de /
analyzed: sems can de rnams kyi don du sku la sogs pa'i 'khor rnams dkyil 'khor dang sngags dang phyag rgya la sogs par byin brlab par bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes gsol pa 'chad de /
translated: For the benefit of those sentient beings, Vajrapāṇi requests the Bhagavān to bless the wheel of the body and so on as the maṇḍala, mantra, mudra, and so on.

original: gsol ba de yang de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la gsang ba pa'i bdag po phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa nas /
analyzed: gsol ba de yang de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la gsang ba pa'i bdag po phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, Vajrapani, Lord of Secrets, again made a request to the Bhagavan, saying:

original: bco ldan 'das gsang sngags spyod pa'i tshul snying rje chen po'i snying po 'byung ba dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po chen po yongs su rdzogs par bgyi pa'i slad du bshad du gsol /
analyzed: bco ldan 'das gsang sngags spyod pa'i tshul snying rje chen po'i snying po 'byung ba dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po chen po yongs su rdzogs par bgyi pa'i slad du bshad du gsol /
translated: Bhagavan, in order to complete the great king of mandalas, the source of the essence of great compassion, the way of Secret Mantra conduct, please explain it.

original: de ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sems can mang po dag gi don dang phan pa dang bde par 'gyur lags so zhes pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sems can mang po dag gi don dang phan pa dang bde par 'gyur lags so zhes pa'i bar du ste /
translated: In the future, it will be for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of many beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi dbyings bsam gyis mi khyab pa sems kyi sa las 'das pa de thugs su chud nas sems can rnams so so'i dad pa dang rjes su mthun la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi dbyings bsam gyis mi khyab pa sems kyi sa las 'das pa de thugs su chud nas sems can rnams so so'i dad pa dang rjes su mthun la /
translated: The Bhagavan himself, having fully awakened, having realized the inconceivable dharmadhatu that transcends the level of mind, in accordance with the individual faiths of sentient beings,

original: so so'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i sku la sogs pa'i 'khor los sems can gyi khams thams cad du khyab par rnam par sprul pa phyag na rdo rjes ji @298b ltar mthong zhing rtogs pa de bcom ldan 'das la slar bzlas te gsol pa yin
analyzed: so so'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i sku la sogs pa'i 'khor los sems can gyi khams thams cad du khyab par rnam par sprul pa phyag na rdo rjes ji @298b ltar mthong zhing rtogs pa de bcom ldan 'das la slar bzlas te gsol pa yin
translated: Vajrapani repeats to the Lord what he has seen and realized, the emanations of the wheel of body and so forth that completely fulfill the wishes of each and every sentient being and pervade the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: no // de ltar slar gsol pa yang ston pas ci bshad pa rnams nyan pa pos khong du chud pa'i tshul gyis slar mnyan na ston pa po spro ba dang skabs 'og man dang mtshams sbyar pa la yang bde ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: no // de ltar slar gsol pa yang ston pas ci bshad pa rnams nyan pa pos khong du chud pa'i tshul gyis slar mnyan na ston pa po spro ba dang skabs 'og man dang mtshams sbyar pa la yang bde ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He repeats this in order to show that when the listener hears what the teacher has said and understands it, the teacher is pleased and it is easy to connect the present section with the following one.

original: ngo mtshar lags so zhes pa ni de ltar stong pa nyid brjod pa dang rtogs pa las 'das pa thugs su chud kyang sku la sogs pa'i rgyan gyis tshul sna tshogs dang bsam pa sna tshogs dang thabs sna tshogs kyis sprul pa de ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar lags so zhes pa ni de ltar stong pa nyid brjod pa dang rtogs pa las 'das pa thugs su chud kyang sku la sogs pa'i rgyan gyis tshul sna tshogs dang bsam pa sna tshogs dang thabs sna tshogs kyis sprul pa de ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: It is wonderful means that it is wonderful that he has realized emptiness beyond expression and realization, yet he emanates with various modes, various wishes and various methods such as the adornments of body and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings bsam gyis mi khyab pa de gzhan las mnyan nas thugs su chud pa ma yin gyi bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi thugs su chud pa la bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings bsam gyis mi khyab pa de gzhan las mnyan nas thugs su chud pa ma yin gyi bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi thugs su chud pa la bya'o //
translated: This means that the inconceivable dharmadhātu is not something that is understood by listening to others; it is what the Bhagavān himself has realized.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i tshul snying rje chen po snying po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po chen po yongs su rdzogs par bgyi ba'i slad du bshad du gsol de ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sems can mang po dag gi don dang
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i tshul snying rje chen po snying po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po chen po yongs su rdzogs par bgyi ba'i slad du bshad du gsol de ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sems can mang po dag gi don dang
translated: The Bhagavān also should explain it in order to completely accomplish the great king of maṇḍalas that arise from the essence of great compassion, the way of secret mantra conduct.🔽That will be for the benefit,🔽welfare, and happiness of many sentient beings in the future.

original: phan pa dang bde par 'gyur lags so zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor sku la sogs pa'i 'khor lo de bdag cag gis rtogs shing spyod yul du gyur na yang ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don du sku la sogs pa'i 'khor lo de rnams
analyzed: phan pa dang bde par 'gyur lags so zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor sku la sogs pa'i 'khor lo de bdag cag gis rtogs shing spyod yul du gyur na yang ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don du sku la sogs pa'i 'khor lo de rnams
translated: Although we have realized and experienced that maṇḍala of the nature of the body and so on, for the benefit of future migrating beings, those maṇḍalas of the body and so on

original: dkyil 'khor dang sngags dang phyag rgya'i sgo nas 'gro ba de rnams kyi spyod yul du 'gyur par byin gyis brlab tu gsol ba'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang sngags dang phyag rgya'i sgo nas 'gro ba de rnams kyi spyod yul du 'gyur par byin gyis brlab tu gsol ba'o //
translated: Bless them so that they may become the domain of experience of those beings through the mandala, mantra, and seal.

original: snying rje chen po 'byung ba zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor de snying rje chen po las 'byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po 'byung ba zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor de snying rje chen po las 'byung ba la bya'o //
translated: The arising of great compassion refers to the mandala arising from great compassion.

original: dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni 'og nas gzhung nyid las 'chad do //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni 'og nas gzhung nyid las 'chad do //
translated: As for mandala, it will be explained below in the text itself.

original: rgyal po zhes pa ni de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor kun kyang dkyil 'khor chen po 'di'i nang du 'dus pas na rgyal po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal po zhes pa ni de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor kun kyang dkyil 'khor chen po 'di'i nang du 'dus pas na rgyal po zhes bya'o //
translated: As for king, since all the mandalas of other bodhisattvas and so on are included within this great mandala, it is called king.

original: yongs su rdzogs par bgyi ba'i slad du zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi sgo nas sgrub cing lha mnyes par bya'i spyod pa rnam pa bcu drug gis lha mnyes par bya ba yang sgrub pa'i sgo nas bzlas pa'i yan lag bzhi dang rang gi sems yongs su sbyang
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par bgyi ba'i slad du zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi sgo nas sgrub cing lha mnyes par bya'i spyod pa rnam pa bcu drug gis lha mnyes par bya ba yang sgrub pa'i sgo nas bzlas pa'i yan lag bzhi dang rang gi sems yongs su sbyang
translated: As for in order to perfect, it is in order to accomplish through the mandala and to please the deity by means of the sixteen types of conduct. The pleasing of the deity through accomplishment is also accomplished through the four branches of repetition, and one's mind is purified by the four branches of familiarization.

original: ba la sogs pa'i spyod pas lha mnyes par byas te /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa'i spyod pas lha mnyes par byas te /
translated: Having pleased the deity by the conduct of the cow and so on,

original: rig 'dzin la sogs pa'i grub pa thob nas rim gyis sang rgyas su 'grub pa dang / rang gi sems yongs @299a * //
analyzed: rig 'dzin la sogs pa'i grub pa thob nas rim gyis sang rgyas su 'grub pa dang / rang gi sems yongs @299a * //
translated: one attains the powers of the knowledge-holder and so on, and gradually accomplishes buddhahood.

original: su sbyangs pas mngon par shes pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa rdzogs nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnyed par gyur pa ni dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: su sbyangs pas mngon par shes pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa rdzogs nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnyed par gyur pa ni dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The complete maṇḍala is the attainment of the pristine consciousness of omniscience after perfecting the conduct of the perfections and so on through completely purifying one’s mind.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sems can mang po dag gi don dang phan pa dang bde par 'gyur pa'i phyir gsang sngags spyod pa'i tshul de bshad du gsol zhes spyar te ma 'ongs pa'i sems can de rnams kyis dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid can thams
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sems can mang po dag gi don dang phan pa dang bde par 'gyur pa'i phyir gsang sngags spyod pa'i tshul de bshad du gsol zhes spyar te ma 'ongs pa'i sems can de rnams kyis dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid can thams
translated: “ Please explain the method of mantra conduct for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of many sentient beings in the future.”

original: cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de thob par bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor de bshad du gsol zhes pa ste don dang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de thob par bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor de bshad du gsol zhes pa ste don dang zhes pa ni /
translated: The maṇḍala should be explained for the purpose of attaining the pristine consciousness of omniscience, which has the characteristic of the complete maṇḍala.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa'i don gyi phyir ro ;
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa'i don gyi phyir ro ;
translated: For the sake of attaining the gnosis of omniscience.

original: / phan pa dang zhes pa ni tshe phyi ma la phan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / phan pa dang zhes pa ni tshe phyi ma la phan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Beneficial means for the sake of benefit in future lives.

original: bde bar 'gyur zhes pa ni tshe 'di la bde ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde bar 'gyur zhes pa ni tshe 'di la bde ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Happy means for the sake of happiness in this life.

original: yang na don dang zhes pa ni phan pa dang bde pa'i don la bya'o //
analyzed: yang na don dang zhes pa ni phan pa dang bde pa'i don la bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, the meaning of beneficial is for the sake of benefit and happiness.

original: gsang sngags spyod pa'i tshul zhes pa la gsang sngags kyi spyod pa ni dkyil 'khor dang bsgrub pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags spyod pa'i tshul zhes pa la gsang sngags kyi spyod pa ni dkyil 'khor dang bsgrub pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: As for the way of mantra practice, the practice of mantra is the maṇḍala, accomplishment, and so on.

original: de dag nyid tshul te tshul zhes pa ni rgya gar skad kyi gzhung dang sbyar na 'gro ba'am thob pa la bya ste gsang sngags kyi spyod pa des bla na med pa'i sang rgyas su 'gro ba'am thob pa de bshad du gsol zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid tshul te tshul zhes pa ni rgya gar skad kyi gzhung dang sbyar na 'gro ba'am thob pa la bya ste gsang sngags kyi spyod pa des bla na med pa'i sang rgyas su 'gro ba'am thob pa de bshad du gsol zhes pa'o //
translated: That itself is the way. The word way is applied to the Indian text as going or attaining. It means, Please explain that way of mantra practice by which one goes or attains unsurpassed buddhahood.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par sang mdzad kyi thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil nag pa zhes pa la ni ni nges pa aa ya thob pa'am 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par sang mdzad kyi thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil nag pa zhes pa la ni ni nges pa aa ya thob pa'am 'gro ba'o //
translated: Then, the Bhagavān Vairocana, having looked at the entire circle of the assembly, said this to the Bodhisattva Mañjuśrī:🔽“Mañjuśrī, Mañjuśrī!”

original: 'khor la gzigs nas zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag gi nang na g-yeng ba yod dam med pa dang / nyan pa po snod du ma gyur pa yod dam med brtags pa'i phyir gzigs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor la gzigs nas zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag gi nang na g-yeng ba yod dam med pa dang / nyan pa po snod du ma gyur pa yod dam med brtags pa'i phyir gzigs pa la bya'o //
translated: “Having looked at the assembly” means that in order to examine whether or not there is distraction among those bodhisattva disciples and whether or not there are listeners who are not suitable vessels, [the Buddha] looks.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor ni yongs su dag pa sha stag yin na ci'i phyir g-yeng ba dang snod du ma gyur pa srid ce na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor ni yongs su dag pa sha stag yin na ci'i phyir g-yeng ba dang snod du ma gyur pa srid ce na /
translated: If the circle of bodhisattva disciples of the Bhagavān Vairocana is completely pure, why is there distraction and the possibility of being an unsuitable vessel?

original: de'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention is this:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor byang chub sems dpa' de rnams la g-yeng pa dang snod du ma gyur pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor byang chub sems dpa' de rnams la g-yeng pa dang snod du ma gyur pa med mod kyi /
translated: The Bhagavān has no distraction or unsuitable vessels among those bodhisattva disciples.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na nyan pa rnams la de lta bu srid pas de dag la brtag pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na nyan pa rnams la de lta bu srid pas de dag la brtag pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since such [things] are possible for those who listen in the future, [the Bhagavān] teaches the method of investigation for them.🔽Listen to the Dharma discourse that teaches the method of the maṇḍala conduct of Vajrapāṇi, which perfects omniscient wisdom!

original: lag na rdo rje dkyil 'khor spyad pa'i tshul bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyon cig ces pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi sgo nas lha mnyes par bya ba'i spyod pa rnam pa @299b bcu drug bshad pa
analyzed: lag na rdo rje dkyil 'khor spyad pa'i tshul bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyon cig ces pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi sgo nas lha mnyes par bya ba'i spyod pa rnam pa @299b bcu drug bshad pa
translated: The sixteen aspects of the conduct that pleases the deity through the maṇḍala

original: dang / de bzhin du rim gyis grub pa'i sgo nas lha mnyes par bya ba'i spyod pa bzlas pa yan lag bzhi dang rang gi sems yongs su sbyang bar byas pas lha mnyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dang / de bzhin du rim gyis grub pa'i sgo nas lha mnyes par bya ba'i spyod pa bzlas pa yan lag bzhi dang rang gi sems yongs su sbyang bar byas pas lha mnyes par 'gyur te /
translated: and likewise, the conduct that pleases the deity through the stage of accomplishment, the four-branched repetition, and the purification of one's mind, [are taught].

original: rig 'dzin la sogs pa'i grub pa mngon du thob nas rim gyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par gyur pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzog pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rig 'dzin la sogs pa'i grub pa mngon du thob nas rim gyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par gyur pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzog pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one attains the state of a knowledge bearer and so forth, and gradually perfects the exalted wisdom of omniscience, it is called the mandala of perfecting the exalted wisdom of omniscience.

original: dkyil 'khor spyad pa zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor bri ba la sogs pa spyod pa rnam pa bcu drug la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor spyad pa zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor bri ba la sogs pa spyod pa rnam pa bcu drug la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term “practicing the mandala” refers to the sixteen aspects of practice such as drawing the mandala and so forth.

original: tshul ni sngar bshad do //
analyzed: tshul ni sngar bshad do //
translated: The term “method” has been explained above.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs zhes pa ni don gyi dngos po gcig la tshig mang po'i sgo nas don gyi dmigs bstan ba la bya ste thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas kyang 'gyur /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs zhes pa ni don gyi dngos po gcig la tshig mang po'i sgo nas don gyi dmigs bstan ba la bya ste thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas kyang 'gyur /
translated: The term “dharma discourse” refers to the presentation of the meaning of a single entity through many words. It is said that one can attain the exalted wisdom of omniscience through the perfection vehicle and so forth,

original: sngags spyad pa'i sgo nas kyang 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngags spyad pa'i sgo nas kyang 'gyur te /
translated: and also through the practice of mantra.

original: de yang skabs 'dir sngags kyi ste /
analyzed: de yang skabs 'dir sngags kyi ste /
translated: In this context, it is the latter.

original: de bas na dkyil 'khor spyad pa'i tshul bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dkyil 'khor spyad pa'i tshul bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the Dharma discourse that teaches the way of engaging in the maṇḍala.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chos kyi dbyings kyi dgongs pa ma rdzogs shing sems can gyi khams ma lus pa bsgral par dam bca' ba mdzad pas zhes pa byung nas kyang phyogs bcu kun du bskor te slar log nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chos kyi dbyings kyi dgongs pa ma rdzogs shing sems can gyi khams ma lus pa bsgral par dam bca' ba mdzad pas zhes pa byung nas kyang phyogs bcu kun du bskor te slar log nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i
translated: Then, since the Bhagavān Vairocana made the vow to liberate the realm of sentient beings without exception, having arisen from the realm of phenomena, he circled in all ten directions and returned and entered his own place within the body of the Bhagavān.

original: nang rang gi gnas rnams su zhugs so zhes pa'i bar du ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don du snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor 'byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin bstan pa la bya ste /
analyzed: nang rang gi gnas rnams su zhugs so zhes pa'i bar du ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don du snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor 'byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin bstan pa la bya ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the samādhi of the arising of the natural maṇḍala for the benefit of future migrating beings, in order to draw the maṇḍala of the arising of great compassion.

original: ting nge 'dzin bstan pa yang snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i slob dpon gyis ting nge 'dzin 'di lta bu mngon du byas te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bstan pa yang snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i slob dpon gyis ting nge 'dzin 'di lta bu mngon du byas te /
translated: The explanation of the samādhi is as follows: The master who draws the maṇḍala of the arising of great compassion should actualize this samādhi.

original: de nas sa tshon gyis sku'i cha lugs la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i tshul bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nas sa tshon gyis sku'i cha lugs la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i tshul bstan pa'o //
translated: Then, the way of drawing the mandala with the colored powders of the body's accouterments, and so on, is shown.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chos kyi dbyangs kyi dongs pa ma rdzogs pa chos kyi dbyings ni /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chos kyi dbyangs kyi dongs pa ma rdzogs pa chos kyi dbyings ni /
translated: In that, the Bhagavān Vairocana, the inexhaustible dharma-dhātu of the dharma-dhātu,

original: stong pa nyid dang ; de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang ; de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: is emptiness, suchness, and the perfect limit.

original: de'i dgos pa'i sku la sogs pas mi za dpa'i rgyan gyis sems can gyi khams gtams cad kun du khyab par bstan nas sems can de rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsgral ba la bya ste /🔽sems can de rnams @300a * //
analyzed: de'i dgos pa'i sku la sogs pas mi za dpa'i rgyan gyis sems can gyi khams gtams cad kun du khyab par bstan nas sems can de rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsgral ba la bya ste / sems can de rnams @300a * //
translated: Having taught that the purpose of that is the pervasiveness of the entire realm of sentient beings with the inexhaustible ornaments of the body, and so on, the purpose is to liberate those sentient beings in unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: kyang da dung ma lus par ma bsgral bas dgos pa ma rdzogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kyang da dung ma lus par ma bsgral bas dgos pa ma rdzogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Since those sentient beings are not yet liberated without exception, it is said that the purpose is not complete.

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa bsgral par dam bca' pa mdzad pas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa bsgral par dam bca' pa mdzad pas zhes pa ni /
translated: Since the commitment to liberate the entire realm of sentient beings is made,

original: de ltar chos kyi dgos pa de ma rdzogs pa yang rdzogs shing zad pa ma yin gyi bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na thugs kyi yi dam mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi dgos pa de ma rdzogs pa yang rdzogs shing zad pa ma yin gyi bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na thugs kyi yi dam mdzad pa ni /
translated: When the Lord was previously practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva, he made a vow in his mind:

original: bdag gis byang chub thob nas sems can ma lus pa yang bsgral bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis byang chub thob nas sems can ma lus pa yang bsgral bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: After I attain enlightenment, I will liberate all sentient beings without exception.

original: de bas na sems can gyi khams ma lus pa bsgral bar dam bca' ba mdzad ces so //
analyzed: de bas na sems can gyi khams ma lus pa bsgral bar dam bca' ba mdzad ces so //
translated: Therefore, he made a vow to liberate the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang thabs cig yang dag par mol nas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang thabs cig yang dag par mol nas zhes pa ni /
translated: Having conversed with all the Tathagatas means:

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad tshogs dang chos kyi sku dang 'gro ba'i don mdzad pas mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad tshogs dang chos kyi sku dang 'gro ba'i don mdzad pas mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: All Buddhas of the past, future, and present are the same in terms of the assembly, the Dharma body, and the performance of the welfare of beings.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas thams cad gsung gcig tu 'chad par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas thams cad gsung gcig tu 'chad par bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that all Buddhas speak with a single voice.

original: gnyis su na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang thabs cig yang dag par mol nas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis su na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang thabs cig yang dag par mol nas zhes pa ni /
translated: Second, “having conversed with all the Tathagatas”

original: chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid mngon du byas nas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid mngon du byas nas zhes pa'o //
translated: means that he has realized the reality of the ultimate realm.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang thabs cig mol sna zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang thabs cig mol sna zhes pa ni /
translated: Alternatively, “having conversed with all the Tathagatas”

original: ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba nga rgyal can rnams nga rgyal gcag pa dang zhu gtug mi byed pa rnams bla ma dang grogs po la dri zhing zhu gtug byed pa la brtson pa bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba nga rgyal can rnams nga rgyal gcag pa dang zhu gtug mi byed pa rnams bla ma dang grogs po la dri zhing zhu gtug byed pa la brtson pa bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: means that he has done so in order to break the pride of future proud beings and to encourage those who do not ask questions to ask questions of their gurus and friends.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa yang gzhan dang bka' gros mdzad cing chos ston na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa yang gzhan dang bka' gros mdzad cing chos ston na /
translated: If even all the Tathagatas, who are omniscient, consult others and teach the Dharma,

original: bdag cag chod lta ci zhig snyam nas gzhan la 'dri ba la brtson par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag cag chod lta ci zhig snyam nas gzhan la 'dri ba la brtson par 'gyur ro //
translated: then what need is there to mention other beings?

original: snying rje chen po'i snying po 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i snying po 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes pa ni /
translated: He entered the samadhi called “The Source of the Essence of Great Compassion.”

original: ting nge 'dzin de las snying rje chen po'i snying po 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de las snying rje chen po'i snying po 'byung ba'am /
translated: The essence of great compassion arises from that meditative absorption,

original: snying rje chen po las ting nge 'dzin 'byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po las ting nge 'dzin 'byung ba la bya'o //
translated: or meditative absorption arises from great compassion.

original: bcom ldan 'das snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu sku'i yan lag thams cad nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu sku'i yan lag thams cad nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Immediately after the Blessed One entered into meditative absorption, the bodies of the tathāgatas emerged from all the limbs of his body.

original: sa bcu'i bar du sems can la phan ba'i don mdzad pa rnams byung ngo //
analyzed: sa bcu'i bar du sems can la phan ba'i don mdzad pa rnams byung ngo //
translated: From the first generation of the mind of awakening up to the tenth stage, they performed the deeds of benefiting sentient beings.🔽Having emerged, they circled the ten directions and then returned. They entered the places of their own bodies within the body of the Blessed One.

original: byung nas kyang phyogs bcu kun du bskor te slar log nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i nang rang gi gnas rnams su zhugs so zhes pa ni @300b bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa de'i tshe ba spu'i bu ga re re nas kyang de bzhin gshegs
analyzed: byung nas kyang phyogs bcu kun du bskor te slar log nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i nang rang gi gnas rnams su zhugs so zhes pa ni @300b bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa de'i tshe ba spu'i bu ga re re nas kyang de bzhin gshegs
translated: This is as follows: At the time when the Blessed One entered into meditative absorption, from each of his pores, the bodies of the tathāgatas emerged.

original: pa'i sku 'dra ba rnam par sprul pa byung ste sems can gyi don byed pa ni sa dang po nas brtsams nas sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i sku 'dra ba rnam par sprul pa byung ste sems can gyi don byed pa ni sa dang po nas brtsams nas sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emanations of the Buddha's body that have come forth perform the welfare of sentient beings, beginning from the first stage up to the complete perfection of the ten stages.

original: de dag slar bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la so so'i gnas su zhugs pa yang ting nge 'dzin brtan pa'i mthus pa spu'i bu ga gang nas byung ba de nyid du slar ma 'khrul bar zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag slar bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la so so'i gnas su zhugs pa yang ting nge 'dzin brtan pa'i mthus pa spu'i bu ga gang nas byung ba de nyid du slar ma 'khrul bar zhugs pa'o //
translated: And when they return to the body of the Bhagavat, they enter their respective places by the power of firm samadhi, without confusion as to which pore they came out of.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Bhagavat again said to the Bodhisattva Vajrapani:

original: lag na rje dkyil 'khor rnam par dgod pa nyon cig ces pa ni /
analyzed: lag na rje dkyil 'khor rnam par dgod pa nyon cig ces pa ni /
translated: Vajrapani, listen to the arrangement of the mandala.

original: ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs nas phyag na rdo rje la dkyil 'khor bshad pa la bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs nas phyag na rdo rje la dkyil 'khor bshad pa la bya ste /
translated: This means that having arisen from that samadhi, he explained the mandala to Vajrapani.

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba bshad pa de yang rgyu dang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu rnam pa gsum du blta ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba bshad pa de yang rgyu dang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu rnam pa gsum du blta ste /
translated: And that explanation of the drawing of the mandala should be seen as having three aspects: cause, nature, and result.

original: de la rgyu ni slob dpon no //
analyzed: de la rgyu ni slob dpon no //
translated: The cause is the master.

original: rang bzhin ni dkyil 'khor sa bcad cing bri ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni dkyil 'khor sa bcad cing bri ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nature is the layout and drawing of the mandala, etc.

original: 'bras bu ni slob ma 'jug cing dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni slob ma 'jug cing dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The result is the initiation of the disciple, etc.

original: de la dkyil 'khor bri ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo ni slob dpon yin te /
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor bri ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo ni slob dpon yin te /
translated: The principal cause of drawing the mandala is the master.

original: de bas na slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid thog mar bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid thog mar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the characteristics of the master are explained first.

original: slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid bshad pa yang slob dpon du 'jug pa'i yon tan gyi mtshan nyid dang / slob dpon du grub pa'i yon tan gyi mtshan nyid dang de'i rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid bshad pa yang slob dpon du 'jug pa'i yon tan gyi mtshan nyid dang / slob dpon du grub pa'i yon tan gyi mtshan nyid dang de'i rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The explanation of the characteristics of the master is threefold: the characteristics of the qualities of the master who has entered, the characteristics of the qualities of the master who has been consecrated, and the characteristics of their distinctions.

original: de la slob dpon du 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni yid byang chub kyi sems la zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la slob dpon du 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni yid byang chub kyi sems la zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of the master who has entered are the qualities of one who has entered the thought of enlightenment, etc.

original: slob dpon du grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni dkyil 'khor 'dri ba'i las byed par gnang zhing dbang bskur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon du grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni dkyil 'khor 'dri ba'i las byed par gnang zhing dbang bskur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of the master who has been consecrated are the qualities of one who has been permitted to perform the actions of drawing the mandala, etc., and who has been initiated.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristics of their distinctions are as follows:

original: byang chub sems la rnam par gnas //
analyzed: byang chub sems la rnam par gnas //
translated: And abide in the thought of enlightenment.

original: zhes pa'o // de dag kyang lus kyi yon tan dang ngag gi yon tan dang yid kyi yon tan gsum ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de dag kyang lus kyi yon tan dang ngag gi yon tan dang yid kyi yon tan gsum ste /
translated: These are the three qualities of body, speech, and mind.

original: ji ltar rigs par spyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par spyar bar bya'o //
translated: They should be applied as appropriate.

original: yid byang chub kyi sems la zhugs pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yid byang chub kyi sems la zhugs pa zhes pa ni /
translated: “One who has entered the thought of enlightenment”

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnam pa stong par 'jigs pa dang 'jug pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnam pa stong par 'jigs pa dang 'jug pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: is one who is frightened of the emptiness of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so forth, and who is engaged in that.

original: shes rab dang ldan pa zhes pa la shes rab rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa zhes pa la shes rab rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “One who is endowed with wisdom” has two kinds of wisdom:

original: rang bzhin gyis shes rab rno ba dang thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis shes rab rno ba dang thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: natural sharpness of wisdom, and wisdom from listening, reflection, and so forth.

original: de dag gang yang rung ba dang ldan pa'o//
analyzed: de dag gang yang rung ba dang ldan pa'o//
translated: One is endowed with either of these.

original: @301a * // snying rje can zhes pa snying rje ni sems can sdug bsngal las 'don par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: @301a * // snying rje can zhes pa snying rje ni sems can sdug bsngal las 'don par 'dod pa ste /
translated: “One who is compassionate” is one who desires to liberate sentient beings from suffering.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyi snying rje can dang mngon par 'dus byas pa'i snying rje ste de dag dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyi snying rje can dang mngon par 'dus byas pa'i snying rje ste de dag dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is also naturally compassionate and has manifest compassion.

original: sgyu rtsal dag la mkhas pa zhes pa ni spyir 'jig rten gyi dgra thabs la sogs pa rnam pa mang mod kyi skabs 'dir ni dkyil 'khor bri ba dang mchod pa'i yan lag rnams la mkhas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu rtsal dag la mkhas pa zhes pa ni spyir 'jig rten gyi dgra thabs la sogs pa rnam pa mang mod kyi skabs 'dir ni dkyil 'khor bri ba dang mchod pa'i yan lag rnams la mkhas pa la bya'o //
translated: He is skilled in the arts, which in general means that he is skilled in the many worldly arts such as warfare, but in this context it means that he is skilled in drawing the maṇḍala and in the branches of worship.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la rtag tu mkhas pa zhes pa ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob rnam pa gnyis kyi tshul gyis mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la rtag tu mkhas pa zhes pa ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob rnam pa gnyis kyi tshul gyis mkhas pa ste /
translated: He is always skilled in the method of the perfection of wisdom, which means that he is skilled in the method of the two kinds of reality, ultimate and conventional.

original: don dam par ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma byung ma skyes pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du bsgom pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma byung ma skyes pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du bsgom pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: In the ultimate sense, he is skilled in the method of the perfection of wisdom, which is to meditate on the nature of all phenomena as emptiness, unborn and unarisen from the beginning.

original: kun rdzob tu ni de ltar stong pa nyid bsgom pa las langs nas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams spyad nas de la yang mi chags par 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul du sbyor ba la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni de ltar stong pa nyid bsgom pa las langs nas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams spyad nas de la yang mi chags par 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul du sbyor ba la mkhas pa'o //
translated: In the relative, having arisen from meditating on emptiness in that way, one practices the perfections such as generosity and so on, and one is skilled in applying oneself in the manner of thoroughly purifying the three spheres without attachment to those.

original: theg pa gsum gyi khyad par shes pa zhes pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa gang zag la bdag med par rtogs nas phung po dang khams la sogs pa la mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang bdag med par rtogs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa phung po la sogs pa de rnams kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi khyad par shes pa zhes pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa gang zag la bdag med par rtogs nas phung po dang khams la sogs pa la mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang bdag med par rtogs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa phung po la sogs pa de rnams kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa dang /
translated: Knowing the distinctions of the three vehicles refers to being skilled in distinguishing the characteristics of those who realize the selflessness of persons in the Śrāvaka Vehicle and realize the impermanence, suffering, and selflessness of the aggregates and constituents and so on, those who realize in the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle that those aggregates and so on are the nature of dependent arising,

original: theg pa chen po chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma byung ma skyes par rtog pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bye brag tu 'byed mkhas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma byung ma skyes par rtog pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bye brag tu 'byed mkhas pa la bya'o //
translated: and those in the Mahāyāna who realize that all phenomena are primordially unarisen and unproduced.

original: de la cir theg pa gcig la gsum du dbye ci yod ce na theg pa nyid gsum du dbye ba la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la cir theg pa gcig la gsum du dbye ci yod ce na theg pa nyid gsum du dbye ba la ni mi bya'o //
translated: What is the point of dividing the one vehicle into three? It is not that the vehicle itself is divided into three.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi so so'i ji ltar rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'byed mkhas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi so so'i ji ltar rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'byed mkhas pa la bya'o //
translated: It is the skill in distinguishing the characteristics of the individual realizations of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: gsang sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyi don la mkhas zhes pa ni sngags rnams kyi spyi'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyi don la mkhas zhes pa ni sngags rnams kyi spyi'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: Skill in the meaning of the reality of the mantra means that the general characteristic of the reality of the mantras is the thought of awakening.

original: de la mkhas pa dang / sngags dang / yi ge sa bon dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: de la mkhas pa dang / sngags dang / yi ge sa bon dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Skill in that, and skill in the mantras, seed syllables, and samādhis.

original: sngags la mkhas pa ni sngags kyi tshig rnams bskul ba dang phyag rgya'i rang bzhin 'byed mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: sngags la mkhas pa ni sngags kyi tshig rnams bskul ba dang phyag rgya'i rang bzhin 'byed mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skill in the mantras means skill in distinguishing the incantations and the nature of the seals.

original: yi ge sa bon la mkhas pa ni lha rnams so so'i sa bon snying po gang yin pa dang / de rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi @301b sgo dang / las gang yin pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge sa bon la mkhas pa ni lha rnams so so'i sa bon snying po gang yin pa dang / de rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi @301b sgo dang / las gang yin pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skill in the seed-syllable means skill in the seed-syllable of each deity, which is the essence-mantra, and in the door of samadhi and the action of those deities.

original: ting nge 'dzin la mkhas pa ni ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa las dbang chen dang chu la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bkod cing de rnams kyi las sgrub pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la mkhas pa ni ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa las dbang chen dang chu la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bkod cing de rnams kyi las sgrub pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skill in samadhi means skill in the array of the maṇḍala of the great earth, water, and so forth, and in accomplishing the action of those deities, from entering into samadhi.

original: bsam pa shes pa ni slob ma rnams kyi bsam pa shes pa ste de yang gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i tshul gyis shes pa la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa shes pa ni slob ma rnams kyi bsam pa shes pa ste de yang gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i tshul gyis shes pa la ni mi bya'o //
translated: Knowledge of the thought means knowledge of the thought of the disciples. Moreover, it should not be taken as knowledge by the method of knowing the mind of another.

original: sngags kyi cha brtag pa'i tshul gyis slob ma rnams kyi spyod pa dang tshul la brtags nas lha zhi ba dang khro bo rnams gang bsnyen par 'os pa dang / grub pa rab 'bring gsum las gang bsgrub par 'os pa la sogs pa'i tshul la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi cha brtag pa'i tshul gyis slob ma rnams kyi spyod pa dang tshul la brtags nas lha zhi ba dang khro bo rnams gang bsnyen par 'os pa dang / grub pa rab 'bring gsum las gang bsgrub par 'os pa la sogs pa'i tshul la mkhas pa'o //
translated: By the method of examining the parts of the mantra, one is skilled in the way of examining the conduct and behavior of the disciples, and in what is suitable for them to approach, whether peaceful or wrathful deities, and in what is suitable for them to accomplish, from among the three: the best, middling, and least accomplishments, and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i rnams la dad pa zhes pa ni de rnams kyi yon tan bshad pa la yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i rnams la dad pa zhes pa ni de rnams kyi yon tan bshad pa la yid ches pa'o //
translated: Faith in the buddhas and bodhisattvas is confidence in the explanations of their good qualities.

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i las byed par gnang zhing dbang bskur ba zhes pa la dbang bskur ba ni dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor du dri dang me tog dang sman dang rin po che la sogs pas brgyan pa'i bum par chu blugs te dbang bskur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i las byed par gnang zhing dbang bskur ba zhes pa la dbang bskur ba ni dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor du dri dang me tog dang sman dang rin po che la sogs pas brgyan pa'i bum par chu blugs te dbang bskur ba la bya'o //
translated: Permission to perform the work of drawing the mandala and consecration means that in the consecration mandala, water is poured into a vase adorned with perfume, flowers, medicine, jewels, and so forth, and consecration is performed.

original: gnang ba ni de ltar dbang bskur nas khyod kyis dkyil 'khor bri ba dang sgrub pa la spyod par gyis shig ces tshig gis gnang ba'o //
analyzed: gnang ba ni de ltar dbang bskur nas khyod kyis dkyil 'khor bri ba dang sgrub pa la spyod par gyis shig ces tshig gis gnang ba'o //
translated: Permission is the verbal permission, Having thus consecrated you, you should perform the practice of drawing the mandala and accomplishing it.

original: de la gnang zhing dbang bskur ba zhes pa dbang ma bskur bar ni gnang ba mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: de la gnang zhing dbang bskur ba zhes pa dbang ma bskur bar ni gnang ba mi 'thob ste /
translated: In that regard, permission and consecration means that without consecration, permission is not obtained.

original: gnang ba smos pas dbang bskur ba ma smos kyang zhar la go bar 'gyur na gnyis ka ci'i phyir smos she na /
analyzed: gnang ba smos pas dbang bskur ba ma smos kyang zhar la go bar 'gyur na gnyis ka ci'i phyir smos she na /
translated: If permission is mentioned, and consecration is understood by implication, why are both mentioned?

original: gdon sel ba la sogs pa'i las phran tshegs la dbang ma bskur kyang byos shig pa'i gnang ba thob pa srid de /
analyzed: gdon sel ba la sogs pa'i las phran tshegs la dbang ma bskur kyang byos shig pa'i gnang ba thob pa srid de /
translated: It is possible that one may be permitted to perform minor rites such as exorcism even without consecration.

original: de bas na gnang ba thob cing dbang bskur ba zhes smos so//
analyzed: de bas na gnang ba thob cing dbang bskur ba zhes smos so//
translated: Therefore, it says, “having obtained permission and consecration.”

original: brtan pa ni shes pa dang longs spyod la sogs pa dang ldan pa yang de dag gis dregs par mi 'gyur la de dag dang mi ldan na yang zhum par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni shes pa dang longs spyod la sogs pa dang ldan pa yang de dag gis dregs par mi 'gyur la de dag dang mi ldan na yang zhum par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “ Steadfast” means that one does not become proud when one has knowledge, wealth, etc., nor does one become discouraged when one does not have them.

original: sbyor ba la mkhas zhes pa ni sgrub pa dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi sbyor ba la mkhas pa'o //🔽byang chub sems la rnam par gnas //
analyzed: sbyor ba la mkhas zhes pa ni sgrub pa dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi sbyor ba la mkhas pa'o // byang chub sems la rnam par gnas //
translated: “ Skilled in practice” means skilled in the practice of rites such as pacification.

original: zhes pa ni stong ba nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas nus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni stong ba nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas nus pa'o //
translated: “ Abiding in the thought of awakening” means being able to abide in the emptiness that is nonconceptual meditative concentration.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po slob dpon de lta bu rgyal ba'i sras yin te /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po slob dpon de lta bu rgyal ba'i sras yin te /
translated: Lord of Secrets, such a master is a son of the Victorious Ones.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rab tu bsngags so zhes pa la slob dpon de lta bu ni gong du smos pa'i yon tan rnams dang ldan @302a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rab tu bsngags so zhes pa la slob dpon de lta bu ni gong du smos pa'i yon tan rnams dang ldan @302a * //
translated: Such a master is endowed with the above-mentioned qualities.

original: pa'o ; / rgyal ba'i sras zhes pa ni rgyal ba'i bdag nyid las skyes pa ste rgyal ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin la /
analyzed: pa'o ; / rgyal ba'i sras zhes pa ni rgyal ba'i bdag nyid las skyes pa ste rgyal ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin la /
translated: The phrase “son of the Victor” means that he is born from the essence of the Victor. The Victor is the Bhagavat Buddha.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: His essence is the ultimate expanse.

original: chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid la mos pa las byung ba ni rgyal ba'i bdag nyid las skyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid la mos pa las byung ba ni rgyal ba'i bdag nyid las skyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who is born from the essence of the Victor is said to be born from the aspiration to the emptiness of the ultimate expanse.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rab tu bsngags so zhes pa ni de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i slob dpon de ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rab tu bsngags so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rab tu bsngags so zhes pa ni de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i slob dpon de ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rab tu bsngags so //
translated: The phrase “he is highly praised by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas” means that such a master is highly praised by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: de lta bu'i slob dpon de sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rab tu bsngags na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i slob dpon de sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rab tu bsngags na /
translated: If such a master is highly praised by the Buddhas and bodhisattvas,🔽are there any masters who are not highly praised?

original: mi bsngags pa'i slob dpon yang yod dam zhe na yod de sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rab tu bsngags so zhes pa'i tshig des slob dpon rnam pa gnyis su shes par bya ste zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa dang dmigs pa can
analyzed: mi bsngags pa'i slob dpon yang yod dam zhe na yod de sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rab tu bsngags so zhes pa'i tshig des slob dpon rnam pa gnyis su shes par bya ste zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa dang dmigs pa can
translated: There are, but the word “highly praised” in the verse indicates that there are two kinds of masters, one who is devoted to the profound and the extensive and one who is devoted to the literal.

original: no // de la skabs 'dir slob dpon yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsngags pa ni zab cing rgya che ba'i slob dpon la bya'o //
analyzed: no // de la skabs 'dir slob dpon yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsngags pa ni zab cing rgya che ba'i slob dpon la bya'o //
translated: In this context, the master who has such good qualities and is praised by the Buddhas and bodhisattvas is the master devoted to the profound and the extensive.

original: dmigs pa can gyi slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid ni 'og nas slob dpon gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid bshad pa'i skabs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa can gyi slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid ni 'og nas slob dpon gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid bshad pa'i skabs su shes par bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of the master who is devoted to the literal will be understood from the explanation below in the section on the characteristics of both kinds of masters.

original: da ni slob dpon de lta bus dkyil 'khor du gzung ba'i slob ma rnams brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni slob dpon de lta bus dkyil 'khor du gzung ba'i slob ma rnams brtag par bya ste /
translated: Now, such a master should examine the disciples to be admitted into the mandala.

original: slob ma de rnams brtag pa yang rang bzhin gyi yon tan dang / mngon par 'dus byas pa'i yon tan gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: slob ma de rnams brtag pa yang rang bzhin gyi yon tan dang / mngon par 'dus byas pa'i yon tan gyi sgo nas so //
translated: And the examination of those disciples is by way of their natural qualities and their manifest qualities.

original: de lta bas na gsang ba pa'i bdag po de la slob dpon la gzhan gyis gsol ba btab kyang rung zhes pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i slob ma rnams kyis gsol ba btab kyang rung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gsang ba pa'i bdag po de la slob dpon la gzhan gyis gsol ba btab kyang rung zhes pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i slob ma rnams kyis gsol ba btab kyang rung zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, O Lord of Mysteries, whether they are requested by others or not, means that even if disciples endowed with the characteristics that will be stated below request [admission],🔽Or else, if one sees that sentient beings

original: yang na bdag gis sems can dag / snod du rung zhing nyes bral ba //
analyzed: yang na bdag gis sems can dag / snod du rung zhing nyes bral ba //
translated: are suitable vessels, free of faults,

original: de mthong nas ni bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: de mthong nas ni bdag nyid kyis //
translated: then, having seen that, one should summon them

original: ma gsol bar ni de bos te //
analyzed: ma gsol bar ni de bos te //
translated: oneself, even without their request.

original: zhes sbyar te snod du rung zhing zhes pa ni sngags bshad pa'i snod du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes sbyar te snod du rung zhing zhes pa ni sngags bshad pa'i snod du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Here, “suitable vessels” means becoming a vessel for the explanation of the mantra.

original: nyes bral ba zhes pa ni sdig pa med pa ste de la sdig pa ni sems kyi rgyud la yod na ji ltar slob dpon des mthong bar 'gyur zhan /
analyzed: nyes bral ba zhes pa ni sdig pa med pa ste de la sdig pa ni sems kyi rgyud la yod na ji ltar slob dpon des mthong bar 'gyur zhan /
translated: The phrase free of faults means without sin. How could that master see that, if the sin were in the continuum of the mind?

original: sems kyi rgyud la gzhan pa'i sdig pa med par mthong ba la ni mi bya'i /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud la gzhan pa'i sdig pa med par mthong ba la ni mi bya'i /
translated: It is not to be taken that he sees that there is no sin in the continuum of the mind.

original: sdig pa'i rgyu mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mi spyod par mthong ba ni sdig pa med par @302b mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i rgyu mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mi spyod par mthong ba ni sdig pa med par @302b mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing that the cause of sin, the ten unwholesome courses of action, are not practiced, is seeing that there is no sin.

original: de lta bu'i slob ma mthong na phas ma gsol kyang slob ma de snod du 'gyur ba yin pas 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pas chos bshad cing sngags kyi tshul la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i slob ma mthong na phas ma gsol kyang slob ma de snod du 'gyur ba yin pas 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pas chos bshad cing sngags kyi tshul la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Seeing a disciple like that, even if he has not requested it, since he is a vessel, one should explain the Dharma with the verse that will be given below and establish him in the way of mantra.

original: mos mang zhes pa ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi chos rnams ma rtogs shing mngon du byas kyang thos pa dang bsam pa dang sgom pa'i sgo nas 'di nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin🔽no zhes pa ni mos pa mang ba'o //
analyzed: mos mang zhes pa ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi chos rnams ma rtogs shing mngon du byas kyang thos pa dang bsam pa dang sgom pa'i sgo nas 'di nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes pa ni mos pa mang ba'o //
translated: She is called one of great devotion because she has not realized and manifested the qualities of the Bhagavat Buddha, such as the stages and perfections, but she has heard about them, reflected on them, and cultivated them, and she thinks, This is it, nothing else is it.

original: brtan zhes pa ni gong du slob dpon gyi brtan pa nyid bshad pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: brtan zhes pa ni gong du slob dpon gyi brtan pa nyid bshad pa dang mthun no //
translated: She is called steadfast because she is in accord with the steadfastness of the master explained above.

original: dad pa zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum la yid ches pa'i rnam pa dang sngags kyi tshul la yid ches pa'i dad pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum la yid ches pa'i rnam pa dang sngags kyi tshul la yid ches pa'i dad pa'o //
translated: She is called one of faith because she has faith in the Three Jewels and in the way of mantra.

original: gzhan la phan dga' zhes pa ni snying rje chen po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la phan dga' zhes pa ni snying rje chen po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: She is called one who delights in benefiting others because she possesses great compassion.

original: gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral bar dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral bar dga' ba'o //
translated: She delights in others being free from suffering.

original: slob ma de lta bu dang ldan par shes shing mthong nas bdag nyid kyis ma gsol bar ni de bos te zhes gong du smos pa'i yon tan gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan par mthong nas shes pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma de lta bu dang ldan par shes shing mthong nas bdag nyid kyis ma gsol bar ni de bos te zhes gong du smos pa'i yon tan gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan par mthong nas shes pa'o //
translated: Having seen and known that such a disciple is endowed with that, one should call him, without one's own request, Come here, son!

original: 'di skad bya zhes pa ni gal te slob ma de bdag cag sngags grub pa'i 'bras bu rig 'dzin la sogs pa 'dod pa ma yin gyi bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod do snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: 'di skad bya zhes pa ni gal te slob ma de bdag cag sngags grub pa'i 'bras bu rig 'dzin la sogs pa 'dod pa ma yin gyi bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod do snyam du sems pa la /
translated: As for thus, if one thinks, This disciple does not desire the result of mantra accomplishment, such as being a knowledge-holder, but desires to attain unsurpassed awakening,

original: sngags kyi sgo nas bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos shod cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi sgo nas bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos shod cig ces pa'o //
translated: one should say, Speak the Dharma that has the characteristics of attaining unsurpassed awakening by means of mantra.

original: khyod ni tshul chen snod yin gyis //
analyzed: khyod ni tshul chen snod yin gyis //
translated: Since you are a great vessel,

original: bu tshur theg pa chen po yi //
analyzed: bu tshur theg pa chen po yi //
translated: come here, son!

original: gsang sngags spyod tshul cho ga ni //
analyzed: gsang sngags spyod tshul cho ga ni //
translated: The ritual of the conduct of mantra practice

original: khyod la yang dag bstan par bya //
analyzed: khyod la yang dag bstan par bya //
translated: will be properly explained to you.

original: zhes pa ni sngags spyad pa'i tshul 'di theg pa chen po yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags spyad pa'i tshul 'di theg pa chen po yin la /
translated: This conduct of mantra practice is the Great Vehicle.

original: de yang slob ma snod du gyur pa'i phyir bshad pas na yang dag par bshad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang slob ma snod du gyur pa'i phyir bshad pas na yang dag par bshad pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, since it is explained for the sake of the disciple who is a suitable vessel, it is a perfect explanation.
