original: khe dang bkur sti'i phyir bshad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khe dang bkur sti'i phyir bshad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not an explanation for the sake of profit or honor.🔽The perfect buddhas of the past,🔽and likewise those who have not yet come,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang 'das dang // de bzhin gang dag ma byon dang // da ltar byung ba'i mgon po rnams //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang 'das dang // de bzhin gang dag ma byon dang // da ltar byung ba'i mgon po rnams //
translated: and the lords who are present,🔽who remain for the sake of migrators,

original: 'gro pan phyir bzhugs pa dag / ces pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar dang ma byon pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang gsang sngags kyi spyad pa'i cho ga mchog 'di las byang chub kyi shing drung du bdud rnam pa bzhi bcom nas thams
analyzed: 'gro pan phyir bzhugs pa dag / ces pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar dang ma byon pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang gsang sngags kyi spyad pa'i cho ga mchog 'di las byang chub kyi shing drung du bdud rnam pa bzhi bcom nas thams
translated: the perfect buddhas of the past, present, and future, by means of this supreme ritual of mantra conduct, under the bodhi tree, having conquered the four māras,

original: cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes te /
analyzed: cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes te /
translated: attained omniscient gnosis.

original: de bas na slob ma khyed rnams kyis kyang cho ga mchog 'di las @303a * //
analyzed: de bas na slob ma khyed rnams kyis kyang cho ga mchog 'di las @303a * //
translated: Therefore, you disciples should also attain omniscient gnosis by means of this supreme ritual.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan ba ste de bas na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan ba ste de bas na /
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: de dag kun gyis gsang sngags kyi //
analyzed: de dag kun gyis gsang sngags kyi //
translated: Therefore, all of them, by means of the mantra,

original: cho ga mchog bzang 'di mkhyen nas //
analyzed: cho ga mchog bzang 'di mkhyen nas //
translated: Knowing this excellent supreme rite,

original: dpa' bos byang chub shing drung du //
analyzed: dpa' bos byang chub shing drung du //
translated: the Hero, under the Bodhi tree,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa mtshan med brnyes //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa mtshan med brnyes //
translated: attained omniscience without characteristics.

original: gsang sngags sbyor ba mnyam med de //
analyzed: gsang sngags sbyor ba mnyam med de //
translated: The incomparable application of mantra

original: sh'akya seng ge skyob pa yis //🔽bdud sde shin tu mi bzad pa //
analyzed: sh'akya seng ge skyob pa yis // bdud sde shin tu mi bzad pa //
translated: of the Protector, the Lion of the Shakyas,🔽he conquered with that

original: dpung chen dag kyang de yis bcom //
analyzed: dpung chen dag kyang de yis bcom //
translated: the extremely unbearable army of Mara.

original: de bas kun mkhyen thob bya'i phyir //
analyzed: de bas kun mkhyen thob bya'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, in order to attain omniscience,

original: bu yis blo gros 'di gyis shig / ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bu yis blo gros 'di gyis shig / ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: O son, apply your mind to this.

original: de dag kun gyis zhes pa ni 'das pa dad da ltar dang ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyis zhes pa'o //🔽byang chub shing drung du thams cad mkhyen pa mtshan med brnyes //
analyzed: de dag kun gyis zhes pa ni 'das pa dad da ltar dang ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyis zhes pa'o // byang chub shing drung du thams cad mkhyen pa mtshan med brnyes //
translated: All of them means all the Buddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi shing gi drung du thams cad mkhyen pa mtshan ma med pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi shing gi drung du thams cad mkhyen pa mtshan ma med pa thob pa'o //
translated: Attained omniscience without characteristics under the Bodhi tree means attaining omniscience without characteristics under the Bodhi tree.

original: sngags kyi sbyor ba mnyam med de //
analyzed: sngags kyi sbyor ba mnyam med de //
translated: The incomparable application of mantra

original: zhes pa ni gang dang yang mi mnyam pa'i sngags kyi sbyor ba des thams cad mkhyen pa thob par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gang dang yang mi mnyam pa'i sngags kyi sbyor ba des thams cad mkhyen pa thob par shes par bya'o //
translated: By this mantra practice, which is unequalled by any other, one should understand that one will attain omniscience.

original: de bas kun mkhyen thob bya'i phyir //
analyzed: de bas kun mkhyen thob bya'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, in order to attain omniscience,🔽the son should apply his mind to this.

original: bu yis blo gros 'di gyis shig / ces pa ni de ltar sh'akya seng ges kyang sngags kyi spyod pa'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa brnyes pas na khyod kyis kyang 'di'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa thob par gyis shig ces bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bu yis blo gros 'di gyis shig / ces pa ni de ltar sh'akya seng ges kyang sngags kyi spyod pa'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa brnyes pas na khyod kyis kyang 'di'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa thob par gyis shig ces bshad pa'o //
translated: Since the Lion of the Shakyas attained omniscience through the practice of mantra, you too should attain omniscience through this.

original: de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa thob pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'og min gyi gnas la sogs par mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa gzhan yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa thob pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'og min gyi gnas la sogs par mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa gzhan yang yod mod kyi /
translated: Thus, although the Bhagavān attained omniscience in other stages of manifest enlightenment, such as in the Akaniṣṭha realm,

original: skabs 'dir mi rnams la bshad pa'i phyir sprul pa'i skus byang chub kyi shing drung du mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: skabs 'dir mi rnams la bshad pa'i phyir sprul pa'i skus byang chub kyi shing drung du mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: in this context, in order to teach humans, he demonstrated the stage of manifest enlightenment under the Bodhi tree as a nirmāṇakāya.

original: de ltar lan mang gzengs bstod de /
analyzed: de ltar lan mang gzengs bstod de /
translated: Thus, having been repeatedly encouraged,

original: zhes pa ni gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis slob ma de mang du spro ba bskyed cig ces pa'o//
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis slob ma de mang du spro ba bskyed cig ces pa'o//
translated: This means that one should delight the disciples in the manner described above.

original: snying rjer gyur pa'i yid kyis ni /
analyzed: snying rjer gyur pa'i yid kyis ni /
translated: With a mind full of compassion,

original: zhes pa khe dang bkur sti'i phyir ma yin gyi slob ma de dag la snying rje ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa khe dang bkur sti'i phyir ma yin gyi slob ma de dag la snying rje ba'i phyir ro //
translated: one should not do it for the sake of profit and honor, but rather out of compassion for those disciples.

original: slob ma de brtan shes nas ni //
analyzed: slob ma de brtan shes nas ni //
translated: Having known the disciples to be steadfast,

original: zhes pa ni slob ma de rnams de ltar gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis yid ches te gzhan du mi 'gyur bar gyur na slob ma de dag gi ched du dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sa rnams brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni slob ma de rnams de ltar gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis yid ches te gzhan du mi 'gyur bar gyur na slob ma de dag gi ched du dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sa rnams brtag par bya ste /
translated: one should examine the ground for drawing the maṇḍala for the sake of those disciples.

original: de yang sa nyid kyi yon tan gyis dga' ba dang // 'phags pa rnams kyis bcags pas dang / lha dang mi rnams kyis bsnyen pas dga' ba dang / sngags mkhan nyid gang du dad pas dga' ba'o//
analyzed: de yang sa nyid kyi yon tan gyis dga' ba dang // 'phags pa rnams kyis bcags pas dang / lha dang mi rnams kyis bsnyen pas dga' ba dang / sngags mkhan nyid gang du dad pas dga' ba'o//
translated: That is to say, it is delightful due to the qualities of the ground itself, delightful because it has been trodden by the noble ones, delightful because it is frequented by gods and humans, and delightful because the mantra practitioner himself has faith in it.

original: @303b de las nyid kyi yon tan gyis dga' ba'i gnas ni //
analyzed: @303b de las nyid kyi yon tan gyis dga' ba'i gnas ni //
translated: Among those, the place that is delightful due to the qualities of the ground itself is:

original: me tog 'bras bu ldan pa'i ri //
analyzed: me tog 'bras bu ldan pa'i ri //
translated: A mountain with flowers and fruits.

original: gtsang zhing yid 'ong chu yi gnas //
analyzed: gtsang zhing yid 'ong chu yi gnas //
translated: A pure and pleasing place of water,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to🔽where there are many waterfalls,

original: gang na 'bab chu mang po dag / ngang pa bzhad kyis brgyan yod pa //
analyzed: gang na 'bab chu mang po dag / ngang pa bzhad kyis brgyan yod pa //
translated: adorned with geese and cranes.

original: der ni sngags pa blo can gyis //
analyzed: der ni sngags pa blo can gyis //
translated: There, the wise one of mantra

original: snying rje 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor bri //🔽zhes pa'i bar du'o //🔽sangs rgyas rnams dang rang mgon dang // de bzhin rgyal ba'i na yan thos kyis //
analyzed: snying rje 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor bri // zhes pa'i bar du'o // sangs rgyas rnams dang rang mgon dang // de bzhin rgyal ba'i na yan thos kyis //
translated: should draw the maṇḍala of compassion.🔽The places relied upon by the buddhas, the self-lords,

original: sa phyogs gang dag bsten pa ni //
analyzed: sa phyogs gang dag bsten pa ni //
translated: and likewise the hearers of the Victorious One,🔽those places

original: de dag thub pas rtag tu bsngags //
analyzed: de dag thub pas rtag tu bsngags //
translated: are always praised by the Sage.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni 'phags pa rnams kyis zhabs kyis bcags pas dga' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni 'phags pa rnams kyis zhabs kyis bcags pas dga' ba'o //
translated: Up to here, it is delightful because it is trodden by the feet of the noble ones.

original: phyogs gzhan rnam pa sna tshogs pa//
analyzed: phyogs gzhan rnam pa sna tshogs pa//
translated: In other directions, various🔽beautiful temples,🔽houses, and delightful mansions,

original: lha khang kun dga' bzang po dang // khyim dang yang tog nyams dga' dang // zhes pa nas /
analyzed: lha khang kun dga' bzang po dang // khyim dang yang tog nyams dga' dang // zhes pa nas /
translated: up to🔽in all the divine abodes,

original: lha yi gnas rnams thams cad dang // de bzhin khang pa stong par yang //
analyzed: lha yi gnas rnams thams cad dang // de bzhin khang pa stong par yang //
translated: and likewise in empty houses,

original: slob ma dag la phan 'dod phyir //
analyzed: slob ma dag la phan 'dod phyir //
translated: for the sake of benefiting the disciples,

original: nan tan du ni dkyil 'khor bri //
analyzed: nan tan du ni dkyil 'khor bri //
translated: the maṇḍala should be drawn with effort.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni lha dang mi rnams kyis bsnyen pas dga' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni lha dang mi rnams kyis bsnyen pas dga' ba'o //
translated: This is the delight of the gods and men in the worship.

original: yang na yid du 'ong ba'i sa //
analyzed: yang na yid du 'ong ba'i sa //
translated: Or else, in a place that is pleasing to the mind,

original: gang yang rung bar bri bar bya //
analyzed: gang yang rung bar bri bar bya //
translated: one should draw the maṇḍala.

original: zhes pa ni gong du smos pa rnam pa gsum las gzhan sngags pa nyid gang du dad pa'i sa der dkyil 'khor bri ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong du smos pa rnam pa gsum las gzhan sngags pa nyid gang du dad pa'i sa der dkyil 'khor bri ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that the maṇḍala should be drawn in a place of one’s own choice, other than the three mentioned above, because one is a mantra practitioner.

original: de la sa gzhi yongs su sbyang bar bya ba ni zhes pa sbyang ba rnam pa gnyis te phyi dang nang gi'o ;
analyzed: de la sa gzhi yongs su sbyang bar bya ba ni zhes pa sbyang ba rnam pa gnyis te phyi dang nang gi'o ;
translated: There, the purification of the ground is twofold: outer and inner.

original: / de bas na slob dpon yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: / de bas na slob dpon yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, there are two kinds of masters:

original: zang cing rgya che ba la mos pa dang dmigs pa can no //
analyzed: zang cing rgya che ba la mos pa dang dmigs pa can no //
translated: those who aspire to the profound and vast, and those who are focused on the outer.

original: de la zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa'i slob dpon gyis ni byang chub kyi sems bsgoms pas phyi'i nyes pa rnams kyi dngos po gzod ma nas ma byung ma skyes par rtogs te nang gi sems sbyangs pas dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir phyi'i zug rdu bsal
analyzed: de la zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa'i slob dpon gyis ni byang chub kyi sems bsgoms pas phyi'i nyes pa rnams kyi dngos po gzod ma nas ma byung ma skyes par rtogs te nang gi sems sbyangs pas dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir phyi'i zug rdu bsal
translated: Among them, the master who aspires to the profound and vast, by cultivating the thought of awakening, realizes that the entities of outer faults are primordially non-arisen and unborn. Since the inner mind is purified, it becomes pure. Therefore, the outer pain is removed.

original: ba la sogs pa mi dgos mod kyi slob ma rnams kyi yid dang sbyar ba'i phyir phyi'i sa rnams brtag pa yang de rnams la ma zhen par bya ste /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa mi dgos mod kyi slob ma rnams kyi yid dang sbyar ba'i phyir phyi'i sa rnams brtag pa yang de rnams la ma zhen par bya ste /
translated: Although it is not necessary to have the outer earth and so forth, in order to adapt to the minds of disciples, the outer earth should be examined, but without attachment to them.

original: de bas na slob dpon zab cing rgya che ba la mos pas ni phyi nang gnyis ka'i sa sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na slob dpon zab cing rgya che ba la mos pas ni phyi nang gnyis ka'i sa sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the master who is devoted to the profound and vast should combine both the inner and outer earths.

original: dmigs pa can gyi slob dpon gyis ni byang chub kyi sems goms par ma byas pas phyi'i sa rnams sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa can gyi slob dpon gyis ni byang chub kyi sems goms par ma byas pas phyi'i sa rnams sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: The master who is an objectivist should purify the outer earths without cultivating the spirit of enlightenment.

original: de la nang gis sbyang ba ni byang chub kyi sems goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la nang gis sbyang ba ni byang chub kyi sems goms par byed pa'o //
translated: Therein, the inner purification is the cultivation of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: phyi'i sa sbyang ba ni rdo dang bong ba dang / gyo mo dang gseg ma med cing zhes pa nas nyes pa thams cad spangs pa'i @304a * //
analyzed: phyi'i sa sbyang ba ni rdo dang bong ba dang / gyo mo dang gseg ma med cing zhes pa nas nyes pa thams cad spangs pa'i @304a * //
translated: The purification of the outer earth is from the absence of stones, clods, pebbles, and gravel up to the place that is free from all faults,

original: gnas ni lha rnams la rab tu shis so zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gnas ni lha rnams la rab tu shis so zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: which is very auspicious for the gods.

original: de la tshes grangs dang zhes pa nas snga dro'i dus kyi ches ltas bzang pos mtshon pa la zhes pa'i bar du ni dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sa brtag pa tshar nas /
analyzed: de la tshes grangs dang zhes pa nas snga dro'i dus kyi ches ltas bzang pos mtshon pa la zhes pa'i bar du ni dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sa brtag pa tshar nas /
translated: The passage from the day up to the auspicious time of the morning is the examination of the site for drawing the mandala.🔽

original: yongs su gzung ba rtsom pa'i tshes grangs dang skar ma brtag pa la bya ste /🔽rgyu skar shis pa ni skar ma 'ba' zhig shis pa la mi bya'i /
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba rtsom pa'i tshes grangs dang skar ma brtag pa la bya ste / rgyu skar shis pa ni skar ma 'ba' zhig shis pa la mi bya'i /
translated: The passage from the lunar day up to the auspicious time of the morning refers to the lunar day and the lunar mansion for beginning the appropriation of the site after the examination of the site for drawing the maṇḍala is complete.

original: nyi ma dang tshes grangs kun kyang ste shis pa zhes pa so sol sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma dang tshes grangs kun kyang ste shis pa zhes pa so sol sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The auspicious lunar mansion does not refer to just the lunar mansion, but to the day and lunar mansion together.

original: snga dro'i dus kyi tshe ltas bzang pos mtshon pa la zhes pa ltas bzang po brtags pa rab 'bring rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: snga dro'i dus kyi tshe ltas bzang pos mtshon pa la zhes pa ltas bzang po brtags pa rab 'bring rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The auspicious time of the morning refers to the three types of auspicious signs:

original: lha'i dang bar snang gi dang sa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: lha'i dang bar snang gi dang sa las byung ba'o //
translated: those that arise from the gods, those that arise in the sky, and those that arise from the earth.

original: de la lha'i ni nam mkha' las sgra snyan pa la sogs pa 'byung ba ste mchog go //
analyzed: de la lha'i ni nam mkha' las sgra snyan pa la sogs pa 'byung ba ste mchog go //
translated: Among those, the best is the sound of a pleasant voice and so forth that arises from the sky.

original: bar snang gi ni bkra shis pa'i tshig dang bram ze'i rig byed la sogs pa thob pa ste 'bring ngo //
analyzed: bar snang gi ni bkra shis pa'i tshig dang bram ze'i rig byed la sogs pa thob pa ste 'bring ngo //
translated: The middling is the attainment of the auspicious words of space, the Vedas of the Brahmins, and so forth.

original: sa las byung ba ni sa la dung la sogs pa 'dug par mthong ba mthong ba ste tha ma'o //
analyzed: sa las byung ba ni sa la dung la sogs pa 'dug par mthong ba mthong ba ste tha ma'o //
translated: The least is seeing the conch and so forth on the ground.

original: de ltar thog rtsom pa'i snga dro'i dus na ltas de rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig byung na bzang ste /
analyzed: de ltar thog rtsom pa'i snga dro'i dus na ltas de rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig byung na bzang ste /
translated: Thus, if any of these signs occur in the morning when beginning the rite, it is good.

original: sa yongs su gzung ba la sogs pa'i las rnams brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sa yongs su gzung ba la sogs pa'i las rnams brtsam par bya'o //
translated: One should commence the rites such as taking possession of the ground.🔽One should proclaim the two verses of the exhortation to the goddess of the ground.

original: sa'i lha mo sbran pa'i tshig su bcad pa gnyis bsgrag par bya'o zhes pa ni snga dro'i dus na ltas bzang po dang ldan na dkyil 'khor gang du bri bar bya ba'i sa gzhi der sa'i lha mo la khyod kyi steng du dkyil 'khor bri'i zhes gsol ba
analyzed: sa'i lha mo sbran pa'i tshig su bcad pa gnyis bsgrag par bya'o zhes pa ni snga dro'i dus na ltas bzang po dang ldan na dkyil 'khor gang du bri bar bya ba'i sa gzhi der sa'i lha mo la khyod kyi steng du dkyil 'khor bri'i zhes gsol ba
translated: This means that if one has the good signs in the morning, one should request the goddess of the ground, “I will draw the maṇḍala on your ground,”

original: btab ste / bstod pa'i tshig su bcad pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: btab ste / bstod pa'i tshig su bcad pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: and with the words of praise.

original: sangs rgyas thob pa thams cad kyi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thob pa thams cad kyi //
translated: All those who have attained buddhahood

original: spyod pa'i tshul gyis khyad par ni //
analyzed: spyod pa'i tshul gyis khyad par ni //
translated: The difference in the way of conduct is

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.🔽🔽

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi tshul khyad par du spyad pa dang / de ltar spyad nas byang chub kyi shing drung du bdud rnam pa bzhi bcom ste mngon par sangs rgyas pa yangs khyod kyi steng du yin pas na lha mo khyod kyis ji lta ba bzhin du shes te dbang du gyur to zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi tshul khyad par du spyad pa dang / de ltar spyad nas byang chub kyi shing drung du bdud rnam pa bzhi bcom ste mngon par sangs rgyas pa yangs khyod kyi steng du yin pas na lha mo khyod kyis ji lta ba bzhin du shes te dbang du gyur to zhes pa ste /
translated: Thus, when the Buddha Bhagavat was practicing the Bodhisattva conduct, he practiced the way of the grounds and perfections in a special way, and having practiced in that way, he conquered the four demons at the foot of the Bodhi tree and fully awakened. Since that is so, you know it just as it is, O goddess, and you have control over it.

analyzed: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas sa @304b dang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams spyad de /

translated: the Bhagavān Śākyamuni, having subdued the four māras under the bodhi tree, attained perfect enlightenment. In the same way, I too, in order to liberate the entire realm of sentient beings, will draw the maṇḍala on you, O earth,

original: zhes pa sa'i lha mo la tshigs su bcad pas bskul te gsol ba gdab pa la yang sngar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang lha mo de la mchod cing phyag byas la lag pa sa la bzhag nas /
analyzed: zhes pa sa'i lha mo la tshigs su bcad pas bskul te gsol ba gdab pa la yang sngar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang lha mo de la mchod cing phyag byas la lag pa sa la bzhag nas /
translated: Having made offerings and prostrations to the earth goddess and to the Tathagatas, and having placed one's hand on the ground,

original: gdod gong du smos pa'i tshigs su bcad pas bskul te gsol ba gdab po /
analyzed: gdod gong du smos pa'i tshigs su bcad pas bskul te gsol ba gdab po /

analyzed: / zhes pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul gyis sa sbyang bar bya'o //

translated: ...not knowing this method,

analyzed: yul dang dus dang bya ba las //

translated: through the signs of virtue and non-virtue,

original: / rmongs pa 'bras bu 'dod byed de //
analyzed: / rmongs pa 'bras bu 'dod byed de //
translated: the deluded one desires results.

original: sems dpa' chen po de dag phyir //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po de dag phyir //
translated: For the sake of those great beings,

original: cho ga 'di ni brjod pa yin //
analyzed: cho ga 'di ni brjod pa yin //
translated: this rite is explained.

original: zhes pa'i bar ni gong du nyi ma dang tshes grangs dang / skar ma la sogs pa'i ltas rnams ni bshad na sngags rnams kyi rang bzhin ni don dam par byang chub kyi sems yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar ni gong du nyi ma dang tshes grangs dang / skar ma la sogs pa'i ltas rnams ni bshad na sngags rnams kyi rang bzhin ni don dam par byang chub kyi sems yin te /
translated: The passage up to “the nature of the mantras is ultimate awakening mind” explains that the signs of the sun, date, stars, and so on are not the nature of the mantras.

original: mtshan ma med pa de dag las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa de dag las 'das pa'o //
translated: The mantras are beyond all signs.

original: kun rdzob tu yang dkyil 'khor dang sgrub pa dang sngags spyad pa'i yan lag rnams mtshan ma can yin mod kyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang dkyil 'khor dang sgrub pa dang sngags spyad pa'i yan lag rnams mtshan ma can yin mod kyi /
translated: “On the relative level, too, the maṇḍala, the practice, and the branches of mantra practice are indeed endowed with signs.

original: don gyi bya ba byed la skar ma dang tshes grangs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma 'di rnams ni don dam pa dang yang 'gal la kun rdzob tu yang don gyi bya ba byed ma yin na /
analyzed: don gyi bya ba byed la skar ma dang tshes grangs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma 'di rnams ni don dam pa dang yang 'gal la kun rdzob tu yang don gyi bya ba byed ma yin na /
translated: However, the signs of the stars, dates, and so on are not only in contradiction with the ultimate, they are also not conducive to the relative accomplishment of one’s aims.

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan ma de dag bshad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang don dam pa'i mtshan nyid bstan nas don dam pa'i mtshan nyid de lta bu yin mod kyi ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don dam pa'i tshul de mi shes @305a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan ma de dag bshad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang don dam pa'i mtshan nyid bstan nas don dam pa'i mtshan nyid de lta bu yin mod kyi ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don dam pa'i tshul de mi shes @305a * //
translated: The Lord, having taught the characteristic of the ultimate, said, Although the ultimate has such a characteristic, the way of the ultimate is not known by future beings.

original: pas 'gro ba de rnams drang ba'i phyir mtshan ma rnams bshad pa'i rigs pa bstan pa ste //
analyzed: pas 'gro ba de rnams drang ba'i phyir mtshan ma rnams bshad pa'i rigs pa bstan pa ste //
translated: Therefore, in order to lead those beings, the reason for explaining the signs is taught.

original: 'gro ba de rnams kyang rnam pa gnyis te //
analyzed: 'gro ba de rnams kyang rnam pa gnyis te //
translated: Those beings are also of two kinds:

original: dngos po la chags pa dang / dngos po med pa la chags pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po la chags pa dang / dngos po med pa la chags pa'o //
translated: those attached to entities and those attached to non-entities.

original: dngos po la chags pa rnams la yang tshes grangs dang dus dang yul la sogs pa dngos po dang rjes su mthun par bshad cing drang ba dang dngos po med pa la chags pa rnams kyang de las bzlog ste dngos po'i sgo nas drang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la chags pa rnams la yang tshes grangs dang dus dang yul la sogs pa dngos po dang rjes su mthun par bshad cing drang ba dang dngos po med pa la chags pa rnams kyang de las bzlog ste dngos po'i sgo nas drang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For those attached to entities, the signs are explained and led in accordance with entities such as the lunar days, times, and places. For those attached to non-entities, it is the opposite, leading through entities.

original: sangs rgyas mtshan ma mi mnga' ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mtshan ma mi mnga' ste //
translated: The Buddha is not characterized by signs.

original: zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma mi mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma mi mnga' ba'o //
translated: This means that he is not characterized by the signs of subject and object.

original: chos kyi sku la rnam par bzhugs //
analyzed: chos kyi sku la rnam par bzhugs //
translated: He abides in the Dharma Body.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma mi mnga' bas dmigs su med pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma mi mnga' bas dmigs su med pa ste /
translated: Since he is not characterized by the signs of subject and object in this way, he is not an object of perception.

original: dmigs su med pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i sku'o //
translated: He is the body that is not an object of perception.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ni chos kyi sku la rnam par bzhugs pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ni chos kyi sku la rnam par bzhugs pa shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān Buddha, who has become the nature of the Dharma Body, is known to abide in the Dharma Body.

original: gsang ba ba'i bdag po de la ji skad bstan pa'i gnas gang yang rung bar sa gzhi rab tu 'thas par bcags te zhes nas /
analyzed: gsang ba ba'i bdag po de la ji skad bstan pa'i gnas gang yang rung bar sa gzhi rab tu 'thas par bcags te zhes nas /
translated: O Lord of Secrets, in that place as taught, having thoroughly smoothed the ground,

original: bdag nyed la na 'di skad du /
analyzed: bdag nyed la na 'di skad du /
translated: one should see oneself saying this:

original: sems can chen po bu khyod legs //
analyzed: sems can chen po bu khyod legs //
translated: Great being, child, it is good.

original: dkyil 'khor myur du bris shig ces //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor myur du bris shig ces //
translated: Quickly draw the maṇḍala.

original: spro ba bskyed pa mthong yang rung //
analyzed: spro ba bskyed pa mthong yang rung //
translated: One should see oneself encouraging them.

original: zhes pa'i bar zhag bdun gyi sngon rol du snang ba dang / mi snang ba la dkyil 'khor sa blang ste de la snang ba ni rgyal po la sogs pi'i ma rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar zhag bdun gyi sngon rol du snang ba dang / mi snang ba la dkyil 'khor sa blang ste de la snang ba ni rgyal po la sogs pi'i ma rnams so //
translated: The mandala site is taken up before the seven days of the above passage, and the visible and invisible are the kings and so forth.🔽

original: mi snang ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lha dang gnod spyin dang sha za la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mi snang ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lha dang gnod spyin dang sha za la sogs pa ste /
translated: The above passage indicates that the site for the maṇḍala should be taken seven days prior to the actual maṇḍala, and that the site should be visible to the king and so forth, but not to the worldly gods, yakṣas, piśācas, and so forth.

original: lha la sogs pa la ma blangs par dkyil 'khor bris na dkyil 'khor gyi lha khro bo la sogs pa'i zer gyis 'jig rten pa'i lha de rnams la gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa la ma blangs par dkyil 'khor bris na dkyil 'khor gyi lha khro bo la sogs pa'i zer gyis 'jig rten pa'i lha de rnams la gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: If the maṇḍala is drawn without taking the site from the worldly gods and so forth, the light rays of the maṇḍala deities and so forth will harm those worldly gods and so forth.

original: de ltar gnod par 'gyur na lha de dag sgrub pa la bgegs kyis skabs 'tshol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gnod par 'gyur na lha de dag sgrub pa la bgegs kyis skabs 'tshol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are harmed in that way, those gods will seek an opportunity to create obstacles for the practitioner.

original: gnyis su na de dag la gnod bzhin du dkyil 'khor bris na sgrub pa po snying rje med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyis su na de dag la gnod bzhin du dkyil 'khor bris na sgrub pa po snying rje med par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the maṇḍala is drawn while harming them, the practitioner will become devoid of compassion.

original: de bas na de dag gis sbyin pa'i ched du sdar lha la sogs pa rnams sbran zhing sa bslangs na lha la sogs pa de rnams kyang bag byed cing de nas gzhan du 'dong ste nyes pa med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bas na de dag gis sbyin pa'i ched du sdar lha la sogs pa rnams sbran zhing sa bslangs na lha la sogs pa de rnams kyang bag byed cing de nas gzhan du 'dong ste nyes pa med par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, if one threatens and demands the earth from those deities, etc. for the sake of giving, those deities, etc. will make way, and then one will go elsewhere and there will be no fault.

original: rgyal po la sogs pa mi rnams la yang sngar sa sngar sa blangs na phyis brtsad pa mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa mi rnams la yang sngar sa sngar sa blangs na phyis brtsad pa mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And also for humans, such as kings, etc., if one demands the earth previously, there will be no dispute later.

original: der sdar bslangs @305b nas phyis dkyil 'khor bri ba las zhag gsum gyi sngon rol du ji skad du smos pa'i sa der ji ltar rigs par brtags nas sa yongs su gzung ba'i rim pa 'di ltar bya'o //
analyzed: der sdar bslangs @305b nas phyis dkyil 'khor bri ba las zhag gsum gyi sngon rol du ji skad du smos pa'i sa der ji ltar rigs par brtags nas sa yongs su gzung ba'i rim pa 'di ltar bya'o //
translated: Having demanded the earth there, later, before three days have passed, having examined the earth as described, one should perform this procedure for taking possession of the earth.

original: thog mar ba'i lci bas la ma lhung ba dang ba'i gcin du bsres pas dkyil 'khor bya'o //
analyzed: thog mar ba'i lci bas la ma lhung ba dang ba'i gcin du bsres pas dkyil 'khor bya'o //
translated: First, one should make the maṇḍala with cow dung not fallen on the ground, mixed with cow’s urine.

original: de nas sa de sngags kyis bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sa de sngags kyis bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should protect that earth with a mantra.

original: de nas phyogs mtshams kun du bgegs bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyogs mtshams kun du bgegs bsal bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should remove obstructors in all directions.

original: de'i 'og tu dri'i dkyil 'khor sor bcu gnyis pa gru bzhi rnams bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dri'i dkyil 'khor sor bcu gnyis pa gru bzhi rnams bya'o //
translated: Then below that one should make a square fragrant mandala twelve fingerbreadths.

original: de nas sngags pa 'grengs te dkyil 'khor de'i dbus kyi nam mkha' la sangs rgyas rnams bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sngags pa 'grengs te dkyil 'khor de'i dbus kyi nam mkha' la sangs rgyas rnams bsam par bya ste /
translated: Then the mantrin, standing, should imagine the Buddhas in the sky in the middle of that mandala.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor rnams sdud par gyur pa dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya bcings nas bsam mo //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor rnams sdud par gyur pa dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya bcings nas bsam mo //
translated: And having formed the seal of the three commitments, one should imagine the natural mandalas gathered.

original: sngags pa 'grengs te sangs rgyas lnga po rnams nam mkha' la bsam pa ni mi gnas pa'i ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngags pa 'grengs te sangs rgyas lnga po rnams nam mkha' la bsam pa ni mi gnas pa'i ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mantrin, standing, imagines the five Buddhas in the sky, because they are non-abiding teachers.

original: de nas der dri dang me tog la sogs pas mchod de sangs rgyas kyi spyan sdar 'phags pa mi g-yo ba 'am /
analyzed: de nas der dri dang me tog la sogs pas mchod de sangs rgyas kyi spyan sdar 'phags pa mi g-yo ba 'am /
translated: Then, having made offerings there with fragrance, flowers, and so forth, one should take possession of that ground with the mantra of Noble Acala or

original: khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'am /🔽gang yang rung ba'i sngags kyis sa de yongs su gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'am / gang yang rung ba'i sngags kyis sa de yongs su gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Trilokavijaya or whichever one is suitable.

original: des na sangs rgyas sras dang bcas pa slob ma rnams dkyil 'khor du gzud pa'i nub mo gshegs su gsol lo //
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas sras dang bcas pa slob ma rnams dkyil 'khor du gzud pa'i nub mo gshegs su gsol lo //
translated: Then the Buddhas together with their sons request departure on the night of inducting the disciples into the mandala.

original: de nas sngags pa de nub phyogs kyi ngos su nyal la byang chub kyi sems dang snying rje dang ldan par bya ste rmi lam blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sngags pa de nub phyogs kyi ngos su nyal la byang chub kyi sems dang snying rje dang ldan par bya ste rmi lam blta bar bya'o //
translated: Then, the mantrin should lie down on the western side, endowed with the thought of awakening and compassion, and look at the dream.

original: de yang rab 'bring gsum du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rab 'bring gsum du shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be known as threefold: best, middling, and least.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams mthong ni rmi lam tha ma'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams mthong ni rmi lam tha ma'o //
translated: Among them, seeing bodhisattvas is the least dream.

original: sangs rgyas rnams mthong na 'bring ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams mthong na 'bring ngo //
translated: Seeing buddhas is middling.

original: sangs rgyas de rnams shin tu dgyes shing sngags pa la bu khyod legs so dkyil 'khor myur du bris shig ces bskul ma 'debs par mthong na rmi lam rab tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas de rnams shin tu dgyes shing sngags pa la bu khyod legs so dkyil 'khor myur du bris shig ces bskul ma 'debs par mthong na rmi lam rab tu shes par bya'o //
translated: If the mantrin sees those buddhas very pleased and encouraging him, “Son, it is good! Quickly draw the maṇḍala!” he should know it as the best dream.

original: 'di rnams rgyud nyid kyi nang nas zhib tu 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams rgyud nyid kyi nang nas zhib tu 'byung ste /
translated: These [dreams] occur in detail within the tantra itself.

original: rgyud kyi nang na ltag 'og 'khrugs par 'byung bas 'dir las su bya ba'i rim pa bzhin du bkod do //
analyzed: rgyud kyi nang na ltag 'og 'khrugs par 'byung bas 'dir las su bya ba'i rim pa bzhin du bkod do //
translated: Since they occur in the tantra in a jumbled order, they are arranged here in the order of the ritual actions.

original: de nas de yi phyi de'i nyin //
analyzed: de nas de yi phyi de'i nyin //
translated: Then, on the day after that,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: as stated,

original: gcig gnyis bzhi las lhag kyang rung ;
analyzed: gcig gnyis bzhi las lhag kyang rung ;
translated: one, two, or four, or even more,

original: dpyad mi dgos par gzung bar bya //
analyzed: dpyad mi dgos par gzung bar bya //
translated: It should be accepted without analysis.

original: shes pa'i bar du slob ma rnams brtag pa ste //
analyzed: shes pa'i bar du slob ma rnams brtag pa ste //
translated: The disciple should be examined up to the knowledge.

original: de yang bye brag gi mtshan nyid dang rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang // phal pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de yang bye brag gi mtshan nyid dang rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang // phal pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Moreover, it is the characteristic of the specific, the characteristic of the division, and the general characteristic.

original: de la 'dir /
analyzed: de la 'dir /
translated: Among them, here:

original: slob ma dang cing rigs btsun pa //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad du @306a * //
analyzed: slob ma dang cing rigs btsun pa // zhes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad du @306a * //
translated: The disciple is faithful, of good family,

original: bshad pa rnams ni bye brag gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bshad pa rnams ni bye brag gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: and so on, the characteristics as explained are the characteristic of the specific.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'og nas 'chad la //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'og nas 'chad la //
translated: The characteristic of the division will be explained below.

original: phal pa'i mtshan nyid de sngar ji skad du bshad pa dang grangs su bcad pa gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: phal pa'i mtshan nyid de sngar ji skad du bshad pa dang grangs su bcad pa gzhan pa ste /
translated: The general characteristic is as previously explained and is counted separately.

original: 'og nas 'on kyang slob dpon snying rje chen po dang ldan pas sems can gyi khams ma lus pa bsgral bar yi dam bca' ba kho nar bya ste /
analyzed: 'og nas 'on kyang slob dpon snying rje chen po dang ldan pas sems can gyi khams ma lus pa bsgral bar yi dam bca' ba kho nar bya ste /
translated: However, the master who possesses great compassion should only make the vow to liberate the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: des byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyur 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir sems can tshad med pa rnams yongs su gzung bar bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: des byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyur 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir sems can tshad med pa rnams yongs su gzung bar bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: In order to make that a cause for the Thought of Enlightenment, one should take up the immeasurable sentient beings.

original: slob ma de rnams las kyang rgyud la sogs pa la mkhas shing byang chub kyi sems goms pa ni dkyil 'khor du bcug pa de nyid kyi tshe na de slob dpon nam sgrub par dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma de rnams las kyang rgyud la sogs pa la mkhas shing byang chub kyi sems goms pa ni dkyil 'khor du bcug pa de nyid kyi tshe na de slob dpon nam sgrub par dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: And from among those disciples, one who is skilled in the tantras, etc., and has cultivated the Thought of Enlightenment, should be empowered as a master or adept at the very time of being admitted to the mandala.

original: rgyud la sogs pa rnams la ni mkhas kyang byang chub kyi sems ma bsgoms na byang chub kyi sems sgom du bcug ste phyis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud la sogs pa rnams la ni mkhas kyang byang chub kyi sems ma bsgoms na byang chub kyi sems sgom du bcug ste phyis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: But one who is skilled in the tantras, etc., but has not cultivated the Thought of Enlightenment, should be made to cultivate the Thought of Enlightenment and later be empowered.

original: de las gzhan snga nas kyang rgyud mi shes byang chub kyi sems kyang ma bsgoms //
analyzed: de las gzhan snga nas kyang rgyud mi shes byang chub kyi sems kyang ma bsgoms //
translated: One who is other than those, who does not know the tantra beforehand, and does not cultivate the Thought of Enlightenment,

original: phyis kyang rgyud shes par mi 'gyur la byang chub kyi sems kyang sgom par mi 'gyur ba ni phal pa ste /
analyzed: phyis kyang rgyud shes par mi 'gyur la byang chub kyi sems kyang sgom par mi 'gyur ba ni phal pa ste /
translated: and who will not know the tantra later and will not cultivate the Thought of Enlightenment, is an ordinary person.

original: dus gnyis gar yang dbang mi bskur gyi //
analyzed: dus gnyis gar yang dbang mi bskur gyi //
translated: He is not to be empowered at either time.

original: byang chub kyi sa bon du 'gyur ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor du gzud do //🔽de la / slob ma dad cing rigs btsun pa //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sa bon du 'gyur ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor du gzud do // de la / slob ma dad cing rigs btsun pa //
translated: In order to become the seed of enlightenment, one is admitted into the mandala.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang du slob ma'i mtshan nyid brjod pa ni bshad zin pas 'dir ma bshad do //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang du slob ma'i mtshan nyid brjod pa ni bshad zin pas 'dir ma bshad do //
translated: There, the characteristics of the disciple who has faith, a pure family, and so on, have been explained in the section on the characteristics of the disciple, so they are not explained here.

original: bcu 'am brgyad dam bdun nam lnga //
analyzed: bcu 'am brgyad dam bdun nam lnga //
translated: Ten, eight, seven, or five,

original: gcig gnyis bzhi las lhag kyang rung //
analyzed: gcig gnyis bzhi las lhag kyang rung //
translated: one, two, four, or more.

original: zhes pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i slob ma ni shin tu dkon pas grangs nyung ngu gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i slob ma ni shin tu dkon pas grangs nyung ngu gsungs pa yin la /
translated: Since disciples who have the characteristics explained above are extremely rare, a small number is stated.

original: lhag kyang rung zhes pa ni mtshan nyid de lta bu dang ldan pa mang ba dkon pa ste /
analyzed: lhag kyang rung zhes pa ni mtshan nyid de lta bu dang ldan pa mang ba dkon pa ste /
translated: More means that it is rare to have many who have such characteristics.

original: brgya la de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan na de las lhag ste grangs med pa yod na yang nyes ba med do //
analyzed: brgya la de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan na de las lhag ste grangs med pa yod na yang nyes ba med do //
translated: If there are one hundred who have such characteristics, even if there are more than that, an immeasurable number, there is no fault.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes zhus pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes zhus pa zhes pa nas /
translated: Then again, Vajrapani asked the Blessed One...

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyur gyur par bya ba'i phyir sems can tshad med pa rnams yongs su gzung bar bya'o zhes pa'i bar ni gong du slob ma'i grangs nges par gsungs na ci las yin zhes bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes gsol pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyur gyur par bya ba'i phyir sems can tshad med pa rnams yongs su gzung bar bya'o zhes pa'i bar ni gong du slob ma'i grangs nges par gsungs na ci las yin zhes bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes gsol pa dang /
translated: This is the question of Vajrapāṇi to the Bhagavān, “Why is the number of disciples definite?”

original: de'i lan bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i lan bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The answer to that is the statement of the Bhagavān.

original: slob ma rnams kyi grangs nges par gsungs pa ci las yin @306b zhes dri dgos pa las //
analyzed: slob ma rnams kyi grangs nges par gsungs pa ci las yin @306b zhes dri dgos pa las //
translated: It is necessary to ask, “Why is the number of disciples definite?”

original: dkyil 'khor 'di'i ming ci lags ci'i slad du dkyil 'khor zhes bgyi zhes bya ba dris she na /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'di'i ming ci lags ci'i slad du dkyil 'khor zhes bgyi zhes bya ba dris she na /
translated: Why is the name of this maṇḍala? Why is it called a maṇḍala?”

original: de'i dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The intention is as follows:

original: de skad dris na dkyil 'khor gyi nges pa'i tshig dang dmigs su bab bar bya ba dang / slob ma'i grangs nges pa gsum char dris par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de skad dris na dkyil 'khor gyi nges pa'i tshig dang dmigs su bab bar bya ba dang / slob ma'i grangs nges pa gsum char dris par 'gyur te /
translated: If one asks in that way, one will have asked about all three: the definition of the maṇḍala, the purpose of the maṇḍala, and the number of disciples.

original: de la dkyil 'khor 'di'i ming ci lags zhes pa ni dmigs su bab cing bstan par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor dris pa'o //
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor 'di'i ming ci lags zhes pa ni dmigs su bab cing bstan par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor dris pa'o //
translated: The question What is the name of this mandala? is the question about the mandala that is the focus and should be taught.

original: ci'i slad du dkyil 'khor zhes bgyi zhes pa ni nges pa'i tshig dris pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i slad du dkyil 'khor zhes bgyi zhes pa ni nges pa'i tshig dris pa'o //
translated: The question Why is it called a mandala? is the question about the definition.

original: dkyil 'khor 'di ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'di ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba ste //
translated: This mandala is the source of the buddhas.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor 'di sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir te /🔽sangs rgyas byung na sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi chos rnams kyang 'byung la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor 'di sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir te / sangs rgyas byung na sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi chos rnams kyang 'byung la /
translated: This is because this mandala is similar to the source of the buddhas.

original: sems can gyi don mdzad pa yang yod do /
analyzed: sems can gyi don mdzad pa yang yod do /
translated: When a buddha appears, the qualities of a buddha also appear, and there is benefit for sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor 'di las kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'byung zhing sems can gyi don bya ba yang yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor 'di las kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'byung zhing sems can gyi don bya ba yang yod de /
translated: Similarly, from this mandala, the qualities of a buddha also appear, and there is benefit for sentient beings.

original: 'phral du byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa dang rim gyis mchog la sogs pa'i grub pa dang zhib la sogs pa'i las rnams byed pa yod cing /
analyzed: 'phral du byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa dang rim gyis mchog la sogs pa'i grub pa dang zhib la sogs pa'i las rnams byed pa yod cing /
translated: Immediately, the generation of the mind of enlightenment and gradually the supreme and other attainments and the activities of pacifying and so forth are performed.

original: mthar sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes one to become a Buddha in the end.

original: dkyil ni snying po zhes bya'o //🔽'khor ni rdzogs pa ste zhes pa ni mar gyi snying po'am /
analyzed: dkyil ni snying po zhes bya'o // 'khor ni rdzogs pa ste zhes pa ni mar gyi snying po'am /
translated: The “center” is called the “essence.”🔽The “circle” is the completion.

original: tsandan gyi snying po dang 'dra ste mchog gam dam pa la bya'o //
analyzed: tsandan gyi snying po dang 'dra ste mchog gam dam pa la bya'o //
translated: It is like the essence of butter or the essence of sandalwood, and is called the “best” or the “excellent.”

original: mar dang tsandan gyi snying po dag la ni mi chog pa dang ma rdzogs pa yang srid na de dag dang 'dra ba yin nam zhe na //
analyzed: mar dang tsandan gyi snying po dag la ni mi chog pa dang ma rdzogs pa yang srid na de dag dang 'dra ba yin nam zhe na //
translated: Since it is possible that the essence of butter or the essence of sandalwood is not complete or perfect, are they like that?

original: snying por 'dra mod kyang de las khyad par du khyab pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: snying por 'dra mod kyang de las khyad par du khyab pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: Although they are similar to the essence, it is said that they are different from them in that they are “pervading.”

original: khyab pa ni chog pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: khyab pa ni chog pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i don to //
translated: Pervading means complete and perfect.

original: dkyil 'khor 'di'i snying po ni ji ltar chog pa dang rdzogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'di'i snying po ni ji ltar chog pa dang rdzogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the essence of this mandala like in terms of being complete and perfect?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bskal pa grangs med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags nas stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams yongs su rdzogs te bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa ni snying
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bskal pa grangs med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags nas stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams yongs su rdzogs te bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa ni snying
translated: The Bhagavan Buddha, having accumulated the collections of merit and wisdom for countless eons, perfected the qualities of a buddha such as the powers and fearlessnesses and manifestly and completely awakened to unsurpassed enlightenment.🔽

original: por gyur pa chog pa dang dam pa ste /
analyzed: por gyur pa chog pa dang dam pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavat Buddha, having accumulated the collections of merit and wisdom for countless eons, having perfected the qualities of a Buddha such as the powers and fearlessnesses, and having manifestly and completely awakened to unsurpassed enlightenment, is the essence, the sufficiency, and the sublime.

original: chog pa ni de las gzhan pa btsal mi dgos par des chog pas mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'o //🔽gang bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa de nyid sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis sku la sogs @307a * //
analyzed: chog pa ni de las gzhan pa btsal mi dgos par des chog pas mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'o // gang bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa de nyid sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis sku la sogs @307a * //
translated: Sufficiency is the unchanging perfection, since one is satisfied with that and does not need to seek anything else.

original: pa mi zad pa'i rgyan gyi 'khor lor gyur pa ni dkyil 'khor 'dir byin gyis brlabs pas na dkyil 'khor 'di'i snying pos chog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa mi zad pa'i rgyan gyi 'khor lor gyur pa ni dkyil 'khor 'dir byin gyis brlabs pas na dkyil 'khor 'di'i snying pos chog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That very unchanging perfection, which is the manifest and complete enlightenment in unsurpassed enlightenment, becomes the wheel of inexhaustible ornaments of body and so forth through the power of former aspirations. Since it is empowered in this mandala, it is called the sufficiency of the essence of this mandala.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po 'on kyang dkyil 'khor rgyas pa 'di ni sems can gyi khams ma nges pa yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir snying rje chen po'i snying po 'byung ba zhes bya ba zhes pa la /🔽sems can gyi khams ma nges pa yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir zhes pa ni snying rje chen po'i dbang gis tshad med pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams dkyil 'khor 'dir btsud pa bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur bas yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir zhes gsungs
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po 'on kyang dkyil 'khor rgyas pa 'di ni sems can gyi khams ma nges pa yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir snying rje chen po'i snying po 'byung ba zhes bya ba zhes pa la / sems can gyi khams ma nges pa yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir zhes pa ni snying rje chen po'i dbang gis tshad med pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams dkyil 'khor 'dir btsud pa bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur bas yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir zhes gsungs
translated: Lord of Secrets, however, this extensive maṇḍala is called “the source of the essence of great compassion” in order to protect the realm of sentient beings without exception.🔽“ In order to protect the realm of sentient beings without exception” means that through the power of great compassion, the immeasurable realm of sentient beings is brought into this maṇḍala and is protected by becoming the cause of unsurpassed awakening.

original: so ; / snying rje chen po'i snying po 'byung ba zhes pa na dkyil 'khor 'di snying rje chen po las 'byung ba ste bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes nas snying rje chen po'i dbang gis sku la sogs pa mi zad pa'i rgyan gyi dkyil 'khor
analyzed: so ; / snying rje chen po'i snying po 'byung ba zhes pa na dkyil 'khor 'di snying rje chen po las 'byung ba ste bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes nas snying rje chen po'i dbang gis sku la sogs pa mi zad pa'i rgyan gyi dkyil 'khor
translated: “ The source of the essence of great compassion” means that this maṇḍala arises from great compassion. After the Bhagavān attained omniscient gnosis, through the power of great compassion, the maṇḍala of the inexhaustible ornaments of body, and so on,

original: 'di 'byung bas na snying rje chen po las 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di 'byung bas na snying rje chen po las 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it arises from this, it is called “arising from great compassion.”

original: snying po zhes pa ni 'byung khungs te snying rje chen po'i dkyil 'khor 'di 'byung ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: snying po zhes pa ni 'byung khungs te snying rje chen po'i dkyil 'khor 'di 'byung ba'i gnas so //
translated: “Essence” means source, the place from which this maṇḍala of great compassion arises.

original: yang na dkyil 'khor 'di las snying rje chen po 'byung ba la yang bya ste /
analyzed: yang na dkyil 'khor 'di las snying rje chen po 'byung ba la yang bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, it is also called “arising from great compassion” because great compassion arises from this maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor 'di'i sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi chos snying rje chen po la sogs pa 'byung ste thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'di'i sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi chos snying rje chen po la sogs pa 'byung ste thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
translated: This is because the qualities of the tathāgatas, such as great compassion, arise from this maṇḍala, and omniscient wisdom is attained.

original: dkyil 'khor rgyas pa zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor 'dir btsud pa'i sems can rnams bsod nams rgyas pa'i phyir ro //🔽gnyis su na dkyil 'khor nyid kyi snam bu la sogs pa'i rim pa 'phel ba'am /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rgyas pa zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor 'dir btsud pa'i sems can rnams bsod nams rgyas pa'i phyir ro // gnyis su na dkyil 'khor nyid kyi snam bu la sogs pa'i rim pa 'phel ba'am /
translated: “Maṇḍala of increase” is because the merit of sentient beings who enter this maṇḍala increases.

original: rgyas pa la yang bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa la yang bya'o //
translated: In another way, it is also called “increase” because the stages of the maṇḍala, such as the cloth, increase or expand.

original: 'on kyang zhes pa ni sangs rgyas 'byung bas dkyil 'khor zhes bya mod kyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes pa ni sangs rgyas 'byung bas dkyil 'khor zhes bya mod kyi /
translated: “However” means that although the maṇḍala is called a maṇḍala because a buddha arises,

original: 'di rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir ming yang 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir ming yang 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: Because they possess these, the name is also called this.

original: der ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bskal pa grangs med par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par bsgrubs pa byin gyis brlabs so zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor 'di ni gzhan ma yin gyi /
analyzed: der ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bskal pa grangs med par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par bsgrubs pa byin gyis brlabs so zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor 'di ni gzhan ma yin gyi /
translated: There, the Tathagatas have blessed the accomplishment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in countless eons. This means that this mandala is not other than

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pas bskal pa grangs med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags nas bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa de nyid sngags kyi lta dang phyag rgya dang sngags kyi yi ge rnams su lhag par bkod de byin gyis brlabs so zhes
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pas bskal pa grangs med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags nas bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa de nyid sngags kyi lta dang phyag rgya dang sngags kyi yi ge rnams su lhag par bkod de byin gyis brlabs so zhes
translated: that very unsurpassed enlightenment attained by the Tathagata after accumulating the accumulations of merit and wisdom for countless eons, which is blessed and arranged as the deities of mantra, mudra, and mantra syllables.🔽It is taught.

original: bstan pa'o // gsang ba pa'i bdag @307b po ;
analyzed: bstan pa'o // gsang ba pa'i bdag @307b po ;
translated: O Lord of Secrets,

original: de lta bas na rnam grangs 'dis kyang khyod kyis 'di ltar rig par bya ste zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam grangs 'dis kyang khyod kyis 'di ltar rig par bya ste zhes sbyar te /
translated: therefore, by this explanation also, you should know this thus.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bskal pa grangs med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pas thams cad mkhyen pa brnyes nas sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis sku la sogs pa mi zad pa'i rgyan sems can gyi khams ma lus pa'i phyir byin gyis rlob🔽ste sems can gyi khams gcig gam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bskal pa grangs med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pas thams cad mkhyen pa brnyes nas sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis sku la sogs pa mi zad pa'i rgyan sems can gyi khams ma lus pa'i phyir byin gyis rlob ste sems can gyi khams gcig gam /
translated: The tathagatas, through gathering the accumulations of merit and wisdom for countless eons, attain omniscience and then, by the power of their previous aspirations, they bless their bodies and so forth to be inexhaustible ornaments for the sake of the entire realm of sentient beings.🔽It is not for the sake of one or two sentient beings.

original: gnyis kyi phyir ma yin te rnam grangs des na de bzhin gshegs pa gang du 'tshang rgya ba ni sems can gcig gam gnyis kyi phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis kyi phyir ma yin te rnam grangs des na de bzhin gshegs pa gang du 'tshang rgya ba ni sems can gcig gam gnyis kyi phyir ma yin te /
translated: By this enumeration, one should understand that the tathagatas do not attain enlightenment for the sake of one or two sentient beings,

original: mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi don gyi phyir mngon par 'tshang rgya bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi don gyi phyir mngon par 'tshang rgya bar rig par bya ste /
translated: but for the sake of infinite sentient beings.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni sems can gcig gi phyir byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ma yin /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni sems can gcig gi phyir byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ma yin /
translated: Therefore, the tathagatas do not fully awaken to enlightenment for the sake of one sentient being,

original: gnyis kyi phyir ma yin /
analyzed: gnyis kyi phyir ma yin /
translated: nor for the sake of two.

original: gsum gyi phyir ma yin gyi 'on kyang thugs rje chen po'i dbang du gyur pa dag sems can gyi khams ma lus pa yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum gyi phyir ma yin gyi 'on kyang thugs rje chen po'i dbang du gyur pa dag sems can gyi khams ma lus pa yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is not for these three reasons, but rather, those who are under the sway of great compassion, in order to protect the realm of all sentient beings, fully awaken to supreme enlightenment.

original: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la chos 'chad ces pa ni de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ma lus pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du mngon par sangs rgyas mod kyi /
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la chos 'chad ces pa ni de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ma lus pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du mngon par sangs rgyas mod kyi /
translated: As for “expounding the Dharma to sentient beings according to their thoughts,” although the Tathāgata thus fully awakens to supreme enlightenment for the sake of all sentient beings without exception,

original: ma lus pa'i sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas chos bshad pa'i snod du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma lus pa'i sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas chos bshad pa'i snod du mi 'gyur te /
translated: not all sentient beings without exception become vessels for the Tathāgata’s teaching of the Dharma.

original: so so'i dad pa dang rjes su mthun par de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'chad pa ni bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos 'chad pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: so so'i dad pa dang rjes su mthun par de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'chad pa ni bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos 'chad pa'o zhes so //
translated: The Tathāgata’s teaching of the Dharma in accordance with their individual faith is called “expounding the Dharma according to their thoughts.”

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po theg pa chen po la sngon goms par ma byas pa rnams ni gsang sngags spyad pa'i tshul mthong ngam thos na sems la dga' ba 'am dad pa cung zad kyang yang dag par mi skye'i /🔽gsang ba pa'i bdag po gang dag gis sngon theg pa chen po'i gsang sngags spyod pa'i tshul sgo mtha' yas pa sgrub pa la goms par byas pa zhes pa la byang chub sems dpa' la'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
